meaning_1: stilling (of); serenity (of); calming (of); settling (of); peace (of); (comm) mental unification
example_1:
kadā nu rūpe amite ca sadde,
gandhe rase phusitabbe ca dhamme,
ādittato'haṃ samathehi yutto,
paññāya dacchaṃ tadidaṃ kadā me.
example_2: etaṃ santaṃ etaṃ paṇītaṃ yadidaṃ sabbasaṅkhārasamatho sabb'ūpadhipaṭinissaggo taṇhākkhayo virāgo nirodho nibbānan'ti
sbs_example_3: imaṃ nu kho ahaṃ diṭṭhiṃ āsevanto bhāvento bahulīkaronto labhāmi paccattaṃ samathaṃ, labhāmi paccattaṃ nibbutin'ti?
sbs_example_4: kālena dhammassavanaṃ, kālena dhammasākacchā, kālena samatho, kālena vipassanā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yathākathaṃ pana tvaṃ bhikkhu mayā saṃkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena atthaṃ ājānāsī'ti
example_2: tath'āhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi yathā ye'me antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā te paṭisevato n'ālaṃ antarāyāyā'ti.
sbs_example_3: idān'eva pana mayaṃ, āvuso, āyasmato sāriputtassa bhāsitaṃ evaṃ ājānāma, usmā āyuṃ paṭicca tiṭṭhatī'ti. yathā kathaṃ pan'āvuso, imassa bhāsitassa attho daṭṭhabbo'ti?
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: bhagavā etadavoca, bhadd'ekarattassa vo, bhikkhave, uddesañ'ca vibhaṅgañ'ca desessāmi. taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī'ti.
example_2: tatra idaṃ nissāya idaṃ pajahatha, tayo satipaṭṭhānā yadariyo sevati yadariyo sevamāno satthā gaṇam'anusāsitum'arahati, so vuccati yoggācariyānaṃ anuttaro purisadammasārathī'ti, ayam'uddeso saḷ'āyatanavibhaṅgassa.
sbs_example_3: handa mayaṃ paṭiccasamuppādavibhaṅgaṃ bhaṇāmase
sbs_example_4: dhārehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, bhadd'ekarattassa uddesañ'ca vibhaṅgañ'ca.
sbs_example_5: janapadaniruttiṃ n'ābhiniveseyya, samaññaṃ n'ātidhāveyyāti, ayam'uddeso araṇavibhaṅgassa.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: etha, tumhe'pi, bhikkhave, ek'āsanabhojanaṃ bhuñjatha. ek'āsanabhojanaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tumhe'pi bhuñjamānā app'ābādhatañ'ca sañjānissatha app'ātaṅkatañ'ca lah'uṭṭhānañ'ca balañ'ca phāsuvihārañ'cā'ti.
example_2: ahaṃ kho, samaṇa, kasāmi ca vapāmi ca. kasitvā ca vapitvā ca bhuñjāmi. tvam'pi, samaṇa, kasassu ca vapassu ca. kasitvā ca vapitvā ca bhuñjassū'ti.
sbs_example_3: handa bhikkhu khāda vā bhuñja vā'ti jānaṃ āsādan'āpekkho, bhuttasmiṃ pācittiyaṃ.
sbs_example_4: yo pana bhikkhu, bhuttāvī pavārito, anatirittaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādeyya vā bhuñjeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
sbs_example_5: sappāyāni c'eva bhojanāni bhuñjeyyāsi, mā te asappāyāni bhojanāni bhuñjato vaṇo assāvī assa.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

notes: refers to animals eating or humans chewing
example_1:
ayasā'va malaṃ samuṭṭhitaṃ,
tat'uṭṭhāya tam'eva khādati,
evaṃ atidhonacārinaṃ,
sāni kammāni nayanti duggatiṃ.
example_2: bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, biḷāro sandhisamalasaṅkaṭīre ṭhito ahosi mudumūsiṃ maggayamāno, yadā'yaṃ mudumūsi gocarāya pakkamissati, tatth'eva naṃ gahetvā khādissāmī'ti.
sbs_example_3: handa bhikkhu khāda vā bhuñja vā'ti jānaṃ āsādan'āpekkho, bhuttasmiṃ pācittiyaṃ.
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi yaṃ yad'eva hi sā gāvī niccammā nissāya tiṭṭheyya, ye tan'nissitā pāṇā te naṃ khādeyyuṃ. evam'eva khv'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, phass'āhāro daṭṭhabbo'ti
sbs_example_5: yadā'yaṃ kummo kacchapo soṇḍipañcamānaṃ aṅgānaṃ aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā aṅgaṃ abhininnāmessati, tatth'eva naṃ gahetvā uddālitvā khādissāmī'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: siyā kho pana bhikkhave ekabhikkhussāpi kaṅkhā vā vimati vā buddhe vā dhamme vā saṅghe vā magge vā paṭipadāya vā pucchatha bhikkhave mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha
example_2:
anejaṃ mūladassāviṃ,
atthi pañhena āgamaṃ,
kiṃ nissitā isayo manujā,
khattiyā brāhmaṇā devatānaṃ,
yaññam'akappayiṃsu puthū'dha loke,
pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ.
sbs_example_3: evañ'hi tvaṃ, gahapati, pucchasi, yā imā, bhante thera, anekavihitā diṭṭhiyo loke uppajjanti, sassato loko'ti
sbs_example_4: suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho. yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, ahaṃ āyasmantaṃ (itthannāmaṃ) bhikkhuṃ vinayaṃ puccheyyaṃ.
sbs_example_5:
eṇijaṅghaṃ kisaṃ vīraṃ, app'āhāraṃ alolupaṃ,
sīhaṃ v'ekacaraṃ nāgaṃ, kāmesu anapekkhinaṃ,
upasaṅkamma pucchāma, kathaṃ dukkhā pamuccatī'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: bears in mind; keeps in mind; remembers; lit. carries
commentary: (SNa) upāsakaṃ maṃ, bhante, bhagavā dhāretū'ti maṃ bhagavā, upāsako ayan'ti evaṃ dhāretu, jānātū'ti attho.
example_1: maṃ bhagavā dhāretu ajja't'agge pāṇ'upetaṃ saraṇaṃ gataṃ
example_2: bhagavaṃmūlakā no, bhante, dhammā bhagavaṃnettikā bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā. sādhu vata, bhante, bhagavantaṃ'y'eva paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho. bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī'ti.
sbs_example_3: ek'aṃsena, gotami, dhāreyyāsi, eso dhammo, eso vinayo, etaṃ satthusāsanan'ti
sbs_example_4: dhārehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, bhadd'ekarattassa uddesañ'ca vibhaṅgañ'ca.
sbs_example_5: idha saddhājāto upasaṅkamati, upasaṅkamanto payirupāsati, payirupāsanto sotaṃ odahati, ohitasoto dhammaṃ suṇāti, sutvā dhammaṃ dhāreti, dhatānaṃ dhammānaṃ atthaṃ upaparikkhati,
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: young man; young gentleman; young Brahman
example_1:
tassa taṃ vacanaṃ sutvā,
abbhutaṃ lomahaṃsanaṃ,
satthāni nikkhipitvāna,
māṇavā etadabravuṃ.
example_2: bhavam'atthu bhavantaṃ jotipālaṃ, rājā disampati bhavantaṃ jotipālaṃ māṇavaṃ āmantayati, rājā disampati bhoto jotipālassa māṇavassa dassanakāmo'ti
sbs_example_3:
dumapphalānī'va patanti māṇavā, daharā ca vuḍḍhā ca sarīrabhedā.
etam'pi disvā pabbajito'mhi rāja, apaṇṇakaṃ sāmaññam'eva seyyo.

meaning_1: proposition; synopsis; statement in brief; summary; introduction; lit. pointing up
example_1: yaṃ kho no, āvuso, bhagavā saṃkhittena uddesaṃ uddisitvā vitthārena atthaṃ avibhajitvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā vihāraṃ paviṭṭho
example_2: ataramāno'va bhāseyya, no taramāno. janapadaniruttiṃ n'ābhiniveseyya, samaññaṃ n'ātidhāveyyā'ti, ayam'uddeso araṇavibhaṅgassa.
sbs_example_3: dhārehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, bhadd'ekarattassa uddesañ'ca vibhaṅgañ'ca.

example_1: lobhassa ca pahānāya dosassa ca pahānāya atthi majjhimā paṭipadā cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati
sbs_chant_eng_1: Setting in Motion the Wheel of Dhamma
example_2: ete kho, bhikkhave, ubho ante anupagamma majjhimā paṭipadā tathāgatena abhisambuddhā, cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati.
sbs_example_3: dhammo ca desito niyyāniko upasamiko parinibbāniko sambodhagāmī sugatappavedito
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: fills up; fills out; lit. causes to fill
commentary: (DNa) abhisandetī'ti temeti sneheti, sabbattha pavattapītisukhaṃ karoti. parisandetī'ti samantato sandeti. paripūretī'ti vāyunā bhastaṃ viya pūreti. parippharatī'ti samantato phusati.
example_1: so imam'eva kāyaṃ vivekajena pītisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripūreti parippharati, n'āssa kiñci sabbāvato kāyassa vivekajena pītisukhena apphuṭaṃ hoti
example_2:
ye keci buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gatāse,
na te gamissanti apāyabhūmiṃ,
pahāya mānusaṃ dehaṃ,
devakāyaṃ paripūressantī'ti.
sbs_example_3: āraddhavīriyo ca kho, bhikkhave, sukhaṃ viharati pavivitto pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi, mahantañ'ca sadatthaṃ paripūreti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
devo ca vassati devo ca gaḷagaḷāyati,
ekako c'āhaṃ bherave bile viharāmi,
tassa mayhaṃ ekakassa bherave bile viharato,
n'atthi bhayaṃ vā chambhitattaṃ vā lomahaṃso vā.
example_2: te ce me evaṃ puṭṭhā, āmā'ti paṭijānanti, ty'āhaṃ evaṃ vadāmi, api pana tumhe āyasmanto ek'antasukhaṃ lokaṃ jānaṃ passaṃ viharathā'ti? iti puṭṭhā, no'ti vadanti.
sbs_example_3: asukasmiṃ nāma āvāse sambahulā therā bhikkhū viharanti bahussutā āgat'āgamā dhammadharā vinayadharā mātikādharā. tesaṃ me therānaṃ sammukhā sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ
sbs_example_4:
gāme vā yadi v'āraññe, ninne vā yadi vā thale.
yattha arahanto viharanti, taṃ bhūmirāmaṇeyyakan'ti.
sbs_example_5: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati pubb’ārāme migāramātupāsāde. atha kho gaṇakamoggallāno brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā ten’upasaṅkami
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
no ce labhetha nipakaṃ sahāyaṃ,
saddhiṃcaraṃ sādhuvihāridhīraṃ,
rājā'va raṭṭhaṃ vijitaṃ pahāya,
eko care mātaṅg'araññ'eva nāgo.
example_2: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, khattiyakulā ce'pi agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti, so ca tathāgatappaveditaṃ dhammavinayaṃ āgamma, evaṃ mettaṃ karuṇaṃ muditaṃ upekkhaṃ bhāvetvā labhati ajjhattaṃ vūpasamaṃ.
sbs_example_3: appiyehi sampayogo dukkho, piyehi vippayogo dukkho, yam'p'icchaṃ na labhati tam'pi dukkhaṃ
sbs_chant_eng_3: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_4: imaṃ nu kho ahaṃ diṭṭhiṃ āsevanto bhāvento bahulīkaronto labhāmi paccattaṃ samathaṃ, labhāmi paccattaṃ nibbutin'ti?
sbs_example_5: atthi ca me uttariṃ avasiṭṭhaṃ dārabharaṇāyā'ti. so tatonidānaṃ labhetha pāmojjaṃ, adhigaccheyya somanassaṃ.

sbs_meaning: disciplinary code; precepts; training rules; lit. leading to freedom
commentary: (KV) tattha pātimokkhanti paatimokkhaṃ atipamokkhaṃ atiseṭṭhaṃ atiuttamanti attho.
example_1: ehi tvaṃ bhikkhu sīlavā hohi pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharāhi
example_2:
akittayī vivaṭacakkhu,
sakkhidhammaṃ parissayavinayaṃ,
paṭipadaṃ vadehi bhaddante,
pātimokkhaṃ athavā'pi samādhiṃ.
sbs_example_3:
anūpavādo anūpaghāto, pātimokkhe ca saṃvaro,
mattaññutā ca bhattasmiṃ, pantañ'ca sayan'āsanaṃ,
adhicitte ca āyogo, etaṃ buddhāna sāsanaṃ.

meaning_1: in that regard; in that case; regarding that matter
example_1: so yadeva tattha hoti rūpagataṃ vedanāgataṃ saññāgataṃ saṅkhāragataṃ viññāṇagataṃ te dhamme aniccato dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato parato palokato suññato anattato samanupassati
example_2: rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, upādāniyo dhammo, yo tattha chandarāgo, taṃ tattha upādānaṃ.
sbs_example_3: tattha katame avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārā? puññ'ābhisaṅkhāro, apuññ'ābhisaṅkhāro, āneñj'ābhisaṅkhāro, kāyasaṅkhāro, vacīsaṅkhāro, cittasaṅkhāro.

sbs_example_5:

meaning_1: it is good (for); it would be good (if)
example_1:

example_2: bhagavaṃmūlakā no, bhante, dhammā bhagavaṃnettikā bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā. sādhu vata, bhante, bhagavantaṃ'y'eva paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho. bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī'ti.
sbs_example_3: sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā saṃkhittena dhammaṃ desetu, yam'ahaṃ bhagavato dhammaṃ sutvā ekā vūpakaṭṭhā appamattā ātāpinī pahit'attā vihareyyan'ti
sbs_example_4: sādhu vat'āyasmantaṃ'y'eva sāriputtaṃ paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho'ti.

example_1:

example_1:

example_2: tam'enaṃ jano disvā evaṃ vadeyya, bhogī vata, bho, puriso, evaṃ kira bhogino bhogāni bhuñjantī'ti. tam'enaṃ sāmikā yattha yatth'eva passeyyuṃ tattha tatth'eva sāni hareyyuṃ. taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gahapati, alaṃ nu kho tassa purisassa aññathattāyā'ti?

meaning_1: born from seclusion; (or) born from discrimination

commentary: (VIN 1.1.2) coro nāma yo pañcamāsakaṃ vā atirekapañcamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyati. eso coro nāma.
example_1:
dinnaṃ sukhaphalaṃ hoti,
n'ādinnaṃ hoti taṃ tathā,
corā haranti rājāno,
aggi ḍahati nassati.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, yāni kānici kulāni bahu'tthikāni appapurisāni tāni suppadhaṃsiyāni honti corehi kumbhatthenakehi.
sbs_example_3: yo pana bhikkhu gāmā vā araññā vā adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyeyya, yathārūpe adinn'ādāne rājāno coraṃ gahetvā haneyyuṃ vā bandheyyuṃ vā pabbājeyyuṃ vā

example_1: kathañ'c'ānanda appaṇidhāya bhāvanā hoti?
example_2: yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno abhijjhālussa abhijjhā appahīnā hoti, byāpannacittassa byāpādo appahīno hoti, kodhanassa kodho appahīno hoti, upanāhissa upanāho appahīno hoti
sbs_example_3:
ye puggalā aṭṭha sataṃ pasatthā, cattāri etāni yugāni honti.
te dakkhiṇeyyā sugatassa sāvakā, etesu dinnāni mahapphalāni.
sbs_example_4:
kassako kammunā hoti, sippiko hoti kammunā.
vāṇijo kammunā hoti, pessako hoti kammunā.

meaning_1: desire (for); passion (for); infatuation (with); lust (for); lit. attachment
commentary: (SNa) rāgo'tiādīni lobhass'eva nāmāni. so hi rañjanavasena rāgo, nandanavasena nandī, taṇhāyanavasena taṇhā'ti vuccati.
example_1: kabaḷīkāre ce, bhikkhave, āhāre atthi rāgo atthi nandī atthi taṇhā, patiṭṭhitaṃ tattha viññāṇaṃ virūḷhaṃ. yattha patiṭṭhitaṃ viññāṇaṃ virūḷhaṃ, atthi tattha nāmarūpassa avakkanti.
example_2:
aññaṃ ito y'ābhivadanti dhammaṃ,
aparaddhā suddhim'akevalī te,
evam'pi titthyā puthuso vadanti,
sandiṭṭhirāgena hi te'bhirattā.
sbs_example_3: yāyaṃ taṇhā ponobbhavikā nandirāgasahagatā tatratatr'ābhinandinī seyyath'īdaṃ kāmataṇhā bhavataṇhā vibhavataṇhā
sbs_chant_eng_3: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_4: kena ādittaṃ? rāg'agginā, dos'agginā, moh'agginā ādittaṃ, jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi ādittan'ti vadāmi
sbs_example_5: anicce dukkhasaññā, dukkhe anattasaññā, pahānasaññā, virāgasaññā, nirodhasaññā, rāgassa abhiññāya ime dasa dhammā bhāvetabbā'ti.

example_1: saṅghagato kho pana anānākathiko hoti atiracchānakathiko. sāmaṃ vā dhammaṃ bhāsati, paraṃ vā ajjhesati, ariyaṃ vā tuṇhībhāvaṃ n'ātimaññati.
example_2: pañcahi, bhikkhave, vaḍḍhīhi vaḍḍhamānā ariyasāvikā ariyāya vaḍḍhiyā vaḍḍhati sār'ādāyinī ca hoti var'ādāyinī ca kāyassa. katamehi pañcahi?
sbs_example_3:
yath'indakhīlo pathaviṃ sito siyā, catubbhi vātehi asampakampiyo.
tath'ūpamaṃ sappurisaṃ vadāmi, yo ariyasaccāni avecca passati.
sbs_example_4: ayam'eva ariyo aṭṭh'aṅgiko maggo seyyath'īdaṃ sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākamm'anto sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati sammāsamādhi.
sbs_example_5: ariyassa, bhikkhave, pañc'aṅgikassa sammāsamādhissa bhāvanaṃ desessāmi. taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī'ti.

example_1: idha bhikkhu ekaccassa evaṃ hoti, ahu vata me, taṃ vata me n'atthi, siyā vata me, taṃ vat'āhaṃ na labhāmī'ti.
example_2: ahu kho so, bhikkhave, samayo yaṃ ānakassa mudiṅgassa porāṇaṃ pokkharaphalakaṃ antaradhāyi, āṇisaṅghāṭo'va avasissi.
sbs_example_3:
yaṃ pubbe taṃ visosehi, pacchā te mā-ahu kiñcanaṃ,
majjhe ce no gahessasi, upasanto carissasi.
sbs_example_4:
samaṇassa ahu cintā,
pupphitamhi mahāvane,
ekaggassa nisinnassa,
pavivittassa jhāyino.
sbs_example_5:
tassa me ahu ussāho, nibbānaṃ abhipassato.
nā'haṃ bhabbo eta'r'ahi, kāmāni paṭisevituṃ.
anivatti bhavissāmi, brahmacariyaparāyaṇo'ti.

example_1: atthi, bhikkhave, ajātaṃ abhūtaṃ akataṃ asaṅkhataṃ
example_2:

na no samaṃ atthi tathāgatena

example_1: evam'etassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa samudayo hoti
example_2: sace, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā evaṃ puccheyyuṃ, kiṃmūlakā, āvuso, sabbe dhammā, kiṃsambhavā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamudayā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamosaraṇā sabbe dhammā
sbs_example_3: yaṃ kho bhikkhave dukkhe ñāṇaṃ, dukkhasamudaye ñāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhe ñāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya ñāṇaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati bhikkhave sammādiṭṭhi.

meaning_1: perfect peace of mind; stability of mind; stillness of mind; mental composure
example_1:
asso yathā bhadro kasāniviṭṭho,
ātāpino saṃvegino bhavātha,
saddhāya sīlena ca vīriyena ca,
samādhinā dhammavinicchayena ca,
sampannavijjācaraṇā patissatā,
jahissatha dukkham'idaṃ anappakaṃ.
example_2: saddhassa hi, bhante, ariyasāvakassa āraddhavīriyassa upaṭṭhitassatino etaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ yaṃ vossagg'ārammaṇaṃ karitvā labhissati samādhiṃ, labhissati cittassa ekaggataṃ.
sbs_example_3:

samādhinā tena samo na vijjati
sbs_example_4: ariyassa, bhikkhave, pañc'aṅgikassa sammāsamādhissa bhāvanaṃ desessāmi. taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī'ti.

example_1: ehi tvaṃ, tāta sudassana, bhagavato santike imaṃ gāthaṃ pariyāpuṇitvā mama bhatt'ābhihāre bhāsa. ahañ'ca te devasikaṃ kahāpaṇasataṃ bhikkhaṃ pavattayissāmī'ti.
example_2: idam'avoca bhagavā. attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinandun'ti.
sbs_example_3: yad'idaṃ cattāri purisayugāni aṭṭha purisapuggalā esa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa
sbs_example_4: niṭṭham'ettha gantabbaṃ – addhā, idaṃ na c'eva tassa bhagavato vacanaṃ arahato sammāsambuddhassa.

meaning_1: developing; cultivating; meditating; lit. causing to be
example_1: disvāna āyasmantaṃ rāhulaṃ āmantesi, ānāpānassatiṃ, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. ānāpānassati, rāhula, bhāvanā bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mah'ānisaṃsā'ti.

sbs_example_5: ariyassa, bhikkhave, pañc'aṅgikassa sammāsamādhissa bhāvanaṃ desessāmi. taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī'ti.

example_1: atha kho bhagavā kumbhakār'āvesanaṃ pavisitvā ekam'antaṃ tiṇasanthārakaṃ paññāpetvā nisīdi pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.
example_2: tena kho pana samayena kasibhāradvājassa brāhmaṇassa parivesanā vattati. atha kho bhagavā yena parivesanā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhāsi.
sbs_example_3: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhāsi. ekam'antaṃ ṭhitā kho sā devatā bhagavantaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi
sbs_example_4: atha kho āyasmā tisso bhagavato pitucchāputto yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi
sbs_example_5: sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi. ekam'antaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā udāyī āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etad'avoca

example_1: tatra'pi evaṃ aṭṭhāsiṃ evaṃ nisīdiṃ evaṃ abhāsiṃ evaṃ tuṇhī ahosiṃ
example_2: sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā yena andhavanaṃ ten'upasaṅkami divāvihārāya. andhavanaṃ ajjhogāhetvā aññatarasmiṃ supupphitasālarukkhamūle aṭṭhāsi.
sbs_example_3: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhāsi. ekam'antaṃ ṭhitā kho sā devatā bhagavantaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi

example_1: seyyathā'pi, brāhmaṇa, udapatto accho vippasanno anāvilo āloke nikkhitto. tattha cakkhumā puriso sakaṃ mukhanimittaṃ paccavekkhamāno yathābhūtaṃ jāneyya passeyya.
example_2: yathā kho, mārisā, nimittāni dissanti, uḷāro āloko sañjāyati, obhāso pātubhavati, brahmā pātubhavissati
sbs_example_3: thinamiddhaṃ pahāya vigatathinamiddho viharati ālokasaññī sato sampajāno, thinamiddhā cittaṃ parisodheti
sbs_example_4: idaṃ dukkhaṃ ariyasaccan'ti me, bhikkhave, pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṃ udapādi, ñāṇaṃ udapādi, paññā udapādi, vijjā udapādi, āloko udapādi.
sbs_chant_eng_4: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_5: ālokasaññaṃ manasi kareyyāsi, divāsaññaṃ adhiṭṭhaheyyāsi – yathā divā tathā rattiṃ yathā rattiṃ tathā divā. iti vivaṭena cetasā apariyonaddhena sa'p'pabhāsaṃ cittaṃ bhāveyyāsi

example_1: samaṇā samaṇā'ti vo, bhikkhave, jano sañjānāti. tumhe ca pana, ke tumhe'ti puṭṭhā samānā, samaṇā-amhā'ti paṭijānātha.
example_2:
mahāsamayo pavanasmiṃ,
devakāyā samāgatā,
āgat'amha imaṃ dhammasamayaṃ,
dakkhitāye aparājitasaṅghan'ti.

example_1: evam'eva kho, poṭṭhapāda, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, ek'antasukhī attā hoti arogo paraṃ maraṇā'ti.
example_2:
atthaṅ'gato so uda vā so n'atthi,
udāhu ve sassatiyā arogo,
taṃ me munī sādhu viyākarohi,
tathā hi te vidito esa dhammo.

example_1:

example_2: ahosiṃ nu kho ahaṃ atītam'addhānaṃ? na nu kho ahosiṃ atītam'addhānaṃ? kiṃ nu kho ahosiṃ atītam'addhānaṃ? kathaṃ nu kho ahosiṃ atītam'addhānaṃ? kiṃ hutvā kiṃ ahosiṃ nu kho ahaṃ atītam'addhānaṃ?

sbs_example_4: vohāravepakkaṃ saññaṃ vadāmi. yathā yathā naṃ sañjānāti tathā tathā voharati, evaṃ saññī ahosin'ti. ayaṃ vuccati saññānaṃ vipāko.

meaning_1: practices; follows a course of action; follows a method

meaning_1: (of person or place or thing) that; such; so and so
example_1: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, māgaṇḍiya, api nu so jacc'andho puriso jānanto passanto amuṃ telamalikataṃ sāhuḷicīraṃ paṭiggaṇheyya ... udāhu cakkhumato saddhāyā'ti?
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso loṇaphalaṃ paritte udakamallake pakkhipeyya. taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu taṃ parittaṃ udakaṃ amunā loṇaphalena loṇaṃ assa apeyyan'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

example_1: lobho akusalamūlaṃ doso akusalamūlaṃ moho akusalamūlaṃ idaṃ vuccat'āvuso akusalamūlaṃ.
example_2: idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo kodhano hoti upāyāsabahulo, appam'pi vutto samāno abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātukaroti.
sbs_example_3: kena ādittaṃ? rāg'agginā, dos'agginā, moh'agginā ādittaṃ, jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi ādittan'ti vadāmi
sbs_example_4: na c'eva no cittaṃ vipariṇataṃ bhavissati, na ca pāpikaṃ vācaṃ nicchāressāma, hitānukampī ca viharissāma mettacittā na dos'antarā.

meaning_1: by action; by deed; by doing
example_1:
ete kho vasalā vuttā,
mayā yete pakāsitā,
na jaccā vasalo hoti,
na jaccā hoti brāhmaṇo,
kammunā vasalo hoti,
kammunā hoti brāhmaṇo.
example_2:
na vedagū diṭṭhiyā na mutiyā,
sa mānam'eti na hi tammayo so,
na kammunā no'pi sutena neyyo,
anūpanīto sa nivesanesu.
sbs_example_3:
kassako kammunā hoti, sippiko hoti kammunā.
vāṇijo kammunā hoti, pessako hoti kammunā.

meaning_1: arouses; exhibits; produces; brings into being
example_1: so tathā sato viharanto taṃ dhammaṃ paññāya pavicinati pavicarati parivīmaṃsam'āpajjati.
example_2: tassa saṃvarāya paṭipajjatha, rakkhatha cakkhu'ndriyaṃ, cakkhu'ndriye saṃvaraṃ āpajjatha.
sbs_example_3: idha gihīhi saṃsaṭṭho viharati, sahanandī sahasokī, sukhitesu sukhito, dukkhitesu dukkhito, uppannesu kiccakaraṇīyesu attanā tesu yogaṃ āpajjati. ayaṃ vuccati manussaggāho.

example_1:
te atthaladdhā sukhitā,
viruḷhā buddhasāsane,
arogā sukhitā hotha,
saha sabbehi ñātibhī'ti.
example_2: taṃ alabhantena sukhito'pi pāpakārī puggalo vajjhena upametvā karuṇāyitabbo.

example_1: ñāṇañ'ca pana me dassanaṃ udapādi. akuppā me vimutti, ayamantimā jāti, n'atthi dāni punabbhavo'ti
example_2: seyyathā'pi nāma suddhaṃ vatthaṃ apagatakāḷakaṃ samma'd'eva rajanaṃ paṭiggaṇheyya, evam'eva yasassa kulaputtassa tasmiṃ'y'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi, yaṃ kiñci samudayadhammaṃ, sabbaṃ taṃ nirodhadhamman'ti.
sbs_example_3: idaṃ dukkhaṃ ariyasaccan'ti me, bhikkhave, pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṃ udapādi, ñāṇaṃ udapādi, paññā udapādi, vijjā udapādi, āloko udapādi.

construction:
sa + nta > santa > sat + ya
sat + ya
example_1:

dhammo suciṇṇo sukham'āvahati,
saccaṃ have sādutaraṃ rasānaṃ,

meaning_1: delighted (in); was pleased (with); approved (of); was happy (with); relished
example_1: attamano āyasmā rāhulo bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinandi
example_2: atha kho te bhikkhū tesaṃ aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ bhāsitaṃ n'eva abhinandiṃsu nappaṭikkosiṃsu, anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā pakkamiṃsu, bhagavato santike etassa bhāsitassa atthaṃ ājānissāmā'ti.

example_1: uṭṭhehi, āvuso, diṭṭho-asi bhagavatā, n'atthi te bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ saṃvāso'ti
example_2:
atthakāmo'si me yakkha,
hitakāmo'si devate,
karomi tuyhaṃ vacanaṃ,
tvaṃ'si ācariyo mama.
sbs_example_3:
gahakāraka diṭṭho-asi, puna gehaṃ na kāhasi,
sabbā te phāsukā bhaggā, gahakūṭaṃ visaṅkhataṃ,
visaṅkhāragataṃ cittaṃ, taṇhānaṃ khayam'ajjhagā.
sbs_example_4:
mutt'āhaṃ sabbapāsehi, ye dibbā ye ca mānusā.
mahābandhanamutto'mhi, nihato tvam'asi antakā'ti.

example_1: upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi
example_2: atha kho therā bhikkhū yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu. upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
sbs_example_3: evaṃ vutte, uttaro māṇavo pārāsiviy'antevāsī tuṇhībhūto maṅkubhūto pattakkhandho adhomukho pajjhāyanto appaṭibhāno nisīdi.
sbs_example_4: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi. sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekam’antaṃ nisīdi. ekam’antaṃ nisinno kho gaṇakamoggallāno brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ etad’avoca

meaning_1: is dis-enchanted (with); is disinterested (in); is disillusioned (by); loses interest (in); is dispassionate (towards)
example_1: yaṃ kiñci pasavati, asuci'y'eva pasavati, duggandhaṃ'y'eva pasavati, jegucchiyaṃ'y'eva pasavati. tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, imasmiṃ kāye nibbindathā'ti.

yadā paññāya passati,
atha nibbindati dukkhe,

example_1: atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, na dān'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, ito paraṃ uposathaṃ karissāmi, pātimokkhaṃ uddisissāmi
example_2: tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, bhikkhavo'ti. bhadante'ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ. bhagavā etadavoca

example_1:
es'eva maggo n'atth'añño,

commentary: (SNa) dhajo rathassā'ti mahantasmiṃ hi saṅgāmasīse dūrato'va dhajaṃ disvā, asukarañño nāma ayaṃ ratho'ti ratho pākaṭo hoti.
example_1:

example_1:

example_1: evañ'hi so, bhikkhave, majjhe nadiyā soto vikkhitto visaṭo byādiṇṇo n'eva dūraṅ'gamo assa na sīghasoto na hārahārī .

meaning_1: may they be!; they must be!

example_1:

meaning_1: is reborn (in); re-arises (in); lit. goes towards
example_1:

sbs_example_3: āyudo balado dhīro, vaṇṇado paṭibhāṇado. sukhassa dātā medhāvī, sukhaṃ so adhigacchati. āyuṃ datvā balaṃ vaṇṇaṃ, sukhañ'ca paṭibhānakaṃ, dīgh'āyu yasavā hoti, yattha yatth'ūpapajjatī'ti.

meaning_1: homeless spiritual seeker; wandering ascetic; lit. who goes around
commentary: (VIN 2.5.5.1) paribbājako nāma bhikkhuñ'ca sāmaṇerañ'ca ṭhapetvā yo koci paribbājakasamāpanno.
example_1: atha kho tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etadahosi, atippago kho tāva sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya carituṃ, yaṃ nūna mayaṃ yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo ten'upasaṅkameyyāmā'ti
example_2: sace, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā evaṃ puccheyyuṃ, kiṃmūlakā, āvuso, sabbe dhammā, kiṃsambhavā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamudayā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamosaraṇā sabbe dhammā
sbs_example_3: atha kho te bhikkhū yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā tehi aññatitthiyehi paribbājakehi saddhiṃ sammodiṃsu.
sbs_example_4: yo pana bhikkhu acelakassa vā paribbājakassa vā paribbājikāya vā sahatthā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā dadeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: approached; drew near; went (to); lit. went near

example_2: kosambiyaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā yena bhagavā tena-upasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdiṃsu.

sbs_example_4: atha kho āyasmā tisso bhagavato pitucchāputto yena bhagavā tena-upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi

example_2: etha, tumhe'pi, bhikkhave, ek'āsanabhojanaṃ bhuñjatha. ek'āsanabhojanaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tumhe'pi bhuñjamānā app'ābādhatañ'ca sañjānissatha app'ātaṅkatañ'ca lah'uṭṭhānañ'ca balañ'ca phāsuvihārañ'cā'ti.

commentary: (SNa) ekodi nipakā'ti ekaggacittā c'eva paññānepakkena ca samannāgatā.
example_1: tesaṃ pahānā ajjhattam'eva cittaṃ santiṭṭhati sannisīdati ekodi hoti samādhiyati.
example_2:
kaṃ so sikkhaṃ samādāya,
ekodi nipako sato,
kammāro rajatass'eva,
niddhame malam'attano.
sbs_example_3: vitakkavicārānaṃ vūpasamā ajjhattaṃ sampasādanaṃ cetaso ekodibhāvaṃ avitakkaṃ avicāraṃ samādhijaṃ pītisukhaṃ dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
sbs_example_4: mā, brāhmaṇa, paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ pamādo, paṭhame jhāne cittaṃ saṇṭhapehi, paṭhame jhāne cittaṃ ekodiṃ karohi, paṭhame jhāne cittaṃ samādahā'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
yassa n'atthi idaṃ me'ti,
paresaṃ v'āpi kiñcanaṃ,
mamattaṃ so asaṃvindaṃ,
n'atthi me'ti na socati.
example_2: saṅkhārā ca h'idaṃ, bhikkhave, attā abhavissaṃsu, na'y'idaṃ saṅkhārā ābādhāya saṃvatteyyuṃ, labbhetha ca saṅkhāresu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā hontu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā mā ahesun'ti.
sbs_example_3:
virūpakkhehi me mettaṃ, mettaṃ erāpathehi me.
chabyāputtehi me mettaṃ, mettaṃ kaṇhāgotamakehi ca.
sbs_example_4: rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, anattā. rūpañ'ca h'idaṃ, bhikkhave, attā abhavissa, na'y'idaṃ rūpaṃ ābādhāya saṃvatteyya, labbhetha ca rūpe, evaṃ me rūpaṃ hotu, evaṃ me rūpaṃ mā ahosī'ti.
sbs_chant_eng_4: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_5: so tesaṃ bhogānaṃ ārakkh'ādhikaraṇaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti, kin'ti me bhoge n'eva rājāno hareyyuṃ, na corā hareyyuṃ, na aggi daheyya, na udakaṃ vaheyya, na appiyā dāy'ādā hareyyun'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
manopubbaṅ'gamā dhammā,
manoseṭṭhā manomayā,
manasā ce paduṭṭhena,
bhāsati vā karoti vā,
tato naṃ dukkham'anveti,
cakkaṃva vahato padaṃ.
example_2:
akiñcanaṃ anādānaṃ,
etaṃ dīpaṃ anāparaṃ,
nibbānaṃ iti naṃ brūmi,
jarāmaccuparikkhayaṃ.
sbs_example_3: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato etam'atthaṃ ārocessāma. yathā no bhagavā byākarissati tathā naṃ dhāressāmā'ti.
sbs_example_4: balavā puriso divasaṃsantatte ayokaṭāhe dve vā tīṇi vā udakaphusitāni nipāteyya. dandho, ānanda, udakaphusitānaṃ nipāto, atha kho naṃ khippam'eva parikkhayaṃ pariyādānaṃ gaccheyya.
sbs_example_5: so kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, uppann'uppannaṃ kāmavitakkaṃ pajaham'eva vinodam'eva byantam'eva naṃ akāsiṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: na kho pan'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, saha dukkhena saha domanassena catunnaṃ ariyasaccānaṃ abhisamayaṃ vadāmi
example_2:
nindāya nappavedheyya,
na uṇṇameyya pasaṃsito bhikkhu,
lobhaṃ saha macchariyena,
kodhaṃ pesuṇiyañ'ca panudeyya.
sbs_example_3: te atthaladdhā sukhitā, viruḷhā buddhasāsane. arogā sukhitā hotha, saha sabbehi ñātibhī'ti.
sbs_example_4:
passa cittakataṃ rūpaṃ, maṇinā kuṇḍalena ca.
aṭṭhiṃ tacena onaddhaṃ, saha vatthehi sobhati.
sbs_example_5: upakaṭṭhāya pavāraṇāya sabb'eva saha paṭisambhidāhi arahattaṃ pāpuṇiṃsu
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: sampajānamusāvādo kho pan'āyasmanto antarāyiko dhammo vutto bhagavatā, tasmā saramānena bhikkhunā āpannena visuddh'āpekkhena santī āpatti āvikātabbā, āvikatā hi'ssa phāsu hoti.
example_2:
vijigucchamānassa yadidaṃ phāsu,
ritt'āsanaṃ sayanaṃ sevato ce,
sambodhikāmassa yath'ānudhammaṃ,
taṃ te pavakkhāmi yathā pajānaṃ.
sbs_example_3: tassa dāpetvā vā adāpetvā vā uyyojeyya, gacch'āvuso, na me tayā saddhiṃ kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hoti, ekakassa me kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hotī'ti
sbs_example_4:
purato pacchato vā'pi, aparo ce na vijjati,
atīva phāsu bhavati, ekassa vasato vane.

example_1: divasaṃ caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittaṃ parisodhessāma
example_2: atha kho bhagavā bahu'd'eva rattiṃ abbhokāse nisajjāya vītināmetvā pāde pakkhāletvā vihāraṃ pāvisi. āyasmā'pi kho soṇo bahu'd'eva rattiṃ abbhokāse nisajjāya vītināmetvā pāde pakkhāletvā vihāraṃ pāvisi.
sbs_example_3: tassa dāpetvā vā adāpetvā vā uyyojeyya, gacch'āvuso, na me tayā saddhiṃ kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hoti, ekakassa me kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hotī'ti

example_1:
ākiñcaññaṃ pekkhamāno satimā,
n'atthī'ti nissāya tarassu oghaṃ,
kāme pahāya virato kathāhi,
taṇhakkhayaṃ nattam'ah'ābhipassa.
example_2:
na ca katthitā siyā bhikkhu,
na ca vācaṃ payuttaṃ bhāseyya,
pāgabbhiyaṃ na sikkheyya,
kathaṃ viggāhikaṃ na kathayeyya.
sbs_example_3: tassa dāpetvā vā adāpetvā vā uyyojeyya, gacch'āvuso, na me tayā saddhiṃ kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hoti, ekakassa me kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hotī'ti
sbs_example_4: āyasmā ānando tā bhikkhuniyo dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā uṭṭhāyaāsanā pakkāmi
sbs_example_5: esa vāt'āhatatālapaṇṇaṃ viya taṭataṭāyati, imassa kathāpariyantoy'eva n'atthī'ti nindanti

example_1:
sabbattha te citta vaco kataṃ mayā,
bahūsu jātīsu na me'si kopito,
ajjhattasambhavo kataññutāya te,
dukkhe ciraṃ saṃsaritaṃ tayā kate.
example_2: dujjānaṃ kho etaṃ, mahārāja, tayā gihinā kāmabhoginā puttasambādhasayanaṃ ajjhāvasantena kāsikacandanaṃ paccanubhontena mālāgandhavilepanaṃ dhārayantena jātarūparajataṃ sādiyantena, ime vā arahanto, ime vā arahattamaggaṃ samāpannā'ti.
sbs_example_3: tassa dāpetvā vā adāpetvā vā uyyojeyya, gacch'āvuso, na me tayā saddhiṃ kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hoti, ekakassa me kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hotī'ti

example_1: taggha'si, tāta kumma, khato, taggha upahato. etena hi te, tāta kumma, suttakena pitaro ca pitāmahā ca anayaṃ āpannā byasanaṃ āpannā. gaccha dāni tvaṃ, tāta kumma, na dāni tvaṃ amhākan'ti.
example_2: hivibhatti lopam'āpajjate vā. gaccha, gacchāhi, gama, gamāhi, gamaya, gamayāhi. hī'ti kim'atthaṃ? gacchati, gamayati.
sbs_example_3: tassa dāpetvā vā adāpetvā vā uyyojeyya, gacch'āvuso, na me tayā saddhiṃ kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hoti, ekakassa me kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hotī'ti

meaning_1: approaches; goes (to); visits; lit. goes near
example_1: sace bhavaṃ soṇadaṇḍo samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamissati, bhoto soṇadaṇḍassa yaso hāyissati, samaṇassa gotamassa yaso abhivaḍḍhissati.
example_2: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme. tena kho pana samayena aññataro navo bhikkhu ativelaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamati.
sbs_example_3: tasmā't'iha, moggallāna, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, na uccāsoṇḍaṃ paggahetvā kulāni upasaṅkamissāmī'ti
sbs_example_4: idha saddhājāto upasaṅkamati, upasaṅkamanto payirupāsati, payirupāsanto sotaṃ odahati, ohitasoto dhammaṃ suṇāti, sutvā dhammaṃ dhāreti, dhatānaṃ dhammānaṃ atthaṃ upaparikkhati,
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: taṇhā hi naṃ sibbati tassa tass'eva bhavassa abhinibbattiyā.
example_2:
na hi verena verāni,
sammant'īdha kudācanaṃ,
averena ca sammanti,
esa dhammo sanantano.
sbs_example_3:
tasmā hi bhūtā nisāmetha sabbe, mettaṃ karotha mānusiyā pajāya.
divā ca ratto ca haranti ye baliṃ, tasmā hi ne rakkhatha appamattā.
sbs_example_4:
tuvaṃhi no brahmasamo'si saccaṃ,
kathaṃ upapajjati brahmalokaṃ jutima.
sbs_example_5:
diṭṭhiṃ ca anupaggamma, sīlavā dassanena sampanno,
kāmesu vineyya gedhaṃ, na hi jātu gabbhaseyyaṃ punar'etī' ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (VIN 1.2.13) kulaṃ nāma cattāri kulāni, khattiyakulaṃ, brāhmaṇakulaṃ, vessakulaṃ, suddakulaṃ.
example_1:
paccati munino bhattaṃ,
thokaṃ thokaṃ kule kule,
piṇḍikāya carissāmi,
atthi jaṅghābalaṃ mamā'ti.
example_2: idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo nīce kule paccājāto hoti, caṇḍālakule vā venakule vā nesādakule vā rathakārakule vā pukkusakule vā dalidde app'annapānabhojane kasiravuttike, yattha kasirena ghāsacchādo labbhati.
sbs_example_3: taṃ dhammaṃ suṇāti gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā aññatarasmiṃ vā kule paccājāto.
sbs_example_4: tasmā't'iha, moggallāna, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, na uccāsoṇḍaṃ paggahetvā kulāni upasaṅkamissāmī'ti
sbs_example_5: alam'eva saddhāpabbajitena kulaputtena vīriyaṃ ārabhituṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: kiṃ nu kho mayaṃ āyasmato anuruddhassa evam'ārocimha, imāsañ'ca imāsañ'ca vihārasamāpattīnaṃ mayaṃ lābhino'ti yaṃ no āyasmā anuruddho bhagavato sammukhā yāva āsavānaṃ khayā pakāsetī'ti?
example_2: āyām'āvuso, yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamissāma. upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato etam'atthaṃ ārocessāma. yathā no bhagavā byākarissati tathā naṃ dhāressāmā'ti.
sbs_example_3: taṃ no brahmacariyaṃ imassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa antakiriyāya saṃvattatu
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
puriso aṅkusam'ādāya,
dehi pādan'ti yācati,
nāgo pasārayī pādaṃ,
puriso nāgam'āruhi.
example_2: añña'd'atthu pañjaliko'va naṃ yācati, dehi me, mārisa, urabbhaṃ vā urabbhadhanaṃ vā'ti.
sbs_example_3: suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho. ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu saññācikāya kuṭiṃ kattukāmo assāmikaṃ attuddesaṃ. so saṅghaṃ kuṭivatthuolokanaṃ yācati.
sbs_example_4: ettha dāni, māluṅkyaputta, kiṃ dahare bhikkhū vakkhāma yatra hi nāma tvaṃ, bhikkhu, jiṇṇo vuddho mahallako addhagato vayoanuppatto saṃkhittena ovādaṃ yācasī'ti.
sbs_example_5: tasmā n'ābhikkhaṇaṃ gacche, na ca gacche cirāciraṃ. kālena yācaṃ yāceyya, evaṃ mittā na jīyare.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: site of the hut; grounds of the dwelling
example_1: tena kuṭikārakena bhikkhunā kuṭivatthuṃ sodhetvā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ek'aṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evam'assa vacanīyo
example_2: bhikkhū vā anabhineyya, vatthudesanāya pamāṇaṃ vā atikkāmeyyā'ti ñattidutiyena kammena kuṭivatthuṃ na desāpetvā, āyāmato vā vitthārato vā antamaso kes'aggamattam'pi atikkāmetvā
sbs_example_3: suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho. ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu saññācikāya kuṭiṃ kattukāmo assāmikaṃ attuddesaṃ. so saṅghaṃ kuṭivatthuolokanaṃ yācati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, handa dāni, bhikkhave, āmantayāmi vo, vayadhammā saṅkhārā appamādena sampādethā'ti. ayaṃ tathāgatassa pacchimā vācā.
example_2: yo, bhikkhave, ime dhamme evaṃ pajānāti evaṃ passati, ayaṃ vuccati, sot'āpanno avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyano'ti.
sbs_example_3: so idaṃ dukkhan'ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ayaṃ dukkhasamudayo'ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ayaṃ dukkhanirodho'ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti
sbs_example_4: ayam'eva ariyo aṭṭh'aṅgiko maggo seyyath'īdaṃ sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākamm'anto sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati sammāsamādhi.
sbs_example_5: etāni, bhikkhave, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññ'āgārāni. jhāyatha, bhikkhave, mā pamād'attha, mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. ayaṃ vo amhākaṃ anusāsanī'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanakajātiko ādāse vā parisuddhe pariyodāte acche vā udakapatte sakaṃ mukhanimittaṃ paccavekkhamāno
example_2: vippasannāni kho te, gahapati, indriyāni, parisuddho mukhavaṇṇo pariyodāto.
sbs_example_3: so evaṃ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigat'ūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte pubbenivās'ānussatiñāṇāya cittaṃ abhininnāmeti.

meaning_1: so; thus; in such a way; likewise; similarly
example_1: upekkhāsahagatena cetasā ekaṃ disaṃ pharitvā viharati tathā dutiyaṃ tathā tatiyaṃ tathā catutthaṃ
example_2:
atthaṅ'gato so uda vā so n'atthi,
udāhu ve sassatiyā arogo,
taṃ me munī sādhu viyākarohi,
tathā hi te vidito esa dhammo.
sbs_example_3: so tathā vūpakaṭṭho viharanto taṃ dhammaṃ anussarati anuvitakketi
sbs_example_4: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato etam'atthaṃ ārocessāma. yathā no bhagavā byākarissati tathā naṃ dhāressāmā'ti.

meaning_1: matter; material thing; materiality; experience of material world; physical objects of consciousness; first of the five aggregates; lit. form
example_1: evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako rūpasmim'pi nibbindati vedanāya'pi nibbindati saññāya'pi nibbindati saṅkhāresu'pi nibbindati viññāṇasmim'pi nibbindati
example_2: ahañ'c'eva kho pana anāgataṃ rūpaṃ abhinandeyyaṃ, anāgatam'p'āhaṃ addhānaṃ evam'eva rūpena khajjeyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi eta'r'ahi paccuppannena rūpena khajjāmī'ti
sbs_example_3: seyyath'īdaṃ rūp'ūpādānakkhandho vedan'ūpādānakkhandho saññ'ūpādānakkhandho saṅkhār'ūpādānakkhandho viññāṇ'ūpādānakkhandho
sbs_example_4: yasmā ca kho, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ anattā, tasmā rūpaṃ ābādhāya saṃvattati, na ca labbhati rūpe, evaṃ me rūpaṃ hotu, evaṃ me rūpaṃ mā ahosī''ti.

example_1: ahaṃ kho, samaṇa, kasāmi ca vapāmi ca. kasitvā ca vapitvā ca bhuñjāmi. tvam'pi, samaṇa, kasassu ca vapassu ca. kasitvā ca vapitvā ca bhuñjassū'ti.
example_2:
yathā ahaṃ tathā ete,
yathā ete tathā ahaṃ,
attānaṃ upamaṃ katvā,
na haneyya na ghātaye.
sbs_example_3: sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā saṃkhittena dhammaṃ desetu, yam'ahaṃ bhagavato dhammaṃ sutvā ekā vūpakaṭṭhā appamattā ātāpinī pahit'attā vihareyyan'ti.
sbs_example_4: atha kho aññe imaṃ bhogaṃ paṭipajjissanti, ahaṃ pana yathākammaṃ gamissāmī'ti.
sbs_example_5:
mutta-ahaṃ sabbapāsehi, ye dibbā ye ca mānusā.
mahābandhanamutto'mhi, nihato tvam'asi antakā'ti.

example_1: n'atthi no kiñci uttariṃ karaṇīyan'ti
example_2:
ko sujjhati muccati bajjhatī ca,
ken'attanā gacchati brahmalokaṃ,
ajānato me muni brūhi puṭṭho,
bhagavā hi me sakkhi brahmajjadiṭṭho,
tuvañ'hi no brahmasamo'si saccaṃ,
kathaṃ upapajjati brahmalokaṃ jutima.
sbs_example_3: sādhu no bhante bhagavā suciraparinibbuto'pi pacchimājanat'ānukampamānasā
sbs_example_4: kiñ'c'āpi te evaṃ vadeyyuṃ, piyo no attā'ti, atha kho tesaṃ appiyo attā. taṃ kissa hetu? yañ'hi appiyo appiyassa kareyya, taṃ te attanā'va attano karonti, tasmā tesaṃ appiyo attā.

ath'ettha sallam'addakkhiṃ,

sbs_example_4: tassa dāpetvā vā adāpetvā vā uyyojeyya, gacch'āvuso, na me tayā saddhiṃ kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hoti, ekakassa me kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hotī'ti

example_1: evaṃ abhisaddahati, ime kho te dhammā ye me pubbe sutavā ahesuṃ, ten'āhaṃ eta'r'ahi kāyena ca phusitvā viharāmi, paññāya ca ativijjha passāmī'ti.
example_2: kusāvatiyā, ānanda, rājadhāniyā catunnaṃ vaṇṇānaṃ dvārāni ahesuṃ. ekaṃ dvāraṃ sovaṇṇamayaṃ, ekaṃ rūpiyamayaṃ, ekaṃ veḷuriyamayaṃ, ekaṃ phalikamayaṃ.

example_1:

example_1: etha bhikkhavo'ti bhagavā avoca. svākkhāto dhammo caratha brahmacariyaṃ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā'ti. sāva tesaṃ āyasmantānaṃ upasampadā ahosi
example_2: bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, kummo kacchapo sāy'anhasamayaṃ anunadītīre gocarapasuto ahosi. siṅgālopi kho, bhikkhave, sāy'anhasamayaṃ anunadītīre gocarapasuto ahosi.
sbs_example_3: rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, anattā. rūpañ'ca h'idaṃ, bhikkhave, attā abhavissa, na'y'idaṃ rūpaṃ ābādhāya saṃvatteyya, labbhetha ca rūpe, evaṃ me rūpaṃ hotu, evaṃ me rūpaṃ mā ahosī'ti.

meaning_1: neutral; neither unpleasant nor pleasant; neither comfortable nor uncomfortable
commentary: (VINa) adukkham'asukhan'ti dukkh'ābhāvena adukkhaṃ, sukh'ābhāvena asukhaṃ. eten'ettha dukkhasukhapaṭipakkhabhūtaṃ tatiyavedanaṃ dīpeti, na dukkhasukhābhāvamattaṃ. tatiyavedanā nāma, adukkhamasukhā, upekkhā'ti'pi vuccati. sā iṭṭh'āniṭṭhaviparīt'ānubhavanalakkhaṇā, majjhattarasā, avibhūtapaccupaṭṭhānā, sukhanirodhapadaṭṭhānā'ti veditabbā.
example_1: evaṃ vutte aññataro bhikkhu there bhikkhū etadavoca, sukhā, āvuso, vedanā eko anto, dukkhā vedanā dutiyo anto, adukkham'asukhā vedanā majjhe, taṇhā sibbinī.
example_2: sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā, pubb'eva somanassadomanassānaṃ atthaṅ'gamā, adukkham'asukhaṃ upekkhāsatipārisuddhiṃ catutthaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
sbs_example_3: n'eva tasmiṃ samaye dukkhaṃ vedanaṃ vedeti, na adukkham'asukhaṃ vedanaṃ vedeti
sbs_example_4: sukham'pi vedayati, dukkham'pi vedayati, adukkham'asukham'pi vedayati. vedayatī'ti kho, bhikkhave, tasmā vedanā'ti vuccati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

sbs_example_5: satisambojjh'aṅgaṃ tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhu bhāveti, satisambojjh'aṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati.

example_1: ty'āhaṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadāmi, saccaṃ kira tumhe āyasmanto evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, ek'antasukhī attā hoti arogo paraṃ maraṇā'ti?
example_2:
ko sujjhati muccati bajjhatī ca,
ken'attanā gacchati brahmalokaṃ,
ajānato me muni brūhi puṭṭho,
bhagavā hi me sakkhi brahmajjadiṭṭho,
tuvañ'hi no brahmasamo'si saccaṃ,
kathaṃ upapajjati brahmalokaṃ jutima.

meaning_1: makes stable; steadies; establishes; lit. causes to stand
example_1: moggallāna, moggallāna, mā, brāhmaṇa, ariyaṃ tuṇhībhāvaṃ pamādo, ariye tuṇhībhāve cittaṃ saṇṭhapehi, ariye tuṇhībhāve cittaṃ ekodibhāvaṃ karohi, ariye tuṇhībhāve cittaṃ samādahā'ti.
example_2: so kho ahaṃ, aggivessana, tassā'y'eva kathāya pariyosāne, tasmiṃ'y'eva purimasmiṃ samādhinimitte ajjhattam'eva cittaṃ saṇṭhapemi sannisādemi ekodiṃ karomi samādahāmi, yena sudaṃ niccakappaṃ viharāmī'ti.
sbs_example_3: mā, brāhmaṇa, paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ pamādo, paṭhame jhāne cittaṃ saṇṭhapehi, paṭhame jhāne cittaṃ ekodiṃ karohi, paṭhame jhāne cittaṃ samādahā'ti.

meaning_1: bad; wicked; evil; wrong; worthless; harmful
example_1:
sānuṃ pabuddhaṃ vajjāsi,
yakkhānaṃ vacanaṃ idaṃ,
m'ākāsi pāpakaṃ kammaṃ,
āvi vā yadi vā raho.
example_2: so sabbehi imehi pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi visuddham'attānaṃ samanupassati, vimuttam'attānaṃ samanupassati.
sbs_example_3:
kiñ'c'āpi so kammaṃ karoti pāpakaṃ, kāyena vācā'uda cetasā vā.

example_1: iti kho, ānanda, kammaṃ khettaṃ, viññāṇaṃ bījaṃ, taṇhā sneho.
example_2: cetan'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, kammaṃ vadāmi. cetayitvā kammaṃ karoti, kāyena vācāya manasā.

example_1:

etehi tīhi ṭhānehi,

example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, pāsāṇe lekhā na khippaṃ lujjati vātena vā udakena vā, ciraṭṭhitikā hoti, evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco puggalo abhiṇhaṃ kujjhati. so ca khv'assa kodho dīgharattaṃ anuseti.

example_1: aṭṭh'ime, bhikkhave, mahāsamudde acchariyā abbhutā dhammā, ye disvā disvā asurā mahāsamudde abhiramanti. katame aṭṭha?
example_2:
ek'āsanassa sikkhetha,
samaṇ'ūpāsanassa ca,
ekattaṃ monam'akkhātaṃ,
eko ce abhiramissasi,
atha bhāhisi dasadisā.

example_1: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satthāraṃ upanissāya viharati aññataraṃ vā garuṭṭhāniyaṃ sabrahmacāriṃ, yatth'assa tibbaṃ hir'ottappaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti pemañ'ca gāravo ca.
example_2:
cudito vacībhi satim'ābhinande,

vācaṃ pamuñce kusalaṃ n'ātivelaṃ,
janavādadhammāya na cetayeyya.
sbs_example_3: kacci nu kho maṃ anuvicca viññū sabrahmacārī sīlato na upavadantī'ti, pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ.
sbs_chant_eng_3: Ten Subjects for Frequent Recollection by One Who Has Gone Forth
sbs_example_4: bhikkhu ye te lābhā dhammikā dhammaladdhā antamaso pattapariyāpannamattam'pi, tathārūpehi lābhehi appaṭivibhattabhogī hoti sīlavantehi sabrahmacārīhi sādhāraṇabhogī.
sbs_example_5: yāvakīvañ'ca bhikkhave bhikkhū paccattaññ'eva satiṃ upaṭṭhāpessanti, kin'ti anāgatā ca pesalā sabrahmacārī āgaccheyyuṃ āgatā ca pesalā sabrahmacārī phāsuṃ vihareyyun'ti

example_1:

example_1: iti attahetu vā parahetu vā āmisakiñcikkhahetu vā sampajānamusā bhāsitā hoti. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, puggalo gūthabhāṇī.
example_2: idha, potaliya, ekacco puggalo avaṇṇ'ārahassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena, no ca kho vaṇṇ'ārahassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena.

meaning_1: looking (at); observing; following; noticing; witnessing; watching
example_1: katamā ca, bhikkhave, samādhibhāvanā bhāvitā bahulīkatā āsavānaṃ khayāya saṃvattati? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu udayabbaya-anupassī viharati

example_1:

example_1:

example_1: n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, lokena vivadāmi, loko'va mayā vivadati. na, bhikkhave, dhammavādī kenaci lokasmiṃ vivadati.

example_1: etāni, bhikkhu, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññ'āgārāni. jhāyatha, bhikkhu, mā pamād'attha, mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. ayaṃ vo amhākaṃ anusāsanī'ti.

meaning_1: abandoned; dispelled; eliminated; removed; given up

example_2:

example_2: sādh'āvuso'ti kho āyasmā mahākoṭṭhiko āyasmato sāriputtassa bhāsitaṃ abhinanditvā anumoditvā āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ uttariṃ pañhaṃ apucchi.

commentary:
(MNa) pañcasu kāmaguṇesu cittavossaggalakkhaṇo pamādo, vossagg'ānuppadānaraso, sativippavāsapaccupaṭṭhāno'ti
(MNa) pamādan'ti vissaṭṭhasatibhāvaṃ.
(SNa) pamādā cā'ti ... sati-vippavāsa-lakkhaṇena pamādena ca.
(SNa) pamādo'ti niddāya vā kilesavasena vā pamādo.
example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kiṭṭhaṃ sampannaṃ. kiṭṭh'ārakkho ca pamatto, goṇo ca kiṭṭh'ādo aduṃ kiṭṭhaṃ otaritvā yāva'd'atthaṃ madaṃ āpajjeyya pamādaṃ āpajjeyya.
example_2:
appamādo amatapadaṃ,
pamādo maccuno padaṃ,
appamattā na mīyanti,
ye pamattā yathā matā.
sbs_example_3:
pamādo rajo pamādo, pamād'ānupatito rajo,
appamādena vijjāya, abbahe sallam'attano'ti.
sbs_example_4: etāni, bhikkhave, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññ'āgārāni. jhāyatha, bhikkhave, mā pamādoattha, mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. ayaṃ vo amhākaṃ anusāsanī'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
ārogyaparamā lābhā,
santuṭṭhiparamaṃ dhanaṃ,
vissāsaparamā ñāti,
nibbānaṃ paramaṃ sukhaṃ.
example_2: ye me petā ñātī sālohitā kālaṅ'katā pasannacittā anussaranti tesaṃ taṃ mahapphalaṃ assa mah'ānisaṃsan'ti
sbs_example_3: ñātibyasanena vā phuṭṭhassa, bhogabyasanena vā phuṭṭhassa, rogabyasanena vā phuṭṭhassa, sīlabyasanena vā phuṭṭhassa, diṭṭhibyasanena vā phuṭṭhassa
sbs_example_4: idaṃ vo ñātīnaṃ hotu, sukhitā hontu ñātayo.
sbs_example_5: annakathaṃ pānakathaṃ vatthakathaṃ sayanakathaṃ mālākathaṃ gandhakathaṃ ñātikathaṃ yānakathaṃ gāmakathaṃ nigamakathaṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
kiṃ nu santaramāno'va,
rāhu candaṃ pamuñcasi,
saṃviggarūpo āgamma,
kiṃ nu bhīto'va tiṭṭhasī'ti.
example_2:
catuppado ahaṃ samma,
tvam'pi samma catuppado,
ehi samma nivattassu,
kiṃ nu bhīto palāyasi.
sbs_example_3: kiṃ nu kujjhasi mā kujjhi, akkodho tissa te varaṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (SNa) jhāyathā'ti ārammaṇ'ūpanijjhānena aṭṭhatiṃs'ārammaṇāni, lakkhaṇ'ūpanijjhānena ca anicc'ādito khandh'āyatan'ādīni upanijjhāyatha, samathañ'ca vipassanañ'ca vaḍḍhethā'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
example_1: etāni, bhikkhu, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññ'āgārāni. jhāyatha, bhikkhu, mā pamād'attha, mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. ayaṃ vo amhākaṃ anusāsanī'ti.
example_2:
sa jhānapasuto dhīro,
van'ante ramito siyā,
jhāyetha rukkhamūlasmiṃ,
attānam'abhitosayaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
jhāya bhikkhu mā pamādo, mā te kāmaguṇe bhamassu cittaṃ,
mā lohaguḷaṃ gilī pamatto, mā kandi dukkham'idan'ti ḍayhamāno.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: at one time; on one occasion
example_1: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
example_2: atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, ārādhayiṃsu vata me, bhikkhave, bhikkhū ekaṃ samayaṃ cittaṃ. idh'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū āmantesiṃ, ahaṃ kho, bhikkhave, ek'āsanabhojanaṃ bhuñjāmi.
sbs_example_3: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kosambiyaṃ viharati ghosit'ārāme
sbs_example_4: evaṃ me sutaṃ ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā gayāyaṃ viharati gayāsīse saddhiṃ bhikkhusahassena. tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: so tattha dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā vedanā vedeti, na ca tāva kālaṅ'karoti yāva na taṃ pāpakammaṃ byantīhoti.
example_2: n'eva tasmiṃ samaye dukkhaṃ vedanaṃ vedeti, na adukkham'asukhaṃ vedanaṃ vedeti
sbs_example_3: dukkhaṃ vā vedanaṃ vedayamāno dukkhaṃ vedanaṃ vedayāmī'ti pajānāti.

meaning_1: who speaks about Dhamma; who speaks according to the teaching
example_1: n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, lokena vivadāmi, loko'va mayā vivadati. na, bhikkhave, dhammavādī kenaci lokasmiṃ vivadati.
example_2: kālavādī bhūtavādī atthavādī dhammavādī vinayavādī nidhānavatiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti kālena sāpadesaṃ pariyantavatiṃ atthasaṃhitaṃ
sbs_example_3: dhammavādī c'eso bhikkhu vinayavādī c'eso bhikkhu amhākañ'c'eso bhikkhu chandañ'ca ruciñ'ca ādāya voharati, jānāti no bhāsati amhākam'p'etaṃ khamatī'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, yv'āyaṃ jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo ca hoti samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo ca ayaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ jhāyīnaṃ aggo ca seṭṭho ca mokkho ca uttamo ca pavaro cā'ti.
example_2: katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ? cattāro ca mahābhūtā, catunnañ'ca mahābhūtānaṃ upādāya rūpaṃ. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ.
sbs_example_3: catunnaṃ dhammānaṃ ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evam'idaṃ dīgham'addhānaṃ sandhāvitaṃ saṃsaritaṃ mamañ'c'eva tumhākañ'ca
sbs_example_4: api c'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, sahā'va sukhena, sahā'va somanassena catunnaṃ ariyasaccānaṃ abhisamayaṃ vadāmi.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: chasu kho, nāgita, phass'āyatanesu anicc'ānupassino viharato phasse pāṭikulyatā saṇṭhāti, eso tassa nissando.
example_2: so kāye ca sukhāya ca vedanāya anicc'ānupassī viharati, vay'ānupassī viharati, virāg'ānupassī viharati, nirodh'ānupassī viharati, paṭinissagg'ānupassī viharati.
sbs_example_3: anicc'ānupassī assasissāmī'ti sikkhati, anicc'ānupassī passasissāmī'ti sikkhati
sbs_example_4: iti imesu pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu anicc'ānupassī viharati. ayaṃ vuccat'ānanda, aniccasaññā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: name of the Buddha's chief lay disciple; lit. feeder of the destitute
example_1: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
example_2: atha kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati pañcamattehi upāsakasatehi parivuto yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.
sbs_example_3: anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati yāvatako ahosi tehi aññatitthiyehi paribbājakehi saddhiṃ kathāsallāpo taṃ sabbaṃ bhagavato ārocesi.

example_1: so evaṃ vadeyya, alaṃ me, bho, tāya vīṇāya, tam'eva me saddaṃ āharathā'ti. tam'enaṃ evaṃ vadeyyuṃ, ayaṃ kho, bhante, vīṇā nāma anekasambhārā mahāsambhārā
example_2: alaṃ, vakkali, kiṃ te iminā pūtikāyena diṭṭhena? yo kho, vakkali, dhammaṃ passati so maṃ passati, yo maṃ passati so dhammaṃ passati
sbs_example_3: alaṃ, ānanda, mā soci mā paridevi, nanu etaṃ, ānanda, mayā paṭikacc'eva akkhātaṃ – sabbeh'eva piyehi manāpehi nānābhāvo vinābhāvo aññathābhāvo

example_1: alañ'ca pana vo, bhikkhave, tuṭṭhiyā, alaṃ attamanatāya, alaṃ somanassāya, sammāsambuddho bhagavā, svākkhāto dhammo, suppaṭipanno saṅgho'ti.
example_2: siyā kho pana bhikkhave tumhākaṃ evam'assa, hir'ottappen'amha samannāgatā, alam'ettāvatā katam'ettāvatā, anuppatto no sāmaññ'attho, n'atthi no kiñci uttariṃ karaṇīyan'ti

commentary:

(SNa) app'icchā santuṭṭhā app'icchatāya vattham'pi na nivāsentī'ti evaṃ samuggato yaso etesaṃ atthī'ti yasassino
example_1: atha kho sabhiyo paribbājako tassā devatāya santike te pañhe uggahetvā ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā saṅghino gaṇino gaṇ'ācariyā ñātā yasassino titthakarā sādhusammatā bahujanassa ... te upasaṅkamitvā te pañhe pucchati.

meaning_1: don't have remorse later!; don't regret it later
commentary: (SNa) mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvatthā'ti ye hi pubbe daharakāle arogakāle sattasappāy'ādisampattikāle satthu sammukhībhāvakāle ca yonisomanasikārarahitā rattin'divaṃ maṅkulabhattaṃ hutvā seyyasukhaṃ middhasukhaṃ anubhontā pamajjanti, te pacchā jarākāle rogakāle maraṇakāle vipattikāle satthu parinibbutakāle ca taṃ pubbe pamādavihāraṃ anussarantā sappaṭisandhikālakiriyañ'ca bhāriyaṃ sampassamānā vippaṭisārino honti.
example_1: etāni, bhikkhu, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññ'āgārāni. jhāyatha, bhikkhu, mā pamād'attha, mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. ayaṃ vo amhākaṃ anusāsanī'ti.

meaning_1: don’t let this person defeat you

meaning_1: let it not be; may it not exist

meaning_1: may they not be; may they not exist
commentary: (MNa) mā vā ahesun'ti kiñci'pi mā ahesuṃ. idhā'pi kopamattakena kammapathabhedo na hoti. haññantū'tiādicintanen'eva hoti, tasmā evaṃ vuttaṃ.
example_1: byāpannacitto hoti paduṭṭhamanasaṅkappo, ime sattā haññantu vā bajjhantu vā ucchijjantu vā vinassantu vā mā vā ahesun'ti.
example_2: saṅkhārā ca h'idaṃ, bhikkhave, attā abhavissaṃsu, na'y'idaṃ saṅkhārā ābādhāya saṃvatteyyuṃ, labbhetha ca saṅkhāresu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā hontu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā mā ahesun'ti.

meaning_1: do not make; do not create; don't do; lit. do not made

example_1: ṭhānaṃ kho pan'etaṃ, āvuso, vijjati yaṃ idh'ekaccassa bhikkhuno evaṃ icchā uppajjeyya, aho vata mam'eva bhikkhū sakkareyyuṃ garuṃ kareyyuṃ māneyyuṃ pūjeyyuṃ, na aññaṃ bhikkhuṃ bhikkhū sakkareyyuṃ garuṃ kareyyuṃ māneyyuṃ pūjeyyun'ti.

annena atha pānena,
vatthena sayanena ca,
ucchādanena nhāpanena,

example_1:
evaṃ bho purisa jānāhi,
pāpadhammā asaññatā,
mā taṃ lobho adhammo ca,
ciraṃ dukkhāya randhayuṃ.
example_2:
ciraṃ jīva mahāvīra,
kappaṃ tiṭṭha mahāmune,

meaning_1: wise; intelligent; insightful; percipient; lit. having wisdom quality
commentary:
(SNa) paññavatā'ti tam'pi sappaññen'eva paṇḍitena.
(ANa) paññavanto ... ettha kammassakatapaññā, jhānapaññā vipassanāpaññā, maggapaññā, phalapaññā'ti etāhi samannāgatā paññavanto nāma
example_1:
na attahetu na parassa hetu,
na puttam'icche na dhanaṃ na raṭṭhaṃ,
na iccheyya adhammena samiddhim'attano,
sa sīlavā paññavā dhammiko siyā.
example_2:
yo sīlavā paññavā bhāvit'atto,
samāhito jhānarato satīmā,
sabbassa sokā vigatā pahīnā,
khīṇ'āsavo antimadehadhārī.
sbs_example_3: yāvakīvañ'ca bhikkhave bhikkhū paññavanto bhavissanti
sbs_example_4: ariyasāvako paññavā hoti uday'atthagāminiyā paññāya samannāgato ariyāya nibbedhikāya sammā dukkhakkhayagāminiyā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: and then; or; after that; because of
example_1:
pubbenivāsaṃ yo vedi,
sagg'āpāyañ'ca passati,
atho jātikkhayaṃ patto,
abhiññā vosito muni.
example_2:
kadā nu'haṃ dubbacanena vutto,
tatonimittaṃ vimano na hessaṃ,
atho pasattho'pi tatonimittaṃ,
tuṭṭho na hessaṃ tadidaṃ kadā me.
sbs_example_3:
yān'īdha bhūtāni samāgatāni, bhummāni vā yāni va antalikkhe.
sabb'eva bhūtā sumanā bhavantu, atho'pi sakkacca suṇantu bhāsitaṃ.
sbs_example_4:
byādhidhammā jarādhammā, atho maraṇadhammino.
yathā dhammā tathā sattā, jigucchanti puthujjanā.
sbs_example_5: mātari pitari c'āpi, atho jeṭṭhamhi bhātari. ācariye catutthamhi, tesu na mānaṃ kayirātha.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno yaṃ nimittaṃ āgamma yaṃ nimittaṃ manasikaroto uppajjanti pāpakā akusalā vitakkā chand'ūpasaṃhitā'pi dos'ūpasaṃhitā'pi moh'ūpasaṃhitā'pi, tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tamhā nimittā aññaṃ nimittaṃ manasi kātabbaṃ kusal'ūpasaṃhitaṃ.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, puriso sakamhā gāmā vā nigamā vā ciravippavuttho assa. so aññataraṃ purisaṃ passeyya tamhā gāmā vā nigamā vā acirapakkantaṃ.
sbs_example_3: yā tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ tamhā tamhā sattanikāyā cuti cavanatā bhedo antaradhānaṃ maccu maraṇaṃ kālakiriyā khandhānaṃ bhedo kaḷevarassa
sbs_example_4: ko nu kho, bhante, hetu ko paccayo, yena m'idh'ekacce sattā tamhā kāyā cutā āgāmino honti āgantāro itthattaṃ?
sbs_example_5: atha kho tamhā'va udakarahadā sītā vāridhārā ubbhijjitvā tam'eva udakarahadaṃ sītena vārinā abhisandeyya parisandeyya paripūreyya paripphareyya, n'āssa kiñci sabbāvato udakarahadassa sītena vārinā apphuṭaṃ assa.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yo, bhikkhave, ime dhamme evaṃ pajānāti evaṃ passati, ayaṃ vuccati, sot'āpanno avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyano'ti.
example_2:
sabbe saṅkhārā aniccā'ti,
yadā paññāya passati,
atha nibbindati dukkhe,
esa maggo visuddhiyā.
sbs_example_3:
yath'indakhīlo pathaviṃ sito siyā, catubbhi vātehi asampakampiyo.
tath'ūpamaṃ sappurisaṃ vadāmi, yo ariyasaccāni avecca passati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: by the teacher; with the master
example_1: yañ'hi taṃ, āvuso, sammā vadamāno vadeyya, satthārā anuggahito sāvako mah'ābhiññataṃ patto'ti, mamaṃ taṃ sammā vadamāno vadeyya, satthārā anuggahito sāvako mah'ābhiññataṃ patto'ti.
example_2: so satthārā dinnanaye ṭhatvā satthāraṃ vanditvā, ajja ādiṃ katvā mama santakaṃ dasikasuttamattam'pi maṃ abhibhavitvā anekasatā'pi rājāno vā corā vā gaṇhituṃ samatthā nāma mā hontu, aggināpi mama santakaṃ mā ḍayhatu, udakenapi mā vuyhatū'ti patthanaṃ akāsi.
sbs_example_3: yaṃ, bhikkhave, satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ hit'esinā anukampakena anukampaṃ upādāya, kataṃ vo taṃ mayā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: dresses; clothes; give clothes (to); lit. covers
example_1: bhikkhuṃ pan'eva uddissa aññātakassa gahapatissa vā gahapatāniyā vā cīvaracetāpannaṃ upakkhaṭaṃ hoti, iminā cīvaracetāpannena cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā itthan'nāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ cīvarena acchādessāmī'ti
example_2: sādhu vata maṃ āyasmā iminā cīvaracetāpannena evarūpaṃ vā evarūpaṃ vā cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā acchādehī'ti kalyāṇakamyataṃ upādāya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
sbs_example_3: yaṃ kho, bhante, āyasmā veyyāvaccakaraṃ niddisi, saññatto so mayā, upasaṅkamat'āyasmā kālena, cīvarena taṃ acchādessatī'ti.

example_1:
cittasmiṃ vasībhūt'āmhi,
iddhipādā subhāvitā,
sabbabandhanamutt'āmhi,
na taṃ bhāyāmi āvuso'ti.
example_2:
satiyā taṃ nibandhissaṃ,
payutto te damessāmi,
vīriyadhuraniggahito,
na yito dūraṃ gamissase cittā'ti.
sbs_example_3: yaṃ kho, bhante, āyasmā veyyāvaccakaraṃ niddisi, saññatto so mayā, upasaṅkamat'āyasmā kālena, cīvarena taṃ acchādessatī'ti.
sbs_example_4: so taṃ gahapatiṃ vā gahapatiputtaṃ vā upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya, upaṭṭhaheyyaṃ taṃ, bhante'ti.

meaning_1: before; previously; formerly; in the past
example_1: tassa evaṃ hoti, mayaṃ kho pubbe agāriyabhūtā samānā aññe ovadāma'pi anusāsāma'pi. ime pan'amhākaṃ puttamattā maññe nattamattā maññe ovaditabbaṃ anusāsitabbaṃ maññantī'ti.
example_2:
yo ca pubbe pamajjitvā,
pacchā so nappamajjati,
so'maṃ lokaṃ pabhāseti,
abbhā mutto'va candimā.
sbs_example_3:
yaṃ pubbe taṃ visosehi, pacchā te m'āhu kiñcanaṃ,
majjhe ce no gahessasi, upasanto carissasi.
sbs_example_4: tatra ce so bhikkhu, pubbe appavārito, upasaṅkamitvā cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjeyya
sbs_example_5: uposatha-karaṇato pubbe navavidhaṃ pubbakiccaṃ kātabbaṃ hoti

example_1: evaṃ vutte aññataro bhikkhu there bhikkhū etadavoca, phasso kho, āvuso, eko anto, phassasamudayo dutiyo anto, phassanirodho majjhe, taṇhā sibbinī.
example_2: tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, bhikkhavo'ti. bhadante'ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ. bhagavā etadavoca
sbs_example_3: yaṃ kho bhikkhave dukkhe ñāṇaṃ, dukkhasamudaye ñāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhe ñāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya ñāṇaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati bhikkhave sammādiṭṭhi.
sbs_example_4: yaṃ kho, bhante, āyasmā veyyāvaccakaraṃ niddisi, saññatto so mayā, upasaṅkamat'āyasmā kālena, cīvarena taṃ acchādessatī'ti.
sbs_example_5: atha kho aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami

commentary: (SNa) puññan'ti puññacetanā, sā hi arūpattā pariharituṃ na sakkā'ti.
example_1:
abhittharetha kalyāṇe,
pāpā cittaṃ nivāraye,
dandhañ'hi karoto puññaṃ,
pāpasmiṃ ramatī mano.
example_2:
sīlaṃ yāva jarā sādhu,
saddhā sādhu patiṭṭhitā,
paññā narānaṃ ratanaṃ,
puññaṃ corehi dūharan'ti.
sbs_example_3: yad'idaṃ cattāri purisayugāni aṭṭha purisapuggalā esa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa

example_1: saṅghe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti, suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, ujuppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, ñāyappaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, sāmīcippaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho.
example_2: evam'eva kho ahaṃ, bho, yato addasaṃ samaṇe gotame cattāri padāni ath'āhaṃ niṭṭham'agamaṃ, sammāsambuddho bhagavā, svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo, suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho'ti.

example_1:
na hi verena verāni,
sammant'īdha kudācanaṃ,
averena ca sammanti,
esa dhammo sanantano.
example_2:
yaṃ taṃ apucchimha akittayī no,
aññaṃ taṃ pucchāma tadiṅgha brūhi,
kathaṃ nu dhīrā vitaranti oghaṃ,
jātiṃ jaraṃ sokapariddavañ'ca,
taṃ me muni sādhu viyākarohi,
tathā hi te vidito esa dhammo.
sbs_example_3: yad'idaṃ cattāri purisayugāni aṭṭha purisapuggalā esa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa
sbs_example_4:
et'ādis'āyaṃ santāno, māy'āyaṃ bālalāpinī,

meaning_1: thus; like this; this is; and so
example_1: iti kho, bhikkhave, na'y'idaṃ brahmacariyaṃ lābhasakkārasilok'ānisaṃsaṃ na sīlasampad'ānisaṃsaṃ na samādhisampad'ānisaṃsaṃ na ñāṇadassan'ānisaṃsaṃ
example_2:
akiñcanaṃ anādānaṃ,
etaṃ dīpaṃ anāparaṃ,
nibbānaṃ iti naṃ brūmi,
jarāmaccuparikkhayaṃ.
sbs_example_3: vimuttasmiṃ vimuttam'iti ñāṇaṃ hoti, khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, n'āparaṃ itthattāyā'ti pajānāti
sbs_example_4:
sabb'ābhibhuṃ sabbaviduṃ sumedhaṃ,
sabbesu dhammesu anūpalittaṃ,
sabbañ'jahaṃ taṇhākkhaye vimuttaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ naraṃ ekavihārī'ti brūmī'ti.
sbs_example_5: iti uddham'adho tiriyaṃ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṃ lokaṃ mettāsahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjhena pharitvā viharati
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: not deteriorating; not decreasing; non-declining; non-regressing
example_1:
yo ve kilesāni pahāya pañca,
paripuṇṇasekho aparihānadhammo,
cetovasippatto samāhit'indriyo,
sa ve ṭhit'atto'ti naro pavuccati.
example_2: ime bhikkhave dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattanti.
sbs_example_3: veditabbam'etaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā, na parihāyāmi kusalehi dhammehi'. aparihānañ'h'etaṃ vuttaṃ bhagavatā'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: ekaṃ ekakaṃ, dve dukā, tīṇi tikā, cattāri catukkā, pañca pañcakā, cha chakkā, satta sattakā, aṭṭha aṭṭhakā, nava navakā, dasa dasakā'ti, satam'pi mayaṃ, bho gotama, gaṇāpema, bhiyyo'pi gaṇāpema.
example_2: divasaṃsantatte ayokaṭāhe dve vā tīṇi vā udakaphusitāni nipāteyya
sbs_example_3: tattha katamo upādānapaccayā bhavo? bhavo du'vidhena, atthi kammabhavo, atthi upapattibhavo.
sbs_example_4: idāni, bhante, deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā dve kassakā bhātaro hatā cattāro ca balibaddā
sbs_example_5: so anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussarāmi, seyyath'idaṃ, ekam'pi jātiṃ dve'pi jātiyo tisso'pi jātiyo catasso'pi jātiyo pañca'pi jātiyo dasa'pi jātiyo vīsam'pi jātiyo tiṃsam'pi jātiyo
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
tato malā malataraṃ,
avijjā paramaṃ malaṃ,
etaṃ malaṃ pahantvāna,
nimmalā hotha bhikkhavo.
example_2:
araññe rukkhamūle vā,
suññ'āgāre'va bhikkhavo,
anussaretha sambuddhaṃ,
bhayaṃ tumhāka no siyā.
sbs_example_3: tatra kho bhagavā pañcavagg'iye bhikkhū āmantesi, bhikkhavo'ti. bhadante'ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ. bhagavā etadavoca.

ye dadanti upassayaṃ,

divā ca ratto ca haranti ye baliṃ, tasmā hi ne rakkhatha appamattā.

meaning_1: by day and night; all day and night
example_1:

sadā gotamasāvakā,
yesaṃ divā ca ratto ca,
niccaṃ buddhagatā sati.
example_2:

ye dadanti upassayaṃ,
tesaṃ divā ca ratto ca,

meaning_1: impermanent; inconstant; not lasting; discontinuous; disordered; unstable; unreliable; irregular
example_1: yaṃ rūpaṃ paṭicca uppajjati sukhaṃ somanassaṃ, ayaṃ rūpassa assādo. yaṃ rūpaṃ aniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vipariṇāmadhammaṃ, ayaṃ rūpassa ādīnavo.
example_2:
sabbe saṅkhārā aniccā'ti,
yadā paññāya passati,
atha nibbindati dukkhe,
esa maggo visuddhiyā.

meaning_1: permanent; lasting; continuous; ordered; stable; reliable; regular; immutable
example_1:

so ca labbhetha me varo,
gaṇhe'haṃ sabbalokassa,

meaning_1: by wisdom; with intelligence; by understanding; with insight

example_2: te taṃ dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇitvā tesaṃ dhammānaṃ paññāya atthaṃ na upaparikkhanti. tesaṃ te dhammā paññāya atthaṃ anupaparikkhataṃ na nijjhānaṃ khamanti.

meaning_1: with him; by him; with that; by that
example_1: atha te, jarasakko amhe matte katvā mahāsamuddapiṭṭhe khipitvā amhākaṃ devanagaraṃ gaṇhi, te mayaṃ tena saddhiṃ yujjhitvā amhākaṃ devanagaram'eva gaṇhissāmā'ti kipillikā viya thambhaṃ sineruṃ anusañcaramānā uṭṭhahiṃsu.
example_2: sādhu, devo, vāhanāgāresu ca dvāresu ca āṇāpetu, yena vāhanena jīvako icchati tena vāhanena gacchatu, yena dvārena icchati tena dvārena gacchatu, yaṃ kālaṃ icchati taṃ kālaṃ gacchatu, yaṃ kālaṃ icchati taṃ kālaṃ pavisatū'ti.
sbs_example_3: so taṃ dhammaṃ sutvā tathāgate saddhaṃ paṭilabhati. so tena saddhāpaṭilābhena samannāgato iti paṭisañcikkhati
sbs_example_4:

meaning_1: monk; fully ordained monk; mendicant; lit. beggar
example_1:

sbs_example_5: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññ'āgāragato vā nisīdati, pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā, ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya, parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.

commentary: (MNa) pabbajitā'ti upagatā, evaṃ sabbathā'pi anagāriyasaṅkhātaṃ pabbajjaṃ bhikkhubhāvaṃ vā upagatā'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
example_1: atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ pukkusātiṃ etadavoca, kaṃ'si tvaṃ, bhikkhu, uddissa pabbajito? ko vā te satthā? kassa vā tvaṃ dhammaṃ rocesī'ti?
example_2: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, khattiyakulā ce'pi agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti, so ca tathāgatappaveditaṃ dhammavinayaṃ āgamma, evaṃ mettaṃ karuṇaṃ muditaṃ upekkhaṃ bhāvetvā labhati ajjhattaṃ vūpasamaṃ.
sbs_example_3: so evaṃ pabbajito samāno bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno pāṇ'ātipātaṃ pahāya pāṇ'ātipātā paṭivirato hoti

example_1: atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno taṃ puggalaṃ bāhāyaṃ gahetvā bahidvārakoṭṭhakā nikkhāmetvā sūcighaṭikaṃ datvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami
example_2: so passeyya mahantaṃ alagaddaṃ. tam'enaṃ bhoge vā naṅguṭṭhe vā gaṇheyya. tassa so alagaddo paṭiparivattitvā hatthe vā bāhāya vā aññatarasmiṃ vā aṅgapaccaṅge ḍaṃseyya.
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi, ānanda, balavā puriso samiñjitaṃ vā bāhaṃ pasāreyya, pasāritaṃ vā bāhaṃ samiñjeyya.
sbs_example_4: tam'enaṃ dve balavanto purisā nānābāhāsu gahetvā taṃ aṅgārakāsuṃ upakaḍḍheyyuṃ. atha kho tassa purisassa ārakā'v'assa cetanā ārakā patthanā ārakā paṇidhi.

meaning_1: strong; powerful; lit. having strength quality

example_2: so vata, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ime pañca āvaraṇe nīvaraṇe cetaso ajjhāruhe paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe pahāya, balavatiyā paññāya att'atthaṃ vā ñassati par'atthaṃ vā ñassati ubhay'atthaṃ vā ñassati

example_1: bhārañ'ca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi bhārahārañ'ca bhār'ādānañ'ca bhāranikkhepanañ'ca. taṃ suṇātha. katamo ca, bhikkhave, bhāro?
example_2: ussādanañ'ca jaññā, apasādanañ'ca jaññā, ussādanañ'ca ñatvā apasādanañ'ca ñatvā n'ev'ussādeyya, na apasādeyya, dhammam'eva deseyya.

meaning_1: happy one; who is at ease; who is happy; who is comfortable
example_1: pamuditassa pīti jāyati pītimanassa kāyo passambhati passaddhakāyo sukhaṃ vedayati sukhino cittaṃ samādhiyati
example_2: so muṭṭhassati kālaṃ kurumāno aññataraṃ devanikāyaṃ upapajjati. tassa tattha sukhino dhammapadā plavanti. dandho, bhikkhave, sat'uppādo, atha so satto khippaṃ'y'eva visesagāmī hoti.
sbs_example_3:
na ca khuddaṃ samācare kiñci, yena viññū pare upavadeyyuṃ.

meaning_1: inner village; inhabited area; lit. among the houses
example_1: upavassaṃ kho pana kattikapuṇṇamaṃ yāni kho pana tāni āraññakāni sen'āsanāni sāsaṅkasammatāni sappaṭibhayāni, tathārūpesu bhikkhu sen'āsanāni viharanto ākaṅkhamāno tiṇṇaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataraṃ cīvaraṃ antaraghare nikkhipeyya
example_2: kahaṃ nu kho, bhante, eta'r'ahi bhagavā viharati arahaṃ sammāsambuddho? dassanakām'amhā mayaṃ taṃ bhagavantaṃ arahantaṃ sammāsambuddhan'ti. antaragharaṃ paviṭṭho kho, bāhiya, bhagavā piṇḍāyā'ti.
sbs_example_3: na bāhuppacālakaṃ antaraghare nisīdissāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
sbs_example_4: yo pana bhikkhu aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā, antaragharaṃ paviṭṭhāya, hatthato khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khādeyya vā bhuñjeyya vā

example_1:
na taṃ mātā pitā kayirā,
aññe v'āpi ca ñātakā,
sammāpaṇihitaṃ cittaṃ,
seyyaso naṃ tato kare.
example_2: khat'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā. upahat'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā. sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā pitaraṃ dhammikaṃ dhammarājānaṃ jīvitā na voropessatha, imasmiññ'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ uppajjissathā'ti.
sbs_example_3:
mātāpitu upaṭṭhānaṃ, puttadārassa saṅgaho.
anākulā ca kamm'antā, etaṃ maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.

meaning_1: pride; conceit; egotism; superiority; comparing oneself
example_1:
mam'eva kata maññantu,
gihīpabbajitā ubho,
mam'ev'ātivasā assu,
kicc'ākiccesu kismici.
iti bālassa saṅkappo,
icchā māno ca vaḍḍhati.
example_2:
dhonassa hi n'atthi kuhiñci loke,
pakappitā diṭṭhi bhav'ābhavesu,
māyañ'ca mānañ'ca pahāya dhono,
sa kena gaccheyya anūpayo so.

meaning_1: in those; in them; among them; among those
example_1:
visenikatvā pana ye caranti,
diṭṭhīhi diṭṭhiṃ avirujjhamānā,
tesu tvaṃ kiṃ labhetho pasūra,
yes'īdha n'atthī param'uggahītaṃ.
example_2: iti yathā yathā naṃ tesu tesu janapadesu sañjānanti tathā tathā thāmasā parāmāsā abhinivissa voharati, idam'eva saccaṃ, mogham'aññan'ti.
sbs_example_3: mātari pitari c'āpi, atho jeṭṭhamhi bhātari. ācariye catutthamhi, tesu na mānaṃ kayirātha.

example_1: kammassakomhi kammadāy'ādo kammayoni kammabandhu kammapaṭisaraṇo, yaṃ kammaṃ karissāmi kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā tassa dāy'ādo bhavissāmī'ti pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ
sbs_chant_eng_1: Ten Subjects for Frequent Reflection by One Gone Forth
example_2: kiñ'c'āpi, bhikkhave, evarūpassa puggalassa na diṭṭh'ānugatiṃ āpajjati, atha kho naṃ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggacchati, kalyāṇamitto purisapuggalo kalyāṇasahāyo kalyāṇasampavaṅko'ti.
sbs_example_3: mā maṃ āyasmanto kiñci avacuttha kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā, ahaṃ'p'āyasmante na kiñci vakkhāmi kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā
sbs_example_4: so dhammaṃ deseti ādikalyāṇaṃ majjhekalyāṇaṃ pariyosānakalyāṇaṃ sātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ pakāseti.

example_1: channaṃ, āvuso, phass'āyatanānaṃ asesavirāganirodhā atthi ca n'atthi ca aññaṃ kiñcī'ti? mā h'evaṃ, āvuso.
example_2:
yaṃ kiñci vittaṃ idha vā huraṃ vā,
saggesu vā yaṃ ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ.
na no samaṃ atthi tathāgatena
sbs_example_3: mā maṃ āyasmanto kiñci avacuttha kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā, ahaṃ'p'āyasmante na kiñci vakkhāmi kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā
sbs_example_4: manosañcetanāya āhāre pariññāte tisso taṇhā pariññātā honti. tīsu taṇhāsu pariññātāsu ariyasāvakassa n'atthi kiñci uttarikaraṇīyanti vadāmi.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu appiccho samāno appiccho'ti maṃ jāneyyun'ti na icchati
example_2: tam'enaṃ evaṃ vadeyyuṃ, ambho purisa, yassa tvaṃ pāsādassa ārohaṇāya nisseṇiṃ karosi, jānāsi taṃ pāsādaṃ puratthimāya vā disāya dakkhiṇāya vā disāya pacchimāya vā disāya uttarāya vā disāya ucco vā nīco vā majjhimo vā'ti?
sbs_example_3: mayan'taṃ dhammaṃ sutvā evaṃ jānāma
sbs_example_4: ajj'eva kiccam'ātappaṃ, ko jaññā maraṇaṃ suve. na hi no saṅgaran'tena, mahāsenena maccunā.
sbs_example_5:
evaṃ bho purisa jānāhi, pāpadhammā asaññatā.
mā taṃ lobho adhammo ca, ciraṃ dukkhāya randhayuṃ.

example_1: yo, bhikkhave, evaṃ vadeyya, yathā yath'āyaṃ puriso kammaṃ karoti tathā tathā taṃ paṭisaṃvediyatī'ti, evaṃ santaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyavāso na hoti, okāso na paññāyati sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāya.
example_2:
supinena yathā'pi saṅgataṃ,
paṭibuddho puriso na passati,
evam'pi piyāyitaṃ janaṃ,
petaṃ kālakataṃ na passati.
sbs_example_3: maraṇadhammo'mhi, maraṇaṃ anatītoti abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ itthiyā vā purisena vā gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā.
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi, ānanda, balavā puriso samiñjitaṃ vā bāhaṃ pasāreyya, pasāritaṃ vā bāhaṃ samiñjeyya.
sbs_example_5: arahaṃ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: present state of existence; earthly existence; such an existence; lit. here state
example_1: khīṇā jāti vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ n'āparaṃ itthattāyā'ti pajānāti
example_2:
ye kec'ime isayo manujā,
khattiyā brāhmaṇā devatānaṃ,
yaññam'akappayiṃsu puthū'dha loke,
āsīsamānā puṇṇaka itthattaṃ,
jaraṃ sitā yaññam'akappayiṃsu.
sbs_example_3: ko nu kho, bhante, hetu ko paccayo, yena m'idh'ekacce sattā tamhā kāyā cutā āgāmino honti āgantāro itthattaṃ?
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: sattānaṃ cuta-upapāta-ñāṇāya cittaṃ abhininnāmeti
example_2:
kāmesu giddhā pasutā pamūḷhā,
avadāniyā te visame niviṭṭhā,
dukkh'ūpanītā paridevayanti,
kiṃ'sū bhavissāma ito cutāse.
sbs_example_3: ko nu kho, bhante, hetu ko paccayo, yena m'idh'ekacce sattā tamhā kāyā cutā āgāmino honti āgantāro itthattaṃ?
sbs_example_4: amutr'āsiṃ evaṃnāmo evaṃgotto evaṃvaṇṇo evam'āhāro evaṃsukhadukkhappaṭisaṃvedī evam'āyupariyanto, so tato cuto amutra udapādiṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: ath'āparaṃ viññāṇaṃ'y'eva avasissati parisuddhaṃ pariyodātaṃ. tena ca viññāṇena kiṃ vijānāti? sukhan'ti'pi vijānāti, dukkhan'ti'pi vijānāti, adukkham'asukhan'ti'pi vijānāti.
example_2: tasmiṃ pahīne tasmiṃ byantīkate ath'āparaṃ dhammavitakka-avasissati. so hoti samādhi na c'eva santo na ca paṇīto nappaṭippassaddhaladdho na ekodibhāv'ādhigato sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagato hoti.
sbs_example_3: kāmaṃ taco ca nahāru ca aṭṭhi ca avasissatu, sarīre upasussatu maṃsalohitaṃ
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi balavā saṅkhadhamo appakasiren'eva catuddisā viññāpeyya, evam'eva kho evaṃ bhāvitāya mettāya cetovimuttiyā yaṃ pamāṇakataṃ kammaṃ na taṃ tatra-avasissati, na taṃ tatr'āvatiṭṭhati.

example_1:
manopubbaṅ'gamā dhammā,
manoseṭṭhā manomayā,
manasā ce paduṭṭhena,
bhāsati vā karoti vā,
tato naṃ dukkham'anveti,
cakkaṃva vahato padaṃ.
example_2:
kāmaṃ kāmayamānassa,
tassa ce taṃ samijjhati,
addhā pītimano hoti,
laddhā macco yadicchati.
sbs_example_3:
kayirā ce, kayirāth'enaṃ, daḷham'enaṃ parakkame.
sithilo hi paribbājo, bhiyyo ākirate rajaṃ.
sbs_example_4: tatra ce so bhikkhu, pubbe appavārito, upasaṅkamitvā cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjeyya
sbs_example_5: ettha ce n'atthi abhinanditabbaṃ abhivaditabbaṃ ajjhositabbaṃ. es'ev'anto rāg'ānusayānaṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: venerable; reverend; lit. having age quality
example_1: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco bhikkhu gāmagato vā araññagato vā labhati vattāraṃ, ayañ'ca kho āyasmā evaṃkārī evaṃsamācāro asucigāmakaṇṭako'ti.
example_2: ty'āhaṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadāmi, saccaṃ kira tumhe āyasmanto evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, ek'antasukhī attā hoti arogo paraṃ maraṇā'ti?
sbs_example_3: karomi āyasmato okāsaṃ
sbs_example_4: atha kho āyasmato ānandassa etad'ahosi, acchariyaṃ vata bho, abbhutaṃ vata bho, mahā vatāyaṃ bhūmicālo.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bālo abyatto asappuriso khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati sāvajjo ca hoti sānuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ bahuñ'ca apuññaṃ pasavati
example_2:
n'atthi jhānaṃ apaññassa,
paññā n'atthi ajhāyato,
yamhi jhānañ'ca paññā ca,
sa ve nibbānasantike.
sbs_example_3:
karaṇīyam'atthakusalena, yaṃ taṃ santaṃ padaṃ abhisamecca,
sakko ujū ca suhujū ca, suvaco c'assa mudu, anatimānī.
sbs_example_4:
āyu usmā ca viññāṇaṃ, yadā kāyaṃ jahant'imaṃ,
apaviddho tadā seti, parabhattaṃ acetanaṃ.
sbs_example_5: pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato thero bhikkhu sabrahmacārīnaṃ piyo ca hoti manāpo ca garu ca bhāvanīyo ca.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary:
(VIN 2.5.1.7) viññū nāma purisaviggaho, paṭibalo hoti subhāsitadubbhāsitaṃ duṭṭhull'āduṭṭhullaṃ ājānituṃ.
(MNa) viññūnan'ti ... paṇḍitehi sabrahmacārīhi ca sambhāvito'ti attho.
example_1: evarūpaṃ te, rāhula, kāyakammaṃ satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu desetabbaṃ, vivaritabbaṃ, uttānīkātabbaṃ, desetvā vivaritvā uttānīkatvā āyatiṃ saṃvaraṃ āpajjitabbaṃ.
example_2: yāni kho pan'assa honti sāṭheyyāni kūṭeyyāni jimheyyāni vaṅkeyyāni, tāni yathābhūtaṃ āvikattā hoti satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu.
sbs_example_3: kacci nu kho maṃ anuvicca viññū sabrahmacārī sīlato na upavadantī'ti, pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ.
sbs_chant_eng_3: Ten Subjects for Frequent Recollection by One Who Has Gone Forth
sbs_example_4: yo pana bhikkhu mātugāmassa uttarichappañcavācāhi dhammaṃ deseyya, aññatra viññunā purisaviggahena, pācittiyaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno paccavekkhaṇā bahukārā hoti kusalesu dhammesu
example_2: yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno abhijjhālussa abhijjhā appahīnā hoti, byāpannacittassa byāpādo appahīno hoti, kodhanassa kodho appahīno hoti
sbs_example_3: ime bhikkhave dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattanti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: mindful; fully present; attentive; lit. having memory quality
example_1: avitakkomhi avicāro ajjhattaṃ satimā sukhamasmī'ti pajānāti
example_2:
ākiñcaññaṃ pekkhamāno satimā,
n'atthī'ti nissāya tarassu oghaṃ,
kāme pahāya virato kathāhi,
taṇhakkhayaṃ nattam'ah'ābhipassa.
sbs_example_3: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kāye kāy'ānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ
sbs_example_4: pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca viharati, sato ca sampajāno, sukhañ'ca kāyena paṭisaṃvedeti, yaṃ taṃ ariyā ācikkhanti, upekkhako satimā sukhavihārī'ti tatiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ hit'esinā anukampakena anukampaṃ upādāya
example_2:
eso hi bhagavā buddho,
nadiṃ nerañjaraṃ pati,
sabbadukkhappahānāya,
dhammaṃ deseti pāṇinaṃ,
tass'āhaṃ santikaṃ gacchaṃ,
so me satthā bhavissati.
sbs_example_3: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya, sammukhā m'etaṃ, āvuso, bhagavato sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ, ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanan'ti.
sbs_example_4:
udar'āvadehakaṃ bhutvā, sayant'uttānaseyyakā.
kathaṃ vattenti paṭibuddhā, yā kathā satthugarahitā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: tasmā't'iha bhikkhave attadīpā viharatha
example_2: satiñ'ca khv'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, sabb'atthikaṃ vadāmī'ti.
sbs_example_3: handadāni, bhikkhave, āmantayāmi vo, vayadhammā saṅkhārā, appamādena sampādetha. ayaṃ tathāgatassa pacchimā vācā
sbs_example_4: taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ niccaṃ vā aniccaṃ vā'ti? aniccaṃ, bhante.
sbs_chant_eng_4: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self

meaning_1: timely; at the right moment; at a suitable time; at the proper time
example_1: kālavādī bhūtavādī atthavādī dhammavādī vinayavādī nidhānavatiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti kālena sāpadesaṃ pariyantavatiṃ atthasaṃhitaṃ
example_2:
etesu dhammesu vineyya chandaṃ,
bhikkhu satimā suvimuttacitto,
kālena so sammā dhammaṃ parivīmaṃsamāno,
ekodibhūto vihane tamaṃ so'ti.
sbs_example_3:
gāravo ca nivāto ca, santuṭṭhi ca kataññutā.
kālena dhammassavanaṃ, etaṃ maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.
sbs_example_4: yaṃ kho, bhante, āyasmā veyyāvaccakaraṃ niddisi, saññatto so mayā, upasaṅkamat'āyasmā kālena, cīvarena taṃ acchādessatī'ti.
sbs_example_5: kālena ca bhāsitā hoti, saccā ca bhāsitā hoti, saṇhā ca bhāsitā hoti, atthasaṃhitā ca bhāsitā hoti, mettacittena ca bhāsitā hoti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
mādisā ve jinā honti,
ye pattā āsavakkhayaṃ,
jitā me pāpakā dhammā,
tasm'āham'upaka jino'ti.
example_2: bhūtaṃ kho pana tacchaṃ tathaṃ paṭipadaṃ paññapentassa dhammaṭṭhitataṃ dhammaniyāmataṃ, kathañ'hi nāma mādiso viññū samaṇassa gotamassa subhāsitaṃ subhāsitato n'ābbhanumodeyyā'ti?
sbs_example_3: etadaggaṃ, bhagini, pāricariyānaṃ yā mādisaṃ, sīlavantaṃ kalyāṇadhammaṃ brahmacāriṃ, etena dhammena paricareyyā'ti, methun'ūpasaṃhitena, saṅghādiseso.
