meaning_1: virtuous; ethical; moral; lit. having conduct quality
commentary: (VIN 1.2.4) sīlavantan'ti pāṇ'ātipātā paṭivirataṃ, adinn'ādānā paṭivirataṃ, musāvādā paṭivirataṃ.
example_1:
diṭṭhiñ'ca anupaggamma,
sīlavā dassanena sampanno,
kāmesu vineyya gedhaṃ,
na hi jātu gabbhaseyya punar'etī'ti.
example_2: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sīlavā hoti, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu.
sbs_example_3: etad'aggaṃ, bhagini, pāricariyānaṃ yā mādisaṃ, sīlavantaṃ kalyāṇadhammaṃ brahmacāriṃ, etena dhammena paricareyyā'ti, methun'ūpasaṃhitena, saṅghādiseso.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: evaṃ vutte aññataro bhikkhu there bhikkhū etadavoca, phasso kho, āvuso, eko anto, phassasamudayo dutiyo anto, phassanirodho majjhe, taṇhā sibbinī.
example_2: idh'āhaṃ, bhante, yen'aññataro bhikkhu ten'upasaṅkamiṃ, upasaṅkamitvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavocaṃ, kittāvatā nu kho, āvuso, bhikkhuno dassanaṃ suvisuddhaṃ hotī'ti?
sbs_example_3: ekam'antaṃ ṭhitā kho sā mahāpajāpatī gotamī bhagavantaṃ etad'avoca
sbs_example_4: ekam'antaṃ ṭhitā kho sā devatā bhagavantaṃ etad'avoca, kathaṃ nu tvaṃ, mārisa, ogham'atarī'ti?
sbs_example_5: tatra kho bhagavā pañcavaggiye bhikkhū āmantesi, bhikkhavo'ti. bhadante'ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ. bhagavā etad'avoca.

notes: archaic form of etaṃ found in compounds and idiom
example_1:
etad'aññāya ye satā,
diṭṭhadhamm'ābhinibbutā,
na te māravas'ānugā,
na te mārassa paddhagū'ti.
example_2:
aññāt'atthaṃ pasād'atthaṃ,
sataṃ ve hoti mantanā,
evaṃ kho ariyā mantenti,
esā ariyāna mantanā,
etad'aññāya medhāvī,
na samusseyya mantaye'ti.

meaning_1: knowing the correct measure (in); knowing the limit (in); moderate (in); lit. measure knowing
example_1:

indriyesu susaṃvutaṃ,
bhojanamhi ca mattaññuṃ,

example_1: yato kho tvaṃ anuruddha ime aṭṭha mahāpurisavitakke vitakkessasi, tato tvaṃ anuruddha yāva'd'eva ākaṅkhissasi …
example_2: tam'enaṃ mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā jātam'eva naṃ saṅghāṭikaṃ kareyyuṃ, saṅghāṭikattam'eva samādapeyyuṃ, ehi tvaṃ, bhadramukha, saṅghāṭiko hohi, saṅghāṭikassa te sato saṅghāṭidhāraṇamattena abhijjhālussa abhijjhā pahīyissati
sbs_example_3: ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, sīlavā hohi, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharāhi ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhassu sikkhāpadesū'ti

viseni'katvā pana ye caranti, diṭṭhīhi diṭṭhiṃ avirujjhamānā,

example_1:
sānuṃ pabuddhaṃ vajjāsi,
yakkhānaṃ vacanaṃ idaṃ,
m'ākāsi pāpakaṃ kammaṃ,
āvi vā yadi vā raho.
example_2:
araññe rukkhamūle vā,
suññ'āgāre'va bhikkhavo,
anussaretha sambuddhaṃ,
bhayaṃ tumhāka no siyā.
sbs_example_3:
diṭṭhā vā ye ca adiṭṭhā, ye сa dūre vasanti avidūre
bhūtā vā sambhav'esī vā, sabbe sattā bhavantu sukhit'attā.

meaning_1: (object of the eye) form; material form; shape; sight; lit. form
example_1: andho hi, uttara, cakkhunā rūpaṃ na passati, badhiro sotena saddaṃ na suṇātī'ti
example_2: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, yassa kassaci bhikkhuno kāyagatāsati abhāvitā abahulīkatā, taṃ cakkhu āviñchati manāpiyesu rūpesu, amanāpiyā rūpā paṭikūlā honti
sbs_example_3: cakkhuṃ bhikkhave ādittaṃ, rūpā ādittā, cakkhuviññāṇaṃ ādittaṃ, cakkhusamphasso āditto.

example_1:
passaṃ naro dakkhati nāmarūpaṃ,
disvāna vā ñassati tāni'm'eva,
kāmaṃ bahuṃ passatu appakaṃ vā,
na hi tena suddhiṃ kusalā vadanti.
example_2:
paṭisotagāmiṃ nipuṇaṃ,
gambhīraṃ duddasaṃ aṇuṃ,
rāgarattā na dakkhanti,
tamokhandhena āvuṭā'ti.
sbs_example_3: cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī'ti, evam'evaṃ bhotā gotamena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
sbs_example_4: ye'pi hi keci, bhikkhave, anāgatam'addhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā yaṃ loke piyarūpaṃ sātarūpaṃ taṃ aniccato dakkhissanti dukkhato dakkhissanti anattato dakkhissanti rogato dakkhissanti bhayato dakkhissanti, te taṇhaṃ pajahissanti.
sbs_example_5: suṇāti na vijānāti, āloketi na passati. dhammasmiṃ bhaññamānasmiṃ, atthaṃ bālo na bujjhati. sace'pi dasa pajjote, dhārayissasi, kassapa. n'eva dakkhati rūpāni, cakkhu hi'ssa na vijjatī'ti.

example_1:
ye diṭṭhim'uggayha vivādayanti,
idam'eva saccan'ti ca vādayanti,
te tvaṃ vadassū na hi te'dha atthi,
vādamhi jāte paṭisenikattā.
example_2: ye hi keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā evaṃ rūpaṃ abhiññāya ... rūpassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipannā, te suppaṭipannā.

ye keci pāṇabhūt'atthi, tasā vā thāvarā vā anavasesā,

example_1:
dhammapīti sukhaṃ seti,
vippasannena cetasā,
ariyappavedite dhamme,
sadā ramati paṇḍito.
example_2:
suññato lokaṃ avekkhassu,
mogharāja sadā sato,
att'ānudiṭṭhiṃ ūhacca,
evaṃ maccutaro siyā,
evaṃ lokaṃ avekkhantaṃ,
maccurājā na passatī'ti.
sbs_example_3:
bhavatu sabbamaṅgalaṃ, rakkhantu sabbadevatā,
sabbadhamm'ānubhāvena, sadā sotthi bhavantu te
sbs_example_4:
papañ'ca udapānañ'ca,

meaning_1: gets to; attains; finds; acquires; obtains; lit. arrives at
example_1:
sārañ'ca sārato ñatvā,
asārañ'ca asārato,
te sāraṃ adhigacchanti,
sammāsaṅkappagocarā.
example_2: so, bhogā me atthi uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatā bāhābalaparicitā sed'āvakkhittā dhammikā dhammaladdhā'ti adhigacchati sukhaṃ, adhigacchati somanassaṃ.
sbs_example_3: āyudo balado dhīro, vaṇṇado paṭibhānado. sukhassa dātā medhāvī, sukhaṃ so adhigacchati. āyuṃ datvā balaṃ vaṇṇaṃ, sukhañ'ca paṭibhānakaṃ, dīgh'āyu yasavā hoti, yattha yatth'ūpapajjatī'ti.
sbs_example_4: appamattako so, bhikkhave, kaṭaggaho yaṃ so akkhadhutto paṭhamen'eva kaṭaggahena mahantaṃ bhogakkhandhaṃ adhigaccheyya.

meaning_1: intelligent man; wise man; who has good judgment; lit. who has wisdom
example_1:

niggayhavādiṃ medhāviṃ,
tādisaṃ paṇḍitaṃ bhaje,
tādisaṃ bhajamānassa,
seyyo hoti na pāpiyo.
example_2:
anupubbena medhāvī,
thokaṃ thokaṃ khaṇe khaṇe,
kammāro rajatass'eva,
niddhame malamattano.
sbs_example_3: āyudo balado dhīro, vaṇṇado paṭibhānado. sukhassa dātā medhāvī, sukhaṃ so adhigacchati. āyuṃ datvā balaṃ vaṇṇaṃ, sukhañ'ca paṭibhānakaṃ, dīgh'āyu yasavā hoti, yattha yatth'ūpapajjatī'ti.

example_1: dātā ca ahosi sukhumānaṃ mudukānaṃ attharaṇānaṃ pāvuraṇānaṃ khomasukhumānaṃ kappāsikasukhumānaṃ koseyyasukhumānaṃ kambalasukhumānaṃ
example_2:

amūgo mūgasammato,
appaṃ dānaṃ na hīḷeyya,
dātāraṃ n'āvajāniyā.
sbs_example_3: āyudo balado dhīro, vaṇṇado paṭibhānado. sukhassa dātā medhāvī, sukhaṃ so adhigacchati. āyuṃ datvā balaṃ vaṇṇaṃ, sukhañ'ca paṭibhānakaṃ, dīgh'āyu yasavā hoti, yattha yatth'ūpapajjatī'ti.

example_1: tassa mayhaṃ āvuso, etadahosi, idha bhikkhu vitakkavicārānaṃ vūpasamā ajjhattaṃ sampasādanaṃ cetaso ekodibhāvaṃ avitakkaṃ avicāraṃ samādhijaṃ pītisukhaṃ dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
example_2: atha kho tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etadahosi, atippago kho tāva sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya carituṃ. yaṃnūna mayaṃ yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo ten'upasaṅkameyyāmā'ti.
sbs_example_3: atha kho āyasmato ānandassa etad'ahosi, acchariyaṃ vata bho, abbhutaṃ vata bho, mahā vatāyaṃ bhūmicālo.
sbs_example_4: pubb'eva me, bhikkhave, sambodhā anabhisambuddhassa bodhisattass'eva sato etad'ahosi
sbs_example_5: tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhave, etad'ahosi, kimhi nu kho sati jarāmaraṇaṃ hoti, kiṃpaccayā jarāmaraṇan'ti ?

example_1: manussānaṃ piyo hoti, amanussānaṃ piyo hoti, devatā rakkhanti, n'āssa aggi vā visaṃ vā satthaṃ vā kamati, tuvaṭaṃ cittaṃ samādhiyati, mukhavaṇṇo vippasīdati
example_2:

sbs_example_4: sukhaṃ supati, sukhaṃ paṭibujjhati, na pāpakaṃ supinaṃ passati, manussānaṃ ca amanussānaṃ piyo hoti, devatā rakkhanti

meaning_1: sage; intelligent person; wise man; smart person
commentary: (MNa) bāle ca paṇḍite cā'ti bālā ca paṇḍitā ca.
example_1:
selo yathā ekaghano,
vātena na samīrati,
evaṃ nindāpasaṃsāsu,
na samiñjanti paṇḍitā.
example_2:
yaṃ taṃ apucchimha akittayī no,
aññaṃ taṃ pucchāma tadiṅgha brūhi,
ettāvat'aggaṃ nu vadanti h'eke,
yakkhassa suddhiṃ idha paṇḍitāse,
udāhu aññam'pi vadanti etto.
sbs_example_3:
asevanā ca bālānaṃ, paṇḍitānañ'ca sevanā.
pūjā ca pūjanīyānaṃ, etaṃ maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.
sbs_example_4:
nidhīnaṃ'va pavattāraṃ, yaṃ passe vajjadassinaṃ,
niggayhavādiṃ medhāviṃ, tādisaṃ paṇḍitaṃ bhaje,
tādisaṃ bhajamānassa, seyyo hoti na pāpiyo.
sbs_example_5:
kalyāṇamittatā muninā, lokaṃ ādissa vaṇṇitā.
kalyāṇamitte bhajamāno, api bālo paṇḍito assa.

meaning_1: Sublime One; Blessed One; Fortunate One; Auspicious One; epithet of the Buddha; lit. having good fortune quality
example_1:
anejaṃ mūladassāviṃ,
atthi pañhena āgamaṃ,
kiṃ nissitā isayo manujā,
khattiyā brāhmaṇā devatānaṃ,
yaññam'akappayiṃsu puthū'dha loke,
pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ.
example_2: bhagavaṃmūlakā no, bhante, dhammā bhagavaṃnettikā bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā. sādhu vata, bhante, bhagavantaṃ'y'eva paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho. bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī'ti.
sbs_example_3: arahaṃ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavā
sbs_example_4: ekam'antaṃ ṭhitā kho sā mahāpajāpatī gotamī bhagavantaṃ etadavoca
sbs_example_5: evaṃsampadam'idaṃ āyasmantānaṃ satthari sammukhībhūte, taṃ bhagavantaṃ atisitvā, amhe etam'atthaṃ paṭipucchitabbaṃ maññatha.

example_1:
eko ahaṃ sakka mahantam'oghaṃ,
anissito no visahāmi tārituṃ,
ārammaṇaṃ brūhi samantacakkhu,
yaṃ nissito ogham'imaṃ tareyyaṃ.
example_2:
idh'eva suddhi iti vādayanti,

example_1: idāni, bhante, deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā dve kassakā bhātaro hatā cattāro ca balibaddā
example_2: rañño ālambananaṅgalaṃ rattasuvaṇṇaparikkhittaṃ hoti. balibaddānaṃ siṅgāni'pi rasmipatodā'pi suvaṇṇaparikkhittā honti.
sbs_example_3:

example_1: yā tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ tamhā tamhā sattanikāyā cuti cavanatā bhedo antaradhānaṃ maccu maraṇaṃ kālakiriyā khandhānaṃ bhedo kaḷevarassa nikkhepo jīvitindriyassa upacchedo, idaṃ vuccati maraṇaṃ.

example_1:
uṭṭhahatha nisīdatha,
ko attho supitena vo,
āturānañ'hi kā niddā,
sallaviddhāna ruppataṃ.

meaning_1: effort; exertion; lit. to be burned
commentary:

(MNa) ajj'eva kiccam'ātappan'ti kilesānaṃ ātāpanaparitāpanena ātappan'ti laddhanāmaṃ vīriyaṃ ajj'eva kātabbaṃ.
example_1:
tumhehi kiccam'ātappaṃ,
akkhātāro tathāgatā,

example_1:

meaning_1: is completely freed (from); is totally liberated (from); escapes (from)

attano sukham'icchati.
verasaṃsaggasaṃsaṭṭho,

meaning_1: celibate man; who abstains from sexual intercourse

example_2: idha ekacco dussīlo hoti pāpadhammo asucisaṅkassarasamācāro paṭicchannakamm'anto assamaṇo samaṇapaṭiñño abrahmacārī brahmacāripaṭiñño antopūti avassuto kasambujāto – antopūtibhāvo'ti.

meaning_1: whatever; any whatsoever; everything; all; all those
example_1:

ye keci lokasmim'anekarūpā.
example_2: ye hi keci, rāhula, atītam'addhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā kāyakammaṃ parisodhesuṃ, … sabbe te evam'evaṃ paccavekkhitvā paccavekkhitvā kāyakammaṃ parisodhesuṃ

example_1: yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye līnaṃ cittaṃ hoti, akālo tasmiṃ samaye passaddhisambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo samādhisambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo upekkhāsambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya.
example_2: yasmiṃ, mahānāma, samaye ariyasāvako sīlaṃ anussarati n'ev'assa tasmiṃ samaye rāgapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na dosapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na mohapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti.

example_1:
sabbe saṅkhārā aniccā'ti,
yadā paññāya passati,
atha nibbindati dukkhe,
esa maggo visuddhiyā.
example_2: yadā kho te, bhikkhave, chappāṇakā jhattā assu kilantā, atha tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upatiṭṭheyyuṃ, upanisīdeyyuṃ, upanipajjeyyuṃ.
sbs_example_3: yadā tumhe attanā'va jāneyyātha, ime dhammā kusalā, ime dhammā anavajjā, ime dhammā viññuppasatthā, ime dhammā samattā samādinnā hitāya sukhāya saṃvattantī'ti, atha tumhe upasampajja vihareyyātha.

meaning_1: what do you think about that?; what's your opinion on this?
example_1: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, rāhula, kim'atthiyo ādāso'ti? paccavekkhaṇattho, bhante'ti.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso loṇaphalaṃ paritte udakamallake pakkhipeyya. taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu taṃ parittaṃ udakaṃ amunā loṇaphalena loṇaṃ assa apeyyan'ti? evaṃ, bhante.
sbs_example_3: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, rāhula, cakkhu niccaṃ vā aniccaṃ vā'ti? aniccaṃ, bhante.
sbs_example_4: taṃ kiṃ maññasi ye te cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā adiṭṭhā adiṭṭhapubbā, na ca passasi, na ca te hoti passeyyan'ti? atthi te tattha chando vā rāgo vā pemaṃ vā'ti?
sbs_example_5: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, api nu so puriso allaṃ kaṭṭhaṃ sasnehaṃ, udake nikkhittaṃ, uttar'āraṇiṃ ādāya abhimanthento aggiṃ abhinibbatteyya, tejo pātukareyyā'ti?

meaning_1: just like; as if; imagine if
example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, mahāsamuddo ekaraso loṇaraso, evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, ayaṃ dhammavinayo ekaraso vimuttiraso
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gavā khīraṃ, khīramhā dadhi, dadhimhā navanītaṃ, navanītamhā sappi, sappimhā sappimaṇḍo tatra aggam'akkhāyati.

meaning_1: should be done; must be done; ought to be made; to be observed; lit. to be done
example_1: tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tesaṃ'y'eva pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya adhimatto chando ca vāyāmo ca ussāho ca ussoḷhī ca appaṭivānī ca sati ca sampajaññañ'ca karaṇīyaṃ.
example_2: akusalaṃ idaṃ kāyakammaṃ dukkh'udrayaṃ dukkhavipākan'ti, evarūpaṃ te, rāhula, kāyena kammaṃ sasakkaṃ na karaṇīyaṃ.

example_2: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gahapati, sace so puriso taṃ ādittaṃ tiṇ'ukkaṃ na khippam'eva paṭinissajjeyya tassa sā ādittā tiṇ'ukkā hatthaṃ vā daheyya bāhuṃ vā daheyya aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā aṅgapaccaṅgaṃ daheyya

example_1: so tesaṃ bhogānaṃ ārakkh'ādhikaraṇaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti, kin'ti me bhoge n'eva rājāno hareyyuṃ, na corā hareyyuṃ, na aggi daheyya, na udakaṃ vaheyya, na appiyā dāy'ādā hareyyun'ti

sabbā disā sappuriso pavāyati.
example_2: so mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṃ disaṃ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṃ, tathā tatiyaṃ, tathā catutthaṃ.
sbs_example_3: tato tvaṃ, moggallāna, uṭṭhāy'āsanā udakena akkhīni anumajjitvā disā anuvilokeyyāsi, nakkhattāni tārakarūpāni ullokeyyāsi
sbs_example_4: puna caparaṃ bhikkhu seyyathā'pi passeyya sarīraṃ sivathikāya chaḍḍitaṃ aṭṭhikāni apagatasambandhāni disā vidisā vikkhittāni
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: wishing; wanting; covetousness; greed; lit. over thinking
notes: abhijjhā in poerty can be shorten of abhijjhāya (instr.sg)
example_1: so abhijjhaṃ loke pahāya vigat'ābhijjhena cetasā vihāsiṃ, abhijjhāya cittaṃ parisodhesiṃ.
example_2: dhammesu dhamm'ānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ
sbs_example_3:
tassa vaḍḍhanti vedanā, anekā rūpasambhavā.
abhijjhā ca vihesā ca, cittam'ass'ūpahaññati.
evaṃ ācinato dukkhaṃ, ārā nibbānam'uccati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: puna caparaṃ, ānanda, bhikkhuno jivhāya rasaṃ sāyitvā uppajjati manāpaṃ uppajjati amanāpaṃ uppajjati manāp'āmanāpaṃ
example_2: jivhāya rasaṃ sāyitvā piyarūpe rase adhimuccati, appiyarūpe rase byāpajjati, anupaṭṭhitakāyassati ca viharati parittacetaso.
sbs_example_3: sotena saddaṃ sutvā … ghānena gandhaṃ ghāyitvā ... jivhāya rasaṃ sāyitvā … kāyena phoṭṭhabbaṃ phusitvā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (VINa) dutiyapadaṃ aññesaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ harantassa gacchato vasena
example_1:
dinnaṃ sukhaphalaṃ hoti,
n'ādinnaṃ hoti taṃ tathā,
corā haranti rājāno,
aggi ḍahati nassati.
example_2: theyyasaṅkhātan'ti ādiyeyyā'ti ādiyeyya hareyya avahareyya iriyāpathaṃ vikopeyya ṭhānā cāveyya saṅketaṃ vītināmeyya.
sbs_example_3: so tesaṃ bhogānaṃ ārakkh'ādhikaraṇaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti, kin'ti me bhoge n'eva rājāno hareyyuṃ, na corā hareyyuṃ, na aggi daheyya, na udakaṃ vaheyya, na appiyā dāy'ādā hareyyun'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (VIN 1.1.2) rājāno nāma pathabyārājā padesarājā maṇḍalikā antarabhogikā akkhadassā mahāmattā, ye vā pana chejjabhejjaṃ karontā anusāsanti. ete rājāno nāma.
example_1: yo pana bhikkhu gāmā vā araññā vā adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyeyya, yathārūpe adinn'ādāne rājāno coraṃ gahetvā haneyyuṃ vā bandheyyuṃ vā pabbājeyyuṃ vā
example_2: kodhanassa, bhikkhave, purisapuggalassa kodh'ābhibhūtassa kodhaparetassa, ye'pi'ssa te honti bhogā uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatā bāhābalaparicitā sed'āvakkhittā dhammikā dhammaladdhā, te'pi rājāno rājakosaṃ pavesenti kodh'ābhibhūtassa.
sbs_example_3: so tesaṃ bhogānaṃ ārakkh'ādhikaraṇaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti, kin'ti me bhoge n'eva rājāno hareyyuṃ, na corā hareyyuṃ, na aggi daheyya, na udakaṃ vaheyya, na appiyā dāy'ādā hareyyun'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: could get; would experience; would come across; lit. could arrive at
example_1: evaṃ vutte āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, seyyathā'pi, bhante, puriso jighacchādubbalyapareto madhupiṇḍikaṃ adhigaccheyya, so yato yato sāyeyya, labheth'eva sādurasaṃ asecanakaṃ
example_2: na kho, āvuso gotama, sukhena sukhaṃ adhigantabbaṃ, dukkhena kho sukhaṃ adhigantabbaṃ. sukhena c'āvuso gotama, sukhaṃ adhigantabbaṃ abhavissa, rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro sukhaṃ adhigaccheyya, rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro sukhavihāritaro āyasmatā gotamenā'ti.
sbs_example_3: so tatonidānaṃ labhetha pāmojjaṃ, adhigaccheyya somanassaṃ
sbs_example_4: so tassa pattavaṭṭiṃ vinibbhujanto pheggum'pi na-adhigaccheyya, kuto sāraṃ!
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: man'indriyaṃ asaṃvutassa, bhikkhave, viharato cittaṃ byāsiñcati manoviññeyyesu dhammesu, tassa byāsittacittassa pāmojjaṃ na hoti. pāmojje asati pīti na hoti. pītiyā asati passaddhi na hoti. passaddhiyā asati dukkhaṃ hoti.
example_2: tassa attano ca tāsañ'ca devatānaṃ saddhañ'ca sīlañ'ca sutañ'ca cāgañ'ca paññañ'ca anussarato cittaṃ pasīdati, pāmojjaṃ uppajjati, ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti
sbs_example_3: so tatonidānaṃ labhetha pāmojjaṃ, adhigaccheyya somanassaṃ
sbs_example_4: tassa kismiñci'd'eva pasādanīye nimitte cittaṃ paṇidahato pāmojjaṃ jāyati. pamuditassa pīti jāyati. pītimanassa kāyo passambhati. passaddhakāyo sukhaṃ vedayati. sukhino cittaṃ samādhiyati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
asantaṃ bhāvanam'iccheyya,
purekkhārañ'ca bhikkhusu,
āvāsesu ca issariyaṃ,
pūjā parakulesu ca.
example_2:
asevanā ca bālānaṃ, paṇḍitānañ'ca sevanā.
pūjā ca pūjanīyānaṃ, etaṃ maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.
sbs_example_3: so tathāgataṃ sakkaroti garuṃ karoti māneti pūjeti apaciyati, paramāya pūjāya.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: I could be; I might be; may I be; I could become
example_1: so sace ākaṅkhati, anekavihitaṃ iddhividhaṃ paccanubhaveyyaṃ, eko'pi hutvā bahudhā assaṃ, bahudhā'pi hutvā eko assaṃ, āvibhāvaṃ tirobhāvaṃ
example_2: saddho ca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu hoti, no ca sīlavā. evaṃ so ten'aṅgena aparipūro hoti. tena taṃ aṅgaṃ paripūretabbaṃ, kin't'āhaṃ saddho ca assaṃ, sīlavā cā'ti!
sbs_example_3: so evaṃ pajānāti, n'atthi nu kho taṃ kiñci lokasmiṃ yam'ahaṃ upādiyamāno na vajjavā assaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: grasping; holding (onto); clinging (to); taking possession (of); lit. taking near
notes: passive in form, active in meaning.
example_1: sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā saṃkhittena dhammaṃ desetu yam'ahaṃ bhagavato dhammaṃ sutvā eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahit'atto vihareyyan'ti. upādiyamāno kho, bhikkhu, baddho mārassa, anupādiyamāno mutto pāpimato'ti.
example_2: ahañ'hi rūpaṃ'y'eva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ, vedanaṃ'y'eva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ, saññaṃ'y'eva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ, saṅkhāreyeva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ, viññāṇaṃ'y'eva upādiyamāno upādiyiṃ.
sbs_example_3: so evaṃ pajānāti, n'atthi nu kho taṃ kiñci lokasmiṃ yam'ahaṃ upādiyamāno na vajjavā assaṃ.

commentary: (ANa) abhijjhāya cittaṃ parisodhetī'ti abhijjhāto cittaṃ parimoceti, yathā naṃ sā muñcati c'eva muñcitvā ca na puna gaṇhāti, evaṃ karotī'ti attho.
example_1: divasaṃ caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittaṃ parisodhessāma
example_2: ye'pi hi keci, rāhula, anāgatam'addhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā kāyakammaṃ parisodhessanti … sabbe te evam'evaṃ paccavekkhitvā paccavekkhitvā kāyakammaṃ parisodhessanti
sbs_example_3: so abhijjhaṃ loke pahāya vigat'ābhijjhena cetasā viharati, abhijjhāya cittaṃ parisodheti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: he would (think) thus; this would occur to him
example_1: tassā evam'assa, yaṃnūn'āhaṃ agatapubbañ'c'eva disaṃ gaccheyyaṃ, akhāditapubbāni ca tiṇāni khādeyyaṃ, apītapubbāni ca pānīyāni piveyyan'ti.
example_2: tassa purisassa uttiṇṇassa pāraṅ'gatassa evam'assa, bahukāro kho me ayaṃ kullo, im'āhaṃ kullaṃ nissāya hatthehi ca pādehi ca vāyamamāno sotthinā pāraṃ uttiṇṇo.
sbs_example_3: siyā kho pan'ānanda, tumhākaṃ evam'assa, atītasatthukaṃ pāvacanaṃ, n'atthi no satthā'ti.
sbs_example_4: tassa evam'assa, ayaṃ kho mahāudak'aṇṇavo, orimaṃ tīraṃ sāsaṅkaṃ sappaṭibhayaṃ, pārimaṃ tīraṃ khemaṃ appaṭibhayaṃ, n'atthi ca nāvā santāraṇī uttarasetu vā apārā pāraṃ gamanāya.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: even some; just some; some or other
example_1: seyyathā'pi, āvuso yamaka, gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā aḍḍho mahaddhano mahābhogo, so ca ārakkhasampanno. tassa koci'd'eva puriso uppajjeyya anatthakāmo ahitakāmo ayogakkhemakāmo jīvitā voropetu'kāmo.
example_2: siyā kho pana bhoto rañño mahāyaññaṃ yajamānassa koci'd'eva vippaṭisāro, mahā vata me bhogakkhandho vigacchatī'ti, so bhotā raññā vippaṭisāro na karaṇīyo
sbs_example_3: siyā ca tassa bhikkhuno koci'd'eva paccayo senaṃ gamanāya, dirattatirattaṃ tena bhikkhunā senāya vasitabbaṃ. tato ce uttariṃ vaseyya, pācittiyaṃ.
sbs_example_4: siyā ca tassa bhikkhuno koci'd'eva paccayo tena cīvarena vippavāsāya, chārattaparamaṃ tena bhikkhunā tena cīvarena vippavasitabbaṃ.
sbs_example_5: yathā, mahārāja, koci'd'eva puriso visaṃ abhisaṅkharitvā attanā ca piveyya, pare ca pāyeyya, so attanā'pi dukkhito bhaveyya, pare'pi dukkhitā bhaveyyuṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: is free (from); becomes free (from); is released (from)
example_1:
na antalikkhe na samuddamajjhe,
na pabbatānaṃ vivaraṃ pavissa,
na vijjatī so jagatippadeso,
yatthaṭṭhito mucceyya pāpakammā.
example_2:
ko sujjhati muccati bajjhatī ca,
ken'attanā gacchati brahmalokaṃ,
ajānato me muni brūhi puṭṭho,
bhagavā hi me sakkhi brahmajjadiṭṭho,
tuvañ'hi no brahmasamo'si saccaṃ,
kathaṃ upapajjati brahmalokaṃ jutima.
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi puriso ābādhiko assa dukkhito bāḷhagilāno, bhattañ'ca'ssa nacchādeyya, na c'assa kāye balamattā. so aparena samayena tamhā ābādhā mucceyya
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: (vinaya) ordination; renunciation; becoming a monastic; lit. exile
example_1: tesaṃ te kārā amhesu mahapphalā bhavissanti mah'ānisaṃsā, amhākañ'c'ev'āyaṃ pabbajjā avañjhā bhavissati saphalā saudrayā'ti. evañ'hi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabbaṃ.
example_2: es'āhaṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmi dhammañ'ca bhikkhusaṅghañ'ca, labheyyāhaṃ bhoto gotamassa santike pabbajjaṃ, labheyyaṃ upasampadan'ti.
sbs_example_3: sambādho ghar'āvāso rajopatho abbhokāso pabbajjā.
sbs_example_4: evaṃ no ayaṃ amhākaṃ pabbajjā avaṅkatā avañjhā bhavissati saphalā saudrayā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: name of a forest outside Vesālī; lit. great forest
example_1: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭ'āgārasālāyaṃ
example_2: atha kho saccako nigaṇṭhaputto jaṅghāvihāraṃ anucaṅkamamāno anuvicaramāno yena mahāvanaṃ kūṭ'āgārasālā ten'upasaṅkami.
sbs_example_3:
samaṇassa ahu cintā, pupphitamhi mahāvane.
ek'aggassa nisinnassa, pavivittassa jhāyino.

example_1: yo pana bhikkhu uyyuttaṃ senaṃ dassanāya gaccheyya aññatra tathārūpappaccayā, pācittiyaṃ.
example_2:
ārabbhatha nikkhamatha,
yuñjatha buddhasāsane,
dhunātha maccuno senaṃ,
naḷ'āgāraṃ'va kuñjaro.
sbs_example_3: saddhammasenā sugatānugo, yo lokassa pāp'ūpakilesajetā, santo sayaṃ santiniyojako ca, svākkhātadhammaṃ viditaṃ karoti
sbs_example_4: siyā ca tassa bhikkhuno koci'd'eva paccayo senaṃ gamanāya, dirattatirattaṃ tena bhikkhunā senāya vasitabbaṃ. tato ce uttariṃ vaseyya, pācittiyaṃ.

example_1:
idha vassaṃ vasissāmi,
idha hem'antagimhisu,
iti bālo vicinteti,
antarāyaṃ na bujjhati.
example_2: pāṭaliputtassa kho, ānanda, tayo antarāyā bhavissanti, aggito vā udakato vā mithubhedā vā'ti.
sbs_example_3: sabb'ītiyo vivajjantu, sabbarogo vinassatu, mā te bhavatva-antarāyo, sukhī dīgh'āyuko bhava.
sbs_example_4: tatra ce tumhe assatha kupitā vā anattamanā vā, tumhaṃ yev'assa tena antarāyo.

meaning_1: as much as; only as much as; only as far as
example_1: kā upanisā savanāyā'ti iti ce, bhikkhave, pucchitāro assu, te evam'assu vacanīyā, yāva'd'eva dvayatānaṃ dhammānaṃ yathābhūtaṃ ñāṇāyā'ti. kiñ'ca dvayataṃ vadetha?
example_2: bhojane mattaññuno bhavissāma paṭisaṅkhā yoniso āhāraṃ āharissāma n'eva davāya na madāya na maṇḍanāya na vibhūsanāya yāva'd'eva imassa kāyassa ṭhitiyā yāpanāya
sbs_example_3: paṭisaṅkhā yoniso cīvaraṃ paṭisevāmi yāva'd'eva sītassa paṭighātāya uṇhassa paṭighātāya ḍaṃsamakasavāt'ātapasiriṃsapasamphassānaṃ paṭighātāya yāva'd'eva hirikopīnapaṭicchādan'atthaṃ
sbs_example_4: paṭisaṅkhā yoniso gilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhāraṃ paṭisevāmi yāva'd'eva uppannānaṃ veyyābādhikānaṃ vedanānaṃ paṭighātāya abyāpajjhaparamatāyā'ti
sbs_example_5: yāva'd'eva ñāṇamattāya paṭissatimattāya anissito ca viharati, na ca kiñci loke upādiyati.

meaning_1: does not tolerate; does not accept; does not endure
example_1: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paṭisaṅkhā yoniso uppannaṃ kāmavitakkaṃ n'ādhivāseti pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti
example_2: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu uppannaṃ kāmavitakkaṃ ... byāpādavitakkaṃ ... vihiṃsāvitakkaṃ ... uppann'uppanne pāpake akusale dhamme n'ādhivāseti, pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu hantā hoti.
sbs_example_3: passatha no tumhe taṃ vacanapathaṃ, aṇuṃ vā thūlaṃ vā, yaṃ tumhe n'ādhivāseyyāthā'ti?

example_1:
appamādarato bhikkhu,
pamāde bhayadassi vā,
saṃyojanaṃ aṇuṃ thūlaṃ,
ḍahaṃ aggī'va gacchati.
example_2:
yo ca sameti pāpāni,
aṇuṃ thūlāni sabbaso,
samitattā hi pāpānaṃ,
samaṇo'ti pavuccati.
sbs_example_3: passatha no tumhe taṃ vacanapathaṃ, aṇuṃ vā thūlaṃ vā, yaṃ tumhe n'ādhivāseyyāthā'ti?

example_1:
appamādarato bhikkhu,
pamāde bhayadassi vā,
saṃyojanaṃ aṇuṃ thūlaṃ,
ḍahaṃ aggī'va gacchati.
example_2:
sabbhi'r'eva samāsetha,
paṇḍiteh'atthadassibhi,
atthaṃ mahantaṃ gambhīraṃ,
duddasaṃ nipuṇaṃ aṇuṃ,

meaning_1: way of saying things; mode of expression; manner of speech
example_1: khamā bhavissāma sītassa uṇhassa jighacchāya pipāsāya ḍaṃsa-makasa-vāt'ātapa-sarīsapa-samphassānaṃ duruttānaṃ durāgatānaṃ vacanapathānaṃ
example_2: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco bhikkhu tāva'd'eva soratasorato hoti nivātanivāto hoti upasant'ūpasanto hoti yāva na amanāpā vacanapathā phusanti.
sbs_example_3: passatha no tumhe taṃ vacanapathaṃ, aṇuṃ vā thūlaṃ vā, yaṃ tumhe n'ādhivāseyyāthā'ti?
sbs_example_4: atthi āsavā adhivāsanā pahātabbā – duruttānaṃ durāgatānaṃ vacanapathānaṃ, uppannānaṃ sārīrikānaṃ vedanānaṃ dukkhānaṃ tibbānaṃ

example_1:
rājato vā upasaggaṃ,
abbhakkhānañ'ca dāruṇaṃ,
parikkhayañ'ca ñātīnaṃ,
bhogānañ'ca pabhaṅguraṃ.
example_2: appamattikā esā, bhikkhave, parihāni yadidaṃ bhogaparihāni. etaṃ patikiṭṭhaṃ, bhikkhave, parihānīnaṃ yadidaṃ paññāparihānī'ti.
sbs_example_3: ñātibyasanena vā phuṭṭhassa, bhogabyasanena vā phuṭṭhassa, rogabyasanena vā phuṭṭhassa, sīlabyasanena vā phuṭṭhassa, diṭṭhibyasanena vā phuṭṭhassa
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi puriso bandhanāgāre baddho assa. so aparena samayena tamhā bandhanā mucceyya sotthinā abbhayena, na c'assa kiñci bhogānaṃ vayo.
sbs_example_5: so tesaṃ bhogānaṃ ārakkh'ādhikaraṇaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti, kin'ti me bhoge n'eva rājāno hareyyuṃ, na corā hareyyuṃ, na aggi daheyya, na udakaṃ vaheyya, na appiyā dāy'ādā hareyyun'ti

meaning_1: moreover; and so; but; or; however
example_1: tena kho pana samayena āyasmā mahākassapo pāvāya kusināraṃ addhānamaggappaṭippanno hoti mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi
example_2: samaṇā samaṇā'ti vo, bhikkhave, jano sañjānāti. tumhe ca pana, ke tumhe'ti puṭṭhā samānā, samaṇ'āmhā'ti paṭijānātha.
sbs_example_3: ñāṇañ'ca pana me dassanaṃ udapādi, akuppā me vimutti, ayam'antimā jāti, n'atthidāni punabbhavo'ti.
sbs_chant_eng_3: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_4: yo pana bhikkhu, otiṇṇo vipariṇatena cittena, mātugāmaṃ duṭṭhullāhi vācāhi obhāseyya, yathā taṃ yuvā yuvatiṃ methun'ūpasaṃhitāhi, saṅghādiseso.
sbs_example_5: āraddhaṃ kho pana me vīriyaṃ ahosi asallīnaṃ, upaṭṭhitā sati asammuṭṭhā, passaddho kāyo asāraddho, samāhitaṃ cittaṃ ek'aggaṃ.

meaning_1: we could be; we may be; we might be; we should be
example_1: idha no, āvuso sāriputta, bhagavā kiṃvādī kim'akkhāyī, kathaṃ byākaramānā ca mayaṃ vuttavādino c'eva bhagavato assāma, na ca bhagavantaṃ abhūtena abbhācikkheyyāma
example_2: yathā kathaṃ pana kho, kosiya, bhagavā saṃkhittena taṇhāsaṅkhayavimuttiṃ abhāsi? sādhu mayam'pi etissā kathāya bhāgino assāma savanāyā'ti.
sbs_example_3: maraṇadhammānaṃ sattānaṃ evaṃ icchā uppajjati aho vata mayaṃ na maraṇadhammā assāma, na ca vata no maraṇaṃ āgaccheyyā'ti. na kho pan'etaṃ icchāya pattabbaṃ, idam'pi yam'p'icchaṃ na labhati tam'pi dukkhaṃ

example_1: so tasmiṃ purise kāruññaṃ'y'eva upaṭṭhāpeyya, anuddayaṃ'y'eva upaṭṭhāpeyya, anukampaṃ'y'eva upaṭṭhāpeyya, aho vata-ayaṃ puriso labheyya sappāyāni bhojanāni, labheyya sappāyāni bhesajjāni, labheyya patirūpaṃ upaṭṭhākaṃ, labheyya gām'antanāyakaṃ!
example_2: idha cunda ekacco anabhijjhālu hoti. yaṃ taṃ parassa paravitt'ūpakaraṇaṃ taṃ anabhijjhitā hoti, aho vata yaṃ parassa taṃ mamassā'ti
sbs_example_3: maraṇadhammānaṃ sattānaṃ evaṃ icchā uppajjati aho vata mayaṃ na maraṇadhammā assāma, na ca vata no maraṇaṃ āgaccheyyā'ti. na kho pan'etaṃ icchāya pattabbaṃ, idam'pi yam'p'icchaṃ na labhati tam'pi dukkhaṃ

example_1: yo pana bhikkhu gāmā vā araññā vā adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyeyya, yathārūpe adinn'ādāne rājāno coraṃ gahetvā haneyyuṃ vā bandheyyuṃ vā pabbājeyyuṃ vā
example_2: yo so yodh'ājīvo saṅgāme ussahati vāyamati, tam'enaṃ ussahantaṃ vāyamantaṃ pare hananti pariyāpādenti, so kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā parajitānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjatī'ti.
sbs_example_3: luddho pan'āyaṃ purisapuggalo lobhena abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto pāṇam'pi hanati, adinnam'pi ādiyati, paradāram'pi gacchati, musā'pi bhaṇati, param'pi tathattāya samādapeti, yaṃ sa hoti dīgharattaṃ ahitāya dukkhāyā'ti.

meaning_1: with mind; by mind; with thought; with intention
example_1:
dhammapīti sukhaṃ seti,
vippasannena cetasā,
ariyappavedite dhamme,
sadā ramati paṇḍito.
example_2: so mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṃ disaṃ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṃ, tathā tatiyaṃ, tathā catutthaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
kiñ'c'āpi so kammaṃ karoti pāpakaṃ, kāyena vācā'uda cetasā vā.
abhabbo so tassa paṭicchadāya, abhabbatā diṭṭhapadassa vuttā.
sbs_example_4: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ – adhun'āgatavadhukāsamena cetasā viharissāmā'ti
sbs_example_5: so abhijjhaṁ loke pahāya vigat'ābhijjhena cetasā viharati abhijjhāya cittaṁ parisodheti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (ANa) phāsuṃ'y'evā'ti iminā arahattaṃ dasseti. arahattappatto hi sabb'iriyāpathesu phāsu viharati nāma.
example_1: yaṃnūna mayaṃ yena gosiṅgasālavanadāyo ten'upasaṅkameyyāma. tattha mayaṃ appasaddā app'ākiṇṇā phāsuṃ vihareyyāmā'ti.
example_2: yena yen'eva gagghasi phāsuṃ'y'eva gagghasi, yattha yattha ṭhassasi phāsuṃ'y'eva ṭhassasi, yattha yattha nisīdissasi phāsuṃ'y'eva nisīdissasi, yattha yattha seyyaṃ kappessasi phāsuṃ'y'eva seyyaṃ kappessasī'ti.
sbs_example_3: kin'ti anāgatā ca pesalā sabrahmacārī āgaccheyyuṃ āgatā ca pesalā sabrahmacārī phāsuṃ vihareyyun'ti

meaning_1: looking for; searching for; on a quest for
example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso alagaddatthiko alagaddagavesī alagaddapariyesanaṃ caramāno. so passeyya mahantaṃ alagaddaṃ. tam'enaṃ bhoge vā naṅguṭṭhe vā gaṇheyya.
example_2: atha puriso āgaccheyya phal'atthiko phalagavesī phalapariyesanaṃ caramāno. so taṃ vanasaṇḍaṃ ajjhogāhetvā taṃ rukkhaṃ passeyya sampannaphalañ'ca upapannaphalañ'ca.
sbs_example_3:
kiṃ kayirā udapānena,
āpā ce sabbadā siyuṃ,
taṇhāya mūlato chetvā,
kissa pariyesanaṃ care'ti.

meaning_1: having cut off; having severed; (comm) having killed; lit. having cut
example_1:
vanaṃ chindatha mā rukkhaṃ,
vanato jāyate bhayaṃ,
chetvā vanañ'ca vanathañ'ca,
nibbanā hotha bhikkhavo.
example_2:
kiṃ'su chetvā sukhaṃ seti,
kiṃ'su chetvā na socati,
kissa'ssu ekadhammassa,
vadhaṃ rocesi gotamā'ti.
sbs_example_3:
kiṃ kayirā udapānena,
āpā ce sabbadā siyuṃ,
taṇhāya mūlato chetvā,
kissa pariyesanaṃ care'ti.
sbs_example_4: tam'enaṃ mūle chindeyya, mūle chetvā agge chindeyya, agge chetvā pattavaṭṭiṃ vinibbhujeyya.

example_1:
yass'ānusayā na santi keci,
mūlā ca akusalā samūhatāse,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.
example_2: upadhi dukkhassa mūlan'ti, iti viditvā nirupadhi upadhisaṅkhaye vimutto upadhismiṃ vā kāyaṃ upasaṃharissati cittaṃ vā uppādessatī'ti, n'etaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
sbs_example_3:
kiṃ kayirā udapānena,
āpā ce sabbadā siyuṃ,
taṇhāya mūlato chetvā,
kissa pariyesanaṃ care'ti.

example_1:
kattha āpo ca pathavī,
tejo vāyo na gādhati,
kattha dīghañ'ca rassañ'ca,
aṇuṃ thūlaṃ subh'āsubhaṃ,
kattha nāmañ'ca rūpañ'ca,
asesaṃ uparujjhatī'ti?
example_2: yaṃ ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ āpo āpogataṃ upādinnaṃ … yaṃ vā pan'aññam'pi kiñci ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ āpo āpogataṃ upādinnaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā āpodhātu.
sbs_example_3:
kiṃ kayirā udapānena,
āpā ce sabbadā siyuṃ,
taṇhāya mūlato chetvā,
kissa pariyesanaṃ care'ti.
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi āpasmiṃ sucim'pi, asucim'pi, gūtha ca mutta ca kheḷaca pubba ca lohitagatam'pi dhovanti , na ca tena āpo aṭṭīyati vā harāyati vā jigucchati vā
sbs_example_5: āpaṃ āpato sañjānāti, āpaṃ āpato saññatvā āpaṃ maññati, āpasmiṃ maññati, āpato maññati, āpaṃ me'ti maññati, āpaṃ abhinandati.

meaning_1: is not; it is not; there is not; there is no; there is nothing
example_1:
n'atthi jhānaṃ apaññassa,
paññā n'atthi ajhāyato,
yamhi jhānañ'ca paññā ca,
sa ve nibbānasantike.
example_2: atthi, bhikkhave, dakkhiṇesu janapadesu dhovanaṃ nāma. tattha hoti annam'pi pānam'pi khajjam'pi bhojjam'pi leyyam'pi peyyam'pi naccam'pi gītam'pi vāditam'pi. atth'etaṃ, bhikkhave, dhovanaṃ, n'etaṃ n'atthī'ti vadāmi.
sbs_example_3:
khīṇaṃ purāṇaṃ navaṃ n'atthi sambhavaṃ, virattacitt'āyatike bhavasmiṃ.
te khīṇabījā avirūḷhichandā, nibbanti dhīrā yath'āyaṃ padīpo.
sbs_example_4: siyā kho pan'ānanda, tumhākaṃ evam'assa, atītasatthukaṃ pāvacanaṃ, n'atthi no satthā'ti.
sbs_example_5: ettha ce n'atthi abhinanditabbaṃ abhivaditabbaṃ ajjhositabbaṃ. es'ev'anto rāg'ānusayānaṃ

meaning_1: in the future; lit. future time
example_1: bhavissāmi nu kho ahaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ? na nu kho bhavissāmi anāgatam'addhānaṃ? kiṃ nu kho bhavissāmi anāgatam'addhānaṃ? kathaṃ nu kho bhavissāmi anāgatam'addhānaṃ? kiṃ hutvā kiṃ bhavissāmi nu kho ahaṃ anāgatam'addhānan'ti?
example_2: ye'pi hi keci, rāhula, anāgatam'addhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā kāyakammaṃ parisodhessanti … sabbe te evam'evaṃ paccavekkhitvā paccavekkhitvā kāyakammaṃ parisodhessanti
sbs_example_3: kathañ'ca, gahapati, purakkharāno hoti? idha, gahapati, ekaccassa evaṃ hoti, evaṃrūpo siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ, evaṃvedano siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ
sbs_example_4: ye'pi hi keci, bhikkhave, anāgatam'addhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā yaṃ loke piyarūpaṃ sātarūpaṃ taṃ aniccato dakkhissanti dukkhato dakkhissanti anattato dakkhissanti rogato dakkhissanti bhayato dakkhissanti, te taṇhaṃ pajahissanti.

example_1: evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco bhikkhu bhikkhusaṅghaṃ piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandho hoti, aham'pi bhikkhu, aham'pi bhikkhū'ti.
example_2: idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa appamattakam'pi pāpakammaṃ kataṃ tam'enaṃ nirayaṃ upaneti.
sbs_example_3: kathañ'ca, gahapati, purakkharāno hoti? idha, gahapati, ekaccassa evaṃ hoti, evaṃrūpo siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ, evaṃvedano siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ
sbs_example_4: tādisikāya āpattiyā ekaccaṃ pabbājenti ekaccaṃ na pabbājentī'ti, so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi evam'assa vacanīyo
sbs_example_5: idha ekacco puggalo bhāvitakāyo hoti bhāvitasīlo bhāvitacitto bhāvitapañño aparitto mahatto appamāṇavihārī.

meaning_1: here; in this regard; in this case
example_1: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kāye kāy'ānupassī viharati
example_2: idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo nīce kule paccājāto hoti, caṇḍālakule vā venakule vā nesādakule vā rathakārakule vā pukkusakule vā dalidde app'annapānabhojane kasiravuttike, yattha kasirena ghāsacchādo labbhati.
sbs_example_3: kathañ'ca, gahapati, purakkharāno hoti? idha, gahapati, ekaccassa evaṃ hoti, evaṃrūpo siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ, evaṃvedano siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ
sbs_example_4:
tiṭṭhaṃ, caraṃ, nisinno vā, sayāno vā, yāvatā'ssa vigatamiddho,
etaṃ satiṃ adhiṭṭheyya, brahmam'etaṃ vihāraṃ idha'm'āhu.
sbs_example_5: evaṃ utu-ācikkhanaṃ. utūṃ-idha pana sāsane hem'anta-gimha-vassānānaṃ vasena tīṇi honti.

example_1: avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārā, saṅkhārapaccayā viññāṇaṃ, viññāṇapaccayā nāmarūpaṃ
example_2:
yassa darathajā na santi keci,
oraṃ āgamanāya paccayāse,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.
sbs_example_3: jhānapaccayo, maggapaccayo, sampayuttapaccayo, vippayuttapaccayo, atthipaccayo, n'atthipaccayo, vigatapaccayo, avigatapaccayo.
sbs_example_4: siyā ca tassa bhikkhuno koci'd'eva paccayo senaṃ gamanāya, dirattatirattaṃ tena bhikkhunā senāya vasitabbaṃ. tato ce uttariṃ vaseyya, pācittiyaṃ.
sbs_example_5: siyā ca tassa bhikkhuno koci'd'eva paccayo tena cīvarena vippavāsāya, chārattaparamaṃ tena bhikkhunā tena cīvarena vippavasitabbaṃ.

meaning_1: polite; pleasant; charming; (comm) fit to be remembered; lit. to be desired
commentary:
(MNa) sāraṇīyā'ti saritabbayuttā addhāne atikkante'pi na pamussitabbā.
(SNa) saritabbabhāvato ca sāraṇīyaṃ.
(ANa) sāraṇīyā'ti saritabbayuttakā.
notes: see PED for discussion on disputed etymology
example_1: sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā daṇḍam'olubbha ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhāsi
example_2: cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, dhammā sāraṇīyā piyakaraṇā garukaraṇā saṅgahāya avivādāya sāmaggiyā ekībhāvāya saṃvattanti.
sbs_example_3: ime ce tumhe, ānanda, cha sāraṇīye dhamme samādāya vatteyyātha, passatha no tumhe taṃ vacanapathaṃ, aṇuṃ vā thūlaṃ vā, yaṃ tumhe n'ādhivāseyyāthā'ti?
sbs_example_4: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi. sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekam’antaṃ nisīdi. ekam’antaṃ nisinno kho gaṇakamoggallāno brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ etad’avoca
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yato tumhe, bhikkhave, indriyesu guttadvārā viharissatha, atha tumhehipi māro pāpimā nibbijja pakkamissati, otāraṃ alabhamāno, kummamhāva siṅgālo'ti.
example_2: samaṇā samaṇā'ti vo, bhikkhave, jano sañjānāti. tumhe ca pana, ke tumhe'ti puṭṭhā samānā, samaṇ'āmhā'ti paṭijānātha.
sbs_example_3: ime ce tumhe, ānanda, cha sāraṇīye dhamme samādāya vatteyyātha, passatha no tumhe taṃ vacanapathaṃ, aṇuṃ vā thūlaṃ vā, yaṃ tumhe n'ādhivāseyyāthā'ti?
sbs_example_4:
ese'va maggo natth'añño, dassanassa visuddhiyā,
etañ'hi tumhe paṭipajjatha, mārass'etaṃ pamohanaṃ.
sbs_example_5: tumhe'pi tena ādissā bhaveyyātha, āmisadāy'ādā satthusāvakā viharanti, no dhammadāy'ādā'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: thrown away; discarded; abandoned; disposed of
example_1: puna caparaṃ bhikkhave bhikkhu seyyathā'pi passeyya sarīraṃ sivathikāya chaḍḍitaṃ ek'āhamataṃ vā dvī'hamataṃ vā tī'hamataṃ vā uddhumātakaṃ vinīlakaṃ vipubbakajātaṃ
example_2: atha kho bhagavā parittaṃ udak'āvasesaṃ chaḍḍetvā āyasmantaṃ rāhulaṃ āmantesi, passasi no tvaṃ, rāhula, parittaṃ udak'āvasesaṃ chaḍḍitan'ti? evaṃ, bhante
sbs_example_3:
imañ'ca kāyaṃ ārabbha, bhūripaññena desitaṃ,
pahānaṃ tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ, rūpaṃ passetha chaḍḍitaṃ.

meaning_1: face to face (with); in front (of); in the presence (of); lit. with face
example_1: kiṃ nu kho mayaṃ āyasmato anuruddhassa evam'ārocimha, imāsañ'ca imāsañ'ca vihārasamāpattīnaṃ mayaṃ lābhino'ti yaṃ no āyasmā anuruddho bhagavato sammukhā yāva āsavānaṃ khayā pakāsetī'ti?
example_2: tasmā't'iha, phagguna, tava ce'pi koci sammukhā avaṇṇaṃ bhāseyya, tatr'āpi tvaṃ, phagguna, ye gehasitā chandā ye gehasitā vitakkā te pajaheyyāsi.
sbs_example_3: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya, sammukhā m'etaṃ, āvuso, bhagavato sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ, ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanan'ti.
sbs_example_4: yaṃnūn'āhaṃ bhagavantaṃ sammukhā sāruppāya gāthāya abhitthaveyyan'ti.
sbs_example_5: yañ'ca kho jaññā sammukhā khīṇavādaṃ bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ atthasaṃhitaṃ tatra kālaññū assa tassa sammukhā khīṇavādassa vacanāya

meaning_1: female disciple; laywomen; female devotee; lit. sitting near
commentary: (VIN 1.3.1) upāsikā nāma buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gatā, dhammaṃ saraṇaṃ gatā, saṅghaṃ saraṇaṃ gatā.
example_1: yo kho, ānanda, bhikkhu vā bhikkhunī vā upāsako vā upāsikā vā dhamm'ānudhammappaṭipanno viharati sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī so tathāgataṃ sakkaroti garuṃ karoti māneti pūjeti apaciyati paramāya pūjāya.
example_2:
saddhāya sīlena ca yā'dha vaḍḍhati,
paññāya cāgena sutena c'ūbhayaṃ,
sā tādisī sīlavatī upāsikā,
ādīyati sāram'idh'eva attano'ti.
sbs_example_3: idha bhikkhuno pavivittassa viharato bhavanti upasaṅkamitāro bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo upāsakā upāsikāyo rājāno rājamahāmattā titthiyā titthiyasāvakā.
sbs_example_4: tam'enaṃ saddheyyavacasā upāsikā disvā tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ aññatarena vadeyya

example_1: so tathā vūpakaṭṭho viharanto taṃ dhammaṃ anussarati anuvitakketi.
example_2: yañ'hi'ssa, bhikkhave, cakkhu'ndriyasaṃvaraṃ asaṃvutassa viharato uppajjeyyuṃ āsavā vighātapariḷāhā, cakkhu'ndriyasaṃvaraṃ saṃvutassa viharato evaṃsa te āsavā vighātapariḷāhā na honti
sbs_example_3: idha bhikkhuno pavivittassa viharato bhavanti upasaṅkamitāro bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo upāsakā upāsikāyo rājāno rājamahāmattā titthiyā titthiyasāvakā.
sbs_example_4: tassa kāye kāyānupassino viharato kāyārammaṇo vā uppajjati kāyasmiṃ pariḷāho, cetaso vā līnattaṃ, bahiddhā vā cittaṃ vikkhipati.

meaning_1: pleased; happy; delighted; satisfied; lit. own mind
example_1:
sace labhetha nipakaṃ sahāyaṃ,
saddhiṃcaraṃ sādhuvihāridhīraṃ,
abhibhuyya sabbāni parissayāni,
careyya tena-attamano satīmā.
example_2: purimen'ev'āhaṃ, bhante, opammena bhagavato attamano abhiraddho. api c'āhaṃ imāni bhagavato vicitrāni pañhapaṭibhānāni sotu'kāmo, ev'āhaṃ bhagavantaṃ paccanīkaṃ kātabbaṃ amaññissaṃ
sbs_example_3: idam'avoca bhagavā. attamanā pañcavaggiyā bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinanduṃ.
sbs_chant_eng_3: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_4: te tāvataken'eva attamanā assu, alam'ettāvatā, katam'ettāvatā, anuppatto no sāmaññ'attho, n'atthi no kiñci uttarikaraṇīyan'ti.

example_1:
sahassam'api ce gāthā,
anatthapadasaṃhitā,
ekaṃ gāthāpadaṃ seyyo,
yaṃ sutvā upasammati.

example_1: kassa no tvaṃ, cunda, soceyyāni rocesī'ti?
example_2:
santi loke munayo,
janā vadanti ta'y'idaṃ kathaṃsu,
ñāṇ'ūpapannaṃ no muniṃ vadanti,
udāhu ve jīviten'ūpapannaṃ.

commentary: (SNa) pavivitto'ti kāyaviveko ca vivekaṭṭhakāyānaṃ nekkhamm'ābhiratānaṃ, cittaviveko ca parisuddhacittānaṃ paramavodānappattānaṃ, upadhiviveko ca nirupadhīnaṃ puggalānaṃ visaṅkhāragatānan'ti, imesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ vivekānaṃ lābhī.

example_2: nibbedhikapañño, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. app'iccho, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. santuṭṭho, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. pavivitto, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. asaṃsaṭṭho, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto.
sbs_example_3: āraddhavīriyo ca kho, bhikkhave, sukhaṃ viharati pavivitto pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi, mahantañ'ca sadatthaṃ paripūreti.

example_2: so vata, bhikkhave, aññatr'eva kāmehi aññatra kāmasaññāya aññatra kāmavitakkehi kāme paṭisevissatī'ti, n'etaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.

example_2: yo pana bhikkhu sañcarittaṃ samāpajjeyya itthiyā vā purisamatiṃ purisassa vā itthimatiṃ, jāyattane vā jārattane vā, antamaso taṅ'khaṇikāya'pi, saṅghādiseso.

example_2: tam'enaṃ evaṃ vadeyyuṃ, ambho purisa, yassa tvaṃ pāsādassa ārohaṇāya nisseṇiṃ karosi, jānāsi taṃ pāsādaṃ puratthimāya vā disāya dakkhiṇāya vā disāya pacchimāya vā disāya uttarāya vā disāya ucco vā nīco vā majjhimo vā'ti?

meaning_1: signless; featureless; free of mental images; lit. no sign
commentary: (MNa) tattha yo bhikkhu saṅkhāre aniccato pariggahetvā aniccato disvā aniccato vuṭṭhāti, tassa vuṭṭhānagāminivipassanā animittā nāma hoti.
example_1: kati pan'āvuso, paccayā animittāya cetovimuttiyā samāpattiyā'ti? dve kho, āvuso, paccayā animittāya cetovimuttiyā samāpattiyā, sabbanimittānañ'ca amanasikāro, animittāya ca dhātuyā manasikāro.
example_2:
yass'āsavā parikkhīṇā,
āhāre ca anissito,
suññato animitto ca,
vimokkho yassa gocaro,
ākāse va sakuntānaṃ,
padaṃ tassa durannayaṃ.
sbs_example_3: yāvañ'c'idaṃ, bhikkhave, alam'eva animitto samādhi bhāvetuṃ. animitto, bhikkhave, samādhi bhāvito bahulīkato mahapphalo hoti mahānisaṃso.

example_1:

meaning_1: goes forth from home to homelessness; leaves home to become a monk
example_1: evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, cattāri bhayāni idh'ekaccassa kulaputtassa imasmiṃ dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajitassa pāṭikaṅkhitabbāni.

example_1:

hitvā puttaṃ pasuṃ viyaṃ,
hitvā rāgañ'ca dosañ'ca,

meaning_1: weakness; lack of strength; feebleness; incapability; lit. weak state
example_1: yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno sikkhaṃ appaccakkhāya dubbalyaṃ anāvikatvā methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭiseveyya, antamaso tiracchānagatāya'pi, pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.
example_2: evaṃ vutte āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, seyyathā'pi, bhante, puriso jighacchādubbalyapareto madhupiṇḍikaṃ adhigaccheyya, so yato yato sāyeyya, labheth'eva sādurasaṃ asecanakaṃ

meaning_1: palms placed together (as a token of respect)
example_1: tena kuṭikārakena bhikkhunā kuṭivatthuṃ sodhetvā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ek'aṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evam'assa vacanīyo
example_2: tassa heṭṭhābhāgaṃ sodhāpetvā pākāraparikkhepaṃ kārāpetvā vālukaṃ okirāpetvā dhajapaṭākaṃ ussāpetvā vanappatiṃ alaṅ'karitvā añjaliṃ karitvā, sace puttaṃ vā dhītaraṃ vā labheyyaṃ, tumhākaṃ mahāsakkāraṃ karissāmī'ti patthanaṃ katvā pakkāmi.

sbs_example_4: atha kho āyasmā ānando abhikkantāya rattiyā, nikkhante paṭhame yāme, uṭṭhāy'āsanā ek'aṃsaṃ uttar'āsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā tena-añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṃ etad'avoca

meaning_1: that much; that far; as long as; to that extent; until; at least
example_1: yāv'assa kāyo ṭhassati tāva naṃ dakkhanti devamanussā kāyassa bhedā uddhaṃ jīvitapariyādānā na naṃ dakkhanti devamanussā'ti
example_2: abhabbo taṃ kammaṃ kātuṃ, yaṃ kammaṃ katvā nirayaṃ vā tiracchānayoniṃ vā pettivisayaṃ vā upapajjeyya, abhabbo'va tāva kālaṃ kātuṃ yāva na sot'āpattiphalaṃ sacchikaroti.
sbs_example_3: n'eva tāv'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambuddho'ti paccaññāsiṃ
sbs_chant_eng_3: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_4:
yāva hi vanatho na chijjati, aṇumatto'pi narassa nārisu,
paṭibaddhamano'va tāva so, vaccho khīrapako'va mātari.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: all the more; not to mention; even better
example_1: ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu, ko paccayo yen'ekadā dīgharattaṃ sajjhāyakatā'pi mantā nappaṭibhanti, pag'eva asajjhāyakatā?
example_2: kull'ūpamaṃ vo, bhikkhave, dhammaṃ desitaṃ, ājānantehi dhammā'pi vo pahātabbā pag'eva adhammā.
sbs_example_3: mātugāmo nāma manuss'itthī, na yakkhī na petī, na tiracchānagatā. antamaso tad'ahujātā'pi dārikā, pag'eva mahattarī.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: gacch'āvuso, na me tayā saddhiṃ kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hoti, ekakassa me kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hotī'ti etadeva paccayaṃ karitvā anaññaṃ, pācittiyaṃ.
example_2:
devo ca vassati devo ca gaḷagaḷāyati,
ekako c'āhaṃ bherave bile viharāmi,
tassa mayhaṃ ekakassa bherave bile viharato,
n'atthi bhayaṃ vā chambhitattaṃ vā lomahaṃso vā.
sbs_example_3: kikī'va aṇḍaṃ, camarī'va vāladhiṃ. piyaṃ'va puttaṃ, nayanaṃ'va ekakaṃ. tath'eva sīlaṃ, anurakkhamānā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: mental objects of consciousness; mentality; mental factors of feeling, perception, intention, contact and attention; lit. name
commentary: (MN 9) vedanā, saññā, cetanā, phasso, manasikāro, idaṃ vuccat'āvuso, nāmaṃ
example_1:
kattha āpo ca pathavī,
tejo vāyo na gādhati,
kattha dīghañ'ca rassañ'ca,
aṇuṃ thūlaṃ subh'āsubhaṃ,
kattha nāmañ'ca rūpañca,
asesaṃ uparujjhatī'ti?
example_2: evaṃ vutte aññataro bhikkhu there bhikkhū etadavoca, nāmaṃ kho, āvuso, eko anto, rūpaṃ dutiyo anto, viññāṇaṃ majjhe, taṇhā sibbinī.
sbs_example_3: katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, nāmarūpaṃ? vedanā, saññā, cetanā, phasso, manasikāro, idaṃ vuccati nāmaṃ.
sbs_example_4:
yam'etaṃ pañhaṃ apucchi, ajita taṃ vadāmi te,
yattha nāmañ'ca rūpañ'ca, asesaṃ uparujjhati,
viññāṇassa nirodhena, etth'etaṃ uparujjhati.
sbs_example_5: avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārā, saṅkhārapaccayā viññāṇaṃ, viññāṇapaccayā nāmarūpaṃ, nāmarūpapaccayā saḷ'āyatanaṃ, saḷ'āyatanapaccayā phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
n'etaṃ kho saraṇaṃ khemaṃ,
n'etaṃ saraṇam'uttamaṃ,
n'etaṃ saraṇam'āgamma,
sabbadukkhā pamuccati.
sbs_chant_eng_1: Going to True and False Refuges
example_2: so taṃ pokkharaṇiṃ āgamma vineyya udakapipāsaṃ vineyya ghammapariḷāhaṃ
sbs_example_3:
kaṇhaṃ dhammaṃ vippahāya, sukkaṃ bhāvetha paṇḍito,
okā anokam'āgamma, viveke yattha dūramaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
okaṃ pahāya aniketasārī,
gāme akubbaṃ muni santhavāni,
kāmehi ritto apurekkharāno,
kathaṃ na viggayha janena kayirā.
example_2: rūpadhātu kho, gahapati, viññāṇassa oko. rūpadhāturāgavinibandhañ'ca pana viññāṇaṃ, okasārī'ti vuccati.
sbs_example_3:
kaṇhaṃ dhammaṃ vippahāya, sukkaṃ bhāvetha paṇḍito,
okā anokam'āgamma, viveke yattha dūramaṃ.
sbs_example_4:
uyyuñjanti satīmanto, na nikete ramanti te,
haṃsā'va pallalaṃ hitvā, okam'okaṃ jahanti te.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
api dibbesu kāmesu,
ratiṃ so n'ādhigacchati,
taṇhakkhayarato hoti,
sammāsambuddhasāvako.
example_2:
disvāna taṇhaṃ aratiṃ ragañ'ca,
n'āhosi chando api methunasmiṃ,
kim'ev'idaṃ muttakarīsapuṇṇaṃ,
pādā'pi naṃ samphusituṃ na icche.
sbs_example_3:
kalyāṇamittatā muninā, lokaṃ ādissa vaṇṇitā.
kalyāṇamitte bhajamāno, api bālo paṇḍito assa.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: dve'me, bhikkhave, dhammā sukkā lokaṃ pālenti. katame dve? hirī ca ottappañ'ca.
example_2:
kaṇhaṃ dhammaṃ vippahāya, sukkaṃ bhāvetha paṇḍito,
okā anokam'āgamma, viveke yattha dūramaṃ.
sbs_example_3: ime kho dve sukkā dhammā lokaṃ na pāleyyuṃ, na'y'idha paññāyetha mātā'ti vā mātucchā'ti vā mātulānī'ti vā ācariyabhariyā'ti vā garūnaṃ dārā'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: dhamme aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti, svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhī'ti
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhante, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya, cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī'ti. evam'evaṃ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
sbs_example_3: imassa nu kho, bhante, bhagavatā saṃkhittena bhāsitassa kathaṃ vitthārena attho daṭṭhabbo'ti?
sbs_example_4: atha kho aññataro brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: all objects; all signs; all mental images
commentary:
(MNa) sabbanimittānan'ti rūp'ādīnaṃ sabb'ārammaṇānaṃ.
(ANa) sabbanimittesū'ti rūpanimittaṃ, saddanimittaṃ, gandhanimittaṃ, rasanimittaṃ, phoṭṭhabbanimittaṃ, sassatādinimittaṃ, puggalanimittaṃ dhammanimittan'ti evarūpesu ca bahiddhā sabbanimittesu.
example_1: siyā nu kho, bhante, bhikkhuno tathārūpo samādhipaṭilābho yathā ... bahiddhā ca sabbanimittesu ahaṅ'kāramamaṅ'kāramān'ānusayā n'āssu
example_2: kati pan'āvuso, paccayā animittāya cetovimuttiyā ṭhitiyā'ti? tayo kho, āvuso, paccayā animittāya cetovimuttiyā ṭhitiyā, sabbanimittānañ'ca amanasikāro, animittāya ca dhātuyā manasikāro, pubbe ca abhisaṅkhāro.
sbs_example_3: imasmiñ'ca saviññāṇake kāye bahiddhā ca sabbanimittesu ahaṅ'kāramamaṅ'kāramān'āpagataṃ mānasaṃ hoti vidhā samatikkantaṃ santaṃ suvimuttan'ti.
sbs_example_4: so sabbaṃ dhammaṃ abhijānāti, sabbaṃ dhammaṃ abhiññāya sabbaṃ dhammaṃ parijānāti, sabbaṃ dhammaṃ pariññāya sabbanimittāni aññato passati
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: belonging to the group of five
example_1: tena kho pana maṃ, aggivessana, samayena pañcavaggiyā bhikkhū paccupaṭṭhitā honti, yaṃ kho samaṇo gotamo dhammaṃ adhigamissati, taṃ no ārocessatī'ti.
example_2: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā bārāṇasiyaṃ viharati isipatane migadāye. tatra kho bhagavā pañcavaggiye bhikkhū āmantesi, bhikkhavo'ti. bhadante'ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ. bhagavā etadavoca
sbs_chant_eng_2: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_3: imasmiñ'ca pana veyyākaraṇasmiṃ bhaññamāne pañcavaggiyānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ anupādāya āsavehi cittāni vimucciṃsū'ti.
sbs_chant_eng_3: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: clearly aware; fully knowing; completely comprehending
commentary:
(ITIa) sampajāno'ti sattaṭṭhāniyena sampajaññena samannāgato.
(ANa) sato sampajāno'ti satiyā ca ñāṇena ca samannāgato. idaṃ ubhayaṃ ālokasaññāya upakārakattā vuttaṃ.
example_1: upekkhako tattha viharati sato sampajāno
example_2:
mosavajje na nīyetha,
sampajāno saṭhāni na kayirā,
atha jīvitena paññāya,
sīlabbatena n'āññam'atimaññe.
sbs_example_3: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kāye kāy'ānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ
sbs_example_4: rattiyā majjhimaṃ yāmaṃ dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṃ kappeyyāsi pāde pādaṃ accādhāya sato sampajāno uṭṭhānasaññaṃ manasikaritvā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: tena kho pana samayena āyasmā cūḷapanthako bhagavato avidūre nisinno hoti pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.
example_2: ayya sumedhatāpasa, porāṇakabodhisattānaṃ pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā, pāramiyo vicinissāmā'ti nisinnakāle yāni pubbanimittāni nāma paññāyanti, tāni sabbāni'pi ajja pātubhūtāni
sbs_example_3: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññ'āgāragato vā nisīdati, pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā, ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya, parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

construction:
pari > pali > paly > pall + √añc > aṅk + a
pari + aṅka
example_1: pathaviyā'pi ummujjanimujjaṃ kareyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi udake, udake'pi abhijjamāno gaccheyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi pathaviyaṃ, ākāse'pi pallaṅkena kameyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi pakkhī sakuṇo
example_2: ayya sumedhatāpasa, porāṇakabodhisattānaṃ pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā, pāramiyo vicinissāmā'ti nisinnakāle yāni pubbanimittāni nāma paññāyanti, tāni sabbāni'pi ajja pātubhūtāni
sbs_example_3: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññ'āgāragato vā nisīdati, pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā, ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya, parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.

example_1: rattiyā majjhimaṃ yāmaṃ dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṃ kappessāma pāde pādaṃ accādhāya sato sampajāno uṭṭhānasaññaṃ manasi karitvā
example_2: micchājīvaṃ pahāya sammājīvena jīvitaṃ kappeti, etth'ete akusalā sīlā aparisesā nirujjhanti
sbs_example_3: idha bhikkhave ariyasāvako micchāājīvaṃ pahāya sammāājīvena jīvitaṃ kappeti, ayaṃ vuccati bhikkhave sammāājīvo.

example_1: ayaṃ me mātā, tassā me mātu ayaṃ mātā'ti, apariyādinnā'va bhikkhave, tassa purisassa mātumātaro assu, atha imasmiṃ jambudīpe tiṇakaṭṭhasākhāpalāsaṃ parikkhayaṃ pariyādānaṃ gaccheyya.
example_2: accayo maṃ, bhante, accagamā, yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ, y'āhaṃ evam'akāsiṃ. tassā me, bhante, ayyo ānando accayaṃ accayato paṭiggaṇhātu, āyatiṃ saṃvarāyā'ti.
sbs_example_3: idaṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, dukkhanirodhaṃ ariyasaccaṃ, yo tassā'y'eva taṇhāya asesavirāganirodho cāgo paṭinissaggo mutti anālayo.
sbs_chant_eng_3: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_4: yo ca tassā bhikkhuparisāya pattapariyanto so tassa bhikkhuno padātabbo, ayaṃ te, bhikkhu, patto, yāva bhedanāya dhāretabbo'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhave, abhiññāya dhammaṃ desayato no anabhiññāya, sanidānaṃ dhammaṃ desayato no anidānaṃ, sappāṭihāriyaṃ dhammaṃ desayato no appāṭihāriyaṃ, karaṇīyo ovādo, karaṇīyā anusāsanī.
example_2: atha kho āyasmā rāhulo, ko n'ajja bhagavatā sammukhā ovādena ovadito gāmaṃ piṇḍāya pavisissatī'ti tato paṭinivattitvā aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle nisīdi
sbs_example_3: handa mayaṃ Buddhapacchima-ovāda bhaṇāmase
sbs_example_4: ettha dāni, māluṅkyaputta, kiṃ dahare bhikkhū vakkhāma yatra hi nāma tvaṃ, bhikkhu, jiṇṇo vuddho mah'allako addhagato vayoanuppatto saṃkhittena ovādaṃ yācasī'ti.

meaning_1: name and family name; name and family clan
example_1: agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajitvā jahanti purimāni nāmagottāni, samaṇā sakyaputtiyātv'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchanti, mahāsamuddo'tv'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchanti
example_2:
rūpaṃ jīrati maccānaṃ,
nāmagottaṃ na jīrati,
rāgo uppatho'ti vuccati,
lobho dhammānaṃ paripantho,
vayo rattin'divakkhayo.
sbs_example_3:
gaṅgā yamunā aciravatī sarabhū mahī,
tā mahāsamuddaṃ patvā jahanti purimāni nāmagottāni.
mahāsamuddo'tv'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchanti.

example_1:
dullabho puris'ājañño,
na so sabbattha jāyati,
yattha so jāyati dhīro,
taṃ kulaṃ sukham'edhati.
example_2:
sabbattha munī anissito,
na piyaṃ kubbati no'pi appiyaṃ,
tasmiṃ paridevamaccharaṃ,
paṇṇe vāri yathā na limpati.
sbs_example_3:
et'ādisāni katvāna, sabbattha'm'aparājitā.
sabbattha sotthiṃ gacchanti, taṃ tesaṃ maṅgalam'uttaman'ti.
sbs_example_4:
sabbattha ve sappurisā cajanti, na kāmakāmā lapayanti santo,
sukhena phuṭṭhā atha vā dukhena, na ucc'āvacaṃ paṇḍitā dassayanti.

meaning_1: name of a city; capital of the Licchavis
example_1:
vesāliyaṃ vane viharantaṃ,
aggaṃ sattassa sambuddhaṃ,
kokanad'āham'asmi abhivande,
kokanadā pajjunnassa dhītā.
example_2: sace'pi me ayyaputtā vesāliṃ s'āhāraṃ dajjeyyātha n'eva dajjāhaṃ taṃ bhattan'ti
sbs_example_3: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṃ. atha kho mahāpajāpatī gotamī yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami

meaning_1: name of a city; modern Varanasi
example_1: ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ca sāriputto āyasmā ca mahākoṭṭhiko bārāṇasiyaṃ viharanti isipatane migadāye.
example_2: atīte bārāṇasiyaṃ brahmadatte rajjaṃ kārente bodhisatto kāsigāmake kumbhakārakule nibbattitvā kumbhakārakammaṃ katvā puttadāraṃ posesi.
sbs_example_3: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā bārāṇasiyaṃ viharati isipatane migadāye. tatra kho bhagavā pañcavaggiye bhikkhū āmantesi
sbs_chant_eng_3: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self

example_1:
mā-avoca pharusaṃ kañci,
vuttā paṭivadeyyu taṃ,
dukkhā hi sārambhakathā,
paṭidaṇḍā phuseyyu taṃ.
example_2: evaṃ vutte, āyasmā moḷiyaphagguno bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, ko nu kho, bhante, viññāṇ'āhāraṃ āhāretī'ti? no kallo pañho'ti bhagavā avoca, āhāretī'ti ahaṃ na vadāmi.
sbs_example_3: ekam'antaṃ ṭhitā kho sā mahāpajāpatī gotamī bhagavantaṃ etad'avoca
sbs_example_4: atha kho āyasmā ānando abhikkantāya rattiyā, nikkhante paṭhame yāme, uṭṭhāy'āsanā ek'aṃsaṃ uttar'āsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā ten'añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṃ etad'avoca
sbs_example_5: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi. sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekam’antaṃ nisīdi. ekam’antaṃ nisinno kho gaṇakamoggallāno brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ etad’avoca
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
anūpavādo anūpaghāto,
pātimokkhe ca saṃvaro,
mattaññutā ca bhattasmiṃ,
pantañ'ca sayan'āsanaṃ,
adhicitte ca āyogo,
etaṃ buddhāna sāsanaṃ.
example_2: daḷhe khīle vā thambhe vā'ti kho, bhikkhave, kāyagatāya satiyā etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. tasmā't'iha vo, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, kāyagatā no sati bhāvitā bhavissati bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā'ti.
sbs_example_3: ek'aṃsena, gotami, dhāreyyāsi, eso dhammo, eso vinayo, etaṃ satthusāsanan'ti
sbs_example_4:
asevanā ca bālānaṃ, paṇḍitānañ'ca sevanā.
pūjā ca pūjanīyānaṃ, etaṃ maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: kati pan'āvuso, paccayā adukkham'asukhāya cetovimuttiyā samāpattiyā'ti? cattāro kho, āvuso, paccayā adukkham'asukhāya cetovimuttiyā samāpattiyā.
example_2: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, yv'āyaṃ jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo ca hoti samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo ca ayaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ jhāyīnaṃ aggo ca seṭṭho ca mokkho ca uttamo ca pavaro cā'ti.
sbs_example_3: dve kho, āvuso, paccayā animittāya cetovimuttiyā samāpattiyā, sabbanimittānañ'ca amanasikāro, animittāya ca dhātuyā manasikāro.
sbs_example_4: iti kho, bhikkhave, yāvatā saññāsamāpatti tāvatā aññāpaṭivedho

meaning_1: mental liberation; emancipation of heart; (comm) samadhi obtained from fruition
commentary:
(ANa) rāgavirāgā cetovimuttī'ti rāgassa khayavirāgena cetovimutti nāma hoti. phalasamādhiss'etaṃ nāmaṃ.
(DNa) akuppā cetovimuttī'ti arahattaphalavimutti.
example_1: akuppā cetovimutti etadattham'idaṃ brāhmaṇa brahmacariyaṃ
example_2: khattiyakulā ce'pi agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti. so ca āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭh'eva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati. āsavānaṃ khayā samaṇo hoti.
sbs_example_3: dve kho, āvuso, paccayā animittāya cetovimuttiyā samāpattiyā, sabbanimittānañ'ca amanasikāro, animittāya ca dhātuyā manasikāro.

example_2: addasā kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ mahāmoggallānaṃ avidūre nisinnaṃ pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya kāyagatāya satiyā ajjhattaṃ sūpaṭṭhitāya.

example_1:

example_1:
kena'ssu nivuto loko,
kena'ssu nappakāsati,

meaning_1: called; means; by the name of; namely; lit. name

meaning_1: foot of a tree; base of a tree
example_1: etāni, bhikkhu, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññ'āgārāni. jhāyatha, bhikkhu, mā pamād'attha, mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. ayaṃ vo amhākaṃ anusāsanī'ti.

araññe rukkhamūle vā,

meaning_1: hands in reverential salutation towards someone

meaning_1: drives out; dispels; gets rid of; subdues
example_1: pañc'ime, bhikkhave, ānisaṃsā yāguyā. katame pañca? khuddaṃ paṭihanati, pipāsaṃ paṭivineti, vātaṃ anulometi, vatthiṃ sodheti, ām'āvasesaṃ pāceti. ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca ānisaṃsā yāguyā'ti.
example_2: nava'y'ime, bhikkhave, āghātapaṭivinayā. katame nava? anatthaṃ me acari, taṃ kut'ettha labbhā'ti āghātaṃ paṭivineti.

meaning_1: effort; energy; might; power; lit. virility
example_1:

ātāpino saṃvegino bhavātha,
saddhāya sīlena ca vīriyena ca,

meaning_1: here; in this place; in this case; in this regard

notes: Indic Languages in Brill's Encyclopedia of Buddhism: "Similarly, the correct derivation and original meaning of the legal technical term pārājika based on the Vedic verb parā + aj-, "to drive away," probably originally belonging to the vocabulary of cattle keepers and therefore unknown to the Buddhist tradition, which sought a connection to parā + ji-, "to defeat" (pārājika > pārājayika), were found out by one of the pioneers of Western Buddhist studies, E. Burnouf, as early as 1844 and confirmed again by H. Smith in 1966 (von Hinüber, 1988, 3)"

example_1: atha kho kokanadā pajjunnassa dhītā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ mahāvanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhāsi.
example_2:
idh'āgamā vijjupabhāsavaṇṇā,
kokanadā pajjunnassa dhītā,
buddhañ'ca dhammañ'ca namassamānā,
gāthā'c'imā atthavatī abhāsi.

meaning_1: for this reason; lit. having made cause

example_1: yo pana bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre jānaṃ pubb'upagataṃ bhikkhuṃ anupakhajja seyyaṃ kappeyya yassa sambādho bhavissati, so pakkamissatī'ti etadeva paccayaṃ karitvā anaññaṃ, pācittiyaṃ.
example_2: gacch'āvuso, na me tayā saddhiṃ kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hoti, ekakassa me kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hotī'ti etadeva paccayaṃ karitvā anaññaṃ, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: (vinaya) expelled; excommunicated; unaffiliated; not part of the community; lit. not co-resident
commentary: (VIN 1.1.4) asaṃvāso'ti saṃvāso nāma ekakammaṃ ek'uddeso samasikkhatā, eso saṃvāso nāma. so tena saddhiṃ n'atthi. tena vuccati, asaṃvāso'ti.
example_1: yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno sikkhaṃ appaccakkhāya dubbalyaṃ anāvikatvā methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭiseveyya, antamaso tiracchānagatāya'pi, pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.

meaning_1: non-attention; ignoring; lit. not making in mind
example_1: kati pan'āvuso, paccayā animittāya cetovimuttiyā samāpattiyā'ti? dve kho, āvuso, paccayā animittāya cetovimuttiyā samāpattiyā, sabbanimittānañ'ca amanasikāro, animittāya ca dhātuyā manasikāro.
example_2: idha mayaṃ, bhante, yāva'd'eva ākaṅkhāma sabbaso rūpasaññānaṃ samatikkamā paṭighasaññānaṃ atthaṅ'gamā nānattasaññānaṃ amanasikārā, ananto ākāso'ti ākās'ānañc'āyatanaṃ upasampajja viharāma

meaning_1: covetousness and discontent; wanting and disliking; craving and aversion
commentary: (NP) ātāpī'ti vīriy'indriyaṃ, sampajāno'ti paññ'indriyaṃ, satimā'ti sat'indriyaṃ, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassan'ti samādh'indriyaṃ, evaṃ kāye kāyānupassino viharato cattāro satipaṭṭhānā bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchanti. kena kāraṇena, ekalakkhaṇattā catunnaṃ indriyānaṃ.
example_1: yatv'ādhikaraṇam'enaṃ cakkhu'ndriyaṃ asaṃvutaṃ viharantaṃ abhijjhādomanassā pāpakā akusalā dhammā anvāssaveyyuṃ
example_2: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco bālo abyatto akusalo bhikkhu kāye kāy'ānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.

meaning_1: not used up; not exhausted; not consumed; not run out
example_1: ayaṃ me mātā, tassā me mātu ayaṃ mātā'ti, apariyādinnā'va bhikkhave, tassa purisassa mātumātaro assu, atha imasmiṃ jambudīpe tiṇakaṭṭhasākhāpalāsaṃ parikkhayaṃ pariyādānaṃ gaccheyya.

meaning_1: big; great; large; grand; vast; extensive

example_1:

example_1: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sīlesu paripūrakārī hoti samādhismiṃ paripūrakārī paññāya paripūrakārī. so yāni tāni khudd'ānukhuddakāni sikkhāpadāni tāni āpajjati'pi vuṭṭhāti'pi.
example_2: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sīlavā hoti, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu.

example_2: yadā kho, āvuso, imaṃ kāyaṃ tayo dhammā jahanti, āyu usmā ca viññāṇaṃ, ath'āyaṃ kāyo ujjhito avakkhitto seti, yathā kaṭṭhaṃ acetanan'ti.
sbs_example_3: yā tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ tamhi tamhi sattanikāye jarā jīraṇatā khaṇḍiccaṃ pāliccaṃ valittacatā āyuno saṃhāni indriyānaṃ paripāko, ayaṃ vuccati jarā.
sbs_example_4:

example_1:
evam'etaṃ mahāvīra,
yathā samaṇa bhāsasi,
ettha ca-eke visīdanti,
paṅkamhi'va jaraggavo.
example_2:
na hi verena verāni,
sammant'īdha kudācanaṃ,
averena ca sammanti,
esa dhammo sanantano.
sbs_example_3: yato ca kho me, bhikkhave, imesu catūsu ariyasaccesu evaṃ tiparivaṭṭaṃ dvādas'ākāraṃ yathābhūtaṃ ñāṇadassanaṃ suvisuddhaṃ ahosi
sbs_chant_eng_3: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_4: so paṭisaṃharati ce'va na ca vitakketi na ca vicāreti. avitakko'mhi avicāro, ajjhattaṃ satimā sukham'asmī'ti pajānāti.
sbs_example_5: yasmā ca kho, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ anattā, tasmā rūpaṃ ābādhāya saṃvattati, na ca labbhati rūpe, evaṃ me rūpaṃ hotu, evaṃ me rūpaṃ mā ahosī''ti.

example_1: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, brāhmaṇa, idha puriso āgaccheyya rājagahaṃ gantu'kāmo. so taṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya, icchām'ahaṃ, bhante, rājagahaṃ gantuṃ, tassa me rājagahassa maggaṃ upadisā'ti.
example_2: gilānā nāma bhikkhunī na sakkoti ovādāya vā saṃvāsāya vā gantuṃ.
sbs_example_3: yathārūpaṃ parisaṃ alaṃ yojanagaṇanāni'pi dassanāya gantuṃ api puṭ'aṃsenā'pi, tathārūpo ayaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhusaṅgho.

meaning_1: multitude; many people; mass of people
example_1: atha kho sabhiyo paribbājako tassā devatāya santike te pañhe uggahetvā ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā saṅghino gaṇino gaṇ'ācariyā ñātā yasassino titthakarā sādhusammatā bahujanassa ... te upasaṅkamitvā te pañhe pucchati.
example_2: yā sā vācā n'elā kaṇṇasukhā pemanīyā hadayaṅ'gamā porī bahujanakantā bahujanamanāpā tathārūpiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti.
sbs_example_3: yatha'y'idaṃ brahmacariyaṃ addhaniyaṃ assa ciraṭṭhitikaṃ, tadassa bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lok'ānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṃ

meaning_1: beneficial (for); advantageous (for); lit. for the benefit
example_1: ta'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, hoti bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya, bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan'ti.
example_2: ye te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū suggahitehi suttantehi (na) byañjanappatirūpakehi atthañ'ca dhammañ'ca anulomenti te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bahujanahitāya paṭipannā bahujanasukhāya, bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṃ.
sbs_example_3: yaṃ, bhikkhave, na tumhākaṃ, taṃ pajahatha. taṃ vo pahīnaṃ hitāya sukhāya bhavissati.

example_1: so sabbaso rāg'ānusayaṃ pahāya paṭigh'ānusayaṃ paṭivinodetvā asmī'ti diṭṭhimān'ānusayaṃ samūhanitvā avijjaṃ pahāya vijjaṃ uppādetvā diṭṭh'eva dhamme dukkhass'antakaro hoti
example_2:

tāsaṃ vinayā sadā sato sikkhe.

sbs_chant_eng_3: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_4: ādīnavā ālasy'ānuyoge. atisītan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atiuṇhan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atisāyan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atipāto'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atichāto-asmī'ti kammaṃ na karoti
sbs_example_5: eta'r'ahi vā paccuppannam'addhānaṃ ajjhattaṃ kathaṃkathī hoti, ahaṃ nu kho'smi? no nu kho'smi? kiṃ nu kho'smi? kathaṃ nu kho'smi? ayaṃ nu kho satto kuto āgato? so kuhiṃ gāmī bhavissatī'ti?

meaning_1: (adds a question mark) surely?; didn’t?; wouldn't?; which?

bālo ca paṇḍitamānī,
sa ve bālo'ti vuccati.

sbs_example_5: vuccati cittaṃ iti'pi, mano iti'pi, viññāṇaṃ iti'pi, taṃ rattiyā ca divasassa ca aññadeva uppajjati aññaṃ nirujjhati.
