example_1: imāni cattāri ariyasaccānī'ti, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṃkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhī'ti. iti yaṃ taṃ vuttaṃ idam'etaṃ paṭicca vuttan'ti.
example_2: katamo c'āvuso, rūp'upādānakkhandho? cattāri ca mahābhūtāni, catunnañ'ca mahābhūtānaṃ upādāya rūpaṃ.
sbs_example_3: yad'idaṃ cattāri purisayugāni aṭṭha purisapuggalā esa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa
sbs_example_4:
yesaṃ cattāri piyāni, cattāri tesaṃ dukkhāni,
yesaṃ tīṇi piyāni, tīṇi tesaṃ dukkhāni,
yesaṃ dve piyāni, dve tesaṃ dukkhāni
sbs_example_5: cattār'imāni, bhikkhave, pañhavyākaraṇāni. katamāni cattāri? atthi, bhikkhave, pañho ek'aṃsavyākaraṇīyo, atthi, bhikkhave, pañho vibhajjavyākaraṇīyo
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: imāni cattāri ariyasaccānī'ti, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṃkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhī'ti. iti yaṃ taṃ vuttaṃ idam'etaṃ paṭicca vuttan'ti.
example_2: purimen'ev'āhaṃ, bhante, opammena bhagavato attamano abhiraddho. api c'āhaṃ imāni bhagavato vicitrāni pañhapaṭibhānāni sotu'kāmo, ev'āhaṃ bhagavantaṃ paccanīkaṃ kātabbaṃ amaññissaṃ
sbs_example_3: tīṇiimāni, bhikkhave, nidānāni kammānaṃ samudayāya. katamāni tīṇi?
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
pallaṅkena nisinnassa,
jaṇṇuke n'ābhivassati,
alaṃ phāsuvihārāya,
pahit'attassa bhikkhuno.
example_2: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu gacchanto vā gacchāmī'ti pajānāti ṭhito vā ṭhito'mhī'ti pajānāti nisinno vā nisinno'mhī'ti pajānāti sayāno vā sayāno'mhī'ti pajānāti
sbs_example_3:
tiṭṭhañ'caraṃ, nisinno vā, sayāno vā, yāvat'assa vigatamiddho,
etaṃ satiṃ adhiṭṭheyya, brahmam'etaṃ vihāraṃ idha'm'āhu.
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi puriso odātena vatthena sasīsaṃ pārupetvā nisinno assa, n'āssa kiñci sabbāvato kāyassa odātena vatthena apphuṭaṃ assa.
sbs_example_5: chand'āharaṇa-pārisuddhiāharaṇāni, pana imissaṃ sīmāyaṃ hatthapāsaṃ vijahitvā nisinnānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ abhāvato n'atthi.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: meditation; mental development; higher consciousness; lit. higher mind
example_1:
anūpavādo anūpaghāto,
pātimokkhe ca saṃvaro,
mattaññutā ca bhattasmiṃ,
pantañ'ca sayan'āsanaṃ,
adhicitte ca āyogo,
etaṃ buddhāna sāsanaṃ.
example_2: adhicittam'anuyuttena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā pañca nimittāni kālena kālaṃ manasi kātabbāni. katamāni pañca?
sbs_example_3: tisso imā, bhikkhave, sikkhā yatth'etaṃ sabbaṃ samodhānaṃ gacchati. katamā tisso? adhisīlasikkhā, adhicittasikkhā, adhipaññāsikkhā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: tassa evaṃ yoniso manasikaroto tīṇi saṃyojanāni pahīyanti, sakkāyadiṭṭhi, vicikicchā, sīlabbataparāmāso. ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, āsavā dassanā pahātabbā
example_2: tīṇ'imāni, bhikkhave, kathāvatthūni. katamāni tīṇi?
sbs_example_3: tattha purimesu catūsu kiccesu idāni suriy'ālokassa atthitāya n'atthi, aparāni tīṇi bhikkhūnaṃ vattaṃ jānantehi bhikkhūhi katāni pariniṭṭhitāni honti.
sbs_example_4: tīṇ'imāni, bhikkhave, nidānāni kammānaṃ samudayāya. katamāni tīṇi?
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: to; in the presence (of); near (to); nearby; close (to); on the verge (of); lit. near
example_1:
satañ'ca vivaṭaṃ hoti,
āloko passatām'iva,
santike na vijānanti,
magā dhammass'akovidā.
example_2:
n'atthi jhānaṃ apaññassa,
paññā n'atthi ajhāyato,
yamhi jhānañ'ca paññā ca,
sa ve nibbānasantike.
sbs_example_3: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, yaṃ kiñci rūpaṃ atīt'ānāgatapaccuppannaṃ ajjhattaṃ vā bahiddhā vā oḷārikaṃ vā sukhumaṃ vā hīnaṃ vā paṇītaṃ vā yaṃ dūre santike vā
sbs_chant_eng_3: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_4: dūrato'pi kho mayaṃ, āvuso, āgaccheyyāma āyasmato sāriputtassa santike etassa bhāsitassa attham'aññātuṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: existence or non-existence; being and non-being; any state of existence; (comm) repeated existence
commentary: (SNPa) bhav'ābhavesū'ti kāmabhav'ādīsu. atha vā bhav'ābhavesū'ti bhavabhavesu, punappunabhavesū'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
example_1:
yass'ūbhay'ante paṇidh'īdha n'atthi,
bhav'ābhavāya idha vā huraṃ vā,
nivesanā tassa na santi keci,
dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītaṃ.
example_2:
vidvā ca yo vedagū naro idha,
bhav'ābhave saṅgamimaṃ visajja,
so vītataṇho anīgho nirāso,
atāri so jātijaranti brūmī'ti.
sbs_example_3:
tasmā hi paññā'va dhanena seyyā, yāya vosānam'idh'ādhigacchati.
abyositattā hi bhav'ābhavesu, pāpāni kammāni karoti mohā.
sbs_example_4: sūrakathaṃ visikhākathaṃ kumbhaṭṭhānakathaṃ pubbapetakathaṃ nānattakathaṃ lok'akkhāyikaṃ samudd'akkhāyikaṃ itibhav'ābhavakathaṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: by whichever; by which; with which
example_1:
yāya devā manussā ca,
sitā tiṭṭhanti atthikā,
tarath'etaṃ visattikaṃ,
khaṇo vo mā upaccagā,
khaṇ'ātītā hi socanti,
nirayamhi samappitā.
example_2:
yāya mātu bhato poso,
imaṃ lokaṃ avekkhati,
tam'pi pāṇadadiṃ santiṃ,
hanti kuddho puthujjano.
sbs_example_3:
tasmā hi paññā'va dhanena seyyā, yāya vosānam'idh'ādhigacchati.
abyositattā hi bhav'ābhavesu, pāpāni kammāni karoti mohā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
vāṇijo'va bhayaṃ maggaṃ,
appasattho mahaddhano,
visaṃ jīvitu'kāmo'va,
pāpāni parivajjaye.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso araññe pavane caramāno passeyya purāṇaṃ maggaṃ purāṇ'añjasaṃ pubbakehi manussehi anuyātaṃ.
sbs_example_3: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, brāhmaṇa, idha puriso āgaccheyya rājagahaṃ gantu'kāmo. so taṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya, icchām'ahaṃ, bhante, rājagahaṃ gantuṃ, tassa me rājagahassa maggaṃ upadisā'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: attā me uppajjati ca veti cā'ti icc'assa evam'āgataṃ hoti. tasmā taṃ na upapajjati, cakkhu attā'ti yo vadeyya. iti cakkhu anattā.
example_2: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya, sammukhā m'etaṃ, āvuso, bhagavato sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ, ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanan'ti.
sbs_example_3: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, brāhmaṇa, idha puriso āgaccheyya rājagahaṃ gantu'kāmo. so taṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya, icchām'ahaṃ, bhante, rājagahaṃ gantuṃ, tassa me rājagahassa maggaṃ upadisā'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: sense; mental faculty; power; lit. belonging to Inda
example_1:
subh'ānupassiṃ viharantaṃ,
indriyesu asaṃvutaṃ,
bhojanamhi c'āmattaññuṃ,
kusītaṃ hīnavīriyaṃ,
taṃ ve pasahati māro,
vāto rukkhaṃ'va dubbalaṃ.
example_2: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, indriyesu guttadvārā viharatha.
sbs_example_3: tam'enaṃ tathāgato uttariṃ vineti, ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, indriyesu guttadvāro hohi, cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā mā nimittaggāhī hohi m'ānubyañjanaggāhī
sbs_example_4: yā tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ tamhi tamhi sattanikāye jarā jīraṇatā khaṇḍiccaṃ pāliccaṃ valittacatā āyuno saṃhāni indriyānaṃ paripāko, ayaṃ vuccati jarā.
sbs_example_5:
santussako ca subharo ca, appakicco ca sallahukavutti,
sant'indriyo ca nipako ca, appagabbho kulesu ananugiddho.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: source; origin; foundation; cause; reason; lit. tying down
example_1: yaṃ papañceti tatonidānaṃ purisaṃ papañcasaññāsaṅkhā samudācaranti atītānāgatapaccuppannesu cakkhuviññeyyesu rūpesu
example_2: atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi, anujānāmi, bhikkhave, chattapāṇissa gilānassa dhammaṃ desetuṃ.
sbs_example_3: so tatonidānaṃ labhetha pāmojjaṃ, adhigaccheyya somanassaṃ
sbs_example_4: tīṇ'imāni, bhikkhave, nidānāni kammānaṃ samudayāya. katamāni tīṇi?
sbs_example_5: kāmā veditabbā, kāmānaṃ nidānasambhavo veditabbo, kāmānaṃ vemattatā veditabbā, kāmānaṃ vipāko veditabbo, kāmanirodho veditabbo, kāmanirodhagāminī paṭipadā veditabbā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary:
(SNa) samāhito'ti upacārena vā appanāya vā samāhito.
(ANa) samāhitassā'ti ekaggacittassa.
(THa) samāhitan'ti aṭṭhavidhena samādhinā maggaphalasamādhinā ca samāhitaṃ.
example_1:
bāhitvā sabbapāpakāni,
vimalo sādhusamāhito ṭhit'atto,
saṃsāram'aticca kevalī so,
asito tādi pavuccate sa brahmā.
example_2: samāhitassa-ayaṃ dhammo, n'āyaṃ dhammo asamāhitassa
sbs_example_3: so evaṃ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigat'ūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte pubbenivās'ānussatiñāṇāya cittaṃ abhininnāmeti.
sbs_example_4: āraddhaṃ hoti vīriyaṃ asallīnaṃ, upaṭṭhitā sati asammuṭṭhā, passaddho kāyo asāraddho, samāhitaṃ cittaṃ ek'aggaṃ.
sbs_example_5:
khayaṃ virāgaṃ amataṃ paṇītaṃ,
yad'ajjhagā sakyamunī samāhito.
na tena dhammena sam'atthi kiñci
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (DNa) dakkho'ti cheko paṭibalo nhānīyacuṇṇāni kātuñ'c'eva payojetuñ'ca sannetuñ'ca.
example_1: idha, visākhe, mātugāmo ye te bhattu abbhantarā kamm'antā, uṇṇā'ti vā kappāsā'ti vā, tattha dakkhā hoti analasā tatr'upāyāya vīmaṃsāya samannāgatā alaṃ kātuṃ alaṃ saṃvidhātuṃ.
example_2: seyyathā'pi bhikkhave dakkho nhāpako vā nhāpak'antevāsī vā kaṃsathāle nhānīyacuṇṇāni ākiritvā udakena paripphosakaṃ paripphosakaṃ sanneyya
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi dakkho goghātako vā goghātak'antevāsī vā gāviṃ vadhitvā catumahāpathe bilaso vibhajitvā nisinno assa.
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi dakkho bhamakāro vā bhamakār'antevāsī vā dīghaṃ vā añchanto dīghaṃ añchāmī'ti pajānāti, rassaṃ vā añchanto rassaṃ añchāmī'ti pajānāti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
dukkhaṃ dukkhasamuppādaṃ,
dukkhassa ca atikkamaṃ,
ariyaṃ c'aṭṭh'aṅgikaṃ maggaṃ,
dukkh'ūpasamagāminaṃ.
example_2:
maggāna-aṭṭh'aṅgiko seṭṭho,
saccānaṃ caturo padā,
virāgo seṭṭho dhammānaṃ,
dvipadānañ'ca cakkhumā.
sbs_example_3: seyyath'īdaṃ, cattāro satipaṭṭhānā cattāro sammappadhānā cattāro iddhipādā pañc'indriyāni pañca balāni satta bojjh'aṅgā ariyo aṭṭh'aṅgiko maggo.
sbs_example_4: ayam'eva ariyo aṭṭh'aṅgiko maggo seyyath'īdaṃ sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākamm'anto sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati sammāsamādhi.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: basis for success; road to power; basis for spiritual power; lit. basis for success
example_1:
cittasmiṃ vasībhūt'āmhi,
iddhipādā subhāvitā,
sabbabandhanamutt'āmhi,
na taṃ bhāyāmi āvuso'ti.
example_2: yassa kassaci, ānanda, cattāro iddhipādā bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā so ākaṅkhamāno kappaṃ vā tiṭṭheyya kappāvasesaṃ vā
sbs_example_3: seyyath'īdaṃ, cattāro satipaṭṭhānā cattāro sammappadhānā cattāro iddhipādā pañc'indriyāni pañca balāni satta bojjh'aṅgā ariyo aṭṭh'aṅgiko maggo.
sbs_example_4: bhāvitattā catunnaṃ satipaṭṭhānānaṃ, bhāvitattā catunnaṃ sammappadhānānaṃ, bhāvitattā catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ, bhāvitattā pañcannaṃ indriyānaṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: measure; measurement; length; size; amount; quantity; lit. measuring
example_1: saññācikāya pana bhikkhunā kuṭiṃ kārayamānena assāmikaṃ att'uddesaṃ pamāṇikā kāretabbā, tatr'idaṃ pamāṇaṃ, dīghaso dvādasa vidatthiyo sugatavidatthiyā, tiriyaṃ satt'antarā
example_2: katamo c'āvuso, pariyāyo yaṃ pariyāyaṃ āgamma ime dhammā ek'atthā byañjanam'eva nānaṃ? rāgo kho, āvuso, pamāṇakaraṇo, doso pamāṇakaraṇo, moho pamāṇakaraṇo.
sbs_example_3: sārambhe ce bhikkhu vatthusmiṃ aparikkamane saññācikāya kuṭiṃ kāreyya bhikkhū vā anabhineyya vatthudesanāya pamāṇaṃ vā atikkāmeyya, saṅghādiseso.
sbs_example_4: jātito'pi anussarati, nāmato'pi anussarati, gottato'pi anussarati, āyuppamāṇato'pi anussarati, sāvakayugato'pi anussarati, sāvakasannipātato'pi anussarati
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (VIN 1.2.6) kuṭi nāma ullittā vā hoti avalittā vā ullitt'āvalittā vā.
example_1:
sare hatthehi bhañjitvā,
katvāna kuṭim'acchisaṃ,
tena me sarabhaṅgo'ti,
nāmaṃ sammutiyā ahu.
example_2:
pakk'odano duddhakhīro'ham'asmi,
anutīre mahiyā samānavāso,
channā kuṭi āhito gini,
atha ce patthayasī pavassa deva.
sbs_example_3: sārambhe ce bhikkhu vatthusmiṃ aparikkamane saññācikāya kuṭiṃ kāreyya bhikkhū vā anabhineyya vatthudesanāya pamāṇaṃ vā atikkāmeyya, saṅghādiseso.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: designating the site; appointing the place
commentary: (VINa) bhikkhū abhinetabbā vatthudesanāyā'ti yasmiṃ ṭhāne kuṭiṃ kāretu'kāmo hoti, tattha vatthudesan'atthāya bhikkhū netabbā.
example_1: bhikkhū abhinetabbā vatthudesanāya, tehi bhikkhūhi vatthu desetabbaṃ anārambhaṃ saparikkamanaṃ.
example_2: mahallakaṃ pana bhikkhunā vihāraṃ kārayamānena sassāmikaṃ att'uddesaṃ bhikkhū abhinetabbā vatthudesanāya, tehi bhikkhūhi vatthu desetabbaṃ anārambhaṃ saparikkamanaṃ.
sbs_example_3: sārambhe ce bhikkhu vatthusmiṃ aparikkamane saññācikāya kuṭiṃ kāreyya bhikkhū vā anabhineyya vatthudesanāya pamāṇaṃ vā atikkāmeyya, saṅghādiseso.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
supupphit'aggaṃ upagamma bhikkhuni,
ekā tuvaṃ tiṭṭhasi sālamūle,
na c'atthi te dutiyā vaṇṇadhātu,
bāle na tvaṃ bhāyasi dhuttakānan'ti.
example_2: so eko gāmaṃ piṇḍāya pavisati eko paṭikkamati eko raho nisīdati eko caṅkamaṃ adhiṭṭhāti.
sbs_example_3: sādhu me bhagavā saṃkhittena dhammaṃ desetu, yam'ahaṃ bhagavato dhammaṃ sutvā ekā vūpakaṭṭhā appamattā ātāpinī pahit'attā vihareyyan'ti
sbs_example_4:
eko ahaṃ sakka mahantam'oghaṃ,
anissito no visahāmi tārituṃ,
ārammaṇaṃ brūhi samantacakkhu,
yaṃ nissito ogham'imaṃ tareyyaṃ.
sbs_example_5:
eko pubbe caritvāna, methunaṃ yo nisevati,
yānaṃ bhantaṃ va taṃ loke, hīnam'āhu puthujjanaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: gradual progress; step-by-step path of practice
commentary: (UDa) tattha anupubbasikkhāya tisso bhikkhā gahitā, anupubbakiriyāya terasa dhut'aṅgadhammā, anupubbapaṭipadāya satta anupassanā aṭṭhārasa mahāvipassanā aṭṭhatiṃsa ārammaṇavibhattiyo sattatiṃsa bodhipakkhiyadhammā ca gahitā.
example_1: seyyathā'pi, bho gotama, imassa migāramātupāsādassa dissati anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā yadidaṃ, yāva pacchimasopānakaḷevarā.
example_2: evam'evaṃ kho pahārāda imasmiṃ dhammavinaye anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā na āyataken'eva aññāpaṭivedho
sbs_example_3: sakkā nu kho, bho gotama, imasmim'pi dhammavinaye evam'eva anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā paññapetun'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: gradual undertaking; step-by-step activity; successive process
commentary: (UDa) tattha anupubbasikkhāya tisso bhikkhā gahitā, anupubbakiriyāya terasa dhut'aṅgadhammā, anupubbapaṭipadāya satta anupassanā aṭṭhārasa mahāvipassanā aṭṭhatiṃsa ārammaṇavibhattiyo sattatiṃsa bodhipakkhiyadhammā ca gahitā.

example_2: evam'evaṃ kho pahārāda imasmiṃ dhammavinaye anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā na āyataken'eva aññāpaṭivedho
sbs_example_3: sakkā nu kho, bho gotama, imasmim'pi dhammavinaye evam'eva anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā paññapetun'ti

meaning_1: similarly; in the same way; so too; just so
example_1: atītam'p'āhaṃ addhānaṃ evam'eva rūpena khajjiṃ, seyyathā'pi eta'r'ahi paccuppannena rūpena khajjāmi
example_2: evam'eva kho, poṭṭhapāda, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, ek'antasukhī attā hoti arogo paraṃ maraṇā'ti.
sbs_example_3: sakkā nu kho, bho gotama, imasmim'pi dhammavinaye evam'eva anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā paññapetun'ti

meaning_1: teaching and training; doctrine and discipline
commentary: (SNa) imaṃ dhammavinayan'ti imaṃ dhammañ'ca vinayañ'ca. ubhayam'p'etaṃ sāsanass'eva nāmaṃ.
example_1: evam'evaṃ kho pahārāda imasmiṃ dhammavinaye anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā na āyataken'eva aññāpaṭivedho
example_2: evaṃ adhiccam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, yaṃ manussattaṃ labhati. evaṃ adhiccam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, yaṃ tathāgato loke uppajjati arahaṃ sammāsambuddho. evaṃ adhiccam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, yaṃ tathāgatappavedito dhammavinayo loke dibbati.
sbs_example_3: sakkā nu kho, bho gotama, imasmim'pi dhammavinaye evam'eva anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā paññapetun'ti
sbs_example_4:
yo imasmiṃ dhammavinaye, appamatto vihassati.
pahāya jātisaṃsāraṃ, dukkhass'antaṃ karissati.
sbs_example_5: ahaṃ kho, āvuso, navo acirapabbajito adhun'āgato imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ. na t'āhaṃ sakkomi vitthārena ācikkhituṃ.

example_1: atha kho pāyāsi rājañño uttaraṃ māṇavaṃ āmantāpetvā etadavoca, saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, tāta uttara, dānaṃ datvā evaṃ anuddisasi, imin'āhaṃ dānena pāyāsiṃ rājaññam'eva imasmiṃ loke samāgacchiṃ, mā parasmin'ti
example_2: sattaṭṭhānakusalo, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tividh'ūpaparikkhī imasmiṃ dhammavinaye kevalī vusitavā uttamapuriso'ti vuccati.
sbs_example_3: sakkā nu kho, bho gotama, imasmim'pi dhammavinaye evam'eva anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā paññapetun'ti
sbs_example_4: ayaṃ, bhikkhave, imasmiṃ dhammavinaye chaṭṭho acchariyo abbhuto dhammo, yaṃ disvā disvā bhikkhū imasmiṃ dhammavinaye abhiramanti.
sbs_example_5: bhikkhugaṇanā nāma imasmiṃ uposath'agge uposath'atthāya sannipatitā bhikkhū ettakā'ti, bhikkhūnaṃ gaṇanā.

meaning_1: (respectful address; especially between Brahmans) sir; sirs; master; masters; friend; friends; good man; good men
example_1: tam'enaṃ mahā janakāyo saṅgamma samāgamma āyāceyya thomeyya pañjaliko anuparisakkeyya, ummujja, bho puthusile, uplava, bho puthusile, thalam'uplava, bho puthusile'ti.
example_2: evaṃ vutte, ahaṃ, bhikkhave, bakaṃ brahmānaṃ etadavocaṃ, avijjāgato vata, bho, bako brahmā, avijjāgato vata, bho, bako brahmā. yatra hi nāma aniccaṃ'y'eva samānaṃ niccan'ti vakkhati
sbs_example_3: sakkā nu kho, bho gotama, imasmim'pi dhammavinaye evam'eva anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā paññapetun'ti
sbs_example_4:

mā taṃ lobho adhammo ca, ciraṃ dukkhāya randhayuṃ.

meaning_1: to define; to delineate; to describe; lit. to make known
example_1: sakkā nu kho, bho gotama, imasmim'pi dhammavinaye evam'eva anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā paññapetun'ti?
example_2: na kho, āvuso gotama, āciṇṇaṃ nigaṇṭhassa nāṭaputtassa kammaṃ, kamman'ti paññapetuṃ. daṇḍaṃ, daṇḍan'ti kho, āvuso gotama, āciṇṇaṃ nigaṇṭhassa nāṭaputtassa paññapetun'ti.

notes: turns any statement into a question
example_1: saṃvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no'ti?
example_2: katamo nu kho, āvuso, eko anto, katamo dutiyo anto, kiṃ majjhe, kā sibbinī'ti?
sbs_example_3: sakkā nu kho, bho gotama, imasmim'pi dhammavinaye evam'eva anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā paññapetun'ti
sbs_example_4: api nu tumhe, bhikkhave, evaṃ jānantā evaṃ passantā pubb'antaṃ vā paṭidhāveyyātha, ahesumha nu kho mayaṃ atītam'addhānaṃ, nanu kho ahesumha atītam'addhānaṃ, kiṃ nu kho ahesumha atītam'addhānaṃ
sbs_example_5: kacci nu kho me attā sīlato na upavadatī'ti, pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ.

example_1: taṃ kissa hetu? parisuddhattā, bhikkhave, vatthassa. evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, citte asaṃkiliṭṭhe, sugati pāṭikaṅkhā.
example_2: bhagavā pana, bhante, arahaṃ sammāsambuddho pahoti tathā kātuṃ yathā sabbo loko kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjeyyā'ti?
sbs_example_3: sace kho pana atthi paro loko, atthi sukatadukkaṭānaṃ kammānaṃ phalaṃ vipāko, ath'āhaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjissāmī'ti

example_1: kiñ'ca vedeti? sukham'pi vedeti, dukkham'pi vedeti, adukkham'asukham'pi vedeti. vedeti vedetī'ti kho, āvuso, tasmā vedanā'ti vuccatī'ti.
example_2: kiñ'ca, ānanda, suññaṃ attena vā attaniyena vā? cakkhu kho, ānanda, suññaṃ attena vā attaniyena vā. rūpā suññā attena vā attaniyena vā
sbs_example_3: sabbaṃ bhikkhave ādittaṃ! kiñ'ca bhikkhave sabbaṃ ādittaṃ?
sbs_example_4: yaṃ, bhikkhave, na tumhākaṃ, taṃ pajahatha. taṃ vo pahīnaṃ hitāya sukhāya bhavissati. kiñ'ca, bhikkhave, na tumhākaṃ?

meaning_1: which is impersonal; non-self; not subject to identification
example_1:
anattani attamāniṃ,
passa lokaṃ sadevakaṃ,
niviṭṭhaṃ nāmarūpasmiṃ,
idaṃ saccan'ti maññati.
example_2: rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, anattā vedanā anattā saññā anattā saṅkhārā anattā viññāṇaṃ anattā
sbs_example_3: rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, anattā. rūpañ'ca h'idaṃ, bhikkhave, attā abhavissa, na'y'idaṃ rūpaṃ ābādhāya saṃvatteyya, labbhetha ca rūpe, evaṃ me rūpaṃ hotu, evaṃ me rūpaṃ mā ahosī'ti.

example_1:
evam'pi viggayha vivādayanti,

example_2: imesaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, samaṇamalānaṃ samaṇadosānaṃ samaṇakasaṭānaṃ āpāyikānaṃ ṭhānānaṃ duggativedaniyānaṃ pahānā, samaṇasāmīcippaṭipadaṃ paṭipanno'ti vadāmi.
sbs_example_3: pisuṇaṃ vācaṃ pahāya pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, ito sutvā na amutra akkhātā imesaṃ bhedāya, amutra vā sutvā na imesaṃ akkhātā amūsaṃ bhedāya
sbs_example_4: evam'eva kho ahaṃ, bhante, imesaṃ ekādasannaṃ amatadvārānaṃ ekam'ekena'pi amatadvārena sakkuṇissāmi attānaṃ sotthiṃ kātuṃ.

example_2: so na labheyya sappāyāni bhojanāni, na labheyya sappāyāni bhesajjāni, na labheyya patirūpaṃ upaṭṭhākaṃ, na labheyya gām'antanāyakaṃ.

meaning_1: for crossing; for getting across; lit. for the sake of crossing
example_1: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, kull'ūpamaṃ vo, bhikkhave, dhammaṃ desessāmi nittharaṇ'atthāya, no gahaṇ'atthāya.
example_2: imaṃ ce tumhe, bhikkhave, diṭṭhiṃ evaṃ parisuddhaṃ evaṃ pariyodātaṃ allīyetha kelāyetha dhanāyetha mamāyetha, api nu me tumhe, bhikkhave, kull'ūpamaṃ dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājāneyyātha nittharaṇ'atthāya no gahaṇ'atthāyā'ti?
sbs_example_3: nanu te, bhikkhave, yāva'd'eva kantārassa nittharaṇ'atthāya āhāraṃ āhāreyyun'ti? evaṃ, bhante

sbs_example_5: vijjāvimuttim'p'āhaṃ sāhāraṃ vadāmi, no anāhāraṃ. ko c'āhāro vijjāvimuttiyā? satta bojjh'aṅgā'ti'ssa vacanīyaṃ.

example_1:

example_2: ekam'antaṃ nisinno kho saccako nigaṇṭhaputto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, yam'idaṃ, bho gotama, dāne puññañ'ca puññamahī ca taṃ dāyakānaṃ sukhāya hotū'ti.

meaning_1: wisdom; knowledge; understanding; insight; distinctive knowledge
example_1:

paññā me yuganaṅgalaṃ,
hirī īsā mano yottaṃ,
sati me phālapācanaṃ.
example_2:
n'atthi jhānaṃ apaññassa,

yamhi jhānañ'ca paññā ca,
sa ve nibbānasantike.
sbs_example_3: idaṃ dukkhaṃ ariyasaccan'ti me, bhikkhave, pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṃ udapādi, ñāṇaṃ udapādi, paññā udapādi, vijjā udapādi, āloko udapādi.

meaning_1: contact with the nose; olfactory impression

example_2: cakkhusamphasso... sotasamphasso... ghānasamphasso... jivhāsamphasso... kāyasamphasso... manosamphasso loke piyarūpaṃ sātarūpaṃ, etth'esā taṇhā uppajjamānā uppajjati, ettha nivisamānā nivisati

meaning_1: smelling; nose consciousness; olfactory awareness; lit. nose knowing
example_1: yo'pi hetu yo'pi paccayo ghānaviññāṇassa aññathābhāvi uppādāya, so'pi hetu so'pi paccayo anicco vipariṇāmi aññathābhāvi. aniccaṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, paccayaṃ paṭicca samuppannaṃ ghānaviññāṇaṃ kuto niccaṃ bhavissati.

example_2: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā aṅgesu viharati assapuraṃ nāma aṅgānaṃ nigamo.

sbs_example_4: āraddhaṃ kho pana me vīriyaṃ ahosi asallīnaṃ, upaṭṭhitā sati asammuṭṭhā, passaddho kāyo asāraddho, samāhitaṃ cittaṃ ek'aggaṃ.

meaning_1: like a boat; similar to a raft
example_1: kull'ūpamaṃ vo, bhikkhave, dhammaṃ desitaṃ, ājānantehi dhammā'pi vo pahātabbā pag'eva adhammā.
example_2: imaṃ ce tumhe, bhikkhave, diṭṭhiṃ evaṃ parisuddhaṃ evaṃ pariyodātaṃ allīyetha kelāyetha dhanāyetha mamāyetha, api nu me tumhe, bhikkhave, kull'ūpamaṃ dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājāneyyātha nittharaṇ'atthāya no gahaṇ'atthāyā'ti?
sbs_example_3: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, kull'ūpamo mayā dhammo desito nittharaṇ'atthāya, no gahaṇ'atthāya.

meaning_1: each and every person; every individual; lit. one one
example_1: atha kho āyasmā mahako āyasmantaṃ theraṃ etadavoca, sādhu khv'assa, bhante thera, sītako ca vāto vāyeyya, abbhasampilāpo ca assa, devo ca ekam'ekaṃ phusāyeyyā'ti.
example_2: abhijānāmi kho pan'āhaṃ, aggivessana, anekasatāya parisāya dhammaṃ desetā. apissu maṃ ekam'eko evaṃ maññati, mam'ev'ārabbha samaṇo gotamo dhammaṃ desetī'ti.
sbs_example_3: evam'eva kho ahaṃ, bhante, imesaṃ ekādasannaṃ amatadvārānaṃ ekam'ekena'pi amatadvārena sakkuṇissāmi attānaṃ sotthiṃ kātuṃ.
sbs_example_4: ekam'ekañ'ca bhikkhuṃ paccekaṃ dussayugena acchādesi

meaning_1: door to the deathless state; entrance to Nibbāna
example_1:
sabbaṃ lokaṃ abhiññāya,
sambuddhena pajānatā,
vivaṭaṃ amatadvāraṃ,
khemaṃ nibbānapattiyā.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhante ānanda, puriso ekaṃ'va nidhimukhaṃ gavesanto saki'd'eva ekādasa nidhimukhāni adhigaccheyya. evam'eva kho ahaṃ, bhante, ekaṃ amatadvāraṃ gavesanto saki'd'eva ekādasa amatadvārāni alatthaṃ bhāvanāya.
sbs_example_3: evam'eva kho ahaṃ, bhante, imesaṃ ekādasannaṃ amatadvārānaṃ ekam'ekena'pi amatadvārena sakkuṇissāmi attānaṃ sotthiṃ kātuṃ.

example_1: mettāya, bhikkhave, cetovimuttiyā āsevitāya bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya susamāraddhāya ekādasa-ānisaṃsā pāṭikaṅkhā.
example_2: ekādasahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato gopālako abhabbo gogaṇaṃ pariharituṃ phātiṃ kātuṃ. katamehi ekādasahi?
sbs_example_3: evam'eva kho ahaṃ, bhante, imesaṃ ekādasannaṃ amatadvārānaṃ ekam'ekena'pi amatadvārena sakkuṇissāmi attānaṃ sotthiṃ kātuṃ.

example_1: dūrato'pi kho mayaṃ, āvuso, āgaccheyyāma āyasmato sāriputtassa santike etassa bhāsitassa atthamaññātuṃ
example_2: bhagavaṃmūlakā no, bhante, dhammā bhagavaṃnettikā bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā. sādhu vata, bhante, bhagavantaṃ'y'eva paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho. bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī'ti.
sbs_example_3: evam'etassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa samudayo hoti.
sbs_example_4: na āsevitabbaṃ, na bhāvetabbaṃ, na bahulīkātabbaṃ, bhāyitabbaṃ etassa sukhassā'ti, vadāmi.

example_1:
uddhaṃ adho ca tiriyaṃ,
disā anudisā sv'ahaṃ,
anvesaṃ n'ādhigacchāmi,
godhiko so kuhiṃ gato'ti.
example_2:
patthayamānassa hi jappitāni,
pavedhitaṃ v'āpi pakappitesu,
cut'ūpapāto idha yassa n'atthi,
sa kena vedheyya kuhiṃ'va jappe.
sbs_example_3: eta'r'ahi vā paccuppannam'addhānaṃ ajjhattaṃ kathaṃkathī hoti, ahaṃ nu kho'smi? no nu kho'smi? kiṃ nu kho'smi? kathaṃ nu kho'smi? ayaṃ nu kho satto kuto āgato? so kuhiṃ gāmī bhavissatī'ti?

example_1: gacchati pana bhavaṃ gotamo bāhukaṃ nadiṃ sināyitun'ti? kiṃ, brāhmaṇa, bāhukāya nadiyā? kiṃ bāhukā nadī karissatī'ti?
example_2: sace, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā evaṃ puccheyyuṃ, kiṃmūlakā, āvuso, sabbe dhammā, kiṃsambhavā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamudayā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamosaraṇā sabbe dhammā
sbs_example_3: eta'r'ahi vā paccuppannam'addhānaṃ ajjhattaṃ kathaṃkathī hoti, ahaṃ nu kho'smi? no nu kho'smi? kiṃ nu kho'smi? kathaṃ nu kho'smi? ayaṃ nu kho satto kuto āgato? so kuhiṃ gāmī bhavissatī'ti?
sbs_example_4:
na muṇḍakena samaṇo, abbato alikaṃ bhaṇaṃ.
icchālobhasamāpanno, samaṇo kiṃ bhavissati.
sbs_example_5:
kiṃ te jaṭāhi dummedha, kiṃ te ajinasāṭiyā,
abbhantaraṃ te gahanaṃ, bāhiraṃ parimajjasī'ti.

commentary: (ITIa) anissitenā'ti taṇhādiṭṭhinissayavasena kañci dhammaṃ anissitena, rāgabandhanādīhi vā abandhena.
example_1: atthi kāyo'ti vā pan'assa sati paccupaṭṭhitā hoti yāva'd'eva ñāṇamattāya paṭissatimattāya anissito ca viharati na ca kiñci loke upādiyati
example_2:
duve imā cakkhumatā pakāsitā,
nibbānadhātū anissitena tādinā,
ekā hi dhātu idha diṭṭhadhammikā,
saupādisesā bhavanettisaṅkhayā,
anupādisesā pana samparāyikā,
yamhi nirujjhanti bhavāni sabbaso.
sbs_example_3:
eko ahaṃ sakka mahantam'oghaṃ,
anissito no visahāmi tārituṃ,
ārammaṇaṃ brūhi samantacakkhu,
yaṃ nissito ogham'imaṃ tareyyaṃ.
sbs_example_4:
yass'āsavā parikkhīṇā, āhāre ca anissito,
suññato animitto ca, vimokkho yassa gocaro,
ākāse va sakuntānaṃ, padaṃ tassa durannayaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
tasmā jantu sadā sato,
kāmāni parivajjaye,
te pahāya tare oghaṃ,
nāvaṃ sitvā'va pāragū'ti.
example_2:
ākiñcaññaṃ pekkhamāno satimā,
n'atthī'ti nissāya tarassu oghaṃ,
kāme pahāya virato kathāhi,
taṇhakkhayaṃ nattam'ah'ābhipassa.
sbs_example_3:
eko ahaṃ sakka mahantam'oghaṃ,
anissito no visahāmi tārituṃ,
ārammaṇaṃ brūhi samantacakkhu,
yaṃ nissito ogham'imaṃ tareyyaṃ.
sbs_example_4:
uṭṭhānen'appamādena, saṃyamena damena ca,
dīpaṃ kayirātha medhāvī, yaṃ ogho n'ābhikīrati.
sbs_example_5:
pupphāni h'eva pacinantaṃ, byāsattamanasaṃ naraṃ,
suttaṃ gāmaṃ mah'ogho'va, maccu ādāya gacchati.

example_1: cattār'imāni, bhikkhave, bhayāni udak'orohantassa pāṭikaṅkhitabbāni. katamāni cattāri? ūmibhayaṃ, kumbhīlabhayaṃ, āvaṭṭabhayaṃ, susukābhayaṃ
example_2:
pañcannaṃ dhīro bhayānaṃ na bhāye,
bhikkhu sato sapariyantacārī,
ḍaṃs'ādhipātānaṃ sarīsapānaṃ,
manussaphassānaṃ catuppadānaṃ.
sbs_example_3: ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, sīlavā hohi, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharāhi ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhassu sikkhāpadesū'ti
sbs_example_4: rattiṃ ce'pi naṃ, bhikkhave, anuvitakkeyyaṃ anuvicāreyyaṃ, n'eva tatonidānaṃ bhayaṃ samanupassāmi.

meaning_1: possessing; endowed (with); having; lit. going together
example_1: nibbānapoṇañ'ca me mānasaṃ bhavissati, saṃyojanā ca me pahānaṃ gacchissanti, paramena ca sāmaññena samannāgato bhavissāmī'ti.
example_2: imehi kho, bhikkhave, dasahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu samantapāsādiko ca hoti sabb'ākāraparipūro cā'ti.
sbs_example_3: ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, satisampajaññena samannāgato hohi, abhikkante paṭikkante sampajānakārī, ālokite vilokite sampajānakārī, samiñjite pasārite sampajānakārī, saṅghāṭipattacīvaradhāraṇe sampajānakārī
sbs_example_4: tattha dakkhā hoti analasā tatr'upāyāya vīmaṃsāya samannāgatā alaṃ kātuṃ alaṃ saṃvidhātuṃ.
sbs_example_5: aññatar'aññatarena byasanena samannāgatassa, aññatar'aññatarena dukkhadhammena phuṭṭhassa, soko, socanā, socitattaṃ, antosoko antoparisoko

example_1: mandattā momūhattā paraṃ pañhaṃ pucchati, pāpiccho icchāpakato paraṃ pañhaṃ pucchati, paribhavaṃ paraṃ pañhaṃ pucchati, aññātu'kāmo paraṃ pañhaṃ pucchati
example_2: dūrato'pi kho mayaṃ, āvuso, āgaccheyyāma āyasmato sāriputtassa santike etassa bhāsitassa attham'aññātuṃ
sbs_example_3: dūrato'pi kho mayaṃ, bhante, āgaccheyyāma āyasmato sāriputtassa santike etassa bhāsitassa attham'aññātuṃ

meaning_1: Buddha’s eight-part path; noble eight-fold path
example_1: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, ayaṃ dhammavinayo bahuratano anekaratano, tatr'imāni ratanāni, seyyath'idaṃ, cattāro satipaṭṭhānā, cattāro sammappadhānā, cattāro iddhipādā, pañc'indriyāni, pañca balāni, satta bojjh'aṅgā, ariyo aṭṭh'aṅgiko maggo
example_2: ayam'eva ariyo aṭṭh'aṅgiko maggo rūpanirodhagāminī paṭipadā, seyyath'idaṃ sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākamm'anto sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati sammāsamādhi.
sbs_example_3:
dukkhaṃ dukkhasamuppādaṃ,
dukkhassa ca atikkamaṃ,
ariyaṃ c'aṭṭh'aṅgikaṃ maggaṃ,
dukkh'ūpasamagāminaṃ.

example_1: katame ca, bhikkhave, āsavā adhivāsanā pahātabbā? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paṭisaṅkhā yoniso khamo hoti sītassa uṇhassa, jighacchāya pipāsāya
example_2:
evam'pi viggayha vivādayanti,
bālo paro akusalo'ti c'āhu,
sacco nu vādo katamo imesaṃ,
sabb'eva h'īme kusalā vadānā.
sbs_example_3: dasa ime bhikkhave dhammā pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbā. katame dasa?
sbs_chant_eng_3: Ten Subjects for Frequent Recollection by One Who Has Gone Forth
sbs_example_4: cattār'imāni, bhikkhave, pañhavyākaraṇāni. katamāni cattāri? atthi, bhikkhave, pañho ek'aṃsavyākaraṇīyo, atthi, bhikkhave, pañho vibhajjavyākaraṇīyo
sbs_example_5: katame ca dhammā manasikaraṇīyā ye dhamme manasi karoti? yassa dhamme manasikaroto anuppanno vā kām'āsavo na uppajjati, uppanno vā kām'āsavo pahīyati

example_1: bhagavā pana, bhante, arahaṃ sammāsambuddho pahoti tathā kātuṃ yathā sabbo loko kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjeyyā'ti?
example_2:
yo pubbe karaṇīyāni,
pacchā so kātum'icchati,
sukhā so dhaṃsate ṭhānā,
pacchā ca manutappati.
sbs_example_3:
catūh'apāyehi ca vippamutto,
cha cābhiṭhānāni abhabbo kātuṃ
sbs_example_4: tattha dakkhā hoti analasā tatr'upāyāya vīmaṃsāya samannāgatā alaṃ kātuṃ alaṃ saṃvidhātuṃ.
sbs_example_5: evan'taṃ uposathakammaṃ imehi catūhi lakkhaṇehi saṅgahitaṃ pattakallaṃ nāma hoti, kātuṃ yutta-rūpaṃ.

example_1:
atha pāpāni kammāni,
karaṃ bālo na bujjhati,
sehi kammehi dummedho,
aggidaḍḍho'va tappati.
example_2: ko nu kho, bhante hetu, ko paccayo pāpassa kammassa kiriyāya pāpassa kammassa pavattiyā'ti?
sbs_example_3: buddho susuddho karuṇāmah'aṇṇavo, yo'ccantasuddhabbarañāṇalocano, lokassa pāp'ūpakilesaghātako
sbs_example_4:
tasmā hi paññā'va dhanena seyyā, yāya vosānam'idh'ādhigacchati.
abyositattā hi bhav'ābhavesu, pāpāni kammāni karoti mohā.

example_1: sace te kassapa agaru, viharemu ajjaṇho aggisālamhī'ti
example_2:
dukkhassa ve maṃ pabhavaṃ apucchasi,
taṃ te pavakkhāmi yathā pajānaṃ,
upadhinidānā pabhavanti dukkhā,
ye keci lokasmim'anekarūpā.

bhavatu sabbamaṅgalaṃ, rakkhantu sabbadevatā,
sabbadhamm'ānubhāvena, sadā sotthi bhavantu te
sbs_example_4: ambho purisa, kiṃ tuyh'iminā pāpakena dujjīvitena? matan'te jīvitā seyyo'ti
sbs_example_5: ahaṃ kho, āvuso, navo acirapabbajito, adhunāgato imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ, na teahaṃ sakkomi vitthārena dhammaṃ desetuṃ, api ca te saṃkhittena atthaṃ vakkhāmī'ti

example_1:
ayaṃ loko paro loko,
brahmaloko sadevako,
diṭṭhiṃ te n'ābhijānāti,
gotamassa yasassino.
example_2:
pāpāni parivajjeti,
sa munī tena so muni,
yo munāti ubho loke,
muni tena pavuccati.
sbs_example_3: bhagavā pana, bhante, arahaṃ sammāsambuddho pahoti tathā kātuṃ yathā sabbo loko kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjeyyā'ti?

meaning_1: after death; lit. after from death
example_1: kiṃ pana, bhante, hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā, idam'eva saccaṃ mogham'aññan'ti? etam'pi kho, poṭṭhapāda, mayā abyākataṃ, hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā, idam'eva saccaṃ mogham'aññan'ti.
example_2: tath'āhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi, yathā khīṇ'āsavo bhikkhu kāyassa bhedā ucchijjati vinassati, na hoti paraṃ maraṇā'ti.
sbs_example_3: bhagavā pana, bhante, arahaṃ sammāsambuddho pahoti tathā kātuṃ yathā sabbo loko kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjeyyā'ti?

meaning_1: (it is) suitable (to); proper (to); appropriate (to); worthy (for); lit. enough
example_1: alañ'hi vo, kālāmā, kaṅkhituṃ alaṃ vicikicchituṃ
example_2:
appañ'hi etaṃ na alaṃ samāya,
duve vivādassa phalāni brūmi,
etam'pi disvā na vivādayetha,
khem'ābhipassaṃ avivādabhūmiṃ.
sbs_example_3: atthi nu kho me uttarimanussadhammā alam'ariyañāṇadassanaviseso adhigato, so'haṃ pacchime kāle sabrahmacārīhi puṭṭho na maṅku bhavissāmī'ti

example_1: yāni kho pana tāni paṇītabhojanāni, seyyath'idaṃ, sappi, navanītaṃ, telaṃ, madhu, phāṇitaṃ, maccho, maṃsaṃ, khīraṃ, dadhi. yo pana bhikkhu evarūpāni paṇītabhojanāni agilāno attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, ānanda, puriso daliddo assako anāḷhiko, tassa akāmakassa bilaṃ olaggeyyuṃ, idaṃ te, ambho purisa, maṃsañ'ca khāditabbaṃ, mūlañ'ca anuppadātabban'ti.
sbs_example_3: atthi imasmiṃ kāye kesā lomā nakhā dantā taco maṃsaṃ nhāru aṭṭhi aṭṭhimiñjaṃ vakkaṃ hadayaṃ yakanaṃ kilomakaṃ pihakaṃ papphāsaṃ
sbs_example_4:
appassut'āyaṃ puriso, balibaddho'va jīrati,
maṃsāni tassa vaḍḍhanti, paññā tassa na vaḍḍhati.

meaning_1: for alms; to collect alms food
example_1: addasā kho aññataro upāsako taṃ bhikkhuṃ kīṭāgirismiṃ piṇḍāya carantaṃ. disvāna yena so bhikkhu ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ abhivādetvā etadavoca, api, bhante, piṇḍo labbhatī'ti?
example_2: atha kho āyasmā rāhulo, ko n'ajja bhagavatā sammukhā ovādena ovadito gāmaṃ piṇḍāya pavisissatī'ti tato paṭinivattitvā aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle nisīdi
sbs_example_3: atha kho te bhikkhū sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu
sbs_example_4: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, idha therā bhikkhū pubb'aṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya gāmaṃ vā nigamaṃ vā piṇḍāya pavisanti.

meaning_1: name of a city; capital of Kosala
example_1: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati
example_2: atha kho bhagavā rājagahe yath'ābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena sāvatthi tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
sbs_example_3: atha kho te bhikkhū sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu
sbs_example_4: vuttho me, bhante, sāvatthiyaṃ vass'āvāso. icchām'ahaṃ, bhante, janapadacārikaṃ pakkamitun'ti.

meaning_1: for them; to them; to those
example_1:
nānājanā janapadehi saṅgatā,
tava vīra vākyaṃ abhikaṅkhamānā,
tesaṃ tuvaṃ sādhu viyākarohi,
tathā hi te vidito esa dhammo.
example_2:
apārutā tesaṃ amatassa dvārā,
ye sotavanto pamuñcantu saddhaṃ,
vihiṃsasaññī paguṇaṃ na bhāsiṃ,
dhammaṃ paṇītaṃ manujesu brahme'ti.
sbs_example_3: atha kho tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etad'ahosi, atippago kho tāva sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya carituṃ, yaṃ nūna mayaṃ yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo ten'upasaṅkameyyāmā'ti
sbs_example_4: evam'eva tesaṃ caturāsītipāṇasahassānaṃ tasmiṃ'y'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi
sbs_example_5: yāv'āhaṃ tesaṃ uddisitvā āgacchāmī'ti, udāhu vippalapan'tass'eva coraghātā sīsaṃ chindeyyun'ti?

meaning_1: ages; grows old; gets worn out; declines
example_1:
jīranti ve rājarathā sucittā,
atho sarīram'pi jaraṃ upeti,
satañ'ca dhammo na jaraṃ upeti,
santo have sabbhi pavedayanti.

meaning_1: similarly; in the same way; so too
example_1: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sīlaṃ nissāya sīle patiṭṭhāya satta bojjh'aṅge bhāveti, satta bojjh'aṅge bahulīkaroti.
example_2: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, yassa kassaci bhikkhuno kāyagatāsati abhāvitā abahulīkatā, taṃ cakkhu āviñchati manāpiyesu rūpesu, amanāpiyā rūpā paṭikūlā honti
sbs_example_3: evam'eva kho ahaṃ, bhante, imesaṃ ekādasannaṃ amatadvārānaṃ ekam'ekena'pi amatadvārena sakkuṇissāmi attānaṃ sotthiṃ kātuṃ.
sbs_example_4:
seyyathā'pi mahāsamuddo ekaraso loṇaraso,
evam'eva kho ayaṃ dhammavinayo ekaraso vimuttiraso.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
cirappavāsiṃ purisaṃ,
dūrato sotthim'āgataṃ,
ñātimittā suhajjā ca,
abhinandanti āgataṃ.
example_2: addasā kho, bhikkhave, kummo kacchapo siṅgālaṃ dūrato'va gocarapasutaṃ. disvāna soṇḍipañcamāni aṅgāni sake kapāle samodahitvā app'ossukko tuṇhībhūto saṅkasāyati.
sbs_example_3: dūrato'pi kho mayaṃ, āvuso, āgaccheyyāma āyasmato sāriputtassa santike etassa bhāsitassa attham'aññātuṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tathā vūpakaṭṭho viharanto taṃ dhammaṃ anussarati anuvitakketi, satisambojjh'aṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno āraddho hoti, satisambojjh'aṅgaṃ tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhu bhāveti, satisambojjh'aṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati.
example_2: āraddhaṃ kho pana me, brāhmaṇa, vīriyaṃ ahosi asallīnaṃ, upaṭṭhitā sati asammuṭṭhā, passaddho kāyo asāraddho, samāhitaṃ cittaṃ ekaggaṃ
sbs_example_3: āraddhavīriyo ca kho, bhikkhave, sukhaṃ viharati pavivitto pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi, mahantañ'ca sadatthaṃ paripūreti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: cattār'imāni, bhikkhave, pañhavyākaraṇāni. katamāni cattāri? atthi, bhikkhave, pañho ek'aṃsavyākaraṇīyo, atthi, bhikkhave, pañho vibhajjavyākaraṇīyo

meaning_1: perfecting; accomplishing; attaining; mastering; lit. finishing
example_1:

atho jātikkhayaṃ patto,
abhiññāvosito muni,

tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.
example_2:
tasmā hi paññā'va dhanena seyyā, yāya vosānam'idh'ādhigacchati.
abyositattā hi bhav'ābhavesu, pāpāni kammāni karoti mohā.

example_1: handa carahi te, mārisa, passa antaradhāyāmī'ti. handa carahi me tvaṃ, brahme, antaradhāyassu, sace visahasī'ti.
example_2:
eko ahaṃ sakka mahantam'oghaṃ,

meaning_1: site; location; base; grounds; lit. ground

example_2: sārambhe ce bhikkhu vatthusmiṃ aparikkamane saññācikāya kuṭiṃ kāreyya bhikkhū vā anabhineyya vatthudesanāya pamāṇaṃ vā atikkāmeyya, saṅghādiseso.

meaning_1: name of a city; capital of Magadha; lit. king’s house

example_2: tena kho pana samayena āyasmā soṇo rājagahe viharati sītavanasmiṃ. atha kho āyasmato soṇassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi

notes: (BDN) they are unshakable by their opposites: (1) the power of faith is unshakable by faithlessness (unbelief); (2) energy, by laziness; (3) mindfulness, by forgetfulness; (4) concentration, by distractedness; (5) wisdom, by ignorance. They represent, therefore, the aspect of firmness in the spiritual faculties.

example_1: sārambhe ce bhikkhu vatthusmiṃ aparikkamane saññācikāya kuṭiṃ kāreyya, bhikkhū vā anabhineyya vatthudesanāya, pamāṇaṃ vā atikkāmeyya, saṅghādiseso.
example_2: sārambhe ce bhikkhu vatthusmiṃ aparikkamane mahallakaṃ vihāraṃ kāreyya, bhikkhū vā anabhineyya vatthudesanāya, saṅghādiseso.

meaning_1: fortunate (for); beneficial (for); useful (for); lit. for the sake
example_1: ta'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, hoti bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya, bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan'ti.

meaning_1: good (for), beneficial (for) and comfortable (for); lit. for the good, the benefit and the happiness
example_1: caratha, bhikkhave, cārikaṃ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lok'ānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṃ, mā ekena dve agamittha
example_2: ye te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū suggahitehi suttantehi (na) byañjanappatirūpakehi atthañ'ca dhammañ'ca anulomenti te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bahujanahitāya paṭipannā bahujanasukhāya, bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṃ.

example_1: atha kho tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etadahosi, atippago kho tāva sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya carituṃ, yaṃ nūna mayaṃ yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo ten'upasaṅkameyyāmā'ti
example_2: atha kho tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etadahosi, atippago kho tāva sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya carituṃ. yaṃnūna mayaṃ yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo ten'upasaṅkameyyāmā'ti.

meaning_1: exceeds; goes over; oversteps; lit. causes to go beyond
example_1: sārambhe ce bhikkhu vatthusmiṃ aparikkamane saññācikāya kuṭiṃ kāreyya, bhikkhū vā anabhineyya vatthudesanāya, pamāṇaṃ vā atikkāmeyya, saṅghādiseso.
example_2: yo pana bhikkhu rañño khattiyassa muddh'ābhisittassa anikkhantarājake aniggataratanake pubbe appaṭisaṃvidito indakhīlaṃ atikkāmeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: who lives in a home; who is domestically settled

meaning_1: could go; would move; would walk
commentary: (MNa) yaṃnūn'āhaṃ saṇikaṃ gaccheyyan'ti kiṃ me iminā sīghagamanena, saṇikaṃ gacchissāmī'ti cintesi.
example_1: pathaviyā'pi ummujjanimujjaṃ kareyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi udake, udake'pi abhijjamāno gaccheyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi pathaviyaṃ, ākāse'pi pallaṅkena kameyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi pakkhī sakuṇo
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso sīghaṃ gaccheyya. tassa evam'assa, kiṃ nu kho ahaṃ sīghaṃ gacchāmi? yaṃnūn'āhaṃ saṇikaṃ gaccheyyan'ti. so saṇikaṃ gaccheyya.
sbs_example_3: yo pana bhikkhu saṅghikaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā bhisiṃ vā kocchaṃ vā ajjhokāse santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā taṃ pakkamanto n'eva uddhareyya na uddharāpeyya anāpucchā vā gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: birth and wandering on; cycle of rebirth; endless rebirth
example_1:
ucchinnabhavataṇhassa,
santacittassa bhikkhuno,
vikkhīṇo jātisaṃsāro,
n'atthi tassa punabbhavo'ti.
example_2:
anekajātisaṃsāraṃ,
sandhāvissaṃ anibbisaṃ,
gahakārakaṃ gavesanto,
dukkhā jāti punappunaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
yo imasmiṃ dhammavinaye, appamatto vihassati.
pahāya jātisaṃsāraṃ, dukkhass'antaṃ karissati.

commentary: (ITIa) patthayamānassā'ti dve patthanā taṇhāpatthanā, kusalacchandapatthanā ca ... chinnaṃ pāpimato sotaṃ, viddhastaṃ vinaḷīkataṃ, pāmojjabahulā hotha, khemaṃ patthetha bhikkhavo'ti, ettha kattu'kamyatākusalacchandapatthanā, ayam'eva idh'ādhippetā. tena patthayamānassā'ti taṃ yogakkhemaṃ gantu'kāmassa tan'ninnassa tap'poṇassa tap'pabbhārassā'ti attho.
example_1: tīṇ'imāni, bhikkhave, sukhāni patthayamāno sīlaṃ rakkheyya paṇḍito. katamāni tīṇi?
example_2:
patthayamānassa hi jappitāni,
pavedhitaṃ v'āpi pakappitesu,
cut'ūpapāto idha yassa n'atthi,
sa kena vedheyya kuhiṃ'va jappe.
sbs_example_3:
ye kho te bhikkhū sekkhā apattamānasā anuttaraṃ yogakkhemaṃ
patthayamānā viharanti tesu me ayaṃ evarūpī anusāsanī hoti.

meaning_1: spiritual success; enlightenment; sanctuary; lit. rest from yoke
example_1:
te jhāyino sātatikā,
niccaṃ daḷhaparakkamā,
phusanti dhīrā nibbānaṃ,
yogakkhemaṃ anuttaraṃ.
example_2:
evaṃ vihārī ātāpī,
ahorattam'atandito,
bhāvayaṃ kusalaṃ dhammaṃ,
yogakkhemassa pattiyā.
sbs_example_3:
ye kho te bhikkhū sekkhā apattamānasā anuttaraṃ yogakkhemaṃ
patthayamānā viharanti tesu me ayaṃ evarūpī anusāsanī hoti.

grammar: masc & nt loc sg, loc abs
meaning_1: when there isn’t; when not existing; when does not exist
construction:
na > a + sa + nta + e
na + sante
example_1: bhikkhuno pan'eva addhānamaggappaṭipannassa eḷakalomāni uppajjeyyuṃ, ākaṅkhamānena bhikkhunā paṭiggahetabbāni, paṭiggahetvā tiyojanaparamaṃ sahatthā haritabbāni asante hārake.
example_2:
sātaṃ asātañ'ca kutonidānā,
kismiṃ asante na bhavanti h'ete,
vibhavaṃ bhavañ'cā'pi yam'etam'atthaṃ,
etaṃ me pabrūhi yatonidānaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
ye keci sokā paridevitā vā, dukkhā ca lokasmim'anekarūpā.
piyaṃ paṭiccappabhavanti ete, piye asante na bhavanti ete.

example_1: āyasmā sāriputto etadavoca, yo hi koci, āvuso, paraṃ pañhaṃ pucchati, sabbo so pañcahi ṭhānehi, etesaṃ vā aññatarena
example_2: evam'etesaṃ, bhikkhave, suttantānaṃ tathāgatabhāsitānaṃ gambhīrānaṃ gambhīr'atthānaṃ lok'uttarānaṃ suññatappaṭisaṃyuttānaṃ antaradhānaṃ bhavissati.
sbs_example_3: ye hi keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussaramānā anussaranti sabb'ete pañc'upādānakkhandhe anussaranti etesaṃ vā aññataraṃ.

meaning_1: five heaps that are clung to; five grasping groups
commentary: (KPa) tattha pañcā'ti gaṇanaparicchedo. upādānajanitā upādānajanakā vā khandhā upādānakkhandhā. yaṃkiñci rūpaṃ, vedanā, saññā, saṅkhārā, viññāṇañ'ca sāsavā upādāniyā, etesam'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
example_1: so gacchati ce'pi ime pañc'upādānakkhandhe upagacchati. tiṭṭhati ce'pi ime pañc'upādānakkhandhe upatiṭṭhati. nisīdati ce'pi ime pañc'upādānakkhandhe upanisīdati. nipajjati ce'pi ime pañc'upādānakkhandhe upanipajjati.
example_2: jāti'pi dukkhā, jarā'pi dukkhā, maraṇam'pi dukkhaṃ, sokaparidevadukkhadomanass'upāyāsā'pi dukkhā, appiyehi sampayogo'pi dukkho, piyehi vippayogo'pi dukkho, yam'p'icchaṃ na labhati tam'pi dukkhaṃ, saṅkhittena pañc'upādānakkhandhā dukkhā.

meaning_1: (vinaya) unified; united; in concord; harmonious; in agreement
commentary:
(VIN 2.5.9.1) samaggo nāma saṅgho samānasaṃvāsako samānasīmāyaṃ ṭhito.
(VINa) samaggo hi saṅgho sammodamāno avivadamāno ek'uddeso phāsu viharatīti.
example_1: yo pana bhikkhu samaggassa saṅghassa bhedāya parakkameyya, bhedanasaṃvattanikaṃ vā adhikaraṇaṃ samādāya paggayha tiṭṭheyya, so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi evam'assa vacanīyo
example_2: iti bhinnānaṃ vā sandhātā sahitānaṃ vā anuppadātā samagg'ārāmo samaggarato samagganandī samaggakaraṇiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti
sbs_example_3: yāvakīvañ'ca bhikkhave bhikkhū samaggā sannipatissanti, samaggā vuṭṭhahissanti, samaggā saṅghakaraṇīyāni karissanti
sbs_example_4: samet'āyasmā saṅghena, samaggo hi saṅgho, sammodamāno avivadamāno ek'uddeso, phāsu viharatī'ti.
sbs_example_5:
āraddhavīriye pahit'atte, niccaṃ daḷhaparakkame.
samagge sāvake passa, etaṃ buddhāna'vandanaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: grasps; holds (onto); clings (to); takes possession (of); lit. takes near
commentary: (ANa) na kiñci loke upādiyatī'ti kiñci ekam'pi saṅkhāragataṃ taṇhāvasena na upādiyati na gaṇhāti na parāmasati.
notes: passive in form, active in meaning.
example_1: na kho pan'āhaṃ, sāriputta, ettāvatā saupavajjo'ti vadāmi. yo kho, sāriputta, tañ'ca kāyaṃ nikkhipati, aññañ'ca kāyaṃ upādiyati, tam'ahaṃ saupavajjo'ti vadāmi.
example_2: so evaṃ asamanupassanto na kiñci loke upādiyati, anupādiyaṃ na paritassati, aparitassaṃ paccattaññ'eva parinibbāyati.
sbs_example_3: yāva'd'eva ñāṇamattāya paṭissatimattāya anissito ca viharati, na ca kiñci loke upādiyati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: their; of these; of them; of those
example_1:
yesaṃ sannicayo n'atthi,
ye pariññātabhojanā,
suññato animitto ca,
vimokkho yesaṃ gocaro,
ākāse va sakuntānaṃ,
gati tesaṃ durannayā.
example_2:
yāni sotāni lokasmiṃ,
sati tesaṃ nivāraṇaṃ,
sotānaṃ saṃvaraṃ brūmi,
paññāy'ete pidhiyyare.
sbs_example_3: yā tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ tamhi tamhi sattanikāye jāti sañjāti okkanti abhinibbatti khandhānaṃ pātubhāvo āyatanānaṃ paṭilābho, ayaṃ vuccati jāti.
sbs_example_4: kacci, bhante, bhagavā sukham'asayitthā'ti? evaṃ, kumāra, sukham'asayitthaṃ. ye ca pana loke sukhaṃ senti, ahaṃ tesaṃ aññataro'ti
sbs_example_5: bhikkhunā tesaṃ vitakkānaṃ ādīnavo upaparikkhitabbo, iti'pi'me vitakkā akusalā, iti'pi'me vitakkā sāvajjā, iti'pi'me vitakkā dukkhavipākā'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: (wrong or false) belief; misconception; theory; dogma; doctrine; lit. gone into views
example_1: idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, diṭṭhigataṃ diṭṭhigahanaṃ diṭṭhikantāraṃ diṭṭhivisūkaṃ diṭṭhivipphanditaṃ diṭṭhisaṃyojanaṃ
example_2:
pubb'āsave hitvā nave akubbaṃ,
na chandagū no'pi nivissavādī,
sa vippamutto diṭṭhigatehi dhīro,
na lippati loke anattagarahī.
sbs_example_3: yato kho te bhikkhū n'āsakkhiṃsu āyasmantaṃ yamakaṃ etasmā pāpakā diṭṭhigatā vivecetuṃ
sbs_example_4:
kiṃ nu satto'ti paccesi, māra diṭṭhigataṃ nu te.
suddhasaṅkhārapuñjo'yaṃ, na'y'idha satt'upalabbhati.

meaning_1: (of place) from here; away from; lit. from this
example_1: na ito sutvā amutra akkhātā imesaṃ bhedāya na amutra vā sutvā imesaṃ akkhātā amūsaṃ bhedāya
example_2:
okañ'jahaṃ taṇhacchidaṃ anejaṃ,
nandiñ'jahaṃ oghatiṇṇaṃ vimuttaṃ,
kappañ'jahaṃ abhiyāce sumedhaṃ,
sutvāna nāgassa apanamissanti ito.

example_1: tayo'me, bhikkhave, āsavā, kām'āsavo, bhav'āsavo, avijj'āsavo.
example_2: tassa evaṃ jānato evaṃ passato kām'āsavā'pi cittaṃ vimuccati bhav'āsavā'pi cittaṃ vimuccati avijj'āsavā'pi cittaṃ vimuccati

meaning_1: as long as; as far as; of all; to the extent that
example_1: yāvatā kho, āvuso, appamāṇā cetovimuttiyo, akuppā tāsaṃ cetovimutti aggam'akkhāyati. sā kho pan'ākuppā cetovimutti suññā rāgena, suññā dosena, suññā mohena.
example_2: sa kho so, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati, na kho ahaññ'ev'eko jarādhammo jaraṃ anatīto, atha kho yāvatā sattānaṃ āgati gati cuti upapatti sabbe sattā jarādhammā jaraṃ anatītā'ti.
sbs_example_3:
tiṭṭhañ'caraṃ, nisinno vā, sayāno vā, yāvat'assa vigatamiddho,
etaṃ satiṃ adhiṭṭheyya, brahmam'etaṃ vihāraṃ idha'm'āhu.
sbs_example_4:
yāvatā channaṃ phass'āyatanānaṃ gati tāvatā papañcassa gati,
yāvatā papañcassa gati tāvatā channaṃ phass'āyatanānaṃ gati.

meaning_1: is perturbed; is shaken; is agitated; is anguished
commentary:
(ANa) anupādiyaṃ na paritassatī'ti aggaṇhanto taṇhāparitassanāya na paritassati.
(DHPa) na paritassatī'ti taṇhāya na bhāyati
example_1:
sabbasaṃyojanaṃ chetvā,
yo ve na paritassati,
saṅg'ātigaṃ visaṃyuttaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.
example_2: so evaṃ asamanupassanto na kiñci loke upādiyati, anupādiyaṃ na paritassati, aparitassaṃ paccattaññ'eva parinibbāyati.
sbs_example_3: tesaṃ pahānā na paritassati, aparitassaṃ sukhaṃ viharati, sukhavihārī bhikkhu tadaṅganibbuto'ti vuccati.

example_1: tassa evaṃ jānato evaṃ passato kām'āsavā'pi cittaṃ vimuccati, bhav'āsavā'pi cittaṃ vimuccati, avijj'āsavā'pi cittaṃ vimuccati.
example_2: te ce me evaṃ puṭṭhā, āmā'ti paṭijānanti, ty'āhaṃ evaṃ vadāmi, api pana tumhe āyasmanto ek'antasukhaṃ lokaṃ jānaṃ passaṃ viharathā'ti? iti puṭṭhā, no'ti vadanti.
sbs_example_3: tattha purimesu catūsu kiccesu idāni suriy'ālokassa atthitāya n'atthi, aparāni tīṇi bhikkhūnaṃ vattaṃ jānantehi bhikkhūhi katāni pariniṭṭhitāni honti.
sbs_example_4: jānato ahaṃ passato āsavānaṃ khayaṃ vadāmi, no ajānato no apassato. yoniso ca manasikāraṃ ayoniso ca manasikāraṃ.

example_1: tassa sabbehi imehi pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi visuddham'attānaṃ samanupassato, vimuttam'attānaṃ samanupassato, pāmojjaṃ jāyati, pamuditassa pīti jāyati, pītimanassa kāyo passambhati, passaddhakāyo sukhaṃ vedeti, sukhino cittaṃ samādhiyati.

meaning_1: many; various; countless; lit. not one

example_2:

meaning_1: thorough investigation; complete examination; lit. all around investigation
example_1: so tathā sato viharanto taṃ dhammaṃ paññāya pavicinati pavicarati parivīmaṃsam'āpajjati.
example_2: yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tathā sato viharanto taṃ dhammaṃ paññāya pavicinati pavicayati parivīmaṃsaṃ āpajjati, dhammavicayasambojjh'aṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno āraddho hoti
sbs_example_3: tassa taṃ dhammaṃ paññāya pavicinato pavicayato parivīmaṃsaṃ āpajjato āraddhaṃ hoti vīriyaṃ asallīnaṃ.

example_1: so ajānaṃ vā āha jānāmī'ti, jānaṃ vā āha na jānāmī'ti, apassaṃ vā āha passāmī'ti, passaṃ vā āha na passāmī'ti

ajjhattañ'ca bahiddhā ca,
n'atthi kiñcī'ti passato,
ñāṇaṃ sakk'ānupucchāmi,

sbs_example_4: jānato ahaṃ passato āsavānaṃ khayaṃ vadāmi, no ajānato no apassato. yoniso ca manasikāraṃ ayoniso ca manasikāraṃ.

meaning_1: such; such kind; of such quality; so formed
example_1:
attadantassa posassa,
niccaṃ saññatacārino,
n'eva devo na gandhabbo,
na māro saha brahmunā,
jitaṃ apajitaṃ kayirā,
tathārūpassa jantuno.
example_2: tathārūpā'ssa dhammā bahussutā honti dhātā vacasā paricitā manas'ānupekkhitā diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā.
sbs_example_3: taṃ kissa hetu? tathārūpānaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ dhammaṃ sutvā dvayena vūpakāsena vūpakaṭṭho viharati, kāyavūpakāsena ca cittavūpakāsena ca.
sbs_example_4: coro'si, bālo'si, mūḷho'si, theno'sī'ti, tathārūpaṃ bhikkhu adinnaṃ ādiyamāno, ayam'pi pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.
sbs_example_5: bhikkhu ye te lābhā dhammikā dhammaladdhā antamaso pattapariyāpannamattam'pi, tathārūpehi lābhehi appaṭivibhattabhogī hoti sīlavantehi sabrahmacārīhi sādhāraṇabhogī.

example_1:
api dibbesu kāmesu,
ratiṃ so n'ādhigacchati,
taṇhakkhayarato hoti,
sammāsambuddhasāvako.
example_2: ito tvaṃ kālaṅ'kato kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjissasi, tattha dibbehi pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappito samaṅgībhūto paricāressasī'ti.
sbs_example_3: so sace ākaṅkhati, dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passeyyaṃ cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe, sugate duggate yathākamm'ūpage satte pajāneyyaṃ
sbs_example_4:
mutt'āhaṃ sabbapāsehi, ye dibbā ye ca mānusā.
mahābandhanamutto'mhi, nihato tvam'asi antakā'ti.

example_1: yo kho, sabhiya, aññatitthiyapubbo imasmiṃ dhammavinaye ākaṅkhati pabbajjaṃ, ākaṅkhati upasampadaṃ, so cattāro māse parivasati.
example_2:
bhikkhu siyā jhāyī vimuttacitto,
ākaṅkhe ce hadayass'ānupattiṃ,
lokassa ñatvā udayabbayañ'ca,
sucetaso anissito tadānisaṃso'ti.
sbs_example_3: so sace ākaṅkhati, dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passeyyaṃ cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe, sugate duggate yathākamm'ūpage satte pajāneyyaṃ
sbs_example_4: sace ākaṅkhati, paṭikūlañ'ca appaṭikūlañ'ca tad'ubhayaṃ abhinivajjetvā upekkhako vihareyyaṃ sato sampajāno'ti
sbs_example_5: ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vasī vitakkapariyāyapathesu. yaṃ vitakkaṃ ākaṅkhissati taṃ vitakkaṃ vitakkessati, yaṃ vitakkaṃ nākaṅkhissati na taṃ vitakkaṃ vitakkessati.

construction:
adhi > adhy > ajjh + atta + aṃ
ajjhatta + aṃ
example_1:
ajjhattañ'ca bahiddhā ca,
vedanaṃ n'ābhinandato,
evaṃ satassa carato,
viññāṇaṃ uparujjhatī'ti.
example_2: sukhavinicchayaṃ jaññā, sukhavinicchayaṃ ñatvā ajjhattaṃ sukham'anuyuñjeyyā'ti, iti yaṃ taṃ vuttaṃ idam'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ.
sbs_example_3: so iminā ariyena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato ajjhattaṃ anavajjasukhaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti
sbs_example_4: idha bhikkhu santaṃ vā ajjhattaṃ kāmacchandaṃ atthi me ajjhattaṃ kāmacchando'ti pajānāti, asantaṃ vā ajjhattaṃ kāmacchandaṃ n'atthi me ajjhattaṃ kāmacchando'ti pajānāti.
sbs_example_5: uddhaccakukkuccaṃ pahāya anuddhato viharati ajjhattaṃ vūpasantacitto, uddhaccakukkuccā cittaṃ parisodheti

example_1: yo, bhikkhave, ime dhamme evaṃ pajānāti evaṃ passati, ayaṃ vuccati, sot'āpanno avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyano'ti.
example_2: tañ'ca cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, yatth'assa te uppannā pāpakā akusalā dhammā aparisesā nirujjhanti
sbs_example_3: so idaṃ dukkhan'ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ayaṃ dukkhasamudayo'ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ayaṃ dukkhanirodho'ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti
sbs_example_4: so sato'va assasati, sato'va passasati. dīghaṃ vā assasanto dīghaṃ assasāmī'ti pajānāti, dīghaṃ vā passasanto dīghaṃ passasāmī'ti pajānāti

meaning_1: not attaching (to); not taking as mine; not grasping (onto); not clinging (to); not taking possession (of); lit. not taking near
construction:
na > an + upa + ādiya + nta
an + upādiyanta
commentary: (ANa) anupādiyaṃ na paritassatī'ti aggaṇhanto taṇhāparitassanāya na paritassati.
example_1: so evaṃ asamanupassanto na kiñci loke upādiyati, anupādiyaṃ na paritassati, aparitassaṃ paccattaññ'eva parinibbāyati.
example_2: katamā c'ānanda, sabbaloke anabhiratasaññā? idh'ānanda, bhikkhu ye loke upādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhān'ābhinives'ānusayā, te pajahanto viharati anupādiyanto. ayaṃ vuccat'ānanda, sabbaloke anabhiratasaññā.
sbs_example_3: so evaṃ amaññamāno na ca kiñci loke upādiyati. anupādiyaṃ na paritassati. aparitassaṃ paccattaññ'eva parinibbāyati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: te ce me evaṃ puṭṭhā, āmā'ti paṭijānanti, ty'āhaṃ evaṃ vadāmi, api pana tumhe āyasmanto ek'antasukhaṃ lokaṃ jānaṃ passaṃ viharathā'ti? iti puṭṭhā, no'ti vadanti.
example_2: addhā ayam'āyasmā jānaṃ jānāti passaṃ passatī'ti. ayam'pi dhammo piyattāya garuttāya bhāvanāya sāmaññāya ekībhāvāya saṃvattati.
sbs_example_3: so ajānaṃ vā āha jānāmī'ti, jānaṃ vā āha na jānāmī'ti, apassaṃ vā āha passāmī'ti, passaṃ vā āha na passāmī'ti
sbs_example_4: so h'āvuso, bhagavā jānaṃ jānāti, passaṃ passati, cakkhubhūto ñāṇabhūto dhammabhūto brahmabhūto, vattā pavattā, atthassa ninnetā, amatassa dātā, dhammassāmī tathāgato.
sbs_example_5: so ajānaṃ vā āha, jānāmī'ti, jānaṃ vā āha, na jānāmī'ti, apassaṃ vā āha, passāmī'ti, passaṃ vā āha, na passāmī'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
sace musā na bhaṇasi,
sace pāṇaṃ na hiṃsasi,
sace adinnaṃ n'ādiyasi,
saddahāno amaccharī,
kiṃ kāhasi gayaṃ gantvā,
udapāno'pi te gayā'ti.
example_2: sace, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā evaṃ puccheyyuṃ, kiṃmūlakā, āvuso, sabbe dhammā, kiṃsambhavā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamudayā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamosaraṇā sabbe dhammā
sbs_example_3: so sace ākaṅkhati, dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passeyyaṃ cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe, sugate duggate yathākamm'ūpage satte pajāneyyaṃ
sbs_example_4: evam'eva kho sace tumhe'pi na orimaṃ tīraṃ upagacchatha, na pārimaṃ tīraṃ upagacchatha, na majjhe saṃsīdissatha, na thale ussīdissatha,…, nibbānapabbhārā.
sbs_example_5: sace ākaṅkhati, paṭikūlañ'ca appaṭikūlañ'ca tad'ubhayaṃ abhinivajjetvā upekkhako vihareyyaṃ sato sampajāno'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: atha kassa c'āhaṃ, bho gotama, imaṃ pāyasaṃ dammī'ti?
example_2:
hitvā icchañ'ca lobhañ'ca,
yattha satto puthujjano,
cakkhumā paṭipajjeyya,
tareyya narakaṃ imaṃ.
sbs_example_3: so imaṃ lokaṃ sadevakaṃ samārakaṃ sabrahmakaṃ sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiṃ pajaṃ sadevamanussaṃ sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti.
sbs_example_4: evam'eva kho, māgaṇḍiya, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā andhā acakkhukā ajānantā ārogyaṃ, apassantā nibbānaṃ, atha ca pana-imaṃ gāthaṃ bhāsanti
sbs_example_5:
yo cetā parivajjeti, sappasse'va padā siro.
so-amaṃ visattikaṃ loke, sato samativattati.

example_1:
vārijo'va thale khitto,
okam'okata'ubbhato,
pariphandat'idaṃ cittaṃ,
māradheyyaṃ pahātave.
example_2:
diṭṭhā'pi sutā'pi te janā,
yesaṃ nāmam'idaṃ pavuccati,
nāmaṃ yev'āvasissati,
akkheyyaṃ petassa jantuno.
sbs_example_3: so idaṃ dukkhan'ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ayaṃ dukkhasamudayo'ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ayaṃ dukkhanirodho'ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti
sbs_example_4: iti imasmiṃ sati idaṃ hoti, imass'uppādā idaṃ uppajjati. imasmiṃ asati idaṃ na hoti, imassa nirodhā idaṃ nirujjhati
sbs_example_5: n'āhaṃ aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yena anuppanno vā byāpādo uppajjati uppanno vā byāpādo bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati yatha'y'idaṃ paṭighanimittaṃ.

example_1:
bahū devā manussā ca,
maṅgalāni acintayuṃ,
ākaṅkhamānā sotthānaṃ,
brūhi maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.
example_2:
maccherā ca pamādā ca,
evaṃ dānaṃ na dīyati,
puññaṃ ākaṅkhamānena,
deyyaṃ hoti vijānatā'ti.
sbs_example_3: so ākaṅkhamāno attanā'va attānaṃ byākareyya khīṇanirayo'mhi khīṇatiracchānayoni khīṇapettivisayo khīṇ'āpāyaduggativinipāto sot'āpanno'ham'asmi avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo'ti

meaning_1: walking; walking about; wandering around (in); going around
example_1: seyyathā'pi bhikkhave makkaṭo araññe pavane caramāno sākhaṃ gaṇhati taṃ muñcitvā aññaṃ gaṇhati taṃ muñcitvā aññaṃ gaṇhati
example_2: atha kho bhagavā kapilavatthusmiṃ yath'ābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena sāvatthi tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi. anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena sāvatthi tadavasari.
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso sār'atthiko sāragavesī sārapariyesanaṃ caramāno tiṇhaṃ kuṭhāriṃ ādāya vanaṃ paviseyya.

example_1:
ārogyaparamā lābhā,
santuṭṭhiparamaṃ dhanaṃ,
vissāsaparamā ñāti,
nibbānaṃ paramaṃ sukhaṃ.
example_2: yo hi, gahapati, imaṃ kāyaṃ pariharanto muhuttam'pi ārogyaṃ paṭijāneyya, kimaññatra bālyā?
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, āṇaṇyaṃ yathā ārogyaṃ yathā bandhanāmokkhaṃ yathā bhujissaṃ yathā khem'antabhūmiṃ
sbs_example_4: tassa taṃ ṭhānaṃ abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhato yo ārogye ārogyamado so sabbaso vā pahīyati tanu vā pana hoti. idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, atthavasaṃ paṭicca byādhidhammo'mhi, byādhiṃ anatīto'ti
sbs_example_5: evam'eva kho, māgaṇḍiya, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā andhā acakkhukā ajānantā ārogyaṃ, apassantā nibbānaṃ, atha ca pan'imaṃ gāthaṃ bhāsanti

example_1:
viññāṇaṭṭhitiyo sabbā,
abhijānaṃ tathāgato,
tiṭṭhantam'enaṃ jānāti,
vimuttaṃ tapparāyaṇaṃ.
example_2:
majjhe sarasmiṃ tiṭṭhataṃ,
oghe jāte mahabbhaye,
jarāmaccuparetānaṃ,
dīpaṃ pabrūhi mārisa,
tvañ'ca me dīpamakkhāhi,
yathā'y'idaṃ n'āparaṃ siyā.
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi pabbatasaṅkhepe udakarahado accho vippasanno anāvilo. tattha cakkhumā puriso tīre ṭhito passeyya sippisambukam'pi sakkharakathalam'pi macchagumbam'pi, carantam'pi tiṭṭhantam'pi.
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi puriso sār'atthiko sāragavesī sārapariyesanaṃ caramāno mahato rukkhassa tiṭṭhato sāravato atikkamm'eva mūlaṃ, atikkamma khandhaṃ, sākhāpalāse sāraṃ pariyesitabbaṃ maññeyya

meaning_1: experienced; learned; competent; trained; lit. distinguished
example_1: yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhūhi sahadhammikaṃ vuccamāno evaṃ vadeyya, na tāv'āhaṃ, āvuso, etasmiṃ sikkhāpade sikkhissāmi, yāva na aññaṃ bhikkhuṃ byattaṃ vinayadharaṃ paripucchāmī'ti, pācittiyaṃ.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gāvī pabbateyyā paṇḍitā byattā khettaññū kusalā visame pabbate carituṃ.
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi dovāriko hoti paṇḍito byatto medhāvī aññātānaṃ nivāretā ñātānaṃ pavesetā, evam'evaṃ kho ariyasāvako satimā hoti paramena satinepakkena samannāgato cirakatam'pi cirabhāsitam'pi saritā anussaritā.

example_1: bhagavaṃmūlakā no, bhante, dhammā bhagavaṃnettikā bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā. sādhu vata, bhante, bhagavantaṃ'y'eva paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho. bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī'ti.
example_2:
sutvā rusito bahuṃ vācaṃ,
samaṇānaṃ vā puthujanānaṃ,
pharusena ne na paṭivajjā,
na hi santo paṭisenikaronti.
sbs_example_3: sādhu me bhagavā saṃkhittena dhammaṃ desetu, yam'ahaṃ bhagavato dhammaṃ sutvā ekā vūpakaṭṭhā appamattā ātāpinī pahit'attā vihareyyan'ti
sbs_example_4: pisuṇaṃ vācaṃ pahāya pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, ito sutvā na amutra akkhātā imesaṃ bhedāya, amutra vā sutvā na imesaṃ akkhātā amūsaṃ bhedāya
sbs_example_5:
sahassam'api ce gāthā, anatthapadasaṃhitā,
ekaṃ gāthāpadaṃ seyyo, yaṃ sutvā upasammati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: obstructive (for); blocking; impeding; lit. coming in-between
example_1: dāruṇo, bhikkhave, lābhasakkārasiloko kaṭuko pharuso antarāyiko anuttarassa yogakkhemassa adhigamāya.
example_2: tath'āhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi yathā ye'me antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā te paṭisevato n'ālaṃ antarāyāyā'ti.
sbs_example_3: sampajānamusāvādo kho pan'āyasmanto, antarāyiko dhammo vutto bhagavatā.

example_1:
yadā have pātubhavanti dhammā,
ātāpino jhāyato brāhmaṇassa,
vidhūpayaṃ tiṭṭhati mārasenaṃ,
suriyo'va obhāsayam'antalikkhan'ti.
example_2: iminā puññakammena upajjhāyā guṇ'uttarā, ācariy'ūpakārā ca mātāpitā ca ñātakā, suriyo candimā rājā, guṇavantā narā'pi ca
sbs_example_3: sammato'pi ce bhikkhu atthaṅ'gate suriye bhikkhuniyo ovadeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
sbs_example_4: tattha purimesu catūsu kiccesu idāni suriyaālokassa atthitāya n'atthi, aparāni tīṇi bhikkhūnaṃ vattaṃ jānantehi bhikkhūhi katāni pariniṭṭhitāni honti.

example_1: etāni, cunda, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññ'āgārāni, jhāyatha, cunda, mā pamād'attha, mā pacchāvippaṭisārino ahuvattha, ayaṃ kho amhākaṃ anusāsanī'ti.
example_2:
ye puggalā aṭṭha sataṃ pasatthā,
cattāri etāni yugāni honti,
te dakkhiṇeyyā sugatassa sāvakā,
etesu dinnāni mahapphalāni,
idam'pi saṅghe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.
sbs_example_3: sammajjanī, padīpo ca, udakaṃ āsanena ca, uposathassa etāni, pubbakaraṇan'ti vuccati.

meaning_1: blind; sightless; visually impaired; lit. dark
example_1: sabb'eva kho ete, poṭṭhapāda, paribbājakā andhā acakkhukā, tvaṃ'y'eva nesaṃ eko cakkhumā. ek'aṃsikā'pi hi kho, poṭṭhapāda, mayā dhammā desitā paññattā, anekaṃsikā'pi hi kho, poṭṭhapāda, mayā dhammā desitā paññattā.
example_2: evam'eva kho, māgaṇḍiya, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā andhā acakkhukā ajānantā ārogyaṃ, apassantā nibbānaṃ, atha ca pan'imaṃ gāthaṃ bhāsanti
sbs_example_3: saccaṃ vihāya matisaccakavādaketuṃ, vād'ābhiropitamanaṃ ati-andhabhūtaṃ, paññāpadīpajalito jitavā mun'indo
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi, brāhmaṇa, udapatto āvilo luḷito kalalībhūto andhakāre nikkhitto. tattha cakkhumā puriso sakaṃ mukhanimittaṃ paccavekkhamāno yathābhūtaṃ na jāneyya na passeyya.

example_1:
piyato jāyatī soko,
piyato jāyatī bhayaṃ,
piyato vippamuttassa,
n'atthi soko kuto bhayaṃ.
example_2: pamuditassa pīti jāyati, pītimanassa kāyo passambhati, passaddhakāyo sukhaṃ vediyati, sukhino cittaṃ samādhiyati.
sbs_example_3: sabbo pan'āyaṃ piṇḍapāto ajigucchanīyo, imaṃ pūtikāyaṃ patvā ativiya jigucchanīyo jāyati

example_1:
paraman'ti diṭṭhīsu paribbasāno,
yaduttari kurute jantu loke,
hīnā'ti aññe tato sabbam'āha,
tasmā vivādāni avītivatto.
example_2:
yam'āhu saccaṃ tathiyan'ti eke,
tam'āhu aññe tucchaṃ musā'ti,

kasmā na ekaṃ samaṇā vadanti.
sbs_example_3:

ūnā'va hutvāna jahanti dehaṃ, kāmehi lokamhi na h'atthi titti.
sbs_example_4: tañ'ce bhikkhuṃ aññe bhikkhū jāneyyuṃ, nisinnapubbaṃ iminā bhikkhunā dvattikkhattuṃ pātimokkhe uddissamāne, ko pana vādo bhiyyo'ti

meaning_1: when being; when is; when are
example_1: ehi tvaṃ, bhadramukha, saṅghāṭiko hohi, saṅghāṭikassa te sato saṅghāṭidhāraṇamattena abhijjhālussa abhijjhā pahīyissati
example_2: tasmā't'iha te, gahapati, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, āturakāyassa me sato cittaṃ anāturaṃ bhavissatī'ti. evañ'hi te, gahapati, sikkhitabban'ti.
sbs_example_3: pubb'eva me, bhikkhave, sambodhā anabhisambuddhassa bodhisattass'eva sato etad'ahosi

commentary: (VIN 1.2.10) bhedāya parakkameyyā'ti, kathaṃ ime nānā assu, vinā assu, vaggā assū'ti pakkhaṃ pariyesati, gaṇaṃ bandhati.
example_1: yo pana bhikkhu samaggassa saṅghassa bhedāya parakkameyya, bhedanasaṃvattanikaṃ vā adhikaraṇaṃ samādāya paggayha tiṭṭheyya, so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi evam'assa vacanīyo
example_2: sace mayaṃ imāhi āpattīhi aññam'aññaṃ kāressāma, siyā'pi taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ kakkhaḷattāya vāḷattāya bhedāya saṃvatteyya.
sbs_example_3: pisuṇaṃ vācaṃ pahāya pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, ito sutvā na amutra akkhātā imesaṃ bhedāya, amutra vā sutvā na imesaṃ akkhātā amūsaṃ bhedāya
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: speaker (of); who tells (about); who speaks (about); who expresses (about)
example_1:
tumhehi kiccam'ātappaṃ,
akkhātāro tathāgatā,
paṭipannā pamokkhanti,
jhāyino mārabandhanā.
example_2:
akkheyyañ'ca pariññāya,
akkhātāraṃ na maññati,

example_2: kacci, bhante, bhagavā sukham'asayitthā'ti? evaṃ, kumāra, sukham'asayitthaṃ. ye ca pana loke sukhaṃ senti, ahaṃ tesaṃ aññataro'ti

commentary:
(VIN 2.5.4.1) agilāno nāma sakkoti tamhā āvasathā pakkamituṃ.
(VIN 2.5.4.9) agilāno nāma yassa vinā paṇītabhojanāni phāsu hoti.
example_1: agilānena bhikkhunā eko āvasathapiṇḍo bhuñjitabbo. tato ce uttari bhuñjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
example_2: yāni kho pana tāni paṇītabhojanāni, seyyath'idaṃ, sappi, navanītaṃ, telaṃ, madhu, phāṇitaṃ, maccho, maṃsaṃ, khīraṃ, dadhi. yo pana bhikkhu evarūpāni paṇītabhojanāni agilāno attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

sabbe sattā bhavantu sukhit'attā.

kummo aṅgāni sake kapāle,
samodahaṃ bhikkhu manovitakke,
anissito aññam'aheṭhayāno,
parinibbuto na-upavadeyya kañcī'ti.
sbs_example_3: kacci nu kho maṃ anuvicca viññū sabrahmacārī sīlato na upavadantī'ti, pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ.
sbs_chant_eng_3: Ten Subjects for Frequent Reflection by One Gone Forth
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: when isn’t; when does not exist
construction:
na > a + sa + nta + ti
na + santa + ti
example_1: nissitassa calitaṃ, anissitassa calitaṃ n'atthi. calite asati passaddhi, passaddhiyā sati nati na hoti. natiyā asati āgatigati na hoti. āgatigatiyā asati cut'ūpapāto na hoti. cut'ūpapāte asati n'ev'idha na huraṃ na ubhayam'antarena. es'ev'anto dukkhassā'ti.
example_2: so evaṃ samanupassanto asati na paritassatī'ti.
sbs_example_3: iti imasmiṃ sati idaṃ hoti, imass'uppādā idaṃ uppajjati. imasmiṃ asati idaṃ na hoti, imassa nirodhā idaṃ nirujjhati
sbs_example_4: ārammaṇe asati patiṭṭhā viññāṇassa na hoti. tad'appatiṭṭhite viññāṇe avirūḷhe āyatiṃ punabbhav'ābhinibbatti na hoti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: when is; when exists; lit. in being
example_1:
ko nu hāso kim'ānando,
niccaṃ pajjalite sati,
andhakārena onaddhā,
padīpaṃ na gavesatha.
example_2: attani vā, bhikkhave, sati attaniyaṃ me'ti assā'ti? evaṃ, bhante. attaniye vā, bhikkhave, sati attā me'ti assā'ti? evaṃ, bhante.
sbs_example_3: iti imasmiṃ sati idaṃ hoti, imass'uppādā idaṃ uppajjati. imasmiṃ asati idaṃ na hoti, imassa nirodhā idaṃ nirujjhati
sbs_example_4: ārocayāmi vo, bhikkhave, paṭivedayāmi vo, bhikkhave, mā vo sāmaññ'atthikānaṃ sataṃ sāmaññ'attho parihāyi, sati uttariṃ karaṇīye'.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (SNa) suññ'āgārānī'ti iminā janavivittaṃ ṭhānaṃ. ubhayena ca yogānurūpaṃ sen'āsanaṃ ācikkhati, dāyajjaṃ niyyāteti.
example_1: kacci nu kho ahaṃ suññ'āgāre abhiramāmī'ti pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabba
sbs_chant_eng_1: Ten Subjects for Frequent Recollection by One Who Has Gone Forth
example_2:
araññe rukkhamūle vā,
suññ'āgāre'va bhikkhavo,
anussaretha sambuddhaṃ,
bhayaṃ tumhāka no siyā.
sbs_example_3: idha bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññ'āgāragato vā nisīdati, pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā, ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya, parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.
sbs_example_4: etāni, bhikkhave, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññ'āgārāni. jhāyatha, bhikkhave, mā pamād'attha, mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. ayaṃ vo amhākaṃ anusāsanī'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
socanti janā mamāyite,
na hi santi niccā pariggahā,
vinābhāva'santam'ev'idaṃ,
iti disvā n'āgāram'āvase.
example_2: so ñātakehi nīyamāno appatvā'va ñātake antarāmagge kālaṃ karoti. evarūpo'pi, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco yodh'ājīvo hoti. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo yodh'ājīvo santo saṃvijjamāno lokasmiṃ.
sbs_example_3: idha bhikkhu santaṃ vā ajjhattaṃ kāmacchandaṃ atthi me ajjhattaṃ kāmacchando'ti pajānāti, asantaṃ vā ajjhattaṃ kāmacchandaṃ n'atthi me ajjhattaṃ kāmacchando'ti pajānāti.
sbs_example_4: pātimokkhaṃ uddisissāmi, taṃ sabbe'va santā sādhukaṃ suṇoma manasikaroma.
sbs_example_5: yathā yath'āyaṃ puriso kammaṃ karoti tathā tathā taṃ paṭisaṃvediyatī'ti, evaṃ santaṃ brahmacariyavāso na hoti, okāso na paññāyati sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāya
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yo pana bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya, tath'āhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi, yathā ye'me antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā, te paṭisevato n'ālaṃ antarāyāyā'ti
example_2: abrahmacariyaṃ pahāya brahmacārī hoti ārācārī virato methunā gāmadhammā.
sbs_example_3:
evaṃ bho purisa jānāhi, pāpadhammā asaññatā.
mā taṃ lobho adhammo ca, ciraṃ dukkhāya randhayuṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: so ajānaṃ vā āha jānāmī'ti, jānaṃ vā āha na jānāmī'ti, apassaṃ vā āha passāmī'ti, passaṃ vā āha na passāmī'ti
example_2: te ce me evaṃ puṭṭhā, āmā'ti paṭijānanti, ty'āhaṃ evaṃ vadāmi, api pana tumhe āyasmanto ek'antasukhaṃ lokaṃ jānaṃ passaṃ viharathā'ti? iti puṭṭhā, no'ti vadanti.
sbs_example_3: evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako rūpasmim'pi nibbindati, vedanāya'pi nibbindati, saññāya'pi nibbindati, saṅkhāresu'pi nibbindati, viññāṇasmim'pi nibbindati.
sbs_chant_eng_3: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_4: so h'āvuso, bhagavā jānaṃ jānāti, passaṃ passati, cakkhubhūto ñāṇabhūto dhammabhūto brahma-bhūto, vattā pavattā, atthassa ninnetā, amatassa dātā, dhammassāmī tathāgato.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: interest in sensual pleasure; sensual desire (for); sensual impulse (for)
example_1:
kāmacchando ca byāpādo,
thinamiddhañ'ca bhikkhuno,
uddhaccaṃ vicikicchā ca,
pañc'ete cittakelisā.
example_2: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu santaṃ vā ajjhattaṃ kāmacchandaṃ, atthi me ajjhattaṃ kāmacchando'ti pajānāti, asantaṃ vā ajjhattaṃ kāmacchandaṃ, n'atthi me ajjhattaṃ kāmacchando'ti pajānāti
sbs_example_3: evam'eva kho, ye hi keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā kāyena c'eva cittena ca kāmehi avūpakaṭṭhā viharanti, yo ca n'esaṃ kāmesu kāmacchando kāmasneho kāmamucchā kāmapipāsā kāmapariḷāho
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: ye kho keci bhagavato sāvakā āraddhavīriyā viharanti, ahaṃ tesaṃ aññataro. atha ca pana me na anupādāya āsavehi cittaṃ vimuccati
example_2: atha ca pana bhavaṃ gotamo evam'āha, aham'pi kho, brāhmaṇa, kasāmi ca vapāmi ca. kasitvā ca vapitvā ca bhuñjāmī'ti.
sbs_example_3: evam'eva kho, māgaṇḍiya, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā andhā acakkhukā ajānantā ārogyaṃ, apassantā nibbānaṃ, atha ca pan'imaṃ gāthaṃ bhāsanti
sbs_example_4: kicchaṃ vat'āyaṃ loko āpanno, jāyati ca jīyati ca mīyati ca cavati ca upapajjati ca, atha ca pan'imassa dukkhassa nissaraṇaṃ nappajānāti jarāmaraṇassa
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: who belongs to another sect; who follows another religion; lit. another fording place
example_1: imesam'pi candimasūriyānaṃ evaṃmah'iddhikānaṃ evaṃmah'ānubhāvānaṃ tejasā tejaṃ pariyādiyeyyātha, ko pana vādo aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānan'ti!
example_2: sace, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā evaṃ puccheyyuṃ, kiṃmūlakā, āvuso, sabbe dhammā, kiṃsambhavā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamudayā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamosaraṇā sabbe dhammā
sbs_example_3: evam'eva kho, māgaṇḍiya, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā andhā acakkhukā ajānantā ārogyaṃ, apassantā nibbānaṃ, atha ca pan'imaṃ gāthaṃ bhāsanti
sbs_example_4: atha kho tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etad'ahosi, atippago kho tāva sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya carituṃ, yaṃ nūna mayaṃ yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo ten'upasaṅkameyyāmā'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (VIN 2.5.4.10) āhāro nāma udakadantaponaṃ ṭhapetvā yaṃkiñci ajjhoharaṇīyaṃ, eso āhāro nāma.
example_1: yato kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako āhārañ'ca pajānāti
example_2:
kāyagutto vacīgutto,
āhāre udare yato,
saccaṃ karomi niddānaṃ,
soraccaṃ me pamocanaṃ.
sbs_example_3: ehi tvaṃ bhikkhu bhojane mattaññū hohi. paṭisaṅkhā yoniso āhāraṃ āhāreyyāsi
sbs_example_4: avijjam'p'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṃ vadāmi, no anāhāraṃ. ko c'āhāro avijjāya? pañca nīvaraṇā'tissa vacanīyaṃ.
sbs_example_5: cattāro'me āhārā bhūtānaṃ vā sattānaṃ ṭhitiyā sambhav'esīnaṃ vā anuggahāya, kabaḷīkāro āhāro oḷāriko vā sukhumo vā, phasso dutiyo, manosañcetanā tatiyā, viññāṇaṃ catutthaṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
saritvā pubbake yogī,
tesaṃ vattam'anussaraṃ,
kiñ'c'āpi pacchimo kālo,
phuseyya amataṃ padaṃ.
example_2: tassa attano ca tāsañ'ca devatānaṃ saddhañ'ca sīlañ'ca sutañ'ca cāgañ'ca paññañ'ca anussarato cittaṃ pasīdati, pāmojjaṃ uppajjati, ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti
sbs_example_3:
dhamm'ārāmo dhammarato, dhammaṃ anuvicintayaṃ,
dhammaṃ anussaraṃ bhikkhu, saddhammā na parihāyati.

meaning_1: what is auspicious; blessing; good omen; prosperity; lit. auspicious
example_1:
bahū devā manussā ca,
maṅgalāni acintayuṃ,
ākaṅkhamānā sotthānaṃ,
brūhi maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.
example_2:
adhikāre maṅgale c'eva, nipphanne c'āvadhāraṇe,
anantare c'apādāne, athasaddo pavattati.
sbs_example_3: bhavatu sabbamaṅgalaṃ, rakkhantu sabbadevatā, sabbadhamm'ānubhāvena, sadā sotthi bhavantu te
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: alertness; care; carefulness; caution; vigilance; diligence; conscientiousness; heedfulness; lit. not heedless
example_1:
appamādo amatapadaṃ,
pamādo maccuno padaṃ,
appamattā na mīyanti,
ye pamattā yathā matā.
example_2:
appamādarato bhikkhu,
pamāde bhayadassi vā,
abhabbo parihānāya,
nibbānass'eva santike'ti.
sbs_example_3:
āratī viratī pāpā, majjapānā ca saññamo.
appamādo ca dhammesu, etaṃ maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.
sbs_example_4: handadāni, bhikkhave, āmantayāmi vo, vayadhammā saṅkhārā, appamādena sampādetha.
sbs_example_5: par'atthaṃ vā hi bhikkhave sampassamānena alam'eva appamādena sampādetuṃ

example_1:
dhammapīti sukhaṃ seti,
vippasannena cetasā,
ariyappavedite dhamme,
sadā ramati paṇḍito.
example_2:
kiṃ'su chetvā sukhaṃ seti,
kiṃ'su chetvā na socati,
kissa'ssu ekadhammassa,
vadhaṃ rocesi gotamā'ti.
sbs_example_3: āraddhavīriyo ca kho, bhikkhave, sukhaṃ viharati pavivitto pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi, mahantañ'ca sadatthaṃ paripūreti.
sbs_example_4: kacci, bhante, bhagavā sukham'asayitthā'ti? evaṃ, kumāra, sukham'asayitthaṃ. ye ca pana loke sukhaṃ senti, ahaṃ tesaṃ aññataro'ti
sbs_example_5: sukhaṃ supati, sukhaṃ paṭibujjhati, na pāpakaṃ supinaṃ passati, manussānaṃ ca amanussānaṃ piyo hoti, devatā rakkhanti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: personally; with one’s own hand; by oneself; lit. from one’s own hand
example_1: ghaṭikāro kho, mahārāja, kumbhakāro pannamusalo na sahatthā pathaviṃ khaṇati.
example_2: atha kho brahmāyu brāhmaṇo satt'āhaṃ buddhappamukhaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesi sampavāresi.
sbs_example_3: ākaṅkhamānena bhikkhunā paṭiggahetabbāni paṭiggahetvā tiyojanaparamaṃ sahatthā haritabbāni, asante hārake.
sbs_example_4: yo pana bhikkhu acelakassa vā paribbājakassa vā paribbājikāya vā sahatthā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā dadeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

example_1: tam'enaṃ aññataro puriso telamalikatena sāhuḷicīrena vañceyya, idaṃ te, ambho purisa, odātaṃ vatthaṃ abhirūpaṃ nimmalaṃ sucī'ti. so taṃ paṭiggaṇheyya, paṭiggahetvā pārupeyya.
example_2: sace yāgu hoti, bhājanaṃ dhovitvā yāgu upanāmetabbā. yāguṃ pītassa udakaṃ datvā bhājanaṃ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena dhovitvā paṭisāmetabbaṃ.
sbs_example_3: ākaṅkhamānena bhikkhunā paṭiggahetabbāni paṭiggahetvā tiyojanaparamaṃ sahatthā haritabbāni, asante hārake.
sbs_example_4: niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kaṭhine bhikkhuno pan'eva akālacīvaraṃ uppajjeyya, ākaṅkhamānena bhikkhunā paṭiggahetabbaṃ paṭiggahetvā khippam'eva kāretabbaṃ.
sbs_example_5: tāni paṭiggahetvā satt'āhaparamaṃ sannidhikārakaṃ paribhuñjitabbāni. taṃ atikkāmayato, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: for the sake (of); for the purpose (of); for the benefit (of)
example_1: na'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyaṃ vussati janakuhana-atthaṃ, na janalapana-atthaṃ, na lābhasakkārasilok'ānisaṃsa-atthaṃ, na itivādappamokkh'ānisaṃsa-atthaṃ, na iti maṃ jano jānātū'ti
example_2: para-atthaṃ vā hi bhikkhave sampassamānena alam'eva appamādena sampādetuṃ
sbs_example_3: atha kho idaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyaṃ vussati saṃvara-atthaṃ pahāna-atthaṃ virāga-atthaṃ nirodha-atthan'ti.

meaning_1: expert in monastic law; lit. bearer of vinaya
example_1: dullabho, bhikkhave, vuḍḍhapabbajito nipuṇo, dullabho ākappasampanno, dullabho bahussuto, dullabho dhammakathiko, dullabho vinayadharo.
example_2: yato ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu saddho ca hoti, sīlavā ca, bahussuto ca, dhammakathiko ca, paris'āvacaro ca, visārado ca parisāya dhammaṃ deseti, vinayadharo ca … evaṃ so ten'aṅgena paripūro hoti.
sbs_example_3: asukasmiṃ nāma āvāse sambahulā therā bhikkhū viharanti bahussutā āgat'āgamā dhammadharā vinayadharā mātikādharā. tesaṃ me therānaṃ sammukhā sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ
sbs_example_4: na tāv'āhaṃ, āvuso, etasmiṃ sikkhāpade sikkhissāmi yāva na aññaṃ bhikkhuṃ, byattaṃ vinayadharaṃ, paripucchāmī'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
pamādam'anuyuñjanti,
bālā dummedhino janā,
appamādañ'ca medhāvī,
dhanaṃ seṭṭhaṃ'va rakkhati.
example_2:
diṭṭhā'pi sutā'pi te janā,
yesaṃ nāmam'idaṃ pavuccati,
nāmaṃ yev'āvasissati,
akkheyyaṃ petassa jantuno.
sbs_example_3:
appakā te manussesu, ye janā pāragāmino.
ath'āyaṃ itarā pajā, tīram'ev'ānudhāvati.
sbs_example_4:
papañ'ca udapānañ'ca, ye dadanti upassayaṃ.
tesaṃ divā ca ratto ca, sadā puññaṃ pavaḍḍhati.
dhammaṭṭhā sīlasampannā, te janā saggagāmino'ti.
