example_1:
yo sahassaṃ sahassena,
saṅgāme mānuse jine,
ekañ'ca jeyya'm'attānaṃ,
sa ve saṅgāmaji-uttamo,
attā have jitaṃ seyyo,
yā c'āyaṃ itarā pajā.
example_2: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, yv'āyaṃ jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo ca hoti samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo ca ayaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ jhāyīnaṃ aggo ca seṭṭho ca mokkho ca uttamo ca pavaro cā'ti.
sbs_example_3:
aññathā lokanāthamhi, tiṭṭhante puris'uttame.
iriyaṃ āsi bhikkhūnaṃ, aññathā dāni dissati.
sbs_example_4:
bahū devā manussā ca, maṅgalāni acintayuṃ.
ākaṅkhamānā sotthānaṃ, brūhi maṅgalam'uttamaṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
puññañ'ce puriso kayirā,
kayirāth'etaṃ punappunaṃ,
tamhi chandaṃ kayirātha,
sukho puññassa uccayo.
example_2:
yo ve avidvā upadhiṃ karoti,
punappunaṃ dukkham'upeti mando,
tasmā pajānaṃ upadhiṃ na kayirā,
dukkhassa jātippabhav'ānupassī.
sbs_example_3:
anekajātisaṃsāraṃ, sandhāvissaṃ anibbisaṃ,
gahakāraṃ gavesanto, dukkhā jāti punappunaṃ.
sbs_example_4:
yathā'pi mūle anupaddave daḷhe, chinno'pi rukkho punar'eva rūhati,
evam'pi taṇh'ānusaye anūhate, nibbattatī dukkham'idaṃ punappunaṃ.

meaning_1: not seeing; not noticing; not aware
example_1: evam'eva kho, māgaṇḍiya, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā andhā acakkhukā ajānantā ārogyaṃ, apassantā nibbānaṃ, atha ca pan'imaṃ gāthaṃ bhāsanti
example_2: so ajānaṃ vā āha jānāmī'ti, jānaṃ vā āha na jānāmī'ti, apassaṃ vā āha passāmī'ti, passaṃ vā āha na passāmī'ti
sbs_example_3: ajānam'evaṃ, āvuso, avacaṃ jānāmi', apassaṃ passāmi'. tucchaṃ musā vilapin'ti, aññatra adhimānā, ayam'pi pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.

meaning_1: since; because; due to the fact that; lit. from which
example_1: yato kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako akusalañ'ca pajānāti akusalamūlañ'ca pajānāti kusalañ'ca pajānāti kusalamūlañ'ca pajānāti ettāvatā'pi kho āvuso ariyasāvako sammādiṭṭhi hoti
example_2: yato tumhe, bhikkhave, indriyesu guttadvārā viharissatha, atha tumhehipi māro pāpimā nibbijja pakkamissati, otāraṃ alabhamāno, kummamhāva siṅgālo'ti.
sbs_example_3: yato kho te bhikkhū n'āsakkhiṃsu āyasmantaṃ yamakaṃ etasmā pāpakā diṭṭhigatā vivecetuṃ
sbs_example_4: yatonidānaṃ, bhikkhu, purisaṃ papañcasaññāsaṅkhā samudācaranti. ettha ce n'atthi abhinanditabbaṃ abhivaditabbaṃ ajjhositabbaṃ.

grammar: masc & nt gen sg, gen abs
meaning_1: when he; when it; lit. of that
example_1: tassa sabbehi imehi pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi visuddham'attānaṃ samanupassato, vimuttam'attānaṃ samanupassato, pāmojjaṃ jāyati, pamuditassa pīti jāyati, pītimanassa kāyo passambhati, passaddhakāyo sukhaṃ vedeti, sukhino cittaṃ samādhiyati.
example_2:
kāmaṃ kāmayamānassa,
tassa ce taṃ samijjhati,
addhā pītimano hoti,

sbs_example_4: yaṃ loke piyarūpaṃ sātarūpaṃ, etth'esā taṇhā uppajjamānā uppajjati, ettha nivisamānā nivisati.

example_1:
kadā nu'haṃ dubbacanena vutto,
tatonimittaṃ vimano na hessaṃ,
atho pasattho'pi tatonimittaṃ,
tuṭṭho na hessaṃ tadidaṃ kadā me.
example_2: puna caparaṃ, mahānāma, ariyasāvako attano sīlāni anussarati akhaṇḍāni acchiddāni asabalāni akammāsāni bhujissāni viññuppasatthāni aparāmaṭṭhāni samādhisaṃvattanikāni.
sbs_example_3:
ye puggalā aṭṭha sataṃ pasatthā, cattāri etāni yugāni honti.
te dakkhiṇeyyā sugatassa sāvakā, etesu dinnāni mahapphalāni.

meaning_1: realm (of); sphere (of); power (of); influence (of); lit. to be put
example_1:
tasmā pajānaṃ na upādiyetha,
bhikkhu sato kiñcanaṃ sabbaloke,
ādānasatte iti pekkhamāno,
pajaṃ imaṃ maccudheyye visattan'ti.
example_2:
vārijo'va thale khitto,
okam'okata'ubbhato,
pariphandat'idaṃ cittaṃ,
māradheyyaṃ pahātave.
sbs_example_3:
ye ca kho sammadakkhāte, dhamme dhamm'ānuvattino,
te janā pāram'essanti, maccudheyyaṃ suduttaraṃ.

example_1:
etañ'hi tumhe paṭipannā,
dukkhass'antaṃ karissatha,
akkhāto vo mayā maggo,
aññāya sallakantanaṃ.
example_2: kiñ'ca, bhikkhave, mayā akkhātaṃ? idaṃ dukkhan'ti, bhikkhave, mayā akkhātaṃ
sbs_example_3:
ye ca kho sammadakkhāte, dhamme dhamm'ānuvattino,
te janā pāram'essanti, maccudheyyaṃ suduttaraṃ.
sbs_example_4:
et'ādis'āyaṃ santāno, māy'āyaṃ bālalāpinī,
vadhako esa akkhāto, sāro ettha na vijjati.

meaning_1: now; at present; lit. this day
example_1: pubbe c'āhaṃ anurādha eta'r'ahi ca dukkhañ'c'eva paññapemi dukkhassa ca nirodhan'ti
example_2: ye'pi hi keci, rāhula, eta'r'ahi samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā kāyakammaṃ parisodhenti … sabbe te evam'evaṃ paccavekkhitvā paccavekkhitvā kāyakammaṃ parisodhenti
sbs_example_3:
ye ca atītā sambuddhā, ye ca buddhā anāgatā.
yo c'eta'r'ahi sambuddho, bahunnaṃ sokanāsano.
sbs_example_4: pubbe c'eva rūpā eta'r'ahi ca sabbe te rūpā aniccā dukkhā vipariṇāmadhammā'ti evam'etaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya passato uppajjati somanassaṃ.
sbs_example_5: ahaṃ kho eta'r'ahi rūpena khajjāmi. atītam'p'āhaṃ addhānaṃ evam'eva rūpena khajjiṃ, seyyathā'pi eta'r'ahi paccuppannena rūpena khajjāmi

example_1:
idha socati pecca socati,
pāpakārī ubhay'attha socati,
so socati so vihaññati,
disvā kammakiliṭṭham'attano.
example_2: yam'pi taṃ diṭṭhiṭṭhānaṃ, so loko so attā, so pecca bhavissāmi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo, sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassāmī'ti, tam'pi n'etaṃ mama, n'eso'ham'asmi, na m'eso attā'ti samanupassati.
sbs_example_3: yāvatā akatakalyāṇānaṃ akatakusalānaṃ akatabhīruttāṇānaṃ katapāpānaṃ kataluddānaṃ katakibbisānaṃ gati taṃ gatiṃ pecca gacchāmī'ti.

meaning_1: will stand; will stay; will remain; will last
example_1: pathavīsamaṃ, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. pathavīsamañ'hi te, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvayato uppannā manāp'āmanāpā phassā cittaṃ na pariyādāya ṭhassanti.
example_2: atha kho bhagavā parittaṃ gomayapiṇḍaṃ pāṇinā gahetvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca. ettako'pi kho, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho n'atthi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassati.
sbs_example_3: yāvakīvañ'ca, bhikkhave, ime satta aparihāniyā dhammā bhikkhūsu ṭhassanti, imesu ca sattasu aparihāniyesu dhammesu bhikkhū sandississanti.
sbs_example_4: attani ca, bhikkhave, attaniye ca saccato thetato anupalabbhamāne, yam'pi taṃ diṭṭhiṭṭhānaṃ, so loko so attā, so pecca bhavissāmi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo, sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassāmī'ti, nan'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, kevalo paripūro bāladhammo'ti?

meaning_1: to be expected (for); certain (for); can be anticipated; lit. to be wished
example_1: mettāya, bhikkhave, cetovimuttiyā āsevitāya bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya susamāraddhāya ekādasānisaṃsā pāṭikaṅkhā.
example_2: saddhassa hi, bhante, ariyasāvakassa evaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ yaṃ āraddhavīriyo viharissati, akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya, kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ upasampadāya, thāmavā daḷhaparakkamo anikkhittadhuro kusalesu dhammesu.
sbs_example_3: yāvakīvañ'ca bhikkhave bhikkhū abhiṇhaṃ sannipātā bhavissanti sannipātabahulā, vuddhi'y'eva pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni

example_1:
sukhaṃ yāva jarā sīlaṃ,
sukhā saddhā patiṭṭhitā,
sukho paññāya paṭilābho,
pāpānaṃ akaraṇaṃ sukhaṃ.
example_2: so mah'iccho samāno vighātavā asantuṭṭho itarītara-cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajjaparikkhārena pāpikaṃ icchaṃ paṇidahati anavaññappaṭilābhāya lābhasakkārasilokappaṭilābhāya
sbs_example_3: yā tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ tamhi tamhi sattanikāye jāti sañjāti okkanti abhinibbatti khandhānaṃ pātubhāvo āyatanānaṃ paṭilābho, ayaṃ vuccati jāti.
sbs_example_4: cakkhuviññeyyānaṃ rūpānaṃ iṭṭhānaṃ kantānaṃ manāpānaṃ manoramānaṃ lok'āmisapaṭisaṃyuttānaṃ paṭilābhaṃ vā paṭilābhato samanupassato
sbs_example_5: ettako'pi kho, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho n'atthi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassati.

meaning_1: good man; moral man; virtuous man; superior man
example_1:
na pupphagandho paṭivātam'eti,
na candanaṃ tagaramallikā,
satañ'ca gandho paṭivātam'eti,
sabbā disā sappuriso pavāyati.
example_2: dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato paṇḍito viyatto sappuriso akkhataṃ anupahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati anavajjo ca hoti ananuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ bahuñ'ca puññaṃ pasavati.
sbs_example_3:
yath'indakhīlo pathaviṃ sito siyā, catubbhi vātehi asampakampiyo.
tath'ūpamaṃ sappurisaṃ vadāmi, yo ariyasaccāni avecca passati.
sbs_example_4: idha, gahapati, assutavā puthujjano ariyānaṃ adassāvī ariyadhammassa akovido ariyadhamme avinīto sappurisānaṃ adassāvī sappurisadhammassa akovido sappurisadhamme avinīto rūpaṃ attato samanupassati
sbs_example_5: saddhammassavanam'p'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṃ vadāmi, no anāhāraṃ. ko c'āhāro saddhammassavanassa? sappurisasaṃsevo'ti'ssa vacanīyaṃ.

example_1:
ajātaṃ asamuppannaṃ,
asokaṃ virajaṃ padaṃ,
nirodho dukkhadhammānaṃ,
saṅkhār'ūpasamo sukho'ti.
example_2: atthi, bhikkhave, ajātaṃ abhūtaṃ akataṃ asaṅkhataṃ.
sbs_example_3: yaṃ, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ ajātaṃ apātubhūtaṃ, bhavissatī'ti tassa saṅkhā, bhavissatī'ti tassa samaññā, bhavissatī'ti tassa paññatti

example_1:
sekhassa sikkhamānassa,
ujumagg'ānusārino,
khayasmiṃ paṭhamaṃ ñāṇaṃ,
tato aññā anantarā.
example_2: evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako ... viññāṇasmiṃ nibbindati, nibbidā virajjati, virāgā vimuccati, vimuttasmiṃ vimuttam'iti ñāṇaṃ hoti.
sbs_example_3: yaṃ kho bhikkhave dukkhe ñāṇaṃ, dukkhasamudaye ñāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhe ñāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya ñāṇaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati bhikkhave sammādiṭṭhi.
sbs_example_4: nibbindaṃ virajjati, virāgā vimuccati. vimuttasmiṃ vimuttam'iti ñāṇaṃ hoti. 'khīṇā jāti vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ n'āparaṃ itthattāyā'ti pajānātī'ti.
sbs_chant_eng_4: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_5: yāva'd'eva ñāṇamattāya paṭissatimattāya anissito ca viharati, na ca kiñci loke upādiyati.

example_1: yam'pi taṃ diṭṭhaṃ sutaṃ mutaṃ viññātaṃ pattaṃ pariyesitaṃ, anuvicaritaṃ manasā tam'pi etaṃ mama, eso'ham'asmi, eso me attā'ti samanupassati
example_2: attani ca, bhikkhave, attaniye ca saccato thetato anupalabbhamāne, yam'pi taṃ diṭṭhiṭṭhānaṃ, so loko so attā, so pecca bhavissāmi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo, sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassāmī'ti, nan'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, kevalo paripūro bāladhammo'ti?
sbs_example_3: tatra, sunakkhatta, yam'pi tathāgatassa evaṃ hoti, dhammaṃ nesaṃ desessan'ti tass'api hoti aññathattan'ti.

example_1: tena vattabbo, passasī'ti. āma passāmī'ti. āyatiṃ saṃvareyyāsī'ti
example_2: iti kho, ānanda, kammaṃ khettaṃ, viññāṇaṃ bījaṃ, taṇhā sneho. avijjānīvaraṇānaṃ sattānaṃ taṇhāsaṃyojanānaṃ hīnāya dhātuyā viññāṇaṃ patiṭṭhitaṃ evaṃ āyatiṃ punabbhav'ābhinibbatti hoti.
sbs_example_3: tassa me, bhante, bhagavā accayaṃ accayato paṭiggaṇhātu, āyatiṃ saṁvarāyāti.
sbs_example_4: yathā ca pahīnāya vicikicchāya āyatiṃ anuppādo hoti tañ'ca pajānāti.
sbs_example_5: sace so assutavā puthujjano āyatiṃ punabbhavāya ceteti, evañ'hi so moghapuriso suhatataro hoti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: fault; offence; transgression; lit. going beyond
example_1: taggha taṃ, bhikkhu, accayo accagamā yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ, yo tvaṃ sāriputtaṃ asatā tucchā musā abhūtena abbhācikkhi
example_2: accayo maṃ, bhante, accagamā yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ, yo'haṃ bhagavantaṃ āvusovādena samudācaritabbaṃ amaññissaṃ.
sbs_example_3: tassa me, bhante, bhagavā accayaṃ accayato paṭiggaṇhātu, āyatiṃ saṁvarāyāti.

example_1:
diṭṭhā vā y'eva addiṭṭhā,
ye ca dūre vasanti avidūre,
bhūtā vā sambhavesī vā,
sabbasattā bhavantu sukhit'attā.
example_2:
satto guhāyaṃ bahun'ābhichanno,
tiṭṭhaṃ naro mohanasmiṃ pagāḷho,
dūre vivekā hi tathāvidho so,
kāmā hi loke na hi suppahāyā.
sbs_example_3: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, yaṃ kiñci rūpaṃ atīt'ānāgatapaccuppannaṃ ajjhattaṃ vā bahiddhā vā oḷārikaṃ vā sukhumaṃ vā hīnaṃ vā paṇītaṃ vā yaṃ dūre santike vā

sbs_example_4: yaṃ kiñci rūpaṃ atīt'ānāgatapaccuppannaṃ ajjhattaṃ vā bahiddhā vā oḷārikaṃ vā sukhumaṃ vā hīnaṃ vā paṇītaṃ vā yaṃ dūre santike vā n'etaṃ mama

meaning_1: fine; refined; excellent; superior; sublime; lit. brought forward
example_1:
yaṃ kiñci vittaṃ idha vā huraṃ vā,
saggesu vā yaṃ ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
na no samaṃ atthi tathāgatena,
idam'pi buddhe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.
example_2: so, bhikkhave, samayo yaṃ taṃ cittaṃ ajjhattaṃ'y'eva santiṭṭhati sannisīdati ekodi hoti samādhiyati. so hoti samādhi santo paṇīto paṭippassaddhiladdho ekodibhāv'ādhigato na sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagato.
sbs_example_3: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, yaṃ kiñci rūpaṃ atīt'ānāgatapaccuppannaṃ ajjhattaṃ vā bahiddhā vā oḷārikaṃ vā sukhumaṃ vā hīnaṃ vā paṇītaṃ vā yaṃ dūre santike vā
sbs_chant_eng_3: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_4: etaṃ santaṃ etaṃ paṇītaṃ yad'idaṃ sabbasaṅkhārasamatho sabb'ūpadhippaṭinissaggo taṇhākkhayo nirodho nibbānan'ti.

example_1: tassa kāye kāy'ānupassino viharato kāy'ārammaṇo vā uppajjati kāyasmiṃ pariḷāho cetaso vā līnattaṃ bahiddhā vā cittaṃ vikkhipati
example_2: sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno aññen'aññaṃ paṭicarati, bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmeti, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātukaroti, evaṃ sant'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo akaccho hoti.
sbs_example_3: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, yaṃ kiñci rūpaṃ atīt'ānāgatapaccuppannaṃ ajjhattaṃ vā bahiddhā vā oḷārikaṃ vā sukhumaṃ vā hīnaṃ vā paṇītaṃ vā yaṃ dūre santike vā
sbs_chant_eng_3: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_4: iti ajjhattaṃ vā kāye kāy'ānupassī viharati, bahiddhā vā kāye kāy'ānupassī viharati, ajjhatta'bahiddhā vā kāye kāyānupassī viharati.

meaning_1: in the past, the future and the present
example_1: yaṃ papañceti tatonidānaṃ purisaṃ papañcasaññāsaṅkhā samudācaranti atītānāgatapaccuppannesu cakkhuviññeyyesu rūpesu
example_2: atha kho bhagavā apaloketvā āyasmantaṃ rāhulaṃ āmantesi, yaṃ kiñci, rāhula, rūpaṃ, atīt'ānāgatapaccuppannaṃ … sabbaṃ rūpaṃ, n'etaṃ mama
sbs_example_3: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, yaṃ kiñci rūpaṃ atīt'ānāgatapaccuppannaṃ ajjhattaṃ vā bahiddhā vā oḷārikaṃ vā sukhumaṃ vā hīnaṃ vā paṇītaṃ vā yaṃ dūre santike vā

commentary: (ANa) taṃ te mayaṃ paṭiggaṇhāmā'ti taṃ tava aparādhaṃ mayaṃ khamāma.
example_1: accayo maṃ, bhante, accagamā, yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ, y'āhaṃ evam'akāsiṃ. tassā me, bhante, ayyo ānando accayaṃ accayato paṭiggaṇhātu, āyatiṃ saṃvarāyā'ti.
example_2: tena kho pana samayena dve bhikkhū sampayojesuṃ, tatr'eko bhikkhu accasarā, atha kho so bhikkhu tassa bhikkhuno santike accayaṃ accayato deseti, so bhikkhu nappaṭiggaṇhāti.
sbs_example_3: taṃ veraṃ n'ābhinandāmi, paṭiggaṇhāmi vo'ccayan'ti.

meaning_1: visible; perceivable by the eye; lit. to be known by the eye
example_1: ayaṃ vuccat'ānanda … anuttarā indriyabhāvanā cakkhuviññeyyesu rūpesu
example_2: cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kām'ūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā.
sbs_example_3: taṃ kiṃ maññasi ye te cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā adiṭṭhā adiṭṭhapubbā, na ca passasi, na ca te hoti passeyyan'ti? atthi te tattha chando vā rāgo vā pemaṃ vā'ti?
sbs_example_4: yaṃ papañceti tatonidānaṃ purisaṃ papañcasaññāsaṅkhā samudācaranti atīt'ānāgatapaccuppannesu cakkhuviññeyyesu rūpesu

meaning_1: cultivated; developed; lit. caused to be
example_1:
abhiññeyyaṃ abhiññātaṃ,
bhāvetabbañ'ca bhāvitaṃ,
pahātabbaṃ pahīnaṃ me,
tasmā buddho'smi brāhmaṇa.
example_2: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, kāyagatā sati no bhāvitā bhavissati bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā'ti.

example_1:
dummedhehi pasaṃsā ca,
viññūhi garahā ca yā,
garahāva seyyo viññūhi,
yaṃ ce bālappasaṃsanā.
example_2:
muhuttam'api ce viññū,
paṇḍitaṃ payirupāsati,
khippaṃ dhammaṃ vijānāti,
jivhā sūparasaṃ yathā.
sbs_example_3: svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opanayiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhi
sbs_example_4: bhikkhu yāni tāni sīlāni akhaṇḍāni acchiddāni asabalāni akammāsāni bhujissāni viññuppasatthāni aparāmaṭṭhāni samādhisaṃvattanikāni

meaning_1: can be known (by); should be understood (by); lit. to be known
example_1: iminā kho etaṃ, āvuso, pariyāyena veditabbaṃ yathā na cakkhu rūpānaṃ saṃyojanaṃ na rūpā cakkhussa saṃyojanaṃ
example_2: so evam'assa veditabbo, āneñjasaṃyojanena hi kho visaṃyutto lok'āmis'ādhimutto purisapuggalo'ti.
sbs_example_3: svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opanayiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhi
sbs_example_4: saṃvāsena kho, mahārāja, sīlaṃ veditabbaṃ. tañ'ca kho dīghena addhunā, na ittaraṃ

meaning_1: teaching of the Buddha; noble teaching
example_1: ariyānaṃ adassāvī ariyadhammassa akovido ariyadhamme avinīto, sappurisānaṃ adassāvī sappurisadhammassa akovido sappurisadhamme avinīto
example_2:

example_2: pañc'ime, bhikkhave, ānisaṃsā dhammassavane. katame pañca? assutaṃ suṇāti, sutaṃ pariyodāpeti, kaṅkhaṃ vitarati, diṭṭhiṃ ujuṃ karoti, cittam'assa pasīdati.

karaṇīyam'atthakusalena yaṃ taṃ santaṃ padaṃ abhisamecca,

example_1:
yassa pāpaṃ kataṃ kammaṃ,
kusalena pidhīyati,
so'maṃ lokaṃ pabhāseti,
abbhā mutto'va candimā.
example_2: sabb'eva tuṇhībhūtā pañjalikā pallaṅkena nisīdanti, yassa'dāni devassa pallaṅkaṃ icchissati brahmā sanaṅkumāro, tassa devassa pallaṅke nisīdissatī'ti.
sbs_example_3: supaṭipanno yassa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho
sbs_example_4:

asokaṃ virajaṃ khemaṃ, etaṃ maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.

yass'āsavā parikkhīṇā, āhāre ca anissito, suññato animitto ca,

example_1: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yathā iṇaṃ yathā rogaṃ yathā bandhan'āgāraṃ yathā dāsabyaṃ yathā kantār'addhānamaggaṃ ime pañca nīvaraṇe appahīne attani samanupassati
example_2:
idha chinditamārite,
hatajānīsu kassapo,
na pāpaṃ samanupassati,
puññaṃ vā pana attano,
sa ve vissāsam'ācikkhi,
satthā arahati mānanan'ti.
sbs_example_3: so yad'eva tattha hoti rūpagataṃ vedanāgataṃ saññāgataṃ saṅkhāragataṃ viññāṇagataṃ te dhamme aniccato dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato parato palokato suññato anattato samanupassati.
sbs_example_4: na rūpaṃ attato samanupassati, na rūpavantaṃ vā attānaṃ, na attani vā rūpaṃ, na rūpasmiṃ vā attānaṃ. ahaṃ rūpaṃ, mama rūpan'ti na pariyuṭṭhaṭṭhāyī hoti.
sbs_example_5: “n’āhaṃ aññaṃ eka-dhammam’pi samanupassāmi yena anuppanno vā byāpādo uppajjati uppanno vā byāpādo bhiyyo-bhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati yatha’y’idaṃ paṭighanimittaṃ.

example_2: idha, gahapati, assutavā puthujjano ariyānaṃ adassāvī ariyadhammassa akovido ariyadhamme avinīto sappurisānaṃ adassāvī sappurisadhammassa akovido sappurisadhamme avinīto rūpaṃ attato samanupassati
sbs_example_3: so vata, cunda, attanā adanto avinīto aparinibbuto paraṃ damessati vinessati parinibbāpessatī'ti n'etaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.

example_2: yesañ'ca mayaṃ cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajja-parikkhāraṃ paribhuñjāma, tesaṃ te kārā amhesu mahapphalā bhavissanti mah'ānisaṃsā

example_2: yañ'hi taṃ, āvuso, sammā vadamāno vadeyya, satthārā anuggahito sāvako mah'ābhiññataṃ patto'ti, mamaṃ taṃ sammā vadamāno vadeyya, satthārā anuggahito sāvako mah'ābhiññataṃ patto'ti.

example_1: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko, pehī'ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā n'eva abhikkamati no paṭikkamati tatth'eva khīlaṭṭhāyī ṭhito hoti. evarūpo'pi, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko hoti. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, sattamo assadoso.
example_2:

labhetha pubb'āpariyaṃ visesaṃ,

adassanaṃ maccurājassa gacche'ti.

meaning_1: ready; workable; suitable for use; functional
example_1: yato ca kho, bhikkhave, adhicittam'anuyutto bhikkhu kālena kālaṃ samādhinimittaṃ manasi karoti, kālena kālaṃ paggahanimittaṃ manasi karoti, kālena kālaṃ upekkhānimittaṃ manasi karoti, taṃ hoti cittaṃ muduñ'ca kammaniyañ'ca pabhassarañ'ca, na ca pabhaṅgu, sammā samādhiyati āsavānaṃ khayāya.
example_2: pañc'ime, bhikkhave, jātarūpassa upakkilesā, yehi upakkilesehi upakkiliṭṭhaṃ jātarūpaṃ na c'eva mudu hoti na ca kammaniyaṃ na ca pabhassaraṃ pabhaṅgu ca na ca sammā upeti kammāya.
sbs_example_3: so evaṃ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigat'ūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte pubbenivās'ānussatiñāṇāya cittaṃ abhininnāmeti.
sbs_example_4: yassa hi so, bhikkhave, atthāya usukāro tejanaṃ dvīsu alātesu ātāpeyya paritāpeyya ujuṃ kareyya kammaniyaṃ sv'āssa attho abhinipphanno hoti.

example_1:

meaning_1: pure; clean; shiny; bright; lit. become pure
example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanakajātiko ādāse vā parisuddhe pariyodāte acche vā udakapatte sakaṃ mukhanimittaṃ paccavekkhamāno
example_2: vippasannāni kho te, gahapati, indriyāni, parisuddho mukhavaṇṇo pariyodāto.

meaning_1: offering (to); gift (to); lit. what is given
example_1:

example_2: tasmiṃ pahīne tasmiṃ byantīkate ath'āparaṃ dhammavitakk'āvasissati. so hoti samādhi na c'eva santo na ca paṇīto nappaṭippassaddhaladdho na ekodibhāv'ādhigato sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagato hoti.

meaning_1: got; acquired; attained; achieved; lit. arrived at
example_1: atthi nu kho me uttari manussadhammo alam'ariyañāṇadassanaviseso adhigato, yen'āhaṃ pacchime kāle sabrahmacārīhi puṭṭho na maṅku bhavissāmī'ti pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ
sbs_chant_eng_1: Ten Subjects for Frequent Recollection by One Who Has Gone Forth
example_2: tasmiṃ pahīne tasmiṃ byantīkate ath'āparaṃ dhammavitakk'āvasissati. so hoti samādhi na c'eva santo na ca paṇīto nappaṭippassaddhaladdho na ekodibhāva-adhigato sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagato hoti.
sbs_example_3: sa kho so, gahapati, ariyasāvako uṭṭhānavīriya-adhigatehi bhogehi bāhābalaparicitehi sed'āvakkhittehi dhammikehi dhammaladdhehi imāni cattāri pattakammāni kattā hoti.

example_1: yadā kho, āvuso, imaṃ kāyaṃ tayo dhammā jahanti, āyu usmā ca viññāṇaṃ, ath'āyaṃ kāyo ujjhito avakkhitto seti, yathā kaṭṭhaṃ acetanan'ti.
example_2: kodhanassa, bhikkhave, purisapuggalassa kodh'ābhibhūtassa kodhaparetassa, ye'pi'ssa te honti bhogā uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatā bāhābalaparicitā seda-avakkhittā dhammikā dhammaladdhā, te'pi rājāno rājakosaṃ pavesenti kodh'ābhibhūtassa.

commentary: (SNa) uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatassā'ti uṭṭhānena ca vīriyena ca adhigatassa bhogassa.
example_1:
yo dhammaladdhassa dadāti dānaṃ,
uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatassa jantu,
atikkamma so vetaraṇiṃ yamassa,
dibbāni ṭhānāni upeti macco'ti.
example_2: kodhanassa, bhikkhave, purisapuggalassa kodh'ābhibhūtassa kodhaparetassa, ye'pi'ssa te honti bhogā uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatā bāhābalaparicitā sed'āvakkhittā dhammikā dhammaladdhā, te'pi rājāno rājakosaṃ pavesenti kodh'ābhibhūtassa.

meaning_1: effort and exertion; get up and go
example_1: so, bhogā me atthi uṭṭhānavīriya-adhigatā bāhābalaparicitā sed'āvakkhittā dhammikā dhammaladdhā'ti adhigacchati sukhaṃ, adhigacchati somanassaṃ. idaṃ vuccati, gahapati, atthisukhaṃ.
example_2: kodhanassa, bhikkhave, purisapuggalassa kodh'ābhibhūtassa kodhaparetassa, ye'pi'ssa te honti bhogā uṭṭhānavīriya-adhigatā bāhābalaparicitā sed'āvakkhittā dhammikā dhammaladdhā, te'pi rājāno rājakosaṃ pavesenti kodh'ābhibhūtassa.

meaning_1: effort; exertion; initiative; activity; lit. standing up
example_1:
uṭṭhānen'appamādena,
saṃyamena damena ca,
dīpaṃ kayirātha medhāvī,
yaṃ ogho n'ābhikīrati.
example_2: uṭṭhānaṃ anālasyaṃ bhogānaṃ āhāro, maṇḍanā vibhūsanā vaṇṇassa āhāro, sappāyakiriyā ārogyassa āhāro, kalyāṇamittatā sīlānaṃ āhāro
sbs_example_3: sa kho so, gahapati, ariyasāvako uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatehi bhogehi bāhābalaparicitehi sed'āvakkhittehi dhammikehi dhammaladdhehi imāni cattāri pattakammāni kattā hoti.
sbs_example_4: so socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati, sammohaṃ āpajjati, moghaṃ vata me uṭṭhānaṃ, aphalo vata me vāyāmo'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: well; safe; secure; at peace; at rest
example_1:
susukhaṃ vata nibbānaṃ,
sammāsambuddhadesitaṃ,
asokaṃ virajaṃ khemaṃ,
yattha dukkhaṃ nirujjhatī'ti.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso addhānamaggappaṭipanno. so passeyya mahantaṃ udak'aṇṇavaṃ, orimaṃ tīraṃ sāsaṅkaṃ sappaṭibhayaṃ, pārimaṃ tīraṃ khemaṃ appaṭibhayaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
phuṭṭhassa lokadhammehi, cittaṃ yassa na kampati.
asokaṃ virajaṃ khemaṃ, etaṃ maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: charming (to); pleasant (to); desirable; agreeable (to); lit. desired
example_1:
rūpā saddā rasā gandhā,
phassā dhammā ca kevalā,
iṭṭhā kantā manāpā ca,
yāvat'atthī'ti vuccati.
example_2: pañca kho ime, sunakkhatta, kāmaguṇā. katame pañca? cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kām'ūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā
sbs_example_3: pharusaṃ vācaṃ pahāya pharusāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, yā sā vācā n'elā kaṇṇasukhā pemanīyā hadayaṅ'gamā porī bahujanakantā bahujanamanāpā tathārūpiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti
sbs_example_4: cakkhuviññeyyānaṃ rūpānaṃ iṭṭhānaṃ kantānaṃ manāpānaṃ manoramānaṃ lok'āmisapaṭisaṃyuttānaṃ paṭilābhaṃ vā paṭilābhato samanupassato
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yadā tumhe attanā'va jāneyyātha, ime dhammā kusalā, ime dhammā anavajjā, ime dhammā viññuppasatthā, ime dhammā samattā samādinnā hitāya sukhāya saṃvattantī'ti, atha tumhe upasampajja vihareyyātha.
example_2: sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā saṃkhittena dhammaṃ desetu, yam'ahaṃ bhagavato dhammaṃ sutvā ekā vūpakaṭṭhā appamattā ātāpinī pahit'attā vihareyyan'ti.
sbs_example_3: paṭikūlañ'ca appaṭikūlañ'ca tad'ubhayaṃ abhinivajjetvā upekkhako vihareyyaṃ sato sampajāno'ti, upekkhako tattha viharati sato sampajāno.

commentary: (SNa) santuṭṭho'ti catūsu paccayesu yathālābhasantoso yathābalasantoso yathāsāruppasantoso'ti, imehi tīhi santosehi samannāgato.
example_1: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, santuṭṭhā bhavissāma itarītarena cīvarena, itarītaracīvarasantuṭṭhiyā ca vaṇṇavādino, na ca cīvarahetu anesanaṃ appatirūpaṃ āpajjissāma.
example_2: santuṭṭhassa-ayaṃ dhammo n'āyaṃ dhammo asantuṭṭhassa
sbs_example_3: pakkhī sakuṇo yena yen'eva ḍeti, sapattabhāro'va ḍeti. evam'eva kho bhikkhu santuṭṭho hoti kāyaparihārikena cīvarena kucchiparihārikena piṇḍapātena.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: unconditioned; not created; unformed; unconstructed; epithet of Nibbāna; (comm) not made
example_1: tīṇ'imāni, bhikkhave, asaṅkhatassa asaṅkhatalakkhaṇāni. katamāni tīṇi? na uppādo paññāyati, na vayo paññāyati, na ṭhitassa aññathattaṃ paññāyati. imāni kho, bhikkhave, tīṇi asaṅkhatassa asaṅkhatalakkhaṇānī'ti.
example_2: yo, bhikkhave, rāgakkhayo dosakkhayo mohakkhayo, idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, asaṅkhataṃ.
sbs_example_3: no ce'taṃ abhavissa ajātaṃ abhūtaṃ akataṃ asaṅkhataṃ na'y'idha jātassa bhūtassa katassa saṅkhatassa nissaraṇaṃ paññāyetha.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, āvuso, bhikkhu paṃsukūliko rathiyāya nantakaṃ disvā vāmena pādena niggaṇhitvā dakkhiṇena pādena pattharitvā, yo tattha sāro taṃ paripātetvā ādāya pakkameyya.
example_2:
sārañ'ca sārato ñatvā,
asārañ'ca asārato,
te sāraṃ adhigacchanti,
sammāsaṅkappagocarā.
sbs_example_3: niggayha niggayh'āhaṃ, ānanda, vakkhāmi, pavayha pavayha, ānanda, vakkhāmi. yo sāro so ṭhassatī'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: fulfilled the holy life; completed the spiritual journey; epithet of an arahant
example_1:
paroparā yassa samecca dhammā,
vidhūpitā atthagatā na santi,
sa ve muni vusitabrahmacariyo,
lok'antagū pāragato'ti vuccatī'ti.
example_2:
saccena danto damasā upeto,
vedantagū vusitabrahmacariyo,
yaññ'opanīto tam'upavhayetha,
kālena so juhati dakkhiṇeyye'ti.
sbs_example_3: nibbindaṃ virajjati, virāgā vimuccati. vimuttasmiṃ vimuttam'iti ñāṇaṃ hoti. 'khīṇā jāti vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ n'āparaṃ itthattāyā'ti pajānātī'ti.
sbs_chant_eng_3: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_4:
tasmā have lokavidū sumedho,
lok'antagū vusitabrahmacariyo.

example_1: evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako ... viññāṇasmiṃ nibbindati, nibbidā virajjati, virāgā vimuccati, vimuttasmiṃ vimuttam'iti ñāṇaṃ hoti.
example_2:
accī yathā vātavegena khittā,
atthaṃ paleti na upeti saṅkhaṃ,
evaṃ munī nāmakāyā vimutto,
atthaṃ paleti na upeti saṅkhaṃ.
sbs_example_3: nibbindaṃ virajjati, virāgā vimuccati. vimuttasmiṃ vimuttam'iti ñāṇaṃ hoti. 'khīṇā jāti vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ n'āparaṃ itthattāyā'ti pajānātī'ti.

sbs_example_4: atha pacchāpure asaṃkhittaṃ vimuttaṃ appaṇihitan'ti pajānāti. atha ca pana kāye kāy'ānupassī viharāmi ātāpī sampajāno satimā sukham'asmī'ti pajānāti.

meaning_1: becomes detached (from); loses interest (in); becomes dispassionate (towards); gets bored (with)
example_1: rañño'pi kho, bhikkhave, pasenadissa kosalassa atth'eva aññathattaṃ atthi vipariṇāmo. evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako tasmim'pi nibbindati. tasmiṃ nibbindanto agge virajjati, pag'eva hīnasmiṃ.
example_2:
dhono na hi tena maññati,
yadidaṃ diṭṭhasutaṃ mutesu vā,
n'āññena visuddhim'icchati,
na hi so rajjati no virajjatī'ti.
sbs_example_3: nibbindaṃ virajjati, virāgā vimuccati. vimuttasmiṃ vimuttam'iti ñāṇaṃ hoti. 'khīṇā jāti vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ n'āparaṃ itthattāyā'ti pajānātī'ti.

example_1:
sārañ'ca sārato ñatvā,
asārañ'ca asārato,
te sāraṃ adhigacchanti,
sammāsaṅkappagocarā.
example_2: ayam'eva ariyo aṭṭh'aṅgiko maggo rūpanirodhagāminī paṭipadā, seyyath'idaṃ sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākamm'anto sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati sammāsamādhi.
sbs_example_3: nekkhammasaṅkappo abyāpādasaṅkappo avihiṃsāsaṅkappo, ayaṃ vuccati bhikkhave, sammāsaṅkappo.

example_1: so atthi idaṃ, atthi hīnaṃ, atthi paṇītaṃ, atthi imassa saññāgatassa uttariṃ nissaraṇan'ti pajānāti.
example_2:
passāmi loke pariphandamānaṃ,
pajaṃ imaṃ taṇhagataṃ bhavesu,
hīnā narā maccumukhe lapanti,
avītataṇhāse bhav'ābhavesu.
sbs_example_3: na, bhikkhave, hīnena aggassa patti hoti. aggena ca kho, bhikkhave, aggassa patti hoti.
sbs_example_4: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, yaṃ kiñci rūpaṃ atīt'ānāgatapaccuppannaṃ ajjhattaṃ vā bahiddhā vā oḷārikaṃ vā sukhumaṃ vā hīnaṃ vā paṇītaṃ vā yaṃ dūre santike vā

meaning_1: abundant; full of; lit. lots of
example_1: yā tesaṃ'y'eva dhammānaṃ āsevanā bhāvanā bahulīkammaṃ, ayaṃ ettha samādhibhāvanā'ti.
example_2: ānāpānassatisamādhi, bhikkhave, ekadhammo bhāvito bahulīkato cattāro satipaṭṭhāne paripūreti, cattāro satipaṭṭhānā bhāvitā bahulīkatā satta bojjh'aṅge paripūrenti, satta bojjh'aṅgā bhāvitā bahulīkatā vijjāvimuttiṃ paripūrentī'ti.
sbs_example_3: mettāya cetovimuttiyā āsevitāya bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya susamāraddhāya ekādas'ānisaṃsā pāṭikaṅkhā.

meaning_1: delightful; pleasant; attractive; lit. mind pleasing
example_1:
yathā saṅkāraṭhānasmiṃ,
ujjhitasmiṃ mahāpathe,
padumaṃ tattha jāyetha,
sucigandhaṃ manoramaṃ.
example_2:
dhī taṃ jammi jare atthu,
dubbaṇṇakaraṇī jare,
tāva manoramaṃ bimbaṃ,
jarāya abhimadditaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
kāmā hi citrā madhurā manoramā, virūparūpena mathenti cittaṃ.
ādīnavaṃ kāmaguṇesu disvā, tasmā ahaṃ pabbajito'mhi rāja.
sbs_example_4: cakkhuviññeyyānaṃ rūpānaṃ iṭṭhānaṃ kantānaṃ manāpānaṃ manoramānaṃ lok'āmisapaṭisaṃyuttānaṃ paṭilābhaṃ vā paṭilābhato samanupassato

meaning_1: and there would be; but there would be; and there might be
example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso addhānamaggappaṭipanno. so passeyya mahantaṃ udak'aṇṇavaṃ ... na c'assa nāvā santāraṇī uttarasetu vā apārā pāraṃ gamanāya.
example_2:
yassa siyā sabbadā sati,
satataṃ kāyagatā upaṭṭhitā,
no c'assa no ca me siyā,
na bhavissati na ca me bhavissati,
anupubbavihāri tattha so,
kālen'eva tare visattikan'ti.
sbs_example_3:
karaṇīyam'atthakusalena, yaṃ taṃ santaṃ padaṃ abhisamecca,
sakko ujū ca suhujū ca, suvaco c'assa mudu, anatimānī.
sbs_example_4: kesu na mānaṃ kayirātha, kesu c'assa sagāravo. ky'assa apacitā assu, ky'assu sādhu supūjitā'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: immediate; (comm) giving immediate fruit; lit. not related to time
commentary: (SNa) attano phaladānaṃ sandhāya n'āssa kālo'ti akālo, akālo'y'eva akāliko.
example_1: dhamme aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti, svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhī'ti
example_2: so navañ'ca kammaṃ na karoti, purāṇañ'ca kammaṃ phussa phussa byantīkaroti, sandiṭṭhikā nijjarā akālikā ehipassikā opaneyyikā paccattaṃ veditabbā viññūhi.
sbs_example_3: iminā tvaṃ dhammena diṭṭhena viditena akālikena pattena pariyogāḷhena atīt'ānāgate nayaṃ nehi
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bālo abyatto asappuriso khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati sāvajjo ca hoti sānuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ bahuñ'ca apuññaṃ pasavati
example_2:
evam'pi viggayha vivādayanti,
bālo paro akusalo'ti c'āhu,
sacco nu vādo katamo imesaṃ,
sabb'eva h'īme kusalā vadānā.
sbs_example_3: iminā puññakammena mā me bālasamāgamo. sataṃ samāgamo hotu, yāva nibbānapattiyā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: puna caparaṃ, mahānāma, ariyasāvako attano sīlāni anussarati akhaṇḍāni acchiddāni asabalāni akammāsāni bhujissāni viññuppasatthāni aparāmaṭṭhāni samādhisaṃvattanikāni.
example_2: taṃ kiṃ maññatha, kālāmā, ime dhammā kusalā vā akusalā vā'ti? akusalā, bhante. sāvajjā vā anavajjā vā'ti? sāvajjā, bhante. viññugarahitā vā viññuppasatthā vā'ti? viññugarahitā, bhante.
sbs_example_3: ime dhammā kusalā, ime dhammā anavajjā, ime dhammā viññuppasatthā, ime dhammā samattā samādinnā hitāya sukhāya saṃvattantī'ti

meaning_1: basis for opinion; grounds for view; standpoint for views
commentary: (ANa) yāvatā diṭṭhiṭṭhānan'ti khandhā'pi diṭṭhiṭṭhānaṃ, avijjā'pi, phasso'pi, saññā'pi, vitakko'pi ayonisomanasikāro'pi, pāpamitto'pi, paratoghoso'pi diṭṭhiṭṭhānan'ti evaṃ yattakaṃ aṭṭhavidham'pi diṭṭhiṭṭhānaṃ diṭṭhikāraṇaṃ nāma atthi.
example_1: attani ca, bhikkhave, attaniye ca saccato thetato anupalabbhamāne, yam'pi taṃ diṭṭhiṭṭhānaṃ, so loko so attā, so pecca bhavissāmi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo, sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassāmī'ti, nan'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, kevalo paripūro bāladhammo'ti?
example_2: so suṇāti tathāgatassa vā tathāgatasāvakassa vā sabbesaṃ diṭṭhiṭṭhāna-adhiṭṭhāna-pariyuṭṭhāna-abhinivesa-anusayānaṃ samugghātāya sabbasaṅkhārasamathāya sabb'ūpadhipaṭinissaggāya taṇhākkhayāya virāgāya nirodhāya nibbānāya dhammaṃ desentassa.
sbs_example_3: ime diṭṭhiṭṭhānā evaṃgahitā evaṃparāmaṭṭhā evaṃgatikā bhavanti evaṃabhisamparāyā'ti, tañ'ca tathāgato pajānāti,

meaning_1: disciple of the noble ones; a noble disciple
example_1: kittāvatā nu kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako sammādiṭṭhi hoti
example_2: idha, gahapati, sutavā ariyasāvako ariyānaṃ dassāvī ariyadhammassa kovido ariyadhamme suvinīto sappurisānaṃ dassāvī sappurisadhammassa kovido sappurisadhamme suvinīto na rūpaṃ attato samanupassati
sbs_example_3: idha bhikkhave ariyasāvako micchāājīvaṃ pahāya sammāājīvena jīvitaṃ kappeti, ayaṃ vuccati bhikkhave sammāājīvo.
sbs_example_4: tiṭṭhanti kho pana, bhikkhave, tatth'eva pañc'indriyāni. ath'ettha sutavato ariyasāvakassa avijjā pahīyati, vijjā uppajjati.
sbs_example_5: sa kho so, gahapati, ariyasāvako uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatehi bhogehi bāhābalaparicitehi sed'āvakkhittehi dhammikehi dhammaladdhehi imāni cattāri pattakammāni kattā hoti.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, āvuso, dakkho goghātako vā goghātak'antevāsī vā tiṇhena govikantanena kucchiṃ parikanteyya, evam'eva kho adhimattā vātā kucchiṃ parikantanti.
example_2: so santuṭṭho hoti kāyaparihārikena cīvarena kucchiparihārikena piṇḍapātena so yena yen'eva pakkamati samādāy'eva pakkamati

meaning_1: well taught; well preached; well explained
commentary:
(DNa) svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo'ti suṭṭhu akkhāto sukathito niyyāniko maggo phalatthāya niyyāti rāgadosamohanimmadanasamattho.
(ANa) svākkhāte'ti suṭṭhu akkhāte sudesite.
example_1: dhamme aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti, svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhī'ti.
example_2: evañ'h'etaṃ, bhikkhave, hoti yathā taṃ svākkhāte dhammavinaye suppavedite niyyānike upasamasaṃvattanike sammāsambuddhappavedite.
sbs_example_3: evaṃ svākkhāto, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo uttāno vivaṭo pakāsito chinnapilotiko.

example_1:
phuṭṭhassa lokadhammehi,
cittaṃ yassa na kampati,
asokaṃ virajaṃ khemaṃ,
etaṃ maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.
example_2:
jhāyiṃ virajam'āsīnaṃ,
katakiccaṃ anāsavaṃ,
pāraguṃ sabbadhammānaṃ,
atthi pañhena āgamaṃ,
aññāvimokkhaṃ pabrūhi,
avijjāya pabhedanaṃ.
sbs_example_3: evam'eva tesaṃ caturāsītipāṇasahassānaṃ tasmiṃ'y'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi

commentary:
(DNa) dukkhitan'ti rogadukkhena dukkhitaṃ.
(UDa) dukkhito'ti kāyasannissitaṃ dukkhaṃ sañjātaṃ assā'ti dukkhito, dukkhappatto'ti attho.
example_1: seyyathā'pi bhikkhave puriso ābādhiko assa dukkhito bāḷhagilāno
example_2: ambho purisa, na tvaṃ addasa manussesu itthiṃ vā purisaṃ vā ābādhikaṃ dukkhitaṃ bāḷhagilānaṃ, sake muttakarīse palipannaṃ semānaṃ, aññehi vuṭṭhāpiyamānaṃ, aññehi saṃvesiyamānan'ti?
sbs_example_3: ekasmiṃ samaye nātho moggallānañ'ca kassapaṃ gilāne dukkhite disvā, bojjh'aṅge satta desayi. te ca taṃ abhinanditvā rogā mucciṃsu taṅ'khaṇe.

example_1: taggha'si, tāta kumma, khato, taggha upahato. etena hi te, tāta kumma, suttakena pitaro ca pitāmahā ca anayaṃ āpannā byasanaṃ āpannā. gaccha dāni tvaṃ, tāta kumma, na dāni tvaṃ amhākan'ti.
example_2: tena kho pana samayena bhagavato pādo sakalikāya khato hoti.
sbs_example_3: dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bālo abyatto asappuriso khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati sāvajjo ca hoti sānuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ bahuñ'ca apuññaṃ pasavati
sbs_example_4: evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tīhi aṅgehi samannāgato pāpabhikkhu khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati, sāvajjo ca hoti sānuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ, bahuñ'ca apuññaṃ pasavati. katamehi tīhi?

meaning_1: bad man; foolish man; unethical man; inferior man; person of no integrity
example_1: sabhayo c'eso maggo sappaṭibhayo ca sakaṇṭako ca sagahano ca ummaggo ca kummaggo ca duhitiko ca. asappurisasevito c'eso maggo, na c'eso maggo sappurisehi sevito.
example_2: ko c'āhāro asaddhammassavanassa? asappurisasaṃsevo'ti'ssa vacanīyaṃ
sbs_example_3: dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bālo abyatto asappuriso khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati sāvajjo ca hoti sānuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ bahuñ'ca apuññaṃ pasavati

meaning_1: inexperienced; incompetent; inept untrained; lit. undistinguished
construction: na > a + vi > vy > by + √añj + ta
example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gāvī pabbateyyā bālā abyattā akhettaññū akusalā visame pabbate carituṃ.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, bālo abyatto akusalo sūdo rājānaṃ vā rājamahāmattaṃ vā nānaccayehi sūpehi paccupaṭṭhito assa.
sbs_example_3: dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bālo abyatto asappuriso khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati sāvajjo ca hoti sānuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ bahuñ'ca apuññaṃ pasavati

example_1:
ehi sārathi gacchāhi,
rathaṃ niyyādayāh'imaṃ,
ārogyaṃ brāhmaṇiṃ vajja,
pabbaji dāni brāhmaṇo,
sujāto tīhi rattīhi,
tisso vijjā aphassayi.
example_2:
sace enti manussattaṃ,
dalidde jāyare kule,
coḷaṃ piṇḍo ratī khiḍḍā,
yattha kicchena labbhati.
sbs_example_3:
diṭṭhiñ'ca anupaggamma, sīlavā dassanena sampanno,
kāmesu vineyya gedhaṃ, na hi jātu gabbhaseyyaṃ punar'etī'ti.

ye ca kho samma'd'akkhāte, dhamme dhamm'ānuvattino,

example_1:
amosadhammaṃ nibbānaṃ,
tadariyā saccato vidū,
te ve sacc'ābhisamayā,
nicchātā parinibbutā'ti.
example_2: attani ca, bhikkhave, attaniye ca saccato thetato anupalabbhamāne, yam'pi taṃ diṭṭhiṭṭhānaṃ, so loko so attā, so pecca bhavissāmi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo, sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassāmī'ti, nan'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, kevalo paripūro bāladhammo'ti?

meaning_1: conqueror; victor; champion; epithet of the Buddha
example_1:
jinaṃ vandatha gotamaṃ,
jinaṃ vandāma gotamaṃ
vijjācaraṇasampannaṃ,
buddhaṃ vandāma gotamaṃ.
example_2:
aparimeyyito kappe,
caturo āsuṃ vināyakā,
taṇhaṅkaro medhaṅkaro,
atho'pi saraṇaṅkaro,
dīpaṅkaro ca sambuddho,
ekakappamhi te jinā.
sbs_example_3: catur'āsītisahassadhammakkhandh'ānubhāvena piṭakattay'ānubhavena jinasāvak'ānubhāvena
sbs_example_4:
satthā ca me lokam'imaṃ adhiṭṭhahi,
aniccato addhuvato asārato,
pakkhanda maṃ citta jinassa sāsane,
tārehi oghā mahatā suduttarā.
sbs_example_5:
kusalānañ'ca dhammānaṃ, paññāya ca parikkhayā.
sabb'ākāravar'ūpetaṃ, lujjate jinasāsanaṃ.

example_1: tena kho pana samayena bhagavā bhikkhū nibbānapaṭisaṃyuttāya dhammiyā kathāya sandasseti samādapeti samuttejeti sampahaṃseti
example_2: āneñjapaṭisaṃyuttāya ca pana kathāya kacchamānāya na sussūsati, na sotaṃ odahati, na aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhāpeti, na ca taṃ purisaṃ bhajati, na ca tena vittiṃ āpajjati.
sbs_example_3: cakkhuviññeyyānaṃ rūpānaṃ iṭṭhānaṃ kantānaṃ manāpānaṃ manoramānaṃ lok'āmisapaṭisaṃyuttānaṃ paṭilābhaṃ vā paṭilābhato samanupassato
sbs_example_4: tatra bhikkhu vivekaninnena cittena vivekapoṇena vivekapabbhārena vivekaṭṭhena nekkhamm'ābhiratena aññadatthu uyyojanikapaṭisaṃyuttaṃy'eva kathaṃ kattā hoti

meaning_1: worldliness; material pleasure; worldly pleasure; material delight; lit. flesh of the world
commentary: (SNa) lok'āmisan'ti dve lok'āmisā pariyāyena ca nippariyāyena ca. pariyāyena tebhūmakavaṭṭaṃ lok'āmisaṃ, nippariyāyena cattāro paccayā. idha pariyāyalok'āmisaṃ adhippetaṃ.
example_1:
santakāyo santavāco,
santavā susamāhito,
vantalok'āmiso bhikkhu,
upasanto'ti vuccati.
example_2:
upanīyati jīvitam'appam'āyu,
jar'ūpanītassa na santi tāṇā,
etaṃ bhayaṃ maraṇe pekkhamāno,
lok'āmisaṃ pajahe santipekkho'ti.
sbs_example_3: cakkhuviññeyyānaṃ rūpānaṃ iṭṭhānaṃ kantānaṃ manāpānaṃ manoramānaṃ lok'āmisapaṭisaṃyuttānaṃ paṭilābhaṃ vā paṭilābhato samanupassato
sbs_example_4: evam'etaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya disvā y'āyaṃ upekkhā nānattā nānattasitā taṃ abhinivajjetvā, y'āyaṃ upekkhā ekattā ekattasitā yattha sabbaso lok'āmis'ūpādānā aparisesā nirujjhanti tam'ev'ūpekkhaṃ bhāveti.

meaning_1: pleasing; likeable; cherished; wished for; lit. wished
example_1: dīgharattaṃ kho maṃ tvaṃ, devi, iṭṭhehi kantehi piyehi manāpehi samudācarittha, atha ca pana maṃ tvaṃ pacchime kāle aniṭṭhehi akantehi appiyehi amanāpehi samudācarasī'ti
example_2: pañca kho ime, sunakkhatta, kāmaguṇā. katame pañca? cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kām'ūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā
sbs_example_3: cakkhuviññeyyānaṃ rūpānaṃ iṭṭhānaṃ kantānaṃ manāpānaṃ manoramānaṃ lok'āmisapaṭisaṃyuttānaṃ paṭilābhaṃ vā paṭilābhato samanupassato
sbs_example_4: katamo ca, bhikkhave, piyehi vippayogo dukkho? idha yassa te honti iṭṭhā kantā manāpā rūpā saddā gandhā rasā phoṭṭhabbā dhammā

example_1: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā gayāyaṃ viharati gayāsīse saddhiṃ bhikkhusahassena. tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, sabbaṃ, bhikkhave, ādittaṃ.
example_2:
ādittasmiṃ agārasmiṃ,
yaṃ nīharati bhājanaṃ,
taṃ tassa hoti atthāya,
no ca yaṃ tattha ḍayhati.
sbs_example_3: cakkhuṃ bhikkhave ādittaṃ, rūpā ādittā, cakkhuviññāṇaṃ ādittaṃ, cakkhusamphasso āditto.
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi ādittacelo vā ādittasīso vā, tass'eva celassa vā sīsassa vā nibbāpanāya adhimattaṃ chandañ'ca vāyāmañ'ca ussāhañ'ca ussoḷhiñ'ca appaṭivāniñ'ca satiñ'ca sampajaññañ'ca kareyya.

meaning_1: justly acquired; honestly gained; legally obtained; legitimately acquired
commentary: (SNa) dhammaladdhassā'ti dhammena samena laddhassa bhogassa dhammaladdhassa ca puggalassa.
example_1:
yo dhammaladdhassa dadāti dānaṃ,
uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatassa jantu,
atikkamma so vetaraṇiṃ yamassa,
dibbāni ṭhānāni upeti macco'ti.
example_2: kodhanassa, bhikkhave, purisapuggalassa kodh'ābhibhūtassa kodhaparetassa, ye'pi'ssa te honti bhogā uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatā bāhābalaparicitā sed'āvakkhittā dhammikā dhammaladdhā, te'pi rājāno rājakosaṃ pavesenti kodh'ābhibhūtassa.
sbs_example_3: bhikkhu ye te lābhā dhammikā dhammaladdhā antamaso pattapariyāpannamattam'pi, tathārūpehi lābhehi appaṭivibhattabhogī hoti sīlavantehi sabrahmacārīhi sādhāraṇabhogī.
sbs_example_4: sa kho so, gahapati, ariyasāvako uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatehi bhogehi bāhābalaparicitehi sed'āvakkhittehi dhammikehi dhammaladdhehi imāni cattāri pattakammāni kattā hoti.

meaning_1: righteous; just; lit. according to the Dhamma
example_1: sace agāraṃ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato. tass'imāni satta ratanāni bhavanti
example_2:
na attahetu na parassa hetu,
na puttam'icche na dhanaṃ na raṭṭhaṃ,
na iccheyya adhammena samiddhim'attano,
sa sīlavā paññavā dhammiko siyā.
sbs_example_3: bhikkhu ye te lābhā dhammikā dhammaladdhā antamaso pattapariyāpannamattam'pi, tathārūpehi lābhehi appaṭivibhattabhogī hoti sīlavantehi sabrahmacārīhi sādhāraṇabhogī.
sbs_example_4: sa kho so, gahapati, ariyasāvako uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatehi bhogehi bāhābalaparicitehi sed'āvakkhittehi dhammikehi dhammaladdhehi imāni cattāri pattakammāni kattā hoti.

anuvicca suve suve,

example_1:

yantaṃ santaṃ padaṃ abhisamecca,
sakko ujū ca sūjū ca,
suvaco c'assa mudu anatimānī.
example_2:

meaning_1: present; in attendance; available; lit. stood near
example_1:

satataṃ bhikkhu samāhito,
jaññā nibbānam'attano'ti.
example_2: kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, saṃvaro hoti? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā piyarūpe rūpe n'ādhimuccati, appiyarūpe rūpe na byāpajjati, upaṭṭhitakāyassati ca viharati appamāṇacetaso

meaning_1: practised; rehearsed; consolidated; familiarized; lit. piled up; accumulated
commentary:
(MNa) paricitāyā'ti paricayakatāya.
(ANa) vacasā paricitā'ti suttadasaka-vaggadasaka-paṇṇāsadasaka-vasena vācāya sajjhāyitā.
(ANa) paricitā'ti samantato citā ācitā upacitā.
example_1: yassa kassaci, ānanda, cattāro iddhipādā bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā so ākaṅkhamāno kappaṃ vā tiṭṭheyya kappāvasesaṃ vā
example_2: daḷhe khīle vā thambhe vā'ti kho, bhikkhave, kāyagatāya satiyā etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. tasmā't'iha vo, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, kāyagatā no sati bhāvitā bhavissati bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā'ti.
sbs_example_3: āhāre paṭikūlasaññāparicitena, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno cetasā bahulaṃ viharato, rasataṇhāya cittaṃ patilīyati patikuṭati pativattati, na sampasāriyati, upekkhā vā pāṭikulyatā vā saṇṭhāti.
sbs_example_4: sa kho so, gahapati, ariyasāvako uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatehi bhogehi bāhābalaparicitehi sed'āvakkhittehi dhammikehi dhammaladdhehi imāni cattāri pattakammāni kattā hoti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
sa ve vidvā sa vedagū,
ñatvā dhammaṃ anissito,
sammā so loke iriyāno,
na pihet'īdha kassaci.
example_2:
etesu dhammesu vineyya chandaṃ,
bhikkhu satimā suvimuttacitto,
kālena so sammā dhammaṃ parivīmaṃsamāno,
ekodibhūto vihane tamaṃ so'ti.
sbs_example_3: ayam'eva ariyo aṭṭh'aṅgiko maggo seyyath'īdaṃ sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākamm'anto sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati sammāsamādhi.
sbs_example_4:
ye ca kho samma'd'akkhāte, dhamme dhamm'ānuvattino,
te janā pāram'essanti, maccudheyyaṃ suduttaraṃ.
sbs_example_5: yo nu kho evaṃ vadeyya, kāḷo balībaddo odātassa balībaddassa saṃyojanaṃ, odāto balībaddo kāḷassa balībaddassa saṃyojanan'ti, sammā nu kho so vadamāno vadeyyā'ti?
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: pabbatakandarapadarasākhāparipūrā kusubbhe paripūrenti, kusubbhā paripūrā mahāsobbhe paripūrenti, mahāsobbhā paripūrā, kunnadiyo paripūrenti, kunnadiyo paripūrā mahānadiyo paripūrenti, mahānadiyo paripūrā mahāsamuddaṃ paripūrenti
example_2: imehi kho, bhikkhave, dasahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu samantapāsādiko ca hoti sabb'ākāraparipūro cā'ti.
sbs_example_3: attani ca, bhikkhave, attaniye ca saccato thetato anupalabbhamāne, yam'pi taṃ diṭṭhiṭṭhānaṃ, so loko so attā, so pecca bhavissāmi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo, sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassāmī'ti, nan'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, kevalo paripūro bāladhammo'ti?
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: for ever and ever; eternally; lit. like eternity
example_1: atha vā pan'assa evaṃ diṭṭhi hoti, yo me ayaṃ attā vado vedeyyo tatra tatra kalyāṇapāpakānaṃ kammānaṃ vipākaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti so kho pana me ayaṃ attā nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassatī'ti
example_2: atha kho bhagavā parittaṃ gomayapiṇḍaṃ pāṇinā gahetvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca. ettako'pi kho, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho n'atthi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassati.
sbs_example_3: attani ca, bhikkhave, attaniye ca saccato thetato anupalabbhamāne, yam'pi taṃ diṭṭhiṭṭhānaṃ, so loko so attā, so pecca bhavissāmi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo, sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassāmī'ti, nan'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, kevalo paripūro bāladhammo'ti?
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: with unchanging nature; of stable condition
commentary: (MNa) avipariṇāmadhammo'ti attano pakatibhāvaṃ avijahanadhammo, kakaṇṭako viya nānappakārataṃ n'āpajjati.
example_1: atha vā pan'assa evaṃ diṭṭhi hoti, yo me ayaṃ attā vado vedeyyo tatra tatra kalyāṇapāpakānaṃ kammānaṃ vipākaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti so kho pana me ayaṃ attā nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassatī'ti
example_2: atha kho bhagavā parittaṃ gomayapiṇḍaṃ pāṇinā gahetvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca. ettako'pi kho, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho n'atthi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassati.
sbs_example_3: attani ca, bhikkhave, attaniye ca saccato thetato anupalabbhamāne, yam'pi taṃ diṭṭhiṭṭhānaṃ, so loko so attā, so pecca bhavissāmi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo, sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassāmī'ti, nan'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, kevalo paripūro bāladhammo'ti?

meaning_1: eternal; everlasting; endless; perpetual; (comm) existing forever
example_1:
ākāse'va padaṃ n'atthi,
samaṇo n'atthi bāhire,
saṅkhārā sassatā n'atthi,
n'atthi buddhānam'iñjitaṃ.
example_2: atha kho bhagavā parittaṃ gomayapiṇḍaṃ pāṇinā gahetvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca. ettako'pi kho, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho n'atthi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassati.
sbs_example_3: attani ca, bhikkhave, attaniye ca saccato thetato anupalabbhamāne, yam'pi taṃ diṭṭhiṭṭhānaṃ, so loko so attā, so pecca bhavissāmi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo, sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassāmī'ti, nan'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, kevalo paripūro bāladhammo'ti?
sbs_example_4: so'haṃ ajja kathaṃ vajjaṃ, ahaṃ nicco'mhi sassato.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: atthi nu kho bhante kiñci rūpaṃ yaṃ rūpaṃ niccaṃ dhuvaṃ sassataṃ avipariṇāmadhammaṃ sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassati
example_2: kiñca, bhikkhave, n'atthisammataṃ loke paṇḍitānaṃ, yam'ahaṃ n'atthī'ti vadāmi? viññāṇaṃ niccaṃ dhuvaṃ sassataṃ avipariṇāmadhammaṃ n'atthisammataṃ loke paṇḍitānaṃ, aham'pi taṃ n'atthī'ti vadāmi.
sbs_example_3: attani ca, bhikkhave, attaniye ca saccato thetato anupalabbhamāne, yam'pi taṃ diṭṭhiṭṭhānaṃ, so loko so attā, so pecca bhavissāmi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo, sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassāmī'ti, nan'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, kevalo paripūro bāladhammo'ti?
sbs_example_4: ettako'pi kho, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho n'atthi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: one's own; belonging to oneself; fit to be a self
example_1: kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, suñño loko'ti vuccatī'ti? yasmā ca kho, ānanda, suññaṃ attena vā attaniyena vā tasmā suñño loko'ti vuccati.
example_2: attani vā, bhikkhave, sati attaniyaṃ me'ti assā'ti? evaṃ, bhante. attaniye vā, bhikkhave, sati attā me'ti assā'ti? evaṃ, bhante.
sbs_example_3: attani ca, bhikkhave, attaniye ca saccato thetato anupalabbhamāne, yam'pi taṃ diṭṭhiṭṭhānaṃ, so loko so attā, so pecca bhavissāmi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo, sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassāmī'ti, nan'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, kevalo paripūro bāladhammo'ti?
sbs_example_4: api nu tumhākaṃ evam'assa, amhe jano harati vā ḍahati vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karotī'ti? no hetaṃ, bhante. taṃ kissa hetu? na hi no etaṃ, bhante, attā vā attaniyaṃ vā'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: atha kho bhagavā acirapakkantesu pāṭaligāmikesu upāsakesu suññ'āgāraṃ pāvisi
example_2: ahaṃ kho, āvuso, navo acirapabbajito adhun'āgato imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ. na t'āhaṃ sakkomi vitthārena ācikkhituṃ.
sbs_example_3: atha kho acirapakkantassa bhagavato bāhiyaṃ dārucīriyaṃ gāvī taruṇavacchā adhipatitvā jīvitā voropesi.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, ādittacelo vā ādittasīso vā, tass'eva celassa vā sīsassa vā nibbāpanāya adhimattaṃ chandañ'ca vāyāmañ'ca ussāhañ'ca ussoḷhiñ'ca appaṭivāniñ'ca satiñ'ca sampajaññañ'ca kareyya.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, rāhula, rañño nāgo īsādanto urūḷhavā abhijāto saṅgām'āvacaro saṅgāmagato purimehi'pi pādehi kammaṃ karoti ... sīsena'pi kammaṃ karoti, kaṇṇehi'pi kammaṃ karoti
sbs_example_3: aparājitapallaṅke, sīse paṭhavipokkhare, abhiseke sabbabuddhānaṃ, aggappatto pamodati.
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanakajātiko sīsaṃ nhāto ahikuṇapena vā kukkurakuṇapena vā manussakuṇapena vā kaṇṭhe āsattena aṭṭīyeyya harāyeyya jiguccheyya.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, dantebhi dantam'ādhāya jivhāya tāluṃ āhacca cetasā cittaṃ abhiniggaṇhato abhinippīḷayato abhisantāpayato kacchehi sedā muccanti.
example_2: yaṃ ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ āpo āpogataṃ upādinnaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ, pittaṃ semhaṃ pubbo lohitaṃ sedo medo … ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā āpodhātu.
sbs_example_3: antaṃ antaguṇaṃ udariyaṃ karīsaṃ pittaṃ semhaṃ pubbo lohitaṃ sedo medo assu vasā kheḷo siṅghāṇikā lasikā muttaṃ matthaluṅgan'ti
sbs_example_4: sa kho so, gahapati, ariyasāvako uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatehi bhogehi bāhābalaparicitehi sed'āvakkhittehi dhammikehi dhammaladdhehi imāni cattāri pattakammāni kattā hoti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: as impermanent; as unstable; as transient; as unreliable
example_1:
tesaṃ sutvāna sappaññā,
sacittaṃ paccaladdhā te,
aniccaṃ aniccato dakkhuṃ,
dukkham'addakkhu dukkhato.
example_2: ye'pi hi keci, bhikkhave, anāgatam'addhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā yaṃ loke piyarūpaṃ sātarūpaṃ taṃ aniccato dakkhissanti … te taṇhaṃ pajahissanti
sbs_example_3:
aniccaṃ aniccato dakkhuṃ, dukkham'addakkhu dukkhato.
anattani anattā'ti, asubhaṃ asubhat'addasuṃ.
sammādiṭṭhisamādānā, sabbaṃ dukkhaṃ upaccagun'ti
sbs_example_4:
yo sukhaṃ dukkhato adda, dukkham'addakkhi sallato.
adukkham'asukhaṃ santaṃ, addakkhi naṃ aniccato.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: takes care (of); looks after; maintains; lit. carries around
example_1: so attānaṃ'y'eva adhipatiṃ karitvā akusalaṃ pajahati, kusalaṃ bhāveti, sāvajjaṃ pajahati, anavajjaṃ bhāveti, suddhaṃ attānaṃ pariharati. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, att'ādhipateyyaṃ.
example_2: dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato paṇḍito viyatto sappuriso akkhataṃ anupahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati anavajjo ca hoti ananuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ bahuñ'ca puññaṃ pasavati.
sbs_example_3: ahaṃ sukhito homi niddukkho homi avero homi abyāpajjho homi anīgho homi sukhī attānaṃ pariharāmi
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi puriso medakathālikaṃ parihareyya chiddaavachiddaṃ uggharantaṃ paggharantaṃ, evam'evaṃ kho ahaṃ imaṃ kāyaṃ pariharāmi
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: recently; now; presently; at this time
example_1: ye te, ānanda, bhikkhū navā acirapabbajitā adhunā-āgatā imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ, te vo, ānanda, bhikkhū pañcasu dhammesu samādapetabbā nivesetabbā patiṭṭhāpetabbā
example_2: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ adhunā-āgatavadhukāsamena cetasā viharissāmā'ti
sbs_example_3: ahaṃ kho, āvuso, navo acirapabbajito adhun'āgato imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ. na t'āhaṃ sakkomi vitthārena ācikkhituṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: iti purāṇañ'ca vedanaṃ paṭihaṅkhāma navañ'ca vedanaṃ na uppādessāma yātrā ca no bhavissati anavajjatā ca phāsu vihāro cā'ti
example_2:
pubb'āsave hitvā nave akubbaṃ,
na chandagū no'pi nivissavādī,
sa vippamutto diṭṭhigatehi dhīro,
na lippati loke anattagarahī.
sbs_example_3: ahaṃ kho, āvuso, navo acirapabbajito adhun'āgato imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ. na t'āhaṃ sakkomi vitthārena ācikkhituṃ.
sbs_example_4:
khīṇaṃ purāṇaṃ navaṃ n'atthi sambhavaṃ, virattacitt'āyatike bhavasmiṃ.
te khīṇabījā avirūḷhichandā, nibbanti dhīrā yath'āyaṃ padīpo.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: therefore; thus; so; because of that; regarding that; lit. of that
example_1: tassa te, āvuso, alābhā, tassa te dulladdhaṃ, yaṃ tvaṃ pātimokkhe uddissamānena na sādhukaṃ aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi karosī'ti, idaṃ tasmiṃ mohanake pācittiyaṃ.
example_2: tassa me tumhe puttā orasā mukhato jātā dhammajā dhammanimmitā dhammadāy'ādā, no āmisadāy'ādā.
sbs_example_3: tassa me, bhante, bhagavā accayaṃ accayato paṭiggaṇhātu, āyatiṃ saṁvarāyāti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: directly visible; evident; real; perceivable; (comm) able to be seen by oneself
example_1: dhamme aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti, svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhī'ti
example_2: bhuñja, bhikkhu, mānusake kāme, mā sandiṭṭhikaṃ hitvā kālikaṃ anudhāvī'ti.
sbs_example_3: sandiṭṭhiko dhammo, sandiṭṭhiko dhammo'ti, bhante, vuccati. kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, sandiṭṭhiko dhammo hoti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: phuṭṭho, bhikkhave, vedeti, phuṭṭho ceteti, phuṭṭho sañjānāti. itth'ete'pi dhammā calā c'eva byathā ca aniccā vipariṇāmino aññathābhāvino.
example_2:
seyyo na tena maññeyya,
nīceyyo athavā'pi sarikkho,
phuṭṭho anekarūpehi,
n'ātumānaṃ vikappayaṃ tiṭṭhe.
sbs_example_3:
phuṭṭhassa lokadhammehi, cittaṃ yassa na kampati.
asokaṃ virajaṃ khemaṃ, etaṃ maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.
sbs_example_4: tassa sā sukhā vedanā nirujjhati. sukhāya vedanāya nirodhā uppajjati dukkhā vedanā. so dukkhāya vedanāya phuṭṭho samāno socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati sammohaṃ āpajjati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: consumed; spent; finished; exhausted; slowly destroyed
example_1: khīṇā jāti vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ n'āparaṃ itthattāyā'ti pajānāti
sbs_chant_eng_1: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
example_2:
mamāyite passatha phandamāne,
macche'va app'odake khīṇasote,
etam'pi disvā amamo careyya,
bhavesu āsattim'akubbamāno.
sbs_example_3:
khīṇaṃ purāṇaṃ navaṃ n'atthi sambhavaṃ, virattacitt'āyatike bhavasmiṃ.
te khīṇabījā avirūḷhichandā, nibbanti dhīrā yath'āyaṃ padīpo.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: many; much; lots (of); a lot (of); great; large
example_1: katamañ'ca, gahapati, ānaṇyasukhaṃ? idha, gahapati, kulaputto na kassaci kiñci dhāreti appaṃ vā bahuṃ vā.
example_2: dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bālo abyatto asappuriso khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati sāvajjo ca hoti sānuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ bahuñ'ca apuññaṃ pasavati
sbs_example_3:
bahū devā manussā ca, maṅgalāni acintayuṃ.
ākaṅkhamānā sotthānaṃ, brūhi maṅgalam'uttamaṃ
sbs_example_4:
ye ca atītā sambuddhā, ye ca buddhā anāgatā.
yo c'eta'r'ahi sambuddho, bahunnaṃ sokanāsano.
sbs_example_5:
kāsāvakaṇṭhā bahavo, pāpadhammā asaññatā,
pāpā pāpehi kammehi, nirayaṃ te upapajjare.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: not stable; not enduring; not eternal
example_1:
jātaṃ bhūtaṃ samuppannaṃ,
kataṃ saṅkhatam'addhuvaṃ,
jarāmaraṇasaṅghāṭaṃ,
roganīḷaṃ pabhaṅguraṃ.
example_2: yatra hi nāma aniccaṃ'y'eva samānaṃ niccan'ti vakkhati, addhuvaṃ'y'eva samānaṃ dhuvan'ti vakkhati, asassataṃ'y'eva samānaṃ sassatan'ti vakkhati
sbs_example_3: addhuvaṃ me jīvitaṃ, dhuvaṃ me maraṇaṃ, avassaṃ mayā maritabbaṃ, maraṇapariyosānaṃ me jīvitaṃ, jīvitaṃ me aniyataṃ , maraṇaṃ me niyataṃ
sbs_example_4:
satthā ca me lokam'imaṃ adhiṭṭhahi,
aniccato addhuvato asārato,
pakkhanda maṃ citta jinassa sāsane,
tārehi oghā mahatā suduttarā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: offered; lit. burnt in fire as an offering
example_1:
yaṃ kiñci yiṭṭhaṃ va hutaṃ va loke,
saṃvaccharaṃ yajetha puññapekkho,
sabbam'pi taṃ na catubhāgam'eti,
abhivādanā ujugatesu seyyo.
example_2: micchādiṭṭhiko hoti viparītadassano, n'atthi dinnaṃ, n'atthi yiṭṭhaṃ, n'atthi hutaṃ, n'atthi sukaṭadukkaṭānaṃ kammānaṃ phalaṃ vipāko, n'atthi ayaṃ loko, n'atthi paro loko
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: related to felt experience; connected with feeling; concerning sensation; kind of feeling
commentary:
(ANa) vedanāgat'ādīni sampayuttavedanādīnaṃ vasena veditabbāni
(ANa) rūpam'eva rūpagataṃ. sesapadesu'pi es'eva nayo.
example_1: so yadeva tattha hoti rūpagataṃ vedanāgataṃ saññāgataṃ saṅkhāragataṃ viññāṇagataṃ, te dhamme aniccato dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato parato palokato suññato anattato samanupassati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

notes: see PED for discussion on etymology
example_1:
tasmā have lokavidū sumedho,
lok'antagū vusitabrahmacariyo,
lokassa antaṃ samitāvi ñatvā,
n'āsīsatī lokam'imaṃ parañ'cā'ti.
example_2: khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā'ti abbhaññāsi.
sbs_chant_eng_2: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self

paññāya cāgena sutena c'ūbhayaṃ,
sā tādisī sīlavatī upāsikā,
ādīyati sāram'idh'eva attano'ti.
example_2:
diṭṭhīnivesā na hi svātivattā,
dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītaṃ,
tasmā naro tesu nivesanesu,
nirassatī ādiyatī ca dhammaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
ye ariyasaccāni vibhāvayanti, gambhīrapaññena sudesitāni.
kiñ'c'āpi te honti bhusaṃ pamattā, na te bhavaṃ aṭṭhamam'ādiyanti.

meaning_1: state of existence; form of becoming
example_1: kati pan'āvuso, bhavā'ti? tayo'me, āvuso, bhavā, kāmabhavo, rūpabhavo, arūpabhavo'ti.
example_2:
passāmi loke pariphandamānaṃ,
pajaṃ imaṃ taṇhagataṃ bhavesu,
hīnā narā maccumukhe lapanti,
avītataṇhāse bhav'ābhavesu.
sbs_example_3:

example_2:
soḷasa-ākārasampannā,

example_1: dīgharattañ'h'etaṃ, bhikkhave, assutavato puthujjanassa ajjhositaṃ mamāyitaṃ parāmaṭṭhaṃ
example_2: maraṇañ'h'etaṃ, sunakkhatta, ariyassa vinaye yo sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvattati, maraṇamattañ'h'etaṃ, sunakkhatta, dukkhaṃ yaṃ aññataraṃ saṃkiliṭṭhaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
sbs_example_3: yaṃ pan'āniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vipariṇāmadhammaṃ, kallaṃ nu taṃ samanupassituṃ, etaṃ mama, eso'ham'asmi, eso me attā'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.

example_1: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, imasmiṃ dhammavinaye aṭṭha acchariyā abbhutā dhammā, ye disvā disvā bhikkhū imasmiṃ dhammavinaye abhiramanti. katame aṭṭha?
example_2: ime kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭha hetū aṭṭha paccayā ādibrahmacariyikāya paññāya appaṭiladdhāya paṭilābhāya, paṭiladdhāya bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya bhāvanāya pāripūriyā saṃvattantī'ti.
sbs_example_3: yad'idaṃ cattāri purisayugāni aṭṭha purisapuggalā esa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa
sbs_example_4: ayam'eva ariyo aṭṭh'aṅgiko maggo seyyath'īdaṃ sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākamm'anto sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati sammāsamādhi.

example_1: evaṃ vutte aññataro bhikkhu there bhikkhū etadavoca, phasso kho, āvuso, eko anto, phassasamudayo dutiyo anto, phassanirodho majjhe, taṇhā sibbinī.

example_2: idh'ānanda, rañño mahāsudassanassa tadah'uposathe pannarase sīsaṃ nhātassa uposathikassa uparipāsādavaragatassa dibbaṃ cakkaratanaṃ pāturahosi sahass'āraṃ sanemikaṃ sanābhikaṃ sabbākāraparipūraṃ.

meaning_1: by day; during the day; for a day
example_1: divasaṃ caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittaṃ parisodhessāma
example_2: seyyathā'pi nāma phālo divasaṃ santatto udake pakkhitto cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati sandhūpāyati sampadhūpāyati. evam'eva so pāyaso udake pakkhitto cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati sandhūpāyati sampadhūpāyati.
sbs_example_3: taṃ kiṃ maññatha api nu so puriso divasaṃ tīhi sattisatehi haññamāno tatonidānaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvediyethā'ti?
sbs_example_4: balavā puriso divasaṃsantatte ayokaṭāhe dve vā tīṇi vā udakaphusitāni nipāteyya. dandho, ānanda, udakaphusitānaṃ nipāto
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: is?; did?; are?; who?; what?; how?; would?
example_1:
āsādiya edisaṃ janaṃ,
aggiṃ pajjalitaṃ va liṅgiya,
gaṇhiya āsīvisaṃ viya,
api nu sotthi siyā khamehi no.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso loṇaphalaṃ paritte udakamallake pakkhipeyya. taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu taṃ parittaṃ udakaṃ amunā loṇaphalena loṇaṃ assa apeyyan'ti? evaṃ, bhante.
sbs_example_3: taṃ kiṃ maññatha api nu so puriso divasaṃ tīhi sattisatehi haññamāno tatonidānaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvediyethā'ti?
sbs_example_4: api nu tumhākaṃ evam'assa, amhe jano harati vā ḍahati vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karotī'ti? no hetaṃ, bhante. taṃ kissa hetu? na hi no etaṃ, bhante, attā vā attaniyaṃ vā'ti.
sbs_example_5: taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu so puriso evaṃkārī tasmiṃ kulle kiccakārī assā'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: having seen; having understood; having found out
example_1:
ete vivādā samaṇesu jātā,
etesu ugghāti nighāti hoti,
etam'pi disvā virame kath'ojjaṃ,
na h'añña'd'atth'atthi pasaṃsalābhā.
example_2: kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, saṃvaro hoti? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā piyarūpe rūpe n'ādhimuccati, appiyarūpe rūpe na byāpajjati, upaṭṭhitakāyassati ca viharati appamāṇacetaso
sbs_example_3: tam'enaṃ tathāgato uttariṃ vineti, ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, indriyesu guttadvāro hohi, cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā mā nimittaggāhī hohi m'ānubyañjanaggāhī
sbs_example_4: tam'enaṃ saddheyyavacasā upāsikā disvā tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ aññatarena vadeyya, pārājikena vā saṅghādisesena vā pācittiyena vā
sbs_example_5: assutavā kho puthujjano attanā jarādhammo samāno jaraṃ anatīto paraṃ jiṇṇaṃ disvā aṭṭīyati harāyati jigucchati attānaṃ'y'eva {na} atisitvā, aham'pi kho'mhi jarādhammo jaraṃ anatīto
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: ayaṃ, bhikkhave, mahāsamudde chaṭṭho acchariyo abbhuto dhammo, yaṃ disvā disvā asurā mahāsamudde abhiramanti
example_2: ayaṃ, bhikkhave, chaṭṭho hetu chaṭṭho paccayo ādibrahmacariyikāya paññāya appaṭiladdhāya paṭilābhāya, paṭiladdhāya bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya bhāvanāya pāripūriyā saṃvattati.
sbs_example_3: surāpānavaggo chaṭṭho.
sbs_example_4:
pañca kāmaguṇā loke, manochaṭṭhā paveditā,
ettha chandaṃ virājetvā, evaṃ dukkhā pamuccatī'ti.
sbs_example_5: ayaṃ, bhikkhave, imasmiṃ dhammavinaye chaṭṭho acchariyo abbhuto dhammo, yaṃ disvā disvā bhikkhū imasmiṃ dhammavinaye abhiramanti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: kabaḷīkāro āhāro oḷāriko vā sukhumo vā, phasso dutiyo, manosañcetanā tatiyā, viññāṇaṃ catutthaṃ
example_2: so mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṃ disaṃ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṃ, tathā tatiyaṃ, tathā catutthaṃ.
sbs_example_3: sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā, pubb'eva somanassadomanassānaṃ atthaṅ'gamā, adukkham'asukhaṃ upekkhāsatipārisuddhiṃ catutthaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: as it truly is; in reality; lit. like become
example_1: samaṇo, āvuso, gotamo sāvakānaṃ evaṃ dhammaṃ deseti, etha tumhe, bhikkhave, pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe satta bojjh'aṅge yathābhūtaṃ bhāvethā'ti.
example_2: tañ'ca cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, yatth'assa te uppannā pāpakā akusalā dhammā aparisesā nirujjhanti
sbs_example_3: so idaṃ dukkhan'ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ayaṃ dukkhasamudayo'ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ayaṃ dukkhanirodho'ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti
sbs_example_4: yāvakīvañ'ca me, bhikkhave, imesu catūsu ariyasaccesu evaṃ tiparivaṭṭaṃ dvādas'ākāraṃ yathābhūtaṃ ñāṇadassanaṃ na suvisuddhaṃ ahosi,
sbs_chant_eng_4: Setting in Motion the Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_5: sabbaṃ rūpaṃ, n'etaṃ mama, n'eso'ham'asmi, na m'eso attā'ti evam'etaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ.
sbs_chant_eng_5: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (VINa) pubbenivāsan'ti samanantar'ātītaṃ bhavaṃ ādiṃ katvā tattha tattha nivutthasantānaṃ.
example_1: katame ca, bhikkhave, dhammā satiyā sacchikaraṇīyā? pubbenivāso, bhikkhave, satiyā sacchikaraṇīyo.
example_2:
n'eva pubbenivāsāya,
na'pi dibbassa cakkhuno,
cetopariyāya iddhiyā,
cutiyā upapattiyā,
sotadhātuvisuddhiyā,
paṇidhī me na vijjati.
sbs_example_3: so evaṃ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigat'ūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte pubbenivāsa-anussatiñāṇāya cittaṃ abhininnāmeti.
sbs_example_4: so anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussarāmi, seyyath'idaṃ, ekam'pi jātiṃ dve'pi jātiyo tisso'pi jātiyo catasso'pi jātiyo pañca'pi jātiyo dasa'pi jātiyo vīsam'pi jātiyo tiṃsam'pi jātiyo
sbs_example_5:
pubbenivāsaṃ yo vedi, sagg'āpāyañ'ca passati,
atho jātikkhayaṃ patto, abhiññāvosito muni,
sabbavositavosānaṃ, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
bahussuto ca medhāvī,
sīlesu susamāhito,
cetosamatham'anuyutto,
api muddhani tiṭṭhatu.
example_2:
mātā yathā niyaṃ puttaṃ,
āyusā ekaputtam'anurakkhe,
evam'pi sabbabhūtesu,
mānasaṃ bhāvaye aparimāṇaṃ.
sbs_example_3: so anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussarāmi, seyyath'idaṃ, ekam'pi jātiṃ dve'pi jātiyo tisso'pi jātiyo catasso'pi jātiyo pañca'pi jātiyo dasa'pi jātiyo vīsam'pi jātiyo tiṃsam'pi jātiyo
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: dasa'pi, bhante, purisā, vīsam'pi, bhante, purisā, tiṃsam'pi, bhante, purisā, cattārīsam'pi, bhante, purisā, paññāsam'pi, bhante, purisā nappahonti yāvatikā imissā nāḷandāya pāṇā te ekena khaṇena ekena muhuttena ekaṃ maṃsakhalaṃ ekaṃ maṃsapuñjaṃ kātuṃ.
example_2: dasa'pi bhikkhū ek'āhena satthaṃ āharanti, vīsam'pi bhikkhū ek'āhena satthaṃ āharanti, tiṃsam'pi bhikkhū ek'āhena satthaṃ āharanti.
sbs_example_3: so anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussarāmi, seyyath'idaṃ, ekam'pi jātiṃ dve'pi jātiyo tisso'pi jātiyo catasso'pi jātiyo pañca'pi jātiyo dasa'pi jātiyo vīsam'pi jātiyo tiṃsam'pi jātiyo
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: catasso imā, bhikkhave, paṭipadā. katamā catasso? dukkhā paṭipadā dandh'ābhiññā, dukkhā paṭipadā khipp'ābhiññā, sukhā paṭipadā dandh'ābhiññā, sukhā paṭipadā khipp'ābhiññā. imā kho, bhikkhave, catasso paṭipadā.
example_2:
disā catasso vidisā catasso,
uddhaṃ adho dasa disā imāyo,
na tuyhaṃ adiṭṭhaṃ asutaṃ amutaṃ,
atho aviññātaṃ kiñcanam'atthi loke,
ācikkha dhammaṃ yam'ahaṃ vijaññaṃ,
jātijarāya idha vippahānaṃ.
sbs_example_3: so anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussarāmi, seyyath'idaṃ, ekam'pi jātiṃ dve'pi jātiyo tisso'pi jātiyo catasso'pi jātiyo pañca'pi jātiyo dasa'pi jātiyo vīsam'pi jātiyo tiṃsam'pi jātiyo
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
ehi sārathi gacchāhi,
rathaṃ niyyādayāh'imaṃ,
ārogyaṃ brāhmaṇiṃ vajja,
pabbaji dāni brāhmaṇo,
sujāto tīhi rattīhi,
tisso vijjā aphassayi.
example_2: tisso imā, bhikkhave, sikkhā. katamā tisso? adhisīlasikkhā, adhicittasikkhā, adhipaññāsikkhā.
sbs_example_3: so anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussarāmi, seyyath'idaṃ, ekam'pi jātiṃ dve'pi jātiyo tisso'pi jātiyo catasso'pi jātiyo pañca'pi jātiyo dasa'pi jātiyo vīsam'pi jātiyo tiṃsam'pi jātiyo
sbs_example_4: manosañcetanāya āhāre pariññāte tisso taṇhā pariññātā honti. tīsu taṇhāsu pariññātāsu ariyasāvakassa n'atthi kiñci uttarikaraṇīyanti vadāmi.
sbs_example_5: dve'pi mayā, bhikkhave, vedanā vuttā pariyāyena, tisso'pi mayā vedanā vuttā pariyāyena, pañca'pi mayā vedanā vuttā pariyāyena, cha'pi mayā vedanā vuttā pariyāyena
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: various; different kinds of; many different
example_1: ye hi keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussaramānā anussaranti sabbete pañc'upādānakkhandhe anussaranti etesaṃ vā aññataraṃ
example_2: tassa te āyasmanto avivaṭañ'c'eva vivaranti, anuttānīkatañ'ca uttānī karonti, anekavihitesu ca kaṅkhāṭhāniyesu dhammesu kaṅkhaṃ paṭivinodenti.
sbs_example_3: so anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussarāmi, seyyath'idaṃ, ekam'pi jātiṃ dve'pi jātiyo tisso'pi jātiyo catasso'pi jātiyo pañca'pi jātiyo dasa'pi jātiyo vīsam'pi jātiyo tiṃsam'pi jātiyo

example_1: gaṇḍo'ti kho, bhikkhave, imass'etaṃ cātumahābhūtikassa kāyassa adhivacanaṃ mātāpettikasambhavassa odanakummās'ūpacayassa anicc'ucchādana-parimaddana-bhedana-viddhaṃsanadhammassa.
example_2: so yadeva tattha hoti rūpagataṃ vedanāgataṃ saññāgataṃ saṅkhāragataṃ viññāṇagataṃ te dhamme aniccato dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato parato palokato suññato anattato samanupassati
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gaṇḍo anekavassagaṇiko. tass'assu gaṇḍassa nava vaṇamukhāni nava abhedanamukhāni.
sbs_example_4: maññitaṃ, bhikkhave, rogo, maññitaṃ gaṇḍo, maññitaṃ sallaṃ. tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, amaññamānena cetasā viharissāmā'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: hot season; summer; lit. hot months
notes: wrong derivation of gen pl of gimhā. gimhānaṃ > gimhāna
example_1: addhamāso seso gimhānan'ti katvā nivāsetabbanti. addhamāse sese gimhāne katvā nivāsetabbaṃ
example_2: vanappagumbe yathā phussit'agge, gimhānamāse paṭhamasmiṃ gimhe. tath'ūpamaṃ dhammavaraṃ adesayi, nibbānagāmiṃ paramaṃ hitāya.
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi gimhānaṃ pacchime māse ūhataṃ rajojallaṃ, tam'enaṃ mahāakālamegho ṭhānaso antaradhāpeti vūpasameti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: however much; even if; even though; although; but how?
example_1: kiñ'c'āpi-ahaṃ, bhante, jiṇṇo vuddho mahallako addhagato vayoanuppatto, desetu me, bhante, bhagavā saṃkhittena dhammaṃ, desetu sugato saṃkhittena dhammaṃ, app'eva nām'āhaṃ bhagavato bhāsitassa atthaṃ ājāneyyaṃ.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, ahi gūthagato kiñ'c'āpi na daṃsati, atha kho naṃ makkheti.
sbs_example_3:
saritvā pubbake yogī, tesaṃ vattam'anussaraṃ.
kiñ'c'āpi pacchimo kālo, phuseyya amataṃ padaṃ.
sbs_example_4:
ye ariyasaccāni vibhāvayanti, gambhīrapaññena sudesitāni.
kiñ'c'āpi te honti bhusaṃ pamattā, na te bhavaṃ aṭṭhamam'ādiyanti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: tass'imāni satta ratanāni bhavanti, seyyath'idaṃ, cakkaratanaṃ, hatthiratanaṃ, assaratanaṃ, maṇiratanaṃ, itthiratanaṃ, gahapatiratanaṃ, pariṇāyakaratanam'eva sattamaṃ.
example_2: ayaṃ, bhikkhave, mahāsamudde sattamo acchariyo abbhuto dhammo, yaṃ disvā disvā asurā mahāsamudde abhiramanti
sbs_example_3: sappāṇakavaggo sattamo.
sbs_example_4: evañ'hi sā yavakalāpī suhatā assa chahi byābhaṅgīhi haññamānā. atha sattamo puriso āgaccheyya byābhaṅgihattho.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
ye ariyasaccāni vibhāvayanti,
gambhīrapaññena sudesitāni,
kiñ'c'āpi te honti bhusaṃ pamattā,
na te bhavaṃ aṭṭhamam'ādiyanti,
idam'pi saṅghe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.
example_2: ayaṃ, bhikkhave, aṭṭhamo hetu aṭṭhamo paccayo ādibrahmacariyikāya paññāya appaṭiladdhāya paṭilābhāya, paṭiladdhāya bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya bhāvanāya pāripūriyā saṃvattati.
sbs_example_3: sahadhammikavaggo aṭṭhamo.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: ambho purisa na tvaṃ addasa manussesu tatiyaṃ devadūtaṃ pātubhūtan'ti? so evam'āha nāddasaṃ bhante'ti
example_2: so mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṃ disaṃ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṃ, tathā tatiyaṃ, tathā catutthaṃ.
sbs_example_3: pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca viharati, sato ca sampajāno, sukhañ'ca kāyena paṭisaṃvedeti, yaṃ taṃ ariyā ācikkhanti, upekkhako satimā sukhavihārī'ti tatiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
sbs_example_4: cattāro'me āhārā bhūtānaṃ vā sattānaṃ ṭhitiyā sambhav'esīnaṃ vā anuggahāya, kabaḷīkāro āhāro oḷāriko vā sukhumo vā, phasso dutiyo, manosañcetanā tatiyā, viññāṇaṃ catutthaṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
mal'itthiyā duccaritaṃ,
maccheraṃ dadato malaṃ,
malā ve pāpakā dhammā,
asmiṃ loke paramhi ca.
example_2: ye ca kho keci kāyena duccaritaṃ caranti vācāya duccaritaṃ caranti manasā duccaritaṃ caranti tesaṃ appiyo attā
sbs_example_3: pañca'p'āhaṃ nīvaraṇe sāhāre vadāmi, no anāhāre. ko c'āhāro pañcannaṃ nīvaraṇānaṃ? tīṇi duccaritānī'ti'ssa vacanīyaṃ.

meaning_1: with fuel; with nutriment; with sustenance; lit. with food
example_1: avijjam'p'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, s'āhāraṃ vadāmi, no anāhāraṃ. ko c'āhāro avijjāya?
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, pathavīdhātu, evaṃ catasso viññāṇaṭṭhitiyo daṭṭhabbā. seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, āpodhātu, evaṃ nandirāgo daṭṭhabbo. seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, pañca bījajātāni, evaṃ viññāṇaṃ s'āhāraṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.
sbs_example_3: pañca'p'āhaṃ nīvaraṇe sāhāre vadāmi, no anāhāre. ko c'āhāro pañcannaṃ nīvaraṇānaṃ? tīṇi duccaritānī'ti'ssa vacanīyaṃ.

meaning_1: filled (with); accompanied (by); connected (with); associated (with); lit. going
example_1: y'āyaṃ taṇhā ponobhavikā nandirāgasahagatā tatratatr'ābhinandinī, seyyath'idaṃ, kāmataṇhā bhavataṇhā vibhavataṇhā

example_1: yadidaṃ cattāri purisayugāni aṭṭha purisapuggalā, esa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassā'ti
example_2: kiñ'c'āpi, bhikkhave, evarūpassa puggalassa na diṭṭh'ānugatiṃ āpajjati, atha kho naṃ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggacchati, kalyāṇamitto purisapuggalo kalyāṇasahāyo kalyāṇasampavaṅko'ti.
sbs_example_3: luddho pan'āyaṃ purisapuggalo lobhena abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto pāṇam'pi hanati, adinnam'pi ādiyati, paradāram'pi gacchati, musā'pi bhaṇati, param'pi tathattāya samādapeti, yaṃ sa hoti dīgharattaṃ ahitāya dukkhāyā'ti.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kukkuṭiyā aṇḍāni aṭṭha vā dasa vā dvādasa vā. tān'assu kukkuṭiyā sammā adhisayitāni sammā pariseditāni sammā paribhāvitāni.
example_2:
kikī'va aṇḍaṃ rakkheyya,
cāmarī viya vāladhiṃ,
nipako sīlasampanno,
mamaṃ rakkhi mahāmuni.
sbs_example_3:
kikī'va aṇḍaṃ, camarī'va vāladhiṃ. piyaṃ'va puttaṃ,
nayanaṃ'va ekakaṃ. tath'eva sīlaṃ, anurakkhamānā.

meaning_1: more (than); greater than (than); better than (than); superior (to)
example_1: tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, etadahosi, ye kho keci atītam'addhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā opakkamikā dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā vedanā vedayiṃsu, etāvaparamaṃ, na'y'ito bhiyyo.
example_2:
yo ca sītañ'ca uṇhañ'ca,
tiṇā bhiyyo na maññati,
karaṃ purisakiccāni,
so sukhā na vihāyati.
sbs_example_3:
kayirā ce, kayirāth'enaṃ, daḷham'enaṃ parakkame.
sithilo hi paribbājo, bhiyyo ākirate rajaṃ.
sbs_example_4: aṭṭhikaṅkal'ūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bah'upāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo'ti.
sbs_example_5: vīsati'pi vassāni tiṭṭhamāno tiṃsam'pi vassāni tiṭṭhamāno cattārīsam'pi vassāni tiṭṭhamāno paññāsam'pi vassāni tiṭṭhamāno vassasatam'pi tiṭṭhamāno, bhiyyo'pi tiṭṭhamāno.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: dissat'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, cātumahābhūtiko kāyo ekam'pi vassaṃ tiṭṭhamāno dve'pi vassāni tiṭṭhamāno tīṇi'pi vassāni tiṭṭhamāno cattāri'pi vassāni tiṭṭhamāno
example_2:
tiṭṭhe ce so tattha anānuyāyī,
pūgam'pi vassānaṃ samantacakkhu,
tatth'eva so sītisiyā vimutto,
cavetha viññāṇaṃ tathāvidhassa.
sbs_example_3: jayasiddhi dhanaṃ lābhaṃ sotthi bhāgyaṃ sukhaṃ balaṃ siri āyu ca vaṇṇo ca bhogaṃ vuḍḍhī ca yasavā satavassā ca āyū ca jīvasiddhī bhavantu te.
sbs_example_4: ahaṃ cattāri vassāni parivasissāmi, catunnaṃ vassānaṃ accayena āraddhacittā bhikkhū pabbājentu, upasampādentu bhikkhubhāvāyā'ti.
