meaning_1: filled with goodwill; full of friendliness
example_1: so mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṃ disaṃ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṃ, tathā tatiyaṃ, tathā catutthaṃ.
example_2: idh'āvuso, bhikkhu mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṃ disaṃ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṃ, tathā tatiyaṃ, tathā catutthaṃ.
sbs_example_3: iti uddham'adho tiriyaṃ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṃ lokaṃ mettāsahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena pharitvā viharati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: cause; means; way; (comm) door; source; cause
commentary: (SNPa) kiṃ parābhavato mukhan'ti evaṃ āgatānaṃ amhākaṃ brūhi parābhavato purisassa kiṃ mukhaṃ, kiṃ dvāraṃ, kā yoni, kiṃ kāraṇaṃ, yena mayaṃ parābhavantaṃ purisaṃ jāneyyāmā'ti attho.
example_1:
asantassa piyā honti,
sante na kurute piyaṃ,
asataṃ dhammaṃ roceti,
taṃ parābhavato mukhaṃ.
example_2: mahāsatto ... aniccatāmanasikāramukhena sabbabhavesu abhivaḍḍhamānasaṃvego kāye ca asubhasaññaṃ paṭilabhitvā ghar'āvāsapalibodh'ādhibhūtaṃ kilesagahanaṃ anogāhetvā'va
sbs_example_3:
iti h'etaṃ vijānāma, navamo so parābhavo.
dutiyaṃ bhagavā brūhi, kiṃ parābhavato mukhaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: comprehends; understands; recognises; distinguishes; is aware (of)
example_1: viññāṇaṃ viññāṇan'ti, āvuso, vuccati. kittāvatā nu kho, āvuso, viññāṇan'ti vuccatī'ti? vijānāti vijānātī'ti kho, āvuso, tasmā viññāṇan'ti vuccati.
example_2:
yāvajīvam'pi ce bālo,
paṇḍitaṃ payirupāsati,
na so dhammaṃ vijānāti,
dabbī sūparasaṃ yathā.
sbs_example_3:
iti h'etaṃ vijānāma, navamo so parābhavo.
dutiyaṃ bhagavā brūhi, kiṃ parābhavato mukhaṃ.
sbs_example_4: kiñ'ca vijānāti? ambilam'pi vijānāti, tittakam'pi vijānāti, kaṭukam'pi vijānāti, madhuram'pi vijānāti, khārikam'pi vijānāti, akhārikam'pi vijānāti, loṇikam'pi vijānāti, aloṇikam'pi vijānāti.
sbs_example_5: yaṃ vedeti taṃ sañjānāti, yaṃ sañjānāti taṃ vijānāti. tasmā ime dhammā saṃsaṭṭhā no visaṃsaṭṭhā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: insight into the nature of reality; spiritual insight; understanding of the way things are; lit. Dhamma eye
example_1: seyyathā'pi nāma suddhaṃ vatthaṃ apagatakāḷakaṃ samma'd'eva rajanaṃ paṭiggaṇheyya, evam'eva tesaṃ caturāsītipāṇasahassānaṃ tasmiṃ'y'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi, yaṃ kiñci samudayadhammaṃ sabbaṃ taṃ nirodhadhamman'ti
example_2: khat'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā. upahat'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā. sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā pitaraṃ dhammikaṃ dhammarājānaṃ jīvitā na voropessatha, imasmiññ'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ uppajjissathā'ti.
sbs_example_3: imasmiñ'ca pana veyyākaraṇasmiṃ bhaññamāne āyasmato koṇḍaññassa virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi
sbs_chant_eng_3: The Discourse on  Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma

meaning_1: stainless; spotless; without taint; blemish free
example_1: seyyathā'pi nāma suddhaṃ vatthaṃ apagatakāḷakaṃ samma'd'eva rajanaṃ paṭiggaṇheyya, evam'eva tesaṃ caturāsītipāṇasahassānaṃ tasmiṃ'y'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi, yaṃ kiñci samudayadhammaṃ sabbaṃ taṃ nirodhadhamman'ti
example_2: khat'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā. upahat'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā. sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā pitaraṃ dhammikaṃ dhammarājānaṃ jīvitā na voropessatha, imasmiññ'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ uppajjissathā'ti.
sbs_example_3: imasmiñ'ca pana veyyākaraṇasmiṃ bhaññamāne āyasmato koṇḍaññassa virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi

example_1: idaṃ me, deva, paṭhamakammaṃ soḷasasahassāni dāso ca dāsī ca assaratho ca. paṭiggaṇhātu me devo posāvanikan'ti.
example_2: evaṃ, bhante'ti kho āyasmā soṇo bhagavato paṭissutvā soḷasa aṭṭhakavaggikāni sabbān'eva sarena abhaṇi.
sbs_example_3: idāni kho pana dvesahassapañcasatatesaṭṭhi saṃvaccharāni c'eva, navamāsāni ca, soḷasadivasāni atikkantāni.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, yavakalāpī cātumahāpathe nikkhittā assa. atha cha purisā āgaccheyyuṃ byābhaṅgihatthā. te yavakalāpiṃ chahi byābhaṅgīhi haneyyuṃ. evañ'hi sā, bhikkhave, yavakalāpī suhatā assa chahi byābhaṅgīhi haññamānā.
example_2: taṃ kiṃ maññatha api nu so puriso divasaṃ tīhi sattisatehi haññamāno tatonidānaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvediyethā'ti?
sbs_example_3: evañ'hi sā yavakalāpī suhatā assa chahi byābhaṅgīhi haññamānā. atha sattamo puriso āgaccheyya byābhaṅgihattho.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: of such view; who holds the theory that; of the opinion that; who thinks that
example_1: evam'eva kho, poṭṭhapāda, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, ek'antasukhī attā hoti arogo paraṃ maraṇā'ti.
example_2: ahañ'hi, bho gotama, evaṃvādī evaṃdiṭṭhī, yo koci diṭṭhaṃ bhāsati, evaṃ me diṭṭhan'ti, n'atthi tato doso
sbs_example_3: evaṃvādī evaṃdiṭṭhi, n'atthi yo maraṇadhammo samāno na bhāyati, na santāsaṃ āpajjati maraṇassā'ti.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, mahāsamuddo ekaraso loṇaraso, evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, ayaṃ dhammavinayo ekaraso vimuttiraso
example_2:
yo ca gāthā sataṃ bhāse,
anatthapadasaṃhitā,
ekaṃ dhammapadaṃ seyyo,
yaṃ sutvā upasammati.
sbs_example_3: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
sbs_example_4: tass'eva kho pana bhikkhussa bhikkhū honti, anuvattakā vaggavādakā, eko vā dve vā tayo vā, te evaṃ vadeyyuṃ
sbs_example_5: so anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussarāmi, seyyath'idaṃ, ekam'pi jātiṃ dve'pi jātiyo tisso'pi jātiyo catasso'pi jātiyo pañca'pi jātiyo dasa'pi jātiyo vīsam'pi jātiyo tiṃsam'pi jātiyo
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
sahassam'api ce vācā,
anatthapadasaṃhitā,
ekaṃ atthapadaṃ seyyo,
yaṃ sutvā upasammati.
example_2: atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bodhisatto aparena samayena eko gaṇamhā vūpakaṭṭho vihāsi, aññen'eva tāni caturāsīti pabbajitasahassāni agamaṃsu, aññena maggena vipassī bodhisatto.
sbs_example_3: evaṃ me sutaṃ ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā gayāyaṃ viharati gayāsīse saddhiṃ bhikkhusahassena. tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi
sbs_example_4: evam'eva tesaṃ caturāsītipāṇasahassānaṃ tasmiṃ'y'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi

example_1:
sabbattha munī anissito,
na piyaṃ kubbati no'pi appiyaṃ,
tasmiṃ paridevamaccharaṃ,
paṇṇe vāri yathā na limpati.
example_2: tasmiṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, yaññe n'eva gāvo haññiṃsu, na aj'eḷakā haññiṃsu, na kukkuṭasūkarā haññiṃsu, na vividhā pāṇā saṃghātaṃ āpajjiṃsu, na rukkhā chijjiṃsu yūpatthāya, na dabbhā lūyiṃsu barihisatthāya.
sbs_example_3: evam'eva tesaṃ caturāsītipāṇasahassānaṃ tasmiṃ'y'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi
sbs_example_4: taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu so puriso evaṃkārī tasmiṃ kulle kiccakārī assā'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.

example_1:
yañ'hi eke jigucchanti,
mataṃ disvāna pāpakaṃ,
kāmarāgo pāturahu,
andho'va savatī ahuṃ.
example_2:
yam'āhu saccaṃ tathiyan'ti eke,
tam'āhu aññe tucchaṃ musā'ti,
evam'pi vigayha vivādayanti,
kasmā na ekaṃ samaṇā vadanti.
sbs_example_3: evam'eva kho, poṭṭhapāda, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, ek'antasukhī attā hoti arogo paraṃ maraṇā'ti.
sbs_example_4:
n'ānuyuttā tathā eke, muṇḍā saṅghāṭipārutā.
sambhāvanaṃyev'icchanti, lābhasakkāramucchitā.
sbs_example_5:
evam'etaṃ mahāvīra, yathā samaṇa bhāsasi.
ettha c'eke visīdanti, paṅkamh'iva jaraggavo.

meaning_1: ascetics and Brahmans; monks and priests
example_1: sant'āvuso, sāriputta, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā kammavādā sayaṃkataṃ dukkhaṃ paññapenti.
example_2:
n'āhaṃ sabbe samaṇabrāhmaṇāse,
jātijarāya nivutā'ti brūmi,
ye s'īdha diṭṭhaṃ'va sutaṃ mutaṃ vā,
sīlabbataṃ v'āpi pahāya sabbaṃ,
anekarūpam'pi pahāya sabbaṃ,
taṇhaṃ pariññāya anāsavāse,
te ve narā oghatiṇṇā'ti brūmi.
sbs_example_3: evam'eva kho, poṭṭhapāda, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, ek'antasukhī attā hoti arogo paraṃ maraṇā'ti.
sbs_example_4: sammādiṭṭhiko … atthi sattā opapātikā, atthi loke samaṇabrāhmaṇā sammaggatā sammāpaṭipannā ye imañ'ca lokaṃ parañ'ca lokaṃ sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedentī'ti.
sbs_example_5: so ca ajjhattaṃ na suppahīno hoti, na suppaṭippassaddho, opakkamikā c'epi te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā vedanā vedayanti, abhabbāva te ñāṇāya dassanāya anuttarāya sambodhāya.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: leading to putting out the fire; conducive to Nibbāna
example_1:
vanappagumbe yatha phussit'agge,
gimhānamāse paṭhamasmiṃ gimhe,
tath'ūpamaṃ dhammavaraṃ adesayi,
nibbānagāmiṃ paramaṃ hitāya,
idam'pi buddhe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.
example_2:
aññā hi lābh'ūpanisā,
aññā nibbānagāminī,
evam'etaṃ abhiññāya,
bhikkhu buddhassa sāvako,
sakkāraṃ n'ābhinandeyya,
vivekam'anubrūhaye.
sbs_example_3: evam'eva kho, brāhmaṇa, tiṭṭhat'eva nibbānaṃ, tiṭṭhati nibbānagāmī maggo, tiṭṭhām'ahaṃ samādapetā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: is seen; is observed; is manifest
example_1: mahantasmiṃ kho pana lokasannivāse santi samaṇabrāhmaṇā iddhimanto dibbacakkhukā paracittaviduno. te dūrato'pi passanti, āsannā'pi na dissanti, cetasā'pi cittaṃ pajānanti.
example_2: dissati, bhikkhave, imassa cātumahābhūtikassa kāyassa ācayo'pi apacayo'pi ādānam'pi nikkhepanam'pi
sbs_example_3:
dūre santo pakāsenti, himavanto'va pabbato,
asant'ettha na dissanti, rattiṃ khittā yathā sarā.
sbs_example_4: dissat'āyaṃ cātumahābhūtiko kāyo ekam'pi vassaṃ tiṭṭhamāno dve'pi vassāni tiṭṭhamāno tīṇi'pi vassāni tiṭṭhamāno cattāri'pi vassāni tiṭṭhamāno

meaning_1: composed of four primary states; made of the four great elements
example_1: gaṇḍo'ti kho, bhikkhave, imass'etaṃ cātumahābhūtikassa kāyassa adhivacanaṃ mātāpettikasambhavassa odanakummās'ūpacayassa anicc'ucchādana-parimaddana-bhedana-viddhaṃsanadhammassa.
example_2: ayaṃ kho me kāyo rūpī cātumahābhūtiko mātāpettikasambhavo odana-kummāsa-upacayo anicc'ucchādana-parimaddana-bhedana-viddhaṃsana-dhammo, idañ'ca pana me viññāṇaṃ ettha sitaṃ ettha paṭibaddhan'ti
sbs_example_3: dissat'āyaṃ cātumahābhūtiko kāyo ekam'pi vassaṃ tiṭṭhamāno dve'pi vassāni tiṭṭhamāno tīṇi'pi vassāni tiṭṭhamāno cattāri'pi vassāni tiṭṭhamāno

meaning_1: enlightened being; fourth stage of the path; lit. worthy one
commentary:
(MNa) tehi ārakattā arahaṃ hoti, dūrībhūtattā'ti attho.
(SNa) ārakā kilesehī'ti arahanto.
notes: the commentaries supply a multitude of folk etymologies, such as ara + haṃ = enemy + killer, a + rahaṃ = no + secrecy, etc.
example_1: aṭṭhānam'etaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṃ ekissā lokadhātuyā dve arahanto sammāsambuddhā apubbaṃ acarimaṃ uppajjeyyuṃ
example_2: aññataro ca kho pan'āyasmā bhāradvājo arahataṃ ahosī'ti.
sbs_example_3: ciraparinibbutam'pi taṃ bhagavantaṃ uddissa arahantaṃ sammāsambuddhaṃ
sbs_example_4:
gāme vā yadi v'āraññe, ninne vā yadi vā thale.
yattha arahanto viharanti, taṃ bhūmirāmaṇeyyakan'ti.
sbs_example_5: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmiṃ mahāvane mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi sabbeh'eva arahantehi
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: state of loss; state of misery; lit. going away
commentary: (ANa) apāyo'ti niraya-tiracchānayoni-pettivisaya-asurakāyā. sabbe'pi hi te vaḍḍhisaṅkhātassa āyassa abhāvato apāyā'ti vuccanti.
example_1: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, sapatto sapattassa evaṃ icchati, aho vat'āyaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjeyyā'ti! taṃ kissa hetu?
example_2: ayaṃ varāko kiñ'c'āpi idāni sukhito susajjito bhoge paribhuñjati, atha kho tīsu dvāresu ekenā'pi katassa kalyāṇakammassa abhāvā idāni apāyesu anappakaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedissatī'ti.
sbs_example_3:
catūha-apāyehi ca vippamutto,
cha cābhiṭhānāni abhabbo kātuṃ
sbs_example_4: micchādiṭṭhikammasamādānā, te kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapannā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: unable (to); impossible (to); incapable (of); unlikely (to); lit. not to be
example_1:
appamādarato bhikkhu,
pamāde bhayadassi vā,
abhabbo parihānāya,
nibbānass'eva santike.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, paṇḍupalāso bandhanā pavutto abhabbo haritattāya, evam'eva kho, sunakkhatta, āneñj'ādhimuttassa purisapuggalassa ye lok'āmisasaṃyojane se pavutte.
sbs_example_3:
catūh'apāyehi ca vippamutto,

example_1: evaṃ vutte aññataro bhikkhu there bhikkhū etadavoca, cha kho, āvuso, ajjhattikāni āyatanāni eko anto, cha bāhirāni āyatanāni dutiyo anto, viññāṇaṃ majjhe, taṇhā sibbinī.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso chappāṇake gahetvā nānāvisaye nānāgocare daḷhāya rajjuyā bandheyya.
sbs_example_3:
catūh'apāyehi ca vippamutto,

sbs_example_4: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammesu dhamm'ānupassī viharati chasu ajjhattikabāhiresu āyatanesu.

example_1: yato ca kho, bhikkhave, jātarūpaṃ imehi pañcahi upakkilesehi vippamuttaṃ hoti, taṃ hoti jātarūpaṃ mudu ca kammaniyañ'ca pabhassarañ'ca na ca pabhaṅgu sammā upeti kammāya.
example_2:
pubb'āsave hitvā nave akubbaṃ,
na chandagū no'pi nivissavādī,
sa vippamutto diṭṭhigatehi dhīro,
na lippati loke anattagarahī.
sbs_example_3:
catūh'apāyehi ca vippamutto,
cha cābhiṭhānāni abhabbo kātuṃ
sbs_example_4:

example_1: ayaṃ, bhikkhave, mahāsamudde pañcamo acchariyo abbhuto dhammo, yaṃ disvā disvā asurā mahāsamudde abhiramanti
example_2: addasā kho, bhikkhave, kummo kacchapo siṅgālaṃ dūrato'va gocarapasutaṃ. disvāna soṇḍipañcamāni aṅgāni sake kapāle samodahitvā app'ossukko tuṇhībhūto saṅkasāyati.
sbs_example_3:
caturo samaṇā na pañcam'atthi,
te te āvikaromi sakkhipuṭṭho,
maggajino maggadesako ca,
magge jīvati yo ca maggadūsī.
sbs_example_4: tassa abhisambodhāya ayaṃ pañcamo mahāsupino pāturahosi.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
manopubbaṅ'gamā dhammā,
manoseṭṭhā manomayā,
manasā ce paduṭṭhena,
bhāsati vā karoti vā,
tato naṃ dukkham'anveti,
cakkaṃva vahato padaṃ.
example_2: aniccadassāvī kho pan'āhaṃ, bhante, bhagavato manobhāvanīyānañ'ca bhikkhūnaṃ.
sbs_example_3: cakkhuviññāṇaṃ, sotaviññāṇaṃ, ghānaviññāṇaṃ, jivhāviññāṇaṃ, kāyaviññāṇaṃ, manoviññāṇaṃ. idaṃ vuccati saṅkhārapaccayā viññāṇaṃ.
sbs_example_4: cattāro'me āhārā bhūtānaṃ vā sattānaṃ ṭhitiyā sambhav'esīnaṃ vā anuggahāya, kabaḷīkāro āhāro oḷāriko vā sukhumo vā, phasso dutiyo, manosañcetanā tatiyā, viññāṇaṃ catutthaṃ
sbs_example_5: atthi, bhikkhave, sattānaṃ kāyaduccaritaṃ vacīduccaritaṃ manoduccaritaṃ. tassa taṃ ṭhānaṃ abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhato sabbaso vā duccaritaṃ pahīyati tanu vā pana hoti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yā kho, bhikkhave, imesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ saṅgati sannipāto samavāyo, ayaṃ vuccati cakkhusamphasso. cakkhusamphasso'pi anicco vipariṇāmī aññathābhāvī.
example_2:
attānañ'ce piyaṃ jaññā,
rakkheyya naṃ surakkhitaṃ,
tiṇṇaṃ aññataraṃ yāmaṃ,
paṭijaggeyya paṇḍito.
sbs_example_3: buddharatanaṃ dhammaratanaṃ saṅgharatanaṃ tiṇṇaṃ ratanānaṃ ānubhāvena
sbs_example_4: tam'enaṃ saddheyyavacasā upāsikā disvā tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ aññatarena vadeyya, pārājikena vā saṅghādisesena vā pācittiyena vā
sbs_example_5: cakkhuñ'c'āvuso, paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhuviññāṇaṃ, tiṇṇaṃ saṅgati phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā, yaṃ vedeti taṃ sañjānāti, yaṃ sañjānāti taṃ vitakketi, yaṃ vitakketi taṃ papañceti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: tassa evaṃ kicc'āpadesabahulassa viharato anuppannā c'eva bhogā n'uppajjanti, uppannā ca bhogā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti.
example_2:
niccaṃ utrastam'idaṃ cittaṃ,
niccaṃ ubbiggam'idaṃ mano,
anuppannesu kicchesu,
atho uppatitesu ca,
sace atthi anutrastaṃ,
taṃ me akkhāhi pucchito'ti.
sbs_example_3: bhikkhu anuppannānaṃ pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ anuppādāya chandaṃ janeti vāyamati vīriyaṃ ārabhati cittaṃ paggaṇhāti padahati
sbs_example_4: n'āhaṃ aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yena anuppanno vā byāpādo uppajjati uppanno vā byāpādo bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati yatha'y'idaṃ paṭighanimittaṃ.
sbs_example_5: ayoniso manasikaroto anuppannā c'eva āsavā uppajjanti, uppannā ca āsavā pavaḍḍhanti, yoniso ca kho, bhikkhave, manasikaroto anuppannā c'eva āsavā na uppajjanti, uppannā ca āsavā pahīyanti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
tassa taṃ vacanaṃ sutvā,
abbhutaṃ lomahaṃsanaṃ,
satthāni nikkhipitvāna,
māṇavā etadabravuṃ.
example_2: sattahi, bhikkhave, acchariyehi abbhutehi dhammehi samannāgataṃ hatthakaṃ āḷavakaṃ dhāretha.
sbs_example_3: ayaṃ, bhikkhave, imasmiṃ dhammavinaye chaṭṭho acchariyo abbhuto dhammo, yaṃ disvā disvā bhikkhū imasmiṃ dhammavinaye abhiramanti.
sbs_example_4: idha ekacce moghapurisā dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇanti—suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ.

example_1: sattahi, bhikkhave, acchariyehi abbhutehi dhammehi samannāgataṃ hatthakaṃ āḷavakaṃ dhāretha.
example_2: acchariyā hete, āvuso, puggalā dullabhā lokasmiṃ, ye amataṃ dhātuṃ kāyena phusitvā viharanti
sbs_example_3: ayaṃ, bhikkhave, imasmiṃ dhammavinaye chaṭṭho acchariyo abbhuto dhammo, yaṃ disvā disvā bhikkhū imasmiṃ dhammavinaye abhiramanti.
sbs_example_4: apissu maṃ, bhikkhave, imā anacchariyā gāthāyo paṭibhaṃsu pubbe assutapubbā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: iti evarūpāni atītāni chattiṃsa taṇhāvicaritāni, anāgatāni chattiṃsa taṇhāvicaritāni, paccuppannāni chattiṃsa taṇhāvicaritāni. evaṃ aṭṭhasataṃ taṇhāvicaritaṃ honti.
example_2: tasmiṃ pana divase ekena ūnaṃ aṭṭhasataṃ yojenti.
sbs_example_3: aṭṭhārasā'pi mayā vedanā vuttā pariyāyena, chattiṃsā'pi mayā vedanā vuttā pariyāyena, aṭṭhasatam'pi mayā vedanā vuttā pariyāyena.
sbs_example_4: katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, aṭṭhasataṃ vedanā? atītā chattiṃsa vedanā, anāgatā chattiṃsa vedanā, paccuppannā chattiṃsa vedanā, imā vuccanti, bhikkhave, aṭṭhasataṃ vedanā.

example_1: idañ'ca pana mayaṃ āyasmato sāriputtassa bhāsitaṃ imehi chattiṃsāya vatthūhi anumodāma, jarāmaraṇassa ce, āvuso, bhikkhu nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya dhammaṃ deseti, dhammakathiko bhikkhū'ti alaṃ vacanāya.
example_2: imamhi khandhake vatthūni chattiṃsā'ti
sbs_example_3: aṭṭhārasā'pi mayā vedanā vuttā pariyāyena, chattiṃsā'pi mayā vedanā vuttā pariyāyena, aṭṭhasatam'pi mayā vedanā vuttā pariyāyena.
sbs_example_4: katamā ca chattiṃsa vedanā? cha gehasitāni somanassāni, cha nekkhammasitāni somanassāni, cha gehasitāni domanassāni, cha nekkhammasitāni domanassāni, cha gehasitā upekkhā, cha nekkhammasitā upekkhā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: in one way; from a certain point of view; figuratively speaking; lit. by way
commentary:
(SNa) pariyāyenā'ti kāraṇena.
(ANa) pariyāyenā'ti yasmā tena nāmākāyena paṭhamajjhānaṃ sacchikataṃ, tasmā iminā pariyāyena kāyasakkhi vutto.
example_1: kassa nu kho, bhante, subhāsitan'ti? sabbesaṃ vo, bhikkhave, subhāsitaṃ pariyāyena, api ca yaṃ mayā sandhāya bhāsitaṃ pārāyane metteyyapañhe
example_2: idh'āvuso, bhikkhu vivicc'eva kāmehi ... paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati. yathā yathā ca tadāyatanaṃ tathā tathā naṃ kāyena phusitvā viharati. ettāvatā'pi kho, āvuso, kāyasakkhī vutto bhagavatā pariyāyena.
sbs_example_3: aṭṭhārasā'pi mayā vedanā vuttā pariyāyena, chattiṃsā'pi mayā vedanā vuttā pariyāyena, aṭṭhasatam'pi mayā vedanā vuttā pariyāyena.
sbs_example_4: iminā'p'etaṃ, āvuso, pariyāyena veditabbaṃ yathā na cakkhu rūpānaṃ saṃyojanaṃ, na rūpā cakkhussa saṃyojanaṃ.
sbs_example_5: atha kho aparā devatā bhagavantaṃ etad'avoca, kassa nu kho, bhagavā, subhāsitan'ti? sabbāsaṃ vo subhāsitaṃ pariyāyena, api ca mama'pi suṇātha
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
anagāriy'upetassa,
bhikkhācariyaṃ jigīsato,
muni pabrūhi me puṭṭho,
moneyyaṃ uttamaṃ padaṃ.
example_2: evaṃ puṭṭhā, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā na c'eva sampāyissanti, uttariñ'ca vighātaṃ āpajjissanti. taṃ kissa hetu? yathā taṃ, bhikkhave, avisayasmiṃ.
sbs_example_3: atthi nu kho me uttarimanussadhammā alam'ariyañāṇadassanaviseso adhigato, so'haṃ pacchime kāle sabrahmacārīhi puṭṭho na maṅku bhavissāmī'ti
sbs_chant_eng_3: Ten Subjects for Frequent Recollection by One Who Has Gone Forth
sbs_example_4:
caturo samaṇā na pañcam'atthi,
te te āvikaromi sakkhipuṭṭho,
maggajino maggadesako ca,
magge jīvati yo ca maggadūsī.
sbs_example_5: sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno aññen'aññaṃ paṭicarati, bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmeti, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātukaroti, evaṃ sant'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo akaccho hoti.

example_1: ekaṃ ekakaṃ, dve dukā, tīṇi tikā, cattāri catukkā, pañca pañcakā, cha chakkā, satta sattakā, aṭṭha aṭṭhakā, nava navakā, dasa dasakā'ti, satam'pi mayaṃ, bho gotama, gaṇāpema, bhiyyo'pi gaṇāpema.
example_2:
māse māse sahassena,
yo yajetha sataṃ samaṃ,
ekañ'ca bhāvit'attānaṃ,
muhuttam'api pūjaye,
sā'y'eva pūjanā seyyo,
yañ'ce vassasataṃ hutaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
appamāṇo buddho, appamāṇo dhammo.
appamāṇo saṅgho, pamāṇavantāni siriṃsapāni
ahivicchikā satapadī, uṇṇanābhī sarabū mūsikā.
sbs_example_4: taṃ kiṃ maññatha api nu so puriso divasaṃ tīhi sattisatehi haññamāno tatonidānaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvediyethā'ti?

example_1: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, yv'āyaṃ jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo ca hoti samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo ca ayaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ jhāyīnaṃ aggo ca seṭṭho ca mokkho ca uttamo ca pavaro cā'ti.
example_2: katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ? cattāro ca mahābhūtā, catunnañ'ca mahābhūtānaṃ upādāya rūpaṃ. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
apādakehi me mettaṃ, mettaṃ dipādakehi me.
catuppadehi me mettaṃ, mettaṃ bahuppadehi me.
sbs_example_4: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammesu dhamm'ānupassī viharati catūsu ariyasaccesu.
sbs_example_5: dissat'āyaṃ cātumahābhūtiko kāyo ekam'pi vassaṃ tiṭṭhamāno dve'pi vassāni tiṭṭhamāno tīṇi'pi vassāni tiṭṭhamāno cattāri'pi vassāni tiṭṭhamāno
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yāvakīvañ'c'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ pañcannaṃ upādānakkhandhānaṃ evaṃ assādañ'ca assādato ādīnavañ'ca ādīnavato nissaraṇañ'ca nissaraṇato yathābhūtaṃ n'ābbhaññāsiṃ
example_2: yāvakīvañ'ca me, sāriputta, sakaṃ muttakarīsaṃ apariyādinnaṃ hoti, sakaṃ'y'eva sudaṃ muttakarīsaṃ āhāremi. idaṃsu me, sāriputta, mahāvikaṭabhojanasmiṃ hoti.
sbs_example_3: yāvakīvañ'ca bhikkhave bhikkhū abhiṇhaṃ sannipātā bhavissanti sannipātabahulā, vuddhi'y'eva pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni
sbs_example_4: yāvakīvañ'ca me, bhikkhave, imesu catūsu ariyasaccesu evaṃ tiparivaṭṭaṃ dvādas'ākāraṃ yathābhūtaṃ ñāṇadassanaṃ na suvisuddhaṃ ahosi,

example_1: n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ lahuparivattaṃ yatha'y'idaṃ cittaṃ. yāvañ'c'idaṃ, bhikkhave, upamā'pi na sukarā yāva lahuparivattaṃ cittan'ti.
example_2: n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yena anuppannaṃ vā uddhaccakukkuccaṃ uppajjati uppannaṃ vā uddhaccakukkuccaṃ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati yatha'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, cetaso avūpasamo
sbs_example_3: yatha'y'idaṃ brahmacariyaṃ addhaniyaṃ assa ciraṭṭhitikaṃ, tadassa bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lok'ānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: namely; that is; lit. which this
example_1: ayaṃ me puggalo khamati imesaṃ catunnaṃ puggalānaṃ abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro ca. taṃ kissa hetu? abhikkantā h'esā, bho gotama, yadidaṃ upekkhā'ti.
example_2:
udabindu yathā'pi pokkhare,
padume vāri yathā na limpati,
evaṃ muni n'opalimpati,
yadidaṃ diṭṭhasutaṃ mutesu vā.
sbs_example_3: yad'idaṃ cattāri purisayugāni aṭṭha purisapuggalā esa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa
sbs_example_4: ek'āyano ayaṃ maggo sattānaṃ visuddhiyā, sokaparidevānaṃ samatikkamāya, dukkhadomanassānaṃ atthaṅ'gamāya, ñāyassa adhigamāya, nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya, yad'idaṃ cattāro satipaṭṭhānā.

example_1: dissat'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, cātumahābhūtiko kāyo ekam'pi vassaṃ tiṭṭhamāno ... vīsati'pi vassāni tiṭṭhamāno
example_2: pa, parā, ni, nī, u, du, saṃ, vi, ava, anu, pari, adhi, abhi, pati, su, ā, ati, api, apa, upa, pahāro, parābhavo, nihāro, nīhāro, uhāro, duhāro, saṃhāro, vihāro, avahāro, anuhāro, parihāro, adhihāro, abhihāro, patihāro, suhāro, āhāro, atihāro, apihāro, apahāro, upahāro, evaṃ vīsati upasaggehi ca.
sbs_example_3: vīsati'pi vassāni tiṭṭhamāno tiṃsam'pi vassāni tiṭṭhamāno cattārīsam'pi vassāni tiṭṭhamāno paññāsam'pi vassāni tiṭṭhamāno vassasatam'pi tiṭṭhamāno, bhiyyo'pi tiṭṭhamāno.
sbs_example_4: ciṇṇamānatto bhikkhu yattha siyā vīsatigaṇo bhikkhusaṅgho tattha so bhikkhu abbhetabbo.
sbs_example_5:
yesaṃ cattārīsaṃ piyāni, cattārīsaṃ tesaṃ dukkhāni,
yesaṃ tiṃsaṃ piyāni, tiṃsaṃ tesaṃ dukkhāni,
yesaṃ vīsati piyāni, vīsati tesaṃ dukkhāni

meaning_1: comparable in the same way; similar to that; like this
example_1:
yath'indakhīlo pathavissito siyā,
catubbhi vātehi asampakampiyo,
tath'ūpamaṃ sappurisaṃ vadāmi,
yo ariyasaccāni avecca passati,
idam'pi saṅghe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, matajaṃ nāma āvudhajātaṃ ubhatodhāraṃ pītanisitaṃ. tadassa saṅghāṭiyā sampārutaṃ sampaliveṭhitaṃ. tath'ūpama-ahaṃ, bhikkhave, imassa bhikkhuno pabbajjaṃ vadāmi.
sbs_example_3: tath'ūpam'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi gihibhogā ca parihīno, sāmaññ'atthañ'ca na paripūreti.

example_1: taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu so puriso amuṃ telapattaṃ amanasikaritvā bahiddhā pamādaṃ āhareyyā'ti?
example_2: taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ niccaṃ vā aniccaṃ vā'ti? aniccaṃ, bhante.

meaning_1: that one; him; her; that thing; that person
example_1: agamāsi kho, bhikkhave, so kummo taṃ padesaṃ. tam'enaṃ luddo papatāya vijjhi.
example_2: tam'enaṃ evaṃ vadeyya, ayaṃ te, ambho purisa, samatittiko telapatto antarena ca mahāsamajjaṃ antarena ca janapadakalyāṇiyā pariharitabbo.
sbs_example_3: tam'enaṃ tathāgato uttariṃ vineti, ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, indriyesu guttadvāro hohi, cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā mā nimittaggāhī hohi m'ānubyañjanaggāhī
sbs_example_4: tam'enaṃ saddheyyavacasā upāsikā disvā tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ aññatarena vadeyya, pārājikena vā saṅghādisesena vā pācittiyena vā
sbs_example_5: tam'enaṃ dve balavanto purisā nānābāhāsu gahetvā taṃ aṅgārakāsuṃ upakaḍḍheyyuṃ. atha kho tassa purisassa ārakā'v'assa cetanā ārakā patthanā ārakā paṇidhi.

example_1: imehi kho, bhikkhave, dasahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu samantapāsādiko ca hoti sabb'ākāraparipūro cā'ti.
example_2: tīhi kho ahaṃ, jīvaka, ṭhānehi maṃsaṃ aparibhogan'ti vadāmi. diṭṭhaṃ, sutaṃ, parisaṅkitaṃ, imehi kho ahaṃ, jīvaka, tīhi ṭhānehi maṃsaṃ aparibhogan'ti vadāmi.
sbs_example_3: imehi sakkārehi yath'ārahaṃ āropitehi abhipūjayāma

example_1: nanu te, bhikkhave, yāva'd'eva kantārassa nittharaṇ'atthāya āhāraṃ āhāreyyun'ti? evaṃ, bhante
example_2: bhabbo nu kho so puriso parittaṃ aggiṃ ujjālitun'ti? evaṃ, bhante.
sbs_example_3: evaṃ, bhante'ti kho āyasmā soṇo bhagavato paṭissutvā soḷasa aṭṭhakavaggikāni sabbān'eva sarena abhaṇi.
sbs_example_4: tena hi, gahapati, suṇāhi, sādhukaṃ manasi karohi, bhāsissāmī'ti. evaṃ, bhante'ti

example_1: seyyathā'pi brāhmaṇa kukkuṭiyā aṇḍāni aṭṭha vā dasa vā dvādasa vā

sbs_example_3: dasa ime bhikkhave dhammā pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbā. katame dasa?

example_1:
maggān'aṭṭh'aṅgiko seṭṭho,
saccānaṃ caturo padā,
virāgo seṭṭho dhammānaṃ,
dvipadānañ'ca cakkhumā.
example_2:
paññaṃ purakkhatvā kalyāṇapīti,
vikkhambhaye tāni parissayāni,
aratiṃ sahetha sayanamhi pante,
caturo sahetha paridevadhamme.

caturo samaṇā na pañcam'atthi,

example_1: alatthuṃ kho, bhikkhave, tāni caturāsītipāṇasahassāni vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa santike pabbajjaṃ alatthuṃ upasampadaṃ
example_2: atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bodhisatto aparena samayena eko gaṇamhā vūpakaṭṭho vihāsi, aññen'eva tāni caturāsīti pabbajitasahassāni agamaṃsu, aññena maggena vipassī bodhisatto.

meaning_1: dislike; ill-will; hatred; hostility; enmity; malevolence; lit. going wrong
commentary: (ANa) byāpajjati iminā cittaṃ pūtikummās'ādayo viya purimapakatiṃ pajahatī'ti byāpādo.
example_1: mettaṃ, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. mettañ'hi te, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvayato yo byāpādo so pahīyissati.
example_2: yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno abhijjhālussa abhijjhā appahīnā hoti, byāpannacittassa byāpādo appahīno hoti, kodhanassa kodho appahīno hoti
sbs_example_3: byāpādapadosaṃ pahāya abyāpannacitto viharati sabbapāṇabhūtahit'ānukampī, byāpādapadosā cittaṃ parisodheti
sbs_example_4: santaṃ vā ajjhattaṃ byāpādaṃ atthi me ajjhattaṃ byāpādo'ti pajānāti, asantaṃ vā ajjhattaṃ byāpādaṃ n'atthi me ajjhattaṃ byāpādo'ti pajānāti.
sbs_example_5: n'āhaṃ aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yena anuppanno vā byāpādo uppajjati uppanno vā byāpādo bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati yatha'y'idaṃ paṭighanimittaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: cha ajjhattikāni āyatanāni veditabbāni, cha bāhirāni āyatanāni veditabbāni, cha viññāṇakāyā veditabbā, cha phassakāyā veditabbā, aṭṭhārasa mano'pavicārā veditabbā, chattiṃsa sattapadā veditabbā
example_2: chadhāturo ayaṃ, bhikkhu, puriso chaphass'āyatano aṭṭhārasamano'pavicāro catur'ādhiṭṭhāno, yattha ṭhitaṃ maññ'assavā nappavattanti, maññ'assave kho pana nappavattamāne muni santo'ti vuccati.
sbs_example_3: aṭṭhārasa dhātuyo, cakkhudhātu rūpadhātu cakkhuviññāṇadhātu, sotadhātu saddadhātu sotaviññāṇadhātu,
sbs_example_4: aṭṭhārasā'pi mayā vedanā vuttā pariyāyena, chattiṃsā'pi mayā vedanā vuttā pariyāyena, aṭṭhasatam'pi mayā vedanā vuttā pariyāyena.

example_2: kabaḷīkāre ce, bhikkhave, āhāre atthi rāgo atthi nandī atthi taṇhā, patiṭṭhitaṃ tattha viññāṇaṃ virūḷhaṃ. yattha patiṭṭhitaṃ viññāṇaṃ virūḷhaṃ, atthi tattha nāmarūpassa avakkanti.

meaning_1: is calmed (for); becomes collected (for); becomes composed (for); becomes stable (for); lit. is placed together

meaning_1: should go about; should lead (one’s life); should conduct oneself

example_1: tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, imesu āyasmantesu mettaṃ kāyakammaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ āvi c'eva raho ca
example_2: mettaṃ, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. mettañ'hi te, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvayato yo byāpādo so pahīyissati.
sbs_example_3: idha bhikkhave bhikkhuno mettaṃ kāyakammaṃ vacīkammaṃ manokammaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti sabrahmacārīsu āvi c'eva raho ca

example_1: app'ekacce maṃ paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahesuṃ, app'ekacce āsanaṃ paññapesuṃ, app'ekacce pād'odakaṃ upaṭṭhapesuṃ. api ca kho maṃ nāmena ca āvusovādena ca samudācaranti.
example_2:
tath'ev'ime catubbaṇṇā,
pabbajitvā tav'antike,
jahanti purimaṃ nāmaṃ,
buddhaputtā'ti ñāyare.

gaṅgā yamunā aciravatī sarabhū mahī,

meaning_1: falsely; untruthfully; lit. with something nonexistent
example_1: idha no, āvuso sāriputta, bhagavā kiṃvādī kim'akkhāyī, kathaṃ byākaramānā ca mayaṃ vuttavādino c'eva bhagavato assāma, na ca bhagavantaṃ abhūtena abbhācikkheyyāma
example_2: taggha taṃ, bhikkhu, accayo accagamā yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ, yo tvaṃ sāriputtaṃ asatā tucchā musā abhūtena abbhācikkhi
sbs_example_3: evaṃvādiṃ kho maṃ, bhikkhave, evam'akkhāyiṃ eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā asatā tucchā musā abhūtena abbhācikkhanti, samaṇo gotamo na kāmānaṃ pariññaṃ paññāpeti

meaning_1: with them; with those; by them
example_1: atha kho te bhikkhū yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā tehi aññatitthiyehi paribbājakehi saddhiṃ sammodiṃsu
example_2: tiṇalat'ādigahanacchanne caṅkame caṅkamanto andhakāravelāyaṃ uragādike pāṇe akkamitvā vā māreti, tehi vā daṭṭho dukkhaṃ āpajjatī'ti gahanacchannatā tatiyo doso.
sbs_example_3: evam'pi kho ariṭṭho bhikkhu gaddhabādhipubbo tehi bhikkhūhi samanuyuñjiyamāno samanugāhiyamāno samanubhāsiyamāno tad'eva pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ thāmasā parāmāsā abhinivissa voharati
sbs_example_4: bhikkhū abhinetabbā vatthudesanāya. tehi bhikkhūhi vatthuṃ desetabbaṃ, anārambhaṃ saparikkamanaṃ.

meaning_1: fever for sensual pleasures; burning passion for sensual objects
example_1: yo ca nesaṃ kāmesu kāmacchando kāmasneho kāmamucchā kāmapipāsā kāmapariḷāho, so ca ajjhattaṃ na suppahīno hoti, na suppaṭippassaddho ... abhabbā'va te ñāṇāya dassanāya anuttarāya sambodhāya.
example_2: so aññe satte passāmi kāmesu avītarāge kāmataṇhāhi khajjamāne kāmapariḷāhena pariḍayhamāne kāme paṭisevante. so tesaṃ na pihemi, na tattha abhiramāmi.
sbs_example_3: evam'eva kho, ye hi keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā kāyena c'eva cittena ca kāmehi avūpakaṭṭhā viharanti, yo ca n'esaṃ kāmesu kāmacchando kāmasneho kāmamucchā kāmapipāsā kāmapariḷāho so ca ajjhattaṃ na suppahīno hoti
sbs_example_4: nanu mayā, moghapurisa, anekapariyāyena kāmānaṃ pahānaṃ akkhātaṃ, kāmasaññānaṃ pariññā akkhātā, kāmapipāsānaṃ paṭivinayo akkhāto, kāmavitakkānaṃ samugghāto akkhāto, kāmapariḷāhānaṃ vūpasamo akkhāto?

example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso sīghaṃ gaccheyya. tassa evam'assa, kiṃ nu kho ahaṃ sīghaṃ gacchāmi? yaṃnūn'āhaṃ saṇikaṃ gaccheyyan'ti.
example_2: tadā seṭṭhino bhariyā garugabbhā hoti. tasmā so sīghaṃ gehaṃ purisaṃ pesesi, gaccha bhaṇe, jānāhi naṃ vijātā vā, no vā'ti.
sbs_example_3: evam'eva kho, ānanda, yassa kassaci evaṃsīghaṃ evaṃtuvaṭaṃ evaṃappakasirena uppannaṃ manāpaṃ uppannaṃ amanāpaṃ uppannaṃ manāp'āmanāpaṃ nirujjhati, upekkhā saṇṭhāti

meaning_1: is dragged about (by); is swept away (by); is carried away (by)
example_1:
kena'ssu nīyati loko,
kena'ssu parikassati,
kissa'ssu ekadhammassa,
sabb'eva vasam'anvagū'ti.
example_2:
cittena nīyati loko,
cittena parikassati,
cittassa ekadhammassa,
sabb'eva vasam'anvagū'ti.
sbs_example_3: ekam'antaṃ nisinno kho so bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etad'avoca, kena nu kho, bhante, loko nīyati, kena loko parikassati, kassa ca uppannassa vasaṃ gacchatī'ti?

example_1:
tass'īdha diṭṭhe va sute mute vā,
pakappitā n'atthi aṇū'pi saññā,
taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ diṭṭhim'anādiyānaṃ,
ken'īdha lokasmiṃ vikappayeyya.
example_2: idha pana, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa tādisaṃ'y'eva appamattakaṃ pāpakammaṃ kataṃ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṃ hoti, na-aṇu'pi khāyati, kiṃ bahu'd'eva.
sbs_example_3: ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, sīlavā hohi, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharāhi ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhassu sikkhāpadesū'ti
sbs_example_4:
yo ca sameti pāpāni,
aṇuṃ thūlāni sabbaso,
samitattā hi pāpānaṃ,
samaṇo'ti pavuccati.
sbs_example_5: passatha no tumhe taṃ vacanapathaṃ, aṇuṃ vā thūlaṃ vā, yaṃ tumhe n'ādhivāseyyāthā'ti?

example_1: cattāro'me, bhikkhave, āhārā bhūtānaṃ vā sattānaṃ ṭhitiyā sambhava-esīnaṃ vā anuggahāya. katame cattāro?
example_2:
yutto kathāyaṃ parisāya majjhe,
pasaṃsam'icchaṃ vinighāti hoti,
apāhatasmiṃ pana maṅku hoti,
nindāya so kuppati randham'esī.

diṭṭhā vā ye ca adiṭṭhā, ye сa dūre vasanti avidūre

example_1: tena kho pana samayena āyasmā aññāsikoṇḍañño bhagavato avidūre nisinno hoti pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya taṇhāsaṅkhayavimuttiṃ paccavekkhamāno.
example_2: atha kho māro pāpimā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato avidūre mahantaṃ bhayabheravaṃ saddam'akāsi, apissudaṃ pathavī maññe undrīyati

commentary:
(VIN 2.5.1.1) adiṭṭhaṃ nāma na cakkhunā diṭṭhaṃ.
(VINa) adiṭṭhaṃ nāma attano pasādacakkhunā vā dibbacakkhunā vā adiṭṭhaṃ.
example_1: yesañ'h'etaṃ, sāriputta, aññātaṃ assa adiṭṭhaṃ aviditaṃ asacchikataṃ aphassitaṃ paññāya te tattha paresaṃ saddhāya gaccheyyuṃ
example_2:
disā catasso vidisā catasso,
uddhaṃ adho dasa disā imāyo,
na tuyhaṃ adiṭṭhaṃ asutaṃ amutaṃ,
atho aviññātaṃ kiñcanam'atthi loke,
ācikkha dhammaṃ yam'ahaṃ vijaññaṃ,
jātijarāya idha vippahānaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
diṭṭhā vā ye ca adiṭṭhā, ye сa dūre vasanti avidūre
bhūtā vā sambhav'esī vā, sabbe sattā bhavantu sukhit'attā.
sbs_example_4: taṃ kiṃ maññasi ye te cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā adiṭṭhā adiṭṭhapubbā, na ca passasi, na ca te hoti passeyyan'ti? atthi te tattha chando vā rāgo vā pemaṃ vā'ti?

example_1: bhikkhu pan'eva aññataraṃ gāmaṃ vā nigamaṃ vā upanissāya viharati kuladūsako pāpasamācāro, tassa kho pāpakā samācārā dissanti c'eva suyyanti ca, kulāni ca tena duṭṭhāni dissanti c'eva suyyanti ca

meaning_1: in the name of; on account of; for the sake of; especially for; lit. pointing up
commentary:
(VIN 1.4.1.8) bhikkhuṃ pan'eva uddissā'ti bhikkhuss'atthāya, bhikkhuṃ ārammaṇaṃ karitvā, bhikkhuṃ acchādetu'kāmo.
(VINa) ettha uddissā'ti apadissa ārabbha. yasmā pana yaṃ uddissa upakkhaṭaṃ hoti, taṃ tass'atthāya upakkhaṭaṃ nāma hoti.
example_1: bhikkhuṃ pan'eva uddissa aññātakassa gahapatissa vā gahapatāniyā vā cīvaracetāpannaṃ upakkhaṭaṃ hoti, iminā cīvaracetāpannena cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā itthan'nāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ cīvarena acchādessāmī'ti
example_2: tena kho pana samayena pukkusāti nāma kulaputto bhagavantaṃ uddissa saddhāya agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito.
sbs_example_3: ciraparinibbutam'pi taṃ bhagavantaṃ uddissa arahantaṃ sammāsambuddhaṃ
sbs_example_4: catukkhattuṃ, pañcakkhattuṃ, chakkhattu'paramaṃ tuṇhībhūto uddissa tiṭṭhamāno taṃ cīvaraṃ abhinipphādeyya, icc'etaṃ kusalaṃ.

meaning_1: silent; quiet; mute; lit. became silent
example_1: evaṃ vutte, uttaro māṇavo pārāsiviy'antevāsī tuṇhībhūto maṅkubhūto pattakkhandho adhomukho pajjhāyanto appaṭibhāno nisīdi.

sbs_example_3: byādhidhammo'mhi, byādhiṃ anatīto'ti abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ itthiyā vā purisena vā gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā

meaning_1: on the spot; right there; immediately; lit. from the place
commentary: (MNa) udāhu ṭhānaso'v'etan'ti udāhu ṭhān'uppattikañāṇena taṅkhaṇaṃ'y'eva taṃ tathāgatassa upaṭṭhātī'ti pucchati.

example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gimhānaṃ pacchime māse ūhataṃ rajojallaṃ, tam'enaṃ mahāakālamegho ṭhānaso antaradhāpeti vūpasameti.
sbs_example_3: ayañ'ca kho dakkhiṇā dinnā, saṅghamhi supatiṭṭhitā. dīgharattaṃ hitāy'assa, ṭhānaso upakappati.

example_1: tassa tiṭṭhant'eva pañc'indriyāni yesaṃ avighātattā manāp'āmanāpaṃ paccanubhoti, sukhadukkhaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti. tassa yo rāgakkhayo, dosakkhayo, mohakkhayo, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, saupādisesā nibbānadhātu.
example_2:
satto guhāyaṃ bahun'ābhichanno,
tiṭṭhaṃ naro mohanasmiṃ pagāḷho,
dūre vivekā hi tathāvidho so,
kāmā hi loke na hi suppahāyā.

aññathā lokanāthamhi, tiṭṭhante puris'uttame.

commentary: (VIN 2.5.4.10) dinnaṃ nāma kāyena vā kāyapaṭibaddhena vā nissaggiyena vā dente hatthapāse ṭhito kāyena vā kāyapaṭibaddhena vā paṭiggaṇhāti, etaṃ dinnaṃ nāma.
example_1:
appasm'eke pavecchanti,
bahun'eke na dicchare,
appasmā dakkhiṇā dinnā,
sahassena samaṃ mitā'ti.
example_2:
kāle dadanti sappaññā,
vadaññū vītamaccharā,
kālena dinnaṃ ariyesu,
ujubhūtesu tādisu,
vippasannamanā tassa,
vipulā hoti dakkhiṇā.
sbs_example_3: adinn'ādānaṃ pahāya adinn'ādānā paṭivirato hoti dinn'ādāyī dinnapāṭikaṅkhī, athenena sucibhūtena attanā viharati.
sbs_example_4: ayañ'ca kho dakkhiṇā dinnā, saṅghamhi supatiṭṭhitā. dīgharattaṃ hitāy'assa, ṭhānaso upakappati.
sbs_example_5: sammādiṭṭhiko kho pana hoti aviparītadassano, atthi dinnaṃ atthi yiṭṭhaṃ atthi hutaṃ, atthi sukatadukkaṭānaṃ kammānaṃ phalaṃ vipāko, atthi ayaṃ loko atthi paro loko, atthi mātā atthi pitā, …

meaning_1: having suffused; having pervaded; having filled

commentary:
(MNa) tagghā'ti ek'aṃs'atthe nipāto. ek'aṃsena mayaṃ, bhante'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
(ANa) tagghā'ti ek'aṃsena.
example_1: taggha taṃ, bhagini, accayo accagamā, yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ, yā tvaṃ evam'akāsi.
example_2: taggha taṃ, bhikkhu, accayo accagamā yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ, yo tvaṃ sāriputtaṃ asatā tucchā musā abhūtena abbhācikkhi
sbs_example_3:
taggha me kuṭikā n'atthi,
taggha n'atthi kulāvakā.
taggha santānakā n'atthi,
taggha mutto'mhi bandhanā'ti.

example_1: tassa sabbehi imehi pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi visuddham'attānaṃ samanupassato, vimuttam'attānaṃ samanupassato, pāmojjaṃ jāyati, pamuditassa pīti jāyati, pītimanassa kāyo passambhati, passaddhakāyo sukhaṃ vedeti, sukhino cittaṃ samādhiyati.

example_1: ajānam'evaṃ āvuso avacaṃ jānāmi, apassaṃ passāmi, tucchaṃ musā vilapin'ti, aññatra adhimānā, ayam'pi pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.

meaning_1: by what?; by who?; with what?; how?
example_1:
ko sujjhati muccati bajjhatī ca,
ken'attanā gacchati brahmalokaṃ,
ajānato me muni brūhi puṭṭho,
bhagavā hi me sakkhi brahmajjadiṭṭho,
tuvañ'hi no brahmasamo'si saccaṃ,
kathaṃ upapajjati brahmalokaṃ jutima.
example_2:
savanti sabbadhi sotā,
sotānaṃ kiṃ nivāraṇaṃ,
sotānaṃ saṃvaraṃ brūhi,
kena sotā pidhiyyare.
sbs_example_3: kena ādittaṃ? rāg'agginā, dos'agginā, moh'agginā ādittaṃ, jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi ādittan'ti vadāmi
sbs_example_4: ekam'antaṃ nisinno kho so bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etad'avoca, kena nu kho, bhante, loko nīyati, kena loko parikassati, kassa ca uppannassa vasaṃ gacchatī'ti?
sbs_example_5:
ken'āyaṃ pakato satto, kuvaṃ sattassa kārako,
kuvaṃ satto samuppanno, kuvaṃ satto nirujjhatī'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: likewise; just like this; similarly; so too
example_1:
yathā'pi mūle anupaddave daḷhe,
chinno'pi rukkho puna'r'eva rūhati,
evam'pi taṇh'ānusaye anūhate,
nibbattatī dukkham'idaṃ punappunaṃ.
example_2:
supinena yathā'pi saṅgataṃ,
paṭibuddho puriso na passati,
evam'pi piyāyitaṃ janaṃ,
petaṃ kālakataṃ na passati.
sbs_example_3: evam'pi kho ariṭṭho bhikkhu gaddhabādhipubbo tehi bhikkhūhi samanuyuñjiyamāno samanugāhiyamāno samanubhāsiyamāno tad'eva pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ thāmasā parāmāsā abhinivissa voharati
sbs_example_4: aho vata m'āyaṃ gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā āyatim'pi evarūpena paṇītena piṇḍapātena pariviseyyā'ti evam'pi'ssa na hoti.

example_2:
yena yena hi maññanti,
tato taṃ hoti aññathā,

sbs_example_3:
aññathā lokanāthamhi, tiṭṭhante puris'uttame.

meaning_1: became free (from); was released (from); was liberated (from)
example_1: idam'avoca bhagavā. attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinandun'ti. imasmiṃ ca pana veyyākaraṇasmiṃ bhaññamāne saṭṭhimattānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ anupādāya āsavehi cittāni vimucciṃsū'ti.

example_2: manussasaddo viya suyyati, jānissāma nan'ti saddānusārena gantvā taṃ purisaṃ disvā, yakkho bhavissatī'ti bhītatasitā sare sannayhiṃsu

meaning_1: rashly; in haste; lit. with violence

example_1: pathaviyā'pi ummujjanimujjaṃ kareyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi udake, udake'pi abhijjamāno gaccheyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi pathaviyaṃ, ākāse'pi pallaṅkena kameyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi pakkhī sakuṇo
example_2: ahi āviñcheyya, vammikaṃ pavekkhāmī'ti, susumāro āviñcheyya, udakaṃ pavekkhāmī'ti, pakkhī āviñcheyya, ākāsaṃ ḍessāmī'ti

meaning_1: should be kept; should be stored; lit. to be carried
example_1: niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kathine das'āhaparamaṃ atirekacīvaraṃ dhāretabbaṃ, taṃ atikkāmayato nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
example_2: navaṃ pana bhikkhunā santhataṃ kārāpetvā chabbassāni dhāretabbaṃ, orena ce channaṃ vassānaṃ taṃ santhataṃ vissajjetvā vā avissajjetvā vā aññaṃ navaṃ santhataṃ kārāpeyya aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
sbs_example_3: yo ca tassā bhikkhuparisāya pattapariyanto so tassa bhikkhuno padātabbo, ayaṃ te, bhikkhu, patto, yāva bhedanāya dhāretabbo'ti.

meaning_1: to cultivate; to develop; to grow; to increase
example_1: kusalaṃ, bhikkhave, bhāvetha. sakkā, bhikkhave, kusalaṃ bhāvetuṃ. no ce'daṃ, bhikkhave, sakkā abhavissa kusalaṃ bhāvetuṃ, n'āhaṃ evaṃ vadeyyaṃ, kusalaṃ, bhikkhave, bhāvethā'ti.
example_2: karuṇaṃ bhāvetu'kāmena pana nikkaruṇatāya ādīnavaṃ karuṇāya ca ānisaṃsaṃ paccavekkhitvā karuṇābhāvanā ārabhitabbā.
sbs_example_3: yāvañ'c'idaṃ, bhikkhave, alam'eva animitto samādhi bhāvetuṃ. animitto, bhikkhave, samādhi bhāvito bahulīkato mahapphalo hoti mah'ānisaṃso.

example_1:

yassā vijjanti nāriyā,
tam'pi sīlavatiṃ āhu,
dhammaṭṭhaṃ saccavādiniṃ.
example_2:

samādhinā tena samo na vijjati

meaning_1: should be made; lit. to be done

example_2: purimen'ev'āhaṃ, bhante, opammena bhagavato attamano abhiraddho. api c'āhaṃ imāni bhagavato vicitrāni pañhapaṭibhānāni sotu'kāmo, ev'āhaṃ bhagavantaṃ paccanīkaṃ kātabbaṃ amaññissaṃ

meaning_1: should be spoken (to); should be told (to); should be said (to); lit. to be said
example_1: so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi evam'assa vacanīyo, m'āyasmā samaggassa saṅghassa bhedāya parakkami, bhedanasaṃvattanikaṃ vā adhikaraṇaṃ samādāya paggayha aṭṭhāsi
example_2: ye manussā pubbe'pi vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ denti te upasaṅkamitvā evam'assu vacanīyā, kālo vassikasāṭikāya, samayo vassikasāṭikāya, aññe'pi manussā vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ dentī'ti.
sbs_example_3: tādisikāya āpattiyā ekaccaṃ pabbājenti ekaccaṃ na pabbājentī'ti, so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi evam'assa vacanīyo

meaning_1: not devoted (to); not applying oneself (to); not practising; lit. not yoked near
example_1: ye'me, bho gotama, puggalā ... indriyesu aguttadvārā bhojane amattaññuno jāgariyaṃ ananuyuttā sāmaññe anapekkhavanto ... na tehi bhavaṃ gotamo saddhiṃ saṃvasati.
example_2: bhāvan'ānuyogaṃ ananuyuttassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno viharato kiñ'c'āpi evaṃ icchā uppajjeyya, aho vata me anupādāya āsavehi cittaṃ vimucceyyā'ti, atha khv'assa n'eva anupādāya āsavehi cittaṃ vimuccati. taṃ kissa hetu?

meaning_1: consents (to); accepts; agrees (to); permits; lit. causes to be tasted
example_1: seyyath'idaṃ, nando vaccho, kiso saṃkicco, makkhali gosālo, etehi, bho gotama, acelakā mutt'ācārā hatth'āpalekhanā naehibhaddantikā natiṭṭhabhaddantikā na abhihaṭaṃ na uddissakataṃ na nimantanaṃ sādiyanti
example_2: kappati samaṇānaṃ sakyaputtiyānaṃ jātarūparajataṃ, sādiyanti samaṇā sakyaputtiyā jātarūparajataṃ, paṭiggaṇhanti samaṇā sakyaputtiyā jātarūparajatan'ti!

example_1: apalokento kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo sabbakāyen'eva apaloketi, so na uddhaṃ ulloketi, na adho oloketi, na ca vipekkhamāno gacchati, yugamattañ'ca pekkhati, tato c'assa uttari anāvaṭaṃ ñāṇadassanaṃ bhavati.
example_2: tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tesu'y'eva kusalesu dhammesu patiṭṭhāya uttari āsavānaṃ khayāya yogo karaṇīyo'ti.
sbs_example_3: tañ'ce aññātako gahapati vā gahapatānī vā bahūhi cīvarehi abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavāreyya, santar'uttaraparamaṃ tena bhikkhunā tato cīvaraṃ sāditabbaṃ. tato ce uttari sādiyeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: should be given up (by); should be abandoned (by); lit. to be abandoned

meaning_1: right way; correct course; proper procedure
example_1: ekena'pi ce ūno vīsatigaṇo bhikkhusaṅgho taṃ bhikkhuṃ abbheyya, so ca bhikkhu anabbhito, te ca bhikkhū gārayhā, ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.

meaning_1: reason; grounds; basis; cause; lit. standing
example_1:

meaning_1: it is possible that; it is plausible that; lit. this basis exists
example_1: so vata, cunda, attanā palipapalipanno paraṃ palipapalipannaṃ uddharissatīti n'etaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati. so vata, cunda, attanā apalipapalipanno paraṃ palipapalipannaṃ uddharissatī'ti ṭhānam'etaṃ vijjati

sbs_example_3: so vat'āvuso, cakkhusmiṃ sati rūpe sati cakkhuviññāṇe sati phassapaññattiṃ paññāpessatī'ti, ṭhānam'etaṃ vijjati. phassapaññattiyā sati vedanāpaññattiṃ paññāpessatī'ti, ṭhānam'etaṃ vijjati.

meaning_1: source of stress; arising of suffering; appearance of discomfort
example_1: yo imesu pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu chando ālayo anunayo ajjhosānaṃ so dukkhasamudayo. yo imesu pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu chandarāgavinayo chandarāgappahānaṃ, so dukkhanirodho'ti. ettāvatā'pi kho, āvuso, bhikkhuno bahukataṃ hoti.
example_2: katamā ca, bhikkhave, avijjā? yaṃ kho, bhikkhave, dukkhe aññāṇaṃ, dukkhasamudaye aññāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhe aññāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya aññāṇaṃ.

meaning_1: should be seen; should be regarded as; should be understood; lit. to be seen
example_1: kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, kabaḷīkāro āhāro daṭṭhabbo?
example_2: imassa nu kho, sāriputta, saṃkhittena bhāsitassa kathaṃ vitthārena attho daṭṭhabbo'ti? evaṃ vutte, āyasmā sāriputto tuṇhī ahosi.

commentary:
(VIN 1.4.11) santhataṃ nāma santharitvā kataṃ hoti avāyimaṃ.
(VINa) santharitvā kataṃ hotī'ti same bhūmibhāge kosiyaṃsūni uparūpari santharitvā kañjik'ādīhi siñcitvā kataṃ hoti
example_1: yo pana bhikkhu kosiyamissakaṃ santhataṃ kārāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

example_1: channaṃ tv'eva, phagguna, phass'āyatanānaṃ asesavirāganirodhā phassanirodho, phassanirodhā vedanānirodho, vedanānirodhā taṇhānirodho
example_2: yato kho, āvuso, bhikkhu channaṃ phassāyatanānaṃ samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ettāvatā kho, āvuso, bhikkhuno dassanaṃ suvisuddhaṃ hotī'ti.

meaning_1: aversion; repulsion; resistance; irritation; conflict; lit. striking against

example_2: upekkhaṃ, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. upekkhañ'hi te, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvayato yo paṭigho so pahīyissati.

meaning_1: should be considered; should be reviewed; should be contemplated; should be reflected (on); lit. to be looked back down

meaning_1: having built; lit. causing to build
example_1: saññācikāya pana bhikkhunā kuṭiṃ kārayamānena assāmikaṃ att'uddesaṃ pamāṇikā kāretabbā, tatr'idaṃ pamāṇaṃ, dīghaso dvādasa vidatthiyo sugatavidatthiyā, tiriyaṃ satt'antarā
example_2: mahallakaṃ pana bhikkhunā vihāraṃ kārayamānena sassāmikaṃ att'uddesaṃ bhikkhū abhinetabbā vatthudesanāya, tehi bhikkhūhi vatthu desetabbaṃ anārambhaṃ saparikkamanaṃ.
sbs_example_3: mahallakaṃ pana bhikkhunā vihāraṃ kārayamānena yāva dvārakosā aggalaṭṭhapanāya ālokasandhiparikammāya dvatticchadanassa pariyāyaṃ

example_1: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vivicc'eva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṃ savicāraṃ vivekajaṃ pītisukhaṃ paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu andham'akāsi māraṃ, apadaṃ vadhitvā māracakkhuṃ adassanaṃ gato pāpimato.
example_2: tasmiṃ samaye kosalamahārājā mahantena balen'āgantvā bārāṇasiṃ gahetvā rājānaṃ māretvā tass'eva aggamahesiṃ attano aggamahesiṃ akāsi.

example_1:
anupubbena medhāvī,
thokaṃ thokaṃ khaṇe khaṇe,
kammāro rajatass'eva,
niddhame malam'attano.
example_2: atha kho bhagavā kapilavatthusmiṃ yath'ābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena sāvatthi tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi. anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena sāvatthi tadavasari.
sbs_example_3: kālena dhammassavanaṃ, kālena dhammasākacchā, kālena sammasanā, kālena vipassanā, ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro kālā sammā bhāviyamānā sammā anuparivattiyamānā anupubbena āsavānaṃ khayaṃ pāpenti.

meaning_1: should be attended to; should be kept in mind; lit. to be made in mind
example_1: idha, bhikkhave, assutavā puthujjano manasikaraṇīye dhamme nappajānāti, amanasikaraṇīye dhamme nappajānāti
example_2: tassa amanasikaraṇīyānaṃ dhammānaṃ amanasikārā manasikaraṇīyānaṃ dhammānaṃ manasikārā anuppannā c'eva āsavā na uppajjanti, uppannā ca āsavā pahīyanti.
sbs_example_3: katame ca dhammā manasikaraṇīyā ye dhamme manasi karoti? yassa dhamme manasikaroto anuppanno vā kām'āsavo na uppajjati, uppanno vā kām'āsavo pahīyati

commentary: (DNa) kālena kālan'ti kāle kāle, anvaddhamāsaṃ vā anudas'āhaṃ vā'ti attho.
example_1: adhicittam'anuyuttena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā pañca nimittāni kālena kālaṃ manasi kātabbāni. katamāni pañca?
example_2: kālena kālañ'ca vaṇaṃ dhoveyyāsi, kālena kālaṃ vaṇamukhaṃ ālimpeyyāsi, mā te na kālena kālaṃ vaṇaṃ dhovato na kālena kālaṃ vaṇamukhaṃ ālimpato pubbalohitaṃ vaṇamukhaṃ pariyonandhi.
sbs_example_3: ime te, ambho purisa, cattāro āsīvisā uggatejā ghoravisā kālena kālaṃ vuṭṭhāpetabbā, kālena kālaṃ nhāpetabbā

meaning_1: takes life; kills; lit. deprives from life
commentary: (VIN 2.5.7.1) jīvitā voropeyyā'ti jīvit'indriyaṃ upacchindati uparodheti santatiṃ vikopeti
example_1: yo pana bhikkhu sañcicca manussaviggahaṃ jīvitā voropeyya, satthahārakaṃ v'āssa pariyeseyya, maraṇavaṇṇaṃ vā saṃvaṇṇeyya, maraṇāya vā samādapeyya
example_2: yadā kho, āvuso, tassa purisassa evam'assa, saṃvissattho kho my'āyaṃ gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā'ti, atha naṃ rahogataṃ viditvā tiṇhena satthena jīvitā voropeyya.
sbs_example_3: ime kho, ambho purisa, pañca vadhakā paccatthikā piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandhā, yatth'eva naṃ passissāma tatth'eva jīvitā voropessāmā'ti.

meaning_1: who has destroyed the effluents; enlightened; epithet of an arahant
example_1: te bhikkhave sattā sudullabhā lokasmiṃ ye cetasikena rogena muhuttam'pi ārogyaṃ paṭijānanti aññatra khīṇ'āsavehi
example_2:
aññena ca kevalinaṃ mah'esiṃ,
khīṇ'āsavaṃ kukkuccavūpasantaṃ,
annena pānena upaṭṭhahassu,
khettaṃ hi taṃ puññapekkhassa hotī'ti.
sbs_example_3:
hitvā agāraṃ pabbajitā,
hitvā puttaṃ pasuṃ viyaṃ,
hitvā rāgañ'ca dosañ'ca, avijjaṃ ca virājiya, khīṇ'āsavā arahanto
te lokasmiṃ anussukā.
sbs_example_4: yo so, bhante, bhikkhu arahaṃ khīṇ'āsavo vusitavā katakaraṇīyo ohitabhāro anuppattasadattho parikkhīṇabhavasaṃyojano samma'd'aññāvimutto, so cha ṭhānāni adhimutto hoti

meaning_1: should be learned (by); should be practised (by); should be trained (by); lit. to be trained
example_1: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, tibbo no chando bhavissati adhisīlasikkhāsamādāne, tibbo no chando bhavissati adhicittasikkhāsamādāne, tibbo no chando bhavissati adhipaññāsikkhāsamādāne'ti.
example_2: daḷhe khīle vā thambhe vā'ti kho, bhikkhave, kāyagatāya satiyā etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. tasmā't'iha vo, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, kāyagatā no sati bhāvitā bhavissati bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā'ti.
sbs_example_3: evaṃ hi vo bhikkhave sikkhitabbaṃ. att'atthaṃ vā hi bhikkhave sampassamānena alam'eva appamādena sampādetuṃ
sbs_example_4: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ – adhun'āgatavadhukāsamena cetasā viharissāmā'ti

meaning_1: seeing; eye consciousness; visual awareness; lit. eye knowing
example_1: dvayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭicca viññāṇaṃ sambhoti. kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, dvayaṃ paṭicca viññāṇaṃ sambhoti? cakkhuñ'ca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhuviññāṇaṃ.
example_2: katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, viññāṇaṃ? cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, viññāṇakāyā, cakkhuviññāṇaṃ, sotaviññāṇaṃ, ghānaviññāṇaṃ, jivhāviññāṇaṃ, kāyaviññāṇaṃ, manoviññāṇaṃ.
sbs_example_3: cakkhuṃ bhikkhave ādittaṃ, rūpā ādittā, cakkhuviññāṇaṃ ādittaṃ, cakkhusamphasso āditto.
sbs_example_4: so vat'āvuso, cakkhusmiṃ sati rūpe sati cakkhuviññāṇe sati phassapaññattiṃ paññāpessatī'ti, ṭhānam'etaṃ vijjati. phassapaññattiyā sati vedanāpaññattiṃ paññāpessatī'ti, ṭhānam'etaṃ vijjati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: should be cultivated; should be developed; lit. to be caused to be
example_1: yā c'āvuso, paññā yañ'ca viññāṇaṃ, imesaṃ dhammānaṃ saṃsaṭṭhānaṃ no visaṃsaṭṭhānaṃ paññā bhāvetabbā, viññāṇaṃ pariññeyyaṃ. idaṃ nesaṃ nānākaraṇan'ti.
example_2:
abhiññeyyaṃ abhiññātaṃ,

sbs_example_4: anicce dukkhasaññā, dukkhe anattasaññā, pahānasaññā, virāgasaññā, nirodhasaññā, rāgassa abhiññāya ime dasa dhammā bhāvetabbā'ti.

meaning_1: should be practised; should be pursued; should be indulged in; lit. to be associated

meaning_1: directly knowing; understanding experientially; lit. completely knowing
example_1: atthi loke samaṇabrāhmaṇā sammaggatā sammāpaṭipannā ye imañ'ca lokaṃ parañ'ca lokaṃ sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedentī'ti

example_1: seyyathā'pi, ānanda, īsakaṃpoṇe padumapalāse udakaphusitāni pavattanti
example_2: vātavuṭṭhisamayo nāma bhikkhū sarajena vātena okiṇṇā honti, dve vā tīṇi vā udakaphusitāni kāye patitāni honti, vātavuṭṭhisamayo'ti nahāyitabbaṃ.

meaning_1: remains (in); continues (in); persists (in); is established (in); stands firm (in); lit. stands together
example_1: manāp'āmanāpaṃ nirujjhati upekkhā saṇṭhāti
example_2: sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno ṭhān'āṭhāne na saṇṭhāti parikappe na saṇṭhāti aññātavāde na saṇṭhāti paṭipadāya na saṇṭhāti, evaṃ santāyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo akaccho hoti.
sbs_example_3: āhāre paṭikūlasaññāparicitena, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno cetasā bahulaṃ viharato, rasataṇhāya cittaṃ patilīyati patikuṭati pativattati, na sampasāriyati, upekkhā vā pāṭikulyatā vā saṇṭhāti.

meaning_1: aversion (to); disgust (for); revulsion (toward); lit. against the slope state
example_1: evaṃdiṭṭhino, bhikkhave, etaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ, yā c'āyaṃ bhave appaṭikulyatā, sā c'assa na bhavissati. yā c'āyaṃ bhavanirodhe pāṭikulyatā, sā c'assa na bhavissatī'ti.
example_2: asubhanimitt'ānuyogaṃ anuyuttassa kho, nāgita, subhanimitte pāṭikulyatā saṇṭhāti, eso tassa nissando.
sbs_example_3: āhāre paṭikūlasaññāparicitena, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno cetasā bahulaṃ viharato, rasataṇhāya cittaṃ patilīyati patikuṭati pativattati, na sampasāriyati, upekkhā vā pāṭikulyatā vā saṇṭhāti.

example_1: ye'me pañca kāmaguṇā cetaso samphuṭṭhapubbā atītā niruddhā vipariṇatā, tatra me cittaṃ bahulaṃ gacchamānaṃ gaccheyya paccuppannesu vā appaṃ vā anāgatesu.
example_2: abhijjhālu nu kho bahulaṃ viharāmi, anabhijjhālu nu kho bahulaṃ viharāmi, byāpannacitto nu kho bahulaṃ viharāmi, abyāpannacitto nu kho bahulaṃ viharāmi
sbs_example_3: āhāre paṭikūlasaññāparicitena, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno cetasā bahulaṃ viharato, rasataṇhāya cittaṃ patilīyati patikuṭati pativattati, na sampasāriyati, upekkhā vā pāṭikulyatā vā saṇṭhāti.

example_1: ahañ'c'eva kho pana evaṃ pabbajito samāno kāmavitakkaṃ vā vitakkeyyaṃ, byāpādavitakkaṃ vā vitakkeyyaṃ, vihiṃsāvitakkaṃ vā vitakkeyyaṃ, mahā kho pan'āyaṃ lokasannivāso.
example_2: so paṭisaṃharati c'eva na ca vitakketi na ca vicāreti
sbs_example_3: ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vasī vitakkapariyāyapathesu. yaṃ vitakkaṃ ākaṅkhissati taṃ vitakkaṃ vitakkessati, yaṃ vitakkaṃ n'ākaṅkhissati na taṃ vitakkaṃ vitakkessati.

example_1: cattāro'me, bhikkhave, kālā sammā bhāviyamānā sammā anuparivattiyamānā anupubbena āsavānaṃ khayaṃ pāpenti
example_2: sādhu, devo, vāhanāgāresu ca dvāresu ca āṇāpetu, yena vāhanena jīvako icchati tena vāhanena gacchatu, yena dvārena icchati tena dvārena gacchatu, yaṃ kālaṃ icchati taṃ kālaṃ gacchatu, yaṃ kālaṃ icchati taṃ kālaṃ pavisatū'ti.
sbs_example_3: atthi nu kho me uttarimanussadhammā alam'ariyañāṇadassanaviseso adhigato, so'haṃ pacchime kāle sabrahmacārīhi puṭṭho na maṅku bhavissāmī'ti

meaning_1: mansion; stately home; palace; building with pillars
example_1: tam'enaṃ evaṃ vadeyyuṃ, ambho purisa, yassa tvaṃ pāsādassa ārohaṇāya nisseṇiṃ karosi, jānāsi taṃ pāsādaṃ puratthimāya vā disāya dakkhiṇāya vā disāya pacchimāya vā disāya uttarāya vā disāya ucco vā nīco vā majjhimo vā'ti?
example_2: tena kho pana samayena bārāṇasiyaṃ yaso nāma kulaputto seṭṭhiputto sukhumālo hoti. tassa tayo pāsādā honti, eko hem'antiko, eko gimhiko, eko vassiko.
sbs_example_3: atha kho, bhikkhave, bandhumā rājā vipassissa kumārassa tayo pāsāde kārāpesi, ekaṃ vassikaṃ ekaṃ hem'antikaṃ ekaṃ gimhikaṃ, pañca kāmaguṇāni upaṭṭhāpesi
sbs_example_4: bhante, imaṃ catumāsaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ gahetvā idh'eva vasatha, pāsādam'ahaṃ karissāmī'ti.
sbs_example_5:
pamādaṃ appamādena, yadā nudati paṇḍito,
paññāpāsādam'āruyha, asoko sokiniṃ pajaṃ,
pabbataṭṭho'va bhūmaṭṭhe, dhīro bāle avekkhati.

meaning_1: name of the 7th previous Buddha; lit. insightful; who sees distinctly

example_2:

yen'eva maggena sikhī ca vessabhū,
kakusandhakoṇāgamano ca kassapo,
ten'añjasena agamāsi gotamo.

meaning_1: devoted (to); applied oneself (to); practised; doing; lit. yoked near
example_1: jāgariyaṃ anuyuttā bhavissāma, divasaṃ caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittaṃ parisodhessāma
example_2:
okkhittacakkhu na ca pādalolo,
jhāna-anuyutto bahujāgarassa,
upekkham'ārabbha samāhit'atto,
takk'āsayaṃ kukkucciy'ūpachinde.
sbs_example_3: adhicittam'anuyuttena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā pañca nimittāni kālena kālaṃ manasi kātabbāni. katamāni pañca?
sbs_example_4:
na-anuyuttā tathā eke, muṇḍā saṅghāṭipārutā.
sambhāvanaṃyev'icchanti, lābhasakkāramucchitā.
sbs_example_5: ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, jāgariyaṃ anuyutto viharāhi, divasaṃ caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittaṃ parisodhehi
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: so vata, cunda, attanā palipapalipanno paraṃ palipapalipannaṃ uddharissatīti n'etaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati. so vata, cunda, attanā apalipapalipanno paraṃ palipapalipannaṃ uddharissatī'ti ṭhānam'etaṃ vijjati
example_2:
susukhaṃ vata nibbānaṃ,
sammāsambuddhadesitaṃ,
asokaṃ virajaṃ khemaṃ,
yattha dukkhaṃ nirujjhatī'ti.
sbs_example_3:
aciraṃ vat'ayaṃ kāyo, paṭhaviṃ adhisessati.
chuḍḍho apetaviññāṇo, niratthaṃ'va kaliṅgaraṃ.
sbs_example_4: atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, ārādhayiṃsu vata me, bhikkhave, bhikkhū ekaṃ samayaṃ cittaṃ. idh'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū āmantesiṃ, ahaṃ kho, bhikkhave, ek'āsanabhojanaṃ bhuñjāmi.
sbs_example_5: taṃ kut'ettha, ānanda, labbhā yaṃ taṃ jātaṃ bhūtaṃ saṅkhataṃ palokadhammaṃ, taṃ vata mā palujjī'ti n'etaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: therefore here; therefore in this regard
commentary: (VINt) tasmā't'ihā'ti tasmā icc'eva vuttaṃ hoti ... ti-kāra ha-kārā nipātā. ihā'ti vā imasmiṃ sāsane, ta-kāro padasandhivasena āgato.
example_1: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, yaṃ kiñci rūpaṃ atīt'ānāgatapaccuppannaṃ ajjhattaṃ vā bahiddhā vā oḷārikaṃ vā sukhumaṃ vā hīnaṃ vā paṇītaṃ vā yaṃ dūre santike vā, sabbaṃ rūpaṃ, n'etaṃ mama, n'eso'ham'asmi, na m'eso attā'ti evam'etaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ
example_2: daḷhe khīle vā thambhe vā'ti kho, bhikkhave, kāyagatāya satiyā etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. tasmā't'iha vo, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, kāyagatā no sati bhāvitā bhavissati bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā'ti.
sbs_example_3: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, vīriyaṃ ārabhatha appattassa pattiyā, anadhigatassa adhigamāya, asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.
sbs_example_4: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ – adhun'āgatavadhukāsamena cetasā viharissāmā'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: should be practised; should be followed; should be undertaken; lit. to be served
example_1: attānaṃ, bhikkhave, rakkhissāmī'ti satipaṭṭhānaṃ sevitabbaṃ, paraṃ rakkhissāmī'ti satipaṭṭhānaṃ sevitabbaṃ. attānaṃ, bhikkhave, rakkhanto paraṃ rakkhati, paraṃ rakkhanto attānaṃ rakkhati.
example_2: dve'me, bhikkhave, antā pabbajitena na sevitabbā.
sbs_chant_eng_2: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_3: sevitabbe dhamme na jānāti asevitabbe dhamme na jānāti, bhajitabbe dhamme na jānāti abhajitabbe dhamme na jānāti.

example_1: navaṃ pana bhikkhunā santhataṃ kārāpetvā chabbassāni dhāretabbaṃ, orena ce channaṃ vassānaṃ taṃ santhataṃ vissajjetvā vā avissajjetvā vā aññaṃ navaṃ santhataṃ kārāpeyya aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
example_2: yo pana bhikkhu orena-addhamāsaṃ nahāyeyya, pācittiyan'ti
sbs_example_3: orena ce māso seso gimhānan'ti vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ pariyeseyya, oren'addhamāso seso gimhānan'ti katvā nivāseyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

example_1: ambho purisa na tvaṃ addasa manussesu tatiyaṃ devadūtaṃ pātubhūtan'ti? so evam'āha nāddasaṃ bhante'ti
example_2: tam'enaṃ evaṃ vadeyyuṃ, ambho purisa, yassa tvaṃ pāsādassa ārohaṇāya nisseṇiṃ karosi, jānāsi taṃ pāsādaṃ puratthimāya vā disāya dakkhiṇāya vā disāya pacchimāya vā disāya uttarāya vā disāya ucco vā nīco vā majjhimo vā'ti?
sbs_example_3: ambho purisa, na tvaṃ addasa manussesu itthiṃ vā purisaṃ vā ābādhikaṃ dukkhitaṃ bāḷhagilānaṃ, sake muttakarīse palipannaṃ semānaṃ, aññehi vuṭṭhāpiyamānaṃ, aññehi saṃvesiyamānan'ti?
sbs_example_4: ambho purisa, kiṃ tuyh'iminā pāpakena dujjīvitena? matan'te jīvitā seyyo'ti
sbs_example_5: tam'enaṃ pubb'aṇhasamayaṃ sattisatena haneyyuṃ. atha rājā majjh'anhikasamayaṃ evaṃ vadeyya, ambho, kathaṃ so puriso'ti?

meaning_1: hey good man; look here my man

meaning_1: deprives (of); removes (from); cuts off (from); takes down (from)
example_1: yo pana bhikkhu sañcicca manussaviggahaṃ jīvitā voropeyya, satthahārakaṃ v'āssa pariyeseyya, maraṇavaṇṇaṃ vā saṃvaṇṇeyya, maraṇāya vā samādapeyya
example_2: khat'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā. upahat'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā. sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā pitaraṃ dhammikaṃ dhammarājānaṃ jīvitā na voropessatha, imasmiññ'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ uppajjissathā'ti.

meaning_1: with correct understanding; with perfect wisdom
example_1: lokasamudayaṃ kho, kaccāna, yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya passato yā loke natthitā sā na hoti. lokanirodhaṃ kho, kaccāna, yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya passato yā loke atthitā sā na hoti.
example_2: sabbaṃ rūpaṃ, n'etaṃ mama, n'eso'ham'asmi, na m'eso attā'ti evam'etaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ

sbs_example_3:
yo ca buddhañ'ca dhammañ'ca, saṅghañ'ca saraṇaṃ gato,

meaning_1: long lasting; enduring; lit. long standing
example_1: addhānakkhamo hoti, padhānakkhamo hoti, app'ābādho hoti, asitaṃ pītaṃ khāyitaṃ sāyitaṃ sammā pariṇāmaṃ gacchati, caṅkam'ādhigato samādhi ciraṭṭhitiko hoti. ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca caṅkame ānisaṃsā'ti.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, pāsāṇe lekhā na khippaṃ lujjati vātena vā udakena vā, ciraṭṭhitikā hoti, evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco puggalo abhiṇhaṃ kujjhati. so ca khv'assa kodho dīgharattaṃ anuseti.
sbs_example_3: yatha'y'idaṃ brahmacariyaṃ addhaniyaṃ assa ciraṭṭhitikaṃ, tadassa bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lok'ānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: right view; correct outlook; correct belief
example_1: ime vā pana bhonto sattā kāyasucaritena samannāgatā vacīsucaritena samannāgatā manosucaritena samannāgatā ariyānaṃ anupavādakā sammādiṭṭhikā sammādiṭṭhikammasamādānā
example_2: ayam'eva ariyo aṭṭh'aṅgiko maggo rūpanirodhagāminī paṭipadā, seyyath'idaṃ sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākamm'anto sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati sammāsamādhi.
sbs_example_3: yaṃ kho, bhikkhave, dukkhe ñāṇaṃ, dukkhasamudaye ñāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhe ñāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya ñāṇaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, sammādiṭṭhi.
sbs_example_4: sammādiṭṭhi sammādiṭṭhī'ti, bhante, vuccati. kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, sammādiṭṭhi hotī'ti?
sbs_example_5:
aniccaṃ aniccato dakkhuṃ, dukkham'addakkhu dukkhato.
anattani anattā'ti, asubhaṃ asubhat'addasuṃ.
sammādiṭṭhisamādānā, sabbaṃ dukkhaṃ upaccagun'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: kāmacchando, bhikkhave, āvaraṇo nīvaraṇo cetaso ajjhāruho paññāya dubbalīkaraṇo. byāpādo, bhikkhave, āvaraṇo nīvaraṇo cetaso ajjhāruho paññāya dubbalīkaraṇo.
example_2: samaṇo, āvuso, gotamo sāvakānaṃ evaṃ dhammaṃ deseti, etha tumhe, bhikkhave, pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe satta bojjh'aṅge yathābhūtaṃ bhāvethā'ti.
sbs_example_3: vitakkavicārānaṃ vūpasamā ajjhattaṃ sampasādanaṃ cetaso ekodibhāvaṃ avitakkaṃ avicāraṃ samādhijaṃ pītisukhaṃ dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
sbs_example_4: tañ'c'āyaṃ upay'upādānaṃ cetaso adhiṭṭhānaṃ abhinives'ānusayaṃ na upeti na upādiyati n'ādhiṭṭhāti, attā me'ti.
sbs_example_5: yena anuppannaṃ vā thīnamiddhaṃ uppajjati uppannaṃ vā thinamiddhaṃ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati yatha'y'idaṃ arati tandī vijambhitā bhattasammado cetaso ca līnattaṃ.

meaning_1: enters; gets involved (with); engages (in); lit. approaches
example_1:
vadanti ve duṭṭhamanā'pi eke,
atho'pi ve saccamanā vadanti,
vādañ'ca jātaṃ muni no upeti,
tasmā munī n'atthi khilo kuhiñci.
example_2:
upayo hi dhammesu upeti vādaṃ,
anūpayaṃ kena kathaṃ vadeyya,
attā nirattā na hi tassa atthi,
adhosi so diṭṭhim'idh'eva sabban'ti.
sbs_example_3: upay'upādān'ābhinivesavinibandho khv'āyaṃ, kaccāna, loko yebhuyyena. tañ'c'āyaṃ upay'upādānaṃ cetaso adhiṭṭhānaṃ abhinives'ānusayaṃ na upeti na upādiyati n'ādhiṭṭhāti, attā me'ti.

meaning_1: existence; idea of existence; fact of being present; lit. is state
example_1: dvayanissito khv'āyaṃ, kaccāna, loko yebhuyyena, atthitañ'c'eva natthitañ'ca. lokasamudayaṃ kho, kaccāna, yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya passato yā loke natthitā sā na hoti. lokanirodhaṃ kho, kaccāna, yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya passato yā loke atthitā sā na hoti.
example_2: idāni pana sūriy'ālokassa atthitāya padīpakiccaṃ idha n'atthi
sbs_example_3: tattha purimesu catūsu kiccesu idāni suriy'ālokassa atthitāya n'atthi, aparāni tīṇi bhikkhūnaṃ vattaṃ jānantehi bhikkhūhi katāni pariniṭṭhitāni honti.

meaning_1: fairly; correctly; justly; legally; lit. according to the law
commentary:
(VIN 2.5.7.3) yathādhammaṃ nāma dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena kataṃ, etaṃ yathādhammaṃ nāma.
(VINa) yathādhamman'ti yo yassa adhikaraṇassa vūpasamanāya dhammo vutto, ten'eva dhammen'āti attho.
example_1: yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ yathādhammaṃ nihat'ādhikaraṇaṃ punakammāya ukkoṭeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
example_2: accayaṃ accayato na passati, accayaṃ accayato disvā yathādhammaṃ nappaṭikaroti, parassa kho pana accayaṃ desentassa yathādhammaṃ nappaṭiggaṇhāti
sbs_example_3: tass'etaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ, anāpanno vā pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ na āpajjissati, āpanno vā pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ yathādhammaṃ paṭikarissati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: in what way?; to what extent?; in what respect?
example_1: suñño loko, suñño loko'ti, bhante, vuccati. kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, suñño loko'ti vuccatī'ti?
example_2: na hi pana taṃ, gahapati, paṭibhāsi bhagavantaṃ uttariṃ paṭipucchituṃ, kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, āturakāyo c'eva hoti āturacitto ca, kittāvatā ca pana āturakāyo hi kho hoti no ca āturacitto'ti?
sbs_example_3: sammādiṭṭhi sammādiṭṭhī'ti, bhante, vuccati. kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, sammādiṭṭhi hotī'ti?
sbs_example_4: sandiṭṭhiko dhammo, sandiṭṭhiko dhammo'ti, bhante, vuccati. kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, sandiṭṭhiko dhammo hoti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: engaging and grasping; approaching and clinging; going near and grabbing hold
example_1: kathañ'ca, gahapati, anokasārī hoti? rūpadhātuyā kho, gahapati, yo chando yo rāgo yā nandī yā taṇhā ye upay'upādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhān'ābhinives'ānusayā te tathāgatassa pahīnā ucchinnamūlā
example_2: upay'upādān'ābhinivesavinibandho khv'āyaṃ, kaccāna, loko yebhuyyena. tañ'c'āyaṃ upay'upādānaṃ cetaso adhiṭṭhānaṃ abhinives'ānusayaṃ na upeti na upādiyati n'ādhiṭṭhāti, attā me'ti.
sbs_example_3: rūpadhātuyā kho yo chando yo rāgo yā nandī yā taṇhā ye upay'upādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhān'ābhinives'ānusayā, tesaṃ khayā virāgā nirodhā cāgā paṭinissaggā cittaṃ suvimuttan'ti vuccati.

meaning_1: profitable; meaningful; beneficial; lit. connected with benefit
commentary:
(MNa) atthasaṃhitan'ti anekehi'pi nayehi vibhajantena pariyādātuṃ asakkuṇeyyatāya atthasampannaṃ, yaṃ vā so atthavādī atthaṃ vadati, tena atthena saṃhitattā atthasaṃhitaṃ vācaṃ bhāsati, na aññaṃ nikkhipitvā aññaṃ bhāsatī'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
(ANa) kāraṇanissitaṃ katvā vadanto atthasaṃhitena vadati nāma.
example_1: kālavādī bhūtavādī atthavādī dhammavādī vinayavādī nidhānavatiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti kālena sāpadesaṃ pariyantavatiṃ atthasaṃhitaṃ
example_2: yañ'ca kho jaññā rahovādaṃ bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ atthasaṃhitaṃ tatra kālaññū assa tassa rahovādassa vacanāya.
sbs_example_3: kālena ca bhāsitā hoti, saccā ca bhāsitā hoti, saṇhā ca bhāsitā hoti, atthasaṃhitā ca bhāsitā hoti, mettacittena ca bhāsitā hoti.

construction:
sa + nta > santa > sat + ya
sat + ya
example_1: kāmaṃ kho pana m'āhu paro loko, hotu nesaṃ bhavataṃ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ saccaṃ vacanaṃ, atha ca pan'āyaṃ bhavaṃ purisapuggalo diṭṭh'eva dhamme viññūnaṃ gārayho
example_2: tesaṃ vo, bhikkhave, evaṃsamaññānaṃ sataṃ evaṃpaṭiññānaṃ sataṃ, yā samaṇasāmīcippaṭipadā taṃ paṭipajjissāma. evaṃ no ayaṃ amhākaṃ samaññā ca saccā bhavissati paṭiññā ca bhūtā.

example_1: kassa nu kho, bhante, subhāsitan'ti? sabbesaṃ vo, bhikkhave, subhāsitaṃ pariyāyena, api ca yaṃ mayā sandhāya bhāsitaṃ pārāyane metteyyapañhe
example_2: imassa khv'āhaṃ, āvuso, bhagavatā saṃkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena atthaṃ avibhattassa vitthārena atthaṃ ājānāmi. saḷ'āyatananirodhaṃ no etaṃ, āvuso, bhagavatā sandhāya bhāsitaṃ
sbs_example_3: kālena ca bhāsitā hoti, saccā ca bhāsitā hoti, saṇhā ca bhāsitā hoti, atthasaṃhitā ca bhāsitā hoti, mettacittena ca bhāsitā hoti.

example_1:

example_1:

meaning_1: irreproachable; faultless; blameless; innocent; lit. not to be dispraised
example_1: so iminā ariyena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato ajjhattaṃ anavajjasukhaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti
example_2:
sīlabbataṃ v'āpi pahāya sabbaṃ,

virato care santim'anuggahāya.

example_1: pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatā vācā subhāsitā hoti, no dubbhāsitā, anavajjā ca ananuvajjā ca viññūnaṃ. katamehi pañcahi?
example_2: sā kho pan'esā, mahānāma, brahmunā sanaṅkumārena gāthā sugītā no duggītā, subhāsitā no dubbhāsitā, atthasaṃhitā no anatthasaṃhitā, anumatā bhagavatā'ti.

meaning_1: non-existence; idea of non-existence; absence; lit. there is not state
example_1: dvayanissito khv'āyaṃ, kaccāna, loko yebhuyyena, atthitañ'c'eva natthitañ'ca. lokasamudayaṃ kho, kaccāna, yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya passato yā loke natthitā sā na hoti. lokanirodhaṃ kho, kaccāna, yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya passato yā loke atthitā sā na hoti.

example_2: ettāvatā kho, āvuso, bhikkhu abhiññeyyaṃ abhijānāti, pariññeyyaṃ parijānāti, abhiññeyyaṃ abhijānanto pariññeyyaṃ parijānanto diṭṭh'eva dhamme dukkhass'antakaro hotī'ti.

example_2: addasā kho, bhikkhave, kummo kacchapo siṅgālaṃ dūrato'va gocarapasutaṃ. disvāna soṇḍipañcamāni aṅgāni sake kapāle samodahitvā app'ossukko tuṇhībhūto saṅkasāyati.

example_2: yañ'hi'ssa, bhikkhave, cakkhu'ndriyasaṃvaraṃ asaṃvutassa viharato uppajjeyyuṃ āsavā vighātapariḷāhā, cakkhu'ndriyasaṃvaraṃ saṃvutassa viharato evaṃsa te āsavā vighātapariḷāhā na honti

example_1:
sabb'ābhibhuṃ sabbaviduṃ sumedhaṃ,
sabbesu dhammesu anūpalittaṃ,
sabbañ'jahaṃ taṇhākkhaye vimuttaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ naraṃ ekavihārī'ti brūmī'ti.
example_2: yassa kho, brāhmaṇa, āyatiṃ gabbhaseyyā punabbhav'ābhinibbatti pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tāl'āvatthukatā anabhāvaṃkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā tam'ahaṃ apagabbho'ti vadāmi.
sbs_example_3:
yassa rāgo ca doso ca, māno makkho ca pātito,
sāsapo'r'iva ār'aggā, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.
sbs_example_4:
yo ve uppatitaṃ kodhaṃ, rathaṃ bhantaṃ'va vāraye,
tam'ahaṃ sārathiṃ brūmi, rasmiggāho itaro jano.
sbs_example_5: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, bhaddāli, idh'assa bhikkhu ubhatobhāgavimutto, tam'ahaṃ evaṃ vadeyyaṃ, ehi me tvaṃ, bhikkhu, paṅke saṅkamo hohī'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
uṭṭhahatha nisīdatha,
ko attho supitena vo,
āturānañ'hi kā niddā,
sallaviddhāna ruppataṃ.
example_2: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, rāhula, kim'atthiyo ādāso'ti? paccavekkhaṇ'attho, bhante'ti.
sbs_example_3: yassa khv'āhaṃ atthāya cittaṃ paṇidahiṃ so me attho abhinipphanno.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: in this life; right here right now; in the present; lit. even in seen things
example_1: ettāvatā kho, āvuso, bhikkhu abhiññeyyaṃ abhijānāti, pariññeyyaṃ parijānāti, abhiññeyyaṃ abhijānanto pariññeyyaṃ parijānanto diṭṭh'eva dhamme dukkhass'antakaro hotī'ti.
example_2: khattiyakulā ce'pi agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti. so ca āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭh'eva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati. āsavānaṃ khayā samaṇo hoti.
sbs_example_3: yass'atthāya kulaputtā samma'd'eva agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajanti tad'anuttaraṃ brahmacariyapariyosānaṃ diṭṭh'eva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.

meaning_1: conduct; behaviour; way of behaving; state of life
example_1:
paṇḍito'ti samaññāto,
ekacariyaṃ adhiṭṭhito,
athā'pi methune yutto,
mando'va parikissati.
example_2: ye te dhammā ādikalyāṇā majjhekalyāṇā pariyosānakalyāṇā sātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ abhivadanti
sbs_example_3: yass'atthāya kulaputtā samma'd'eva agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajanti tad'anuttaraṃ brahmacariyapariyosānaṃ diṭṭh'eva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.

grammar: in comps, nt nom & acc sg
example_1:
yadattanī passati ānisaṃsaṃ,
diṭṭhe sute sīlavate mute vā,
tad'eva so tattha samuggahāya,
nihīnato passati sabbamaññaṃ.
example_2: yatha'y'idaṃ brahmacariyaṃ addhaniyaṃ assa ciraṭṭhitikaṃ, tad'assa bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lok'ānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṃ
sbs_example_3: yass'atthāya kulaputtā samma'd'eva agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajanti tad'anuttaraṃ brahmacariyapariyosānaṃ diṭṭh'eva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.

meaning_1: could it be?; what if?; shall?; let’s?; perhaps?
example_1: siyā kho pana, bhante, idh'ekaccassa āyasmato evam'assa, kevalaṃ saddhāmattakaṃ nūna ayam'āyasmā nissāya nekkhamm'ādhimutto'ti.
example_2: atha kho tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etadahosi, atippago kho tāva sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya carituṃ, yaṃ nūna mayaṃ yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo ten'upasaṅkameyyāmā'ti
sbs_example_3: yan'nūn'āhaṃ kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajeyyan'ti.
sbs_example_4: yaṃnūn'āhaṃ imaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjitvā jighacchādubbalyaṃ paṭivinodetvā evaṃ imaṃ rattin'divaṃ vītināmeyyan'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: day and night; lit. night and day
commentary: (DNa) rattindivā'ti tato sūriyatthaṅgamanato yāva aruṇuggamanā ratti, aruṇuggamanato yāva sūriyatthaṅgamanā divā'ti evaṃ rattindivā paññāyiṃsu.
example_1: taṃ kiṃ maññath'āvuso nigaṇṭhā, pahoti rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro, aniñjamāno kāyena, abhāsamāno vācaṃ, satta rattindivāni ekantasukhaṃ paṭisaṃvedī viharitun'ti? no h'idaṃ, āvuso.
example_2: kathaṃbhūtassa me rattindivā vītivattantī'ti pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ
sbs_chant_eng_2: Ten Subjects for Frequent Recollection by One Who Has Gone Forth

meaning_1: having driven out; having dispelled; having removed; having got rid (of)
example_1: so sabbaso rāg'ānusayaṃ pahāya paṭigh'ānusayaṃ paṭivinodetvā asmī'ti diṭṭhimān'ānusayaṃ samūhanitvā avijjaṃ pahāya vijjaṃ uppādetvā diṭṭh'eva dhamme dukkhass'antakaro hoti
example_2: so aparena samayena rūpānaṃ'y'eva samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca assādañ'ca ādīnavañ'ca nissaraṇañ'ca yathābhūtaṃ viditvā rūpataṇhaṃ pahāya rūpapariḷāhaṃ paṭivinodetvā vigatapipāso ajjhattaṃ vūpasantacitto vihareyya.
sbs_example_3: yaṃ'nūn'āhaṃ imaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjitvā jighacchādubbalyaṃ paṭivinodetvā evaṃ imaṃ rattin'divaṃ vītināmeyyan'ti

meaning_1: certainly not! definitely not!; lit. not indeed this
example_1: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, soṇa, yadā te vīṇāya tantiyo accāyatā honti, api nu te vīṇā tasmiṃ samaye saravatī vā hoti kammaññā vā'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.
example_2: taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu te davāya vā āhāraṃ āhāreyyuṃ, madāya vā āhāraṃ āhāreyyuṃ, maṇḍanāya vā āhāraṃ āhāreyyuṃ, vibhūsanāya vā āhāraṃ āhāreyyun'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante
sbs_example_3: yaṃ pan'āniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vipariṇāmadhammaṃ, kallaṃ nu taṃ samanupassituṃ, etaṃ mama, eso'ham'asmi, eso me attā'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.
sbs_chant_eng_3: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_4: taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu so puriso evaṃkārī tasmiṃ kulle kiccakārī assā'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

notes: see BHS mrakṣa for discussion on meaning
example_1:
yassa rāgo ca doso ca,
māno makkho ca pātito,
sāsapo'r'iva ār'aggā,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.
example_2:
aṭṭhīnaṃ nagaraṃ kataṃ,
maṃsalohitalepanaṃ,
yattha jarā ca maccu ca,
māno makkho ca ohito.
sbs_example_3: upanāhissa upanāho pahīno hoti, makkhissa makkho pahīno hoti, paḷāsissa paḷāso pahīno hoti, issukissa issā pahīnā hoti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: idha, visākhe, mātugāmo yo so bhattu abbhantaro antojano, dāsā'ti vā pessā'ti vā kammakarā'ti vā, tesaṃ katañ'ca katato jānāti akatañ'ca akatato jānāti, gilānakānañ'ca bal'ābalaṃ jānāti khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyañ'c'assa paccaṃsena saṃvibhajati.
example_2: n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ lahuparivattaṃ yatha'y'idaṃ cittaṃ. yāvañ'c'idaṃ, bhikkhave, upamā'pi na sukarā yāva lahuparivattaṃ cittan'ti.
sbs_example_3: ubhatodaṇḍakena ce'pi, bhikkhave, kakacena corā ocarakā aṅgam'aṅgāni okanteyyuṃ, tatrā'pi yo mano padūseyya, na me so tena sāsanakaro.
sbs_example_4:
patirūpe vase dese, ariyamittakaro siyā.
sammāpaṇidhisampanno, pubbe puññakato naro.
dhaññaṃ dhanaṃ yaso kitti, sukhaṃcetaṃadhivattatī.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: in that case; in that regard; in this matter; in this connection
example_1: tena kho pana samayena dve bhikkhū sampayojesuṃ, tatra-eko bhikkhu accasarā, atha kho so bhikkhu tassa bhikkhuno santike accayaṃ accayato deseti, so bhikkhu nappaṭiggaṇhāti.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gavā khīraṃ, khīramhā dadhi, dadhimhā navanītaṃ, navanītamhā sappi, sappimhā sappimaṇḍo tatra aggam'akkhāyati.
sbs_example_3: ubhatodaṇḍakena ce'pi, bhikkhave, kakacena corā ocarakā aṅgam'aṅgāni okanteyyuṃ, tatrā'pi yo mano padūseyya, na me so tena sāsanakaro.
sbs_example_4:
tatr'āyam'ādi bhavati, idha paññassa bhikkhuno,
indriyagutti santuṭṭhi, pātimokkhe ca saṃvaro.
sbs_example_5: tatra ce tumhe assatha kupitā vā anattamanā vā, tumhaṃ yev'assa tena antarāyo.

example_1: yo pana bhikkhu otiṇṇo vipariṇatena cittena mātugāmena saddhiṃ kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajjeyya hatthaggāhaṃ vā veṇiggāhaṃ vā aññatarassa vā aññatarassa vā aṅgassa parāmasanaṃ, saṅghādiseso.
example_2:
kummo aṅgāni sake kapāle,
samodahaṃ bhikkhu manovitakke,
anissito aññam'aheṭhayāno,
parinibbuto n'ūpavadeyya kañcī'ti.
sbs_example_3: ubhatodaṇḍakena ce'pi, bhikkhave, kakacena corā ocarakā aṅgam'aṅgāni okanteyyuṃ, tatrā'pi yo mano padūseyya, na me so tena sāsanakaro.

meaning_1: uprooted like a palm tree; lit. palm made groundless
commentary: (ANa) tāl'āvatthukatānī'ti tālavatthu viya katāni, puna aviruhaṇaṭṭhena matthakacchinnatālo viya samūlaṃ tālaṃ uddharitvā tassa patiṭṭhitaṭṭhānaṃ viya ca katānī'ti attho.
example_1: idh'āvuso, bhikkhu rāgo me pahīno ucchinnamūlo tāl'āvatthukato anabhāvaṃkato āyatiṃ anuppādadhammo'ti pajānāti
example_2: seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, tālo matthakacchinno abhabbo puna viruḷhiyā. evam'eva kho, sunakkhatta, sammā nibbān'ādhimuttassa purisapuggalassa ye n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatanasaṃyojane se ucchinnamūle tāl'āvatthukate anabhāvaṃkate āyatiṃ anuppādadhamme.
sbs_example_3: te tathāgatassa pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tāl'āvatthukatā anabhāvaṃkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā. tasmā tathāgato anokasārī'ti vuccati.
