meaning_1: never arising again; lit. non-arising nature
example_1: evarūpassa, bhikkhave, puggalassa lobhajā pāpakā akusalā dhammā pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tāl'āvatthukatā anabhāvaṃkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā.

santacittassa bhikkhuno,

meaning_1: ignorant; foolish; idiotic; lit. doesn’t know
example_1:
passa dhammaṃ durājānaṃ,
sampamūḷh'ettha-aviddasu,
nivutānaṃ tamo hoti,
andhakāro apassataṃ.
example_2:
na monena munī hoti,
mūḷharūpo aviddasu,
yo ca tulaṃva paggayha,
varam'ādāya paṇḍito.

example_1: idha, bhante ānanda, sambahulā bhikkhuniyo catūsu satipaṭṭhānesu suppatiṭṭhitacittā viharantiyo uḷāraṃ pubben'āparaṃ visesaṃ sañjānantī'ti
example_2: ehi dāni, āvuso, ubho'va santā imaṃ gaṇaṃ pariharāmā'ti. iti kho, aggivessana, āḷāro kālāmo ācariyo me samāno attano antevāsiṃ maṃ samānaṃ attanā samasamaṃ ṭhapesi, uḷārāya ca maṃ pūjāya pūjesi.
sbs_example_3: so ñātidhammo ca ayaṃ nidassito, petāna'pūjā ca katā uḷārā. balañ'ca bhikkhūnam'anuppadinnaṃ, tumhehi puññaṃ pasutaṃ anappakan'ti.
sbs_example_4: atha kiñ'carahi ty'āyaṃ, sāriputta, uḷārā āsabhī vācā bhāsitā, ek'aṃso gahito, sīhanādo nadito
sbs_example_5: sac'āyaṃ kulaputto app'āyo samāno uḷāraṃ jīvikaṃ kappeti, tassa bhavanti vattāro, udumbarakhādikaṃ v'āyaṃ kulaputto bhoge khādatī'ti.

meaning_1: having personally experienced; having realized for oneself; lit. having personally done
example_1: atthi loke samaṇabrāhmaṇā sammaggatā sammāpaṭipannā ye imañ'ca lokaṃ parañ'ca lokaṃ sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedentī'ti
example_2: yato ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu … āsavānañ'ca khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭh'eva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati, evaṃ so ten'aṅgena paripūro hoti.
sbs_example_3: so imaṃ lokaṃ sadevakaṃ samārakaṃ sabrahmakaṃ sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiṃ pajaṃ sadevamanussaṃ sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti.

example_1: kacci te, bhante, bhikkhū samma'd'eva aññaṃ byākaṃsu udāhu sant'etth'ekacce bhikkhū adhimānena aññaṃ byākaṃsū'ti?
example_2:
atthaṅ'gato so uda vā so n'atthi,
udāhu ve sassatiyā arogo,
taṃ me munī sādhu viyākarohi,
tathā hi te vidito esa dhammo.
sbs_example_3:
santi loke munayo,
janā vadanti ta'y'idaṃ kathaṃsu,
ñāṇ'ūpapannaṃ no muniṃ vadanti,

example_1: ālasyaṃ anuṭṭhānaṃ bhogānaṃ paripantho, amaṇḍanā avibhūsanā vaṇṇassa paripantho, asappāyakiriyā ārogyassa paripantho

example_1:

example_1:

example_2: ettako ce'pi, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho abhavissa nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo, na'y'idaṃ brahmacariyavāso paññāyetha sammā dukkhakkhayāya.

meaning_1: for self; for oneself; to oneself
example_1:

example_1:

example_1:

meaning_1: having not reached; having not arrived (at)

meaning_1: rejects; refuses to accept; disses; disdains

commentary:
(VIN 1.3.1) raho nāma cakkhussa raho, sotassa raho.
(ANa) āvi c'eva raho cā'ti sammukhā ca parammukhā ca.
example_1: so eko gāmaṃ piṇḍāya pavisati eko paṭikkamati eko raho nisīdati eko caṅkamaṃ adhiṭṭhāti.
example_2:
sānuṃ pabuddhaṃ vajjāsi,
yakkhānaṃ vacanaṃ idaṃ,
m'ākāsi pāpakaṃ kammaṃ,
āvi vā yadi vā raho.
sbs_example_3: idha bhikkhave bhikkhuno mettaṃ kāyakammaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti sabrahmacārīsu āvi c'eva raho ca
sbs_example_4: rahovādaṃ na bhāseyya, sammukhā na khīṇaṃ bhaṇe. ataramāno'va bhāseyya, no taramāno.

example_1: idam'pi, bhikkhave, tathāgatassa tathāgatabalaṃ hoti, yaṃ balaṃ āgamma tathāgato āsabhaṃ ṭhānaṃ paṭijānāti, parisāsu sīhanādaṃ nadati, brahmacakkaṃ pavatteti.
example_2:
tiṭṭhañ'caraṃ, nisinno vā, sayāno vā, yāvat'assa vigatamiddho,
etaṃ satiṃ adhiṭṭheyya, brahmam'etaṃ vihāraṃ idha'm'āhu.
sbs_example_3: idha bhikkhave bhikkhuno mettaṃ kāyakammaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti sabrahmacārīsu āvi c'eva raho ca

example_1: idha, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu visamena kāyakammena samannāgato hoti, visamena vacīkammena samannāgato hoti, visamena manokammena samannāgato hoti.

example_1:

meaning_1: dependent; depending (on); contingent (upon); relying (on); because (of); supported (by); on account (of); grounded (on)
example_1: yaṃ rūpaṃ paṭicca uppajjati sukhaṃ somanassaṃ, ayaṃ rūpassa assādo. yaṃ rūpaṃ aniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vipariṇāmadhammaṃ, ayaṃ rūpassa ādīnavo.
example_2: iti yaṃ taṃ vuttaṃ idam'etaṃ paṭicca vuttan'ti.

example_1:
yathā'pi mūle anupaddave daḷhe,
chinno'pi rukkho puna'r'eva rūhati,
evam'pi taṇh'ānusaye anūhate,
nibbattatī dukkham'idaṃ punappunaṃ.

anejo chinnasaṃsayo,

example_1: yassa khv'āhaṃ atthāya cittaṃ paṇidahiṃ so me attho abhinipphanno
example_2: satiñ'ca khv'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, sabb'atthikaṃ vadāmī'ti.
sbs_example_3: evam'eva khv'āhaṃ viññāṇ'āhāro daṭṭhabbo'ti vadāmi. viññāṇe āhāre pariññāte nāmarūpaṃ pariññātaṃ hoti, nāmarūpe pariññāte ariyasāvakassa n'atthi kiñci uttarikaraṇīyan'ti vadāmīti

meaning_1: underlying tendency to aversion; inherent inclination to resistance; lit. striking sleeping alongside
commentary: (MNa) paṭigh'ānusayaṃ paṭivinodetvā'ti paṭigh'ānusayañ'ca sabb'ākāren'eva nīharitvā'ti vuttaṃ hoti. ettāvatā anāgāmimaggo kathito.
example_1: so sabbaso rāg'ānusayaṃ pahāya paṭigh'ānusayaṃ paṭivinodetvā asmī'ti diṭṭhimān'ānusayaṃ samūhanitvā avijjaṃ pahāya vijjaṃ uppādetvā diṭṭh'eva dhamme dukkhass'antakaro hoti
example_2: kāmarāg'ānusayassa ... paṭigh'ānusayassa ... diṭṭh'ānusayassa ... vicikicch'ānusayassa ... mān'ānusayassa ... bhavarāg'ānusayassa ... avijj'ānusayassa pahānāya samucchedāya brahmacariyaṃ vussati.
sbs_example_3: ettha ce n'atthi abhinanditabbaṃ abhivaditabbaṃ ajjhositabbaṃ. es'ev'anto rāg'ānusayānaṃ, es'ev'anto paṭigh'ānusayānaṃ, es'ev'anto diṭṭh'ānusayānaṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: underlying tendency towards desire; lit. desire sleeping alongside

example_1: tassa ce, bhikkhave, kulaputtassa evaṃ uṭṭhahato ghaṭato vāyamato te bhogā n'ābhinipphajjanti. so socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati, sammohaṃ āpajjati, moghaṃ vata me uṭṭhānaṃ, aphalo vata me vāyāmo'ti

meaning_1: such; similar kind of; of such quality

example_2: evarūpo, bhikkhave, aḍḍhakahāpaṇena'pi bandhanaṃ nigacchati, kahāpaṇena'pi bandhanaṃ nigacchati, kahāpaṇasatena'pi bandhanaṃ nigacchati.
sbs_example_3: ev'āhaṃ ajānanto evarūpaṃ sukhaṃ vedanaṃ pajahathā'ti vadeyyaṃ, api nu me etaṃ, bhikkhave, patirūpaṃ abhavissā'ti?
sbs_example_4: evarūpassa puggalassa tādisaṃy'eva appamattakaṃ pāpakammaṃ kataṃ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṃ hoti, n'āṇu'pi khāyati, kiṃ bahud'eva.
sbs_example_5: pubbe vā paṭiladdhapubbaṃ atītaṃ niruddhaṃ vipariṇataṃ samanussarato uppajjati somanassaṃ. yaṃ evarūpaṃ somanassaṃ idaṃ vuccati gehasitaṃ somanassaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: of character; of quality; of kind; referring to
example_1:
yena yena hi maññanti,
tato taṃ hoti aññathā,
eta-adiso vinābhāvo,
passa lokassa pariyāyaṃ.
example_2: tassa na tādiso vaṇṇo hoti seyyathā'pi gunnaṃ, na tādiso saro hoti seyyathā'pi gunnaṃ, na tādisaṃ padaṃ hoti seyyathā'pi gunnaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
et'ādisāni katvāna, sabbattha'm'aparājitā.
sabbattha sotthiṃ gacchanti, taṃ tesaṃ maṅgalam'uttaman'ti.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, sālo vā dhavo vā phandano vā tīhi māluvālatāhi uddhasto pariyonaddho anayaṃ āpajjati, byasanaṃ āpajjati, anayabyasanaṃ āpajjati.
example_2: sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā yena andhavanaṃ ten'upasaṅkami divāvihārāya. andhavanaṃ ajjhogāhetvā aññatarasmiṃ supupphitasālarukkhamūle aṭṭhāsi.
sbs_example_3: ekam'id'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, samayaṃ ukkaṭṭhāyaṃ viharāmi subhagavane sālarājamūle.
sbs_example_4:
yassa accantadussīlyaṃ, māluvā sālam'iv'otthataṃ,
karoti so tath'attānaṃ, yathā naṃ icchatī diso.

example_1:
apārutā tesaṃ amatassa dvārā,
ye sotavanto pamuñcantu saddhaṃ,
vihiṃsasaññī paguṇaṃ na bhāsiṃ,
dhammaṃ paṇītaṃ manujesu brahme'ti.
example_2: hoti kho so, bhikkhave, samayo yaṃ kadāci karahaci dīghassa addhuno accayena tassa mahānirayassa puratthimaṃ dvāraṃ apāpurīyati.
sbs_example_3: ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, indriyesu guttadvāro hohi, cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā mā nimittaggāhī hohi m'ānubyañjanaggāhī.
sbs_example_4: kharassarena paṇavena rathikāya rathikaṃ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ parinetvā dakkhiṇena dvārena nikkhāmetvā dakkhiṇato nagarassa sīsaṃ chindathā'ti.

example_1:
sududdasaṃ sunipuṇaṃ,
yatthakāmanipātinaṃ,
cittaṃ rakkhetha medhāvī,
cittaṃ guttaṃ sukh'āvahaṃ.
example_2:
annañ'ca laddhā vasanañ'ca kāle,
mattaṃ so jaññā idha tosan'atthaṃ,
so tesu gutto yatacāri gāme,
rusito'pi vācaṃ pharusaṃ na vajjā.
sbs_example_3: ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, indriyesu guttadvāro hohi, cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā mā nimittaggāhī hohi m'ānubyañjanaggāhī.

example_1:
evamesā kasī kaṭṭhā,
sā hoti amatapphalā,
etaṃ kasiṃ kasitvāna,
sabbadukkhā pamuccatī'ti.
example_2:
ekanavutito kappe,
yaṃ phalaṃ adadiṃ tadā,
duggatiṃ n'ābhijānāmi,
phaladānassidaṃ phalaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
dumapphalānī'va patanti māṇavā, daharā ca vuḍḍhā ca sarīrabhedā.
etam'pi disvā pabbajito'mhi rāja, apaṇṇakaṃ sāmaññam'eva seyyo.
sbs_example_4:
manujassa pamattacārino,

so plavatī hurā huraṃ,
phalam'icchaṃ'va vanasmi vānaro.
sbs_example_5:
phalaṃ ve kadaliṃ hanti, phalaṃ veḷuṃ phalaṃ naḷaṃ.
sakkāro kāpurisaṃ hanti, gabbho assatariṃ yathā'ti.

meaning_1: very useful; extremely helpful; of great service; lit. doing much
example_1:
yoniso manasikāro,
dhammo sekhassa bhikkhuno,
n'atth'añño evaṃ bahukāro,
uttam'atthassa pattiyā,
yoniso padahaṃ bhikkhu,
khayaṃ dukkhassa pāpuṇe'ti.
example_2: evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno paccavekkhaṇā bahukārā hoti kusalesu dhammesu
sbs_example_3: dassanam'p'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ bahukāraṃ vadāmi
sbs_example_4: tassa purisassa uttiṇṇassa pāraṅ'gatassa evam'assa – bahukāro kho me ayaṃ kullo, im'āhaṃ kullaṃ nissāya hatthehi ca pādehi ca vāyamamāno sotthinā pāraṃ uttiṇṇo.

example_1: tattha katamā cha gehasitā upekkhā? cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā uppajjati upekkhā bālassa mūḷhassa mandassa puthujjanassa anodhijinassa avipākajinassa anādīnavadassāvino assutavato puthujjanassa.
example_2: yadapi, bhikkhave, moho tadapi akusalamūlaṃ. yadapi mūḷho abhisaṅkharoti kāyena vācāya manasā tadapi akusalaṃ.
sbs_example_3: coro'si, bālo'si, mūḷho'si, theno'sī'ti, tathārūpaṃ bhikkhu adinnaṃ ādiyamāno, ayam'pi pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.

example_1:
vanaṃ chindatha mā rukkhaṃ,
vanato jāyate bhayaṃ,
chetvā vanañ'ca vanathañ'ca,
nibbanā hotha bhikkhavo.
example_2:
manujassa pamattacārino,
taṇhā vaḍḍhati māluvā viya,
so plavatī hurā huraṃ,
phalam'icchaṃ'va vanasmi vānaro.

bahuṃ ve saraṇaṃ yanti, pabbatāni vanāni ca,

example_1:

example_1: tatiyam'pi kho āyasmā ānando abhikkantāya rattiyā, nikkhante pacchime yāme, uddhaste aruṇe, nandimukhiyā rattiyā uṭṭhāy'āsanā ek'aṃsaṃ uttar'āsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā ten'añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca
example_2: imassa nu kho, sāriputta, saṃkhittena bhāsitassa kathaṃ vitthārena attho daṭṭhabbo'ti? tatiyam'pi kho āyasmā sāriputto tuṇhī ahosi.

example_1:
attaṃ pahāya anupādiyāno,
ñāṇe'pi so nissayaṃ no karoti,
sa ve viyuttesu na vaggasārī,
diṭṭhim'pi so na pacceti kiñci.
example_2:
n'atthi jhānaṃ apaññassa,
paññā n'atthi ajhāyato,
yamhi jhānañ'ca paññā ca,
sa ve nibbānasantike.
sbs_example_3: sa kho so, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati, na kho ahaññ'ev'eko jarādhammo jaraṃ anatīto
sbs_example_4:
tayo vitakke kusale vitakkaye, tayo pana akusale nirākare,
sa ve vitakkāni vicāritāni, sameti vuṭṭhī'va rajaṃ samūhataṃ
sbs_example_5:
sa ve samm'addaso bhikkhu, parijānāti vedanā.
so vedanā pariññāya, diṭṭhe dhamme anāsavo.
kāyassa bhedā dhammaṭṭho, saṅkhyaṃ n'opeti vedagū'ti.

meaning_1: truly this; indeed this; lit. this indeed this
example_1: sa kho so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu, abhijjhāvisamalobho cittassa upakkileso'ti, iti viditvā abhijjhāvisamalobhaṃ cittassa upakkilesaṃ pajahati.

commentary:
(SNa) pahit'atto'ti pesit'atto.
(SNt) pesit'atto'ti nibbānaṃ pati pesitacitto.
(SNPa) padhānapahit'attan'ti nibbān'atthāya pesitacittaṃ
example_1: sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā saṃkhittena dhammaṃ desetu, yam'ahaṃ bhagavato dhammaṃ sutvā ekā vūpakaṭṭhā appamattā ātāpinī pahit'attā vihareyyan'ti
example_2:
ky'āssa byappathayo assu,
ky'āss'assu idha gocarā,
kāni sīlabbatān'āssu,
pahit'attassa bhikkhuno.

example_1:
manopakopaṃ rakkheyya,
manasā saṃvuto siyā,
manoduccaritaṃ hitvā,
manasā sucaritaṃ care.
example_2: manasā dhammaṃ viññāya piyarūpe dhamme adhimuccati, appiyarūpe dhamme byāpajjati, anupaṭṭhitakāyassati ca viharati parittacetaso.
sbs_example_3: manasā dhammaṃ viññāya mā nimittaggāhī hohi m'ānubyañjanaggāhī.

example_1: karoti, gacchati. yo koci karoti, taṃ añño, karohi karohi icc'evaṃ bravī'ti, atha vā karontaṃ payojayati, kāreti. saṅgho pabbatam'iva attānam'ācarati, pabbatāyati.
example_2: yo koci karoti, taṃ añño, karohi karohi, icc'evaṃ bravīti, atha vā karontaṃ payojayati, kāreti, kārayati, kārāpeti, kārāpayati. ye keci karonti, te aññe, karotha karotha, icc'evaṃ bruvanti, kārenti, kārayanti, kārāpenti, kārāpayanti.
sbs_example_3: icc'evam'ek'antaabhipūjaneyyakaṃ, vatthuttayaṃ vandayat'ābhisaṅkhataṃ
sbs_example_4:

aññathā santam'attānaṃ,
aññathā yo pavedaye,
nikacca kitavass'eva,
bhuttaṃ theyyena tassa taṃ.
example_2:
theyyaṃ na kāre na musā bhaṇeyya,
mettāya phasse tasathāvarāni,
yadāvilattaṃ manaso vijaññā,
kaṇhassa pakkho'ti vinodayeyya.
sbs_example_3: yo pana bhikkhu gāmā vā araññā vā adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyeyya, yathārūpe adinn'ādāne rājāno coraṃ gahetvā haneyyuṃ vā bandheyyuṃ vā pabbājeyyuṃ vā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: human being; person; lit. born from Manu
example_1:
manujassa sadā satīmato,
mattaṃ jānato laddhabhojane,
tanu tassa bhavanti vedanā,
saṇikaṃ jīrati āyupālayan'ti.
example_2:
manujassa pamattacārino,
taṇhā vaḍḍhati māluvā viya,
so plavatī hurā huraṃ,
phalam'icchaṃ'va vanasmi vānaro.
sbs_example_3:
ye kec'ime isayo manujā, (icc'āyasmā puṇṇako)
khattiyā brāhmaṇā devatānaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu imam'eva kāyaṃ yathāṭhitaṃ yathāpaṇihitaṃ dhātuso paccavekkhati atthi imasmiṃ kāye pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū'ti
example_2: yaṃ ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ vāyo vāyogataṃ upādinnaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ, uddhaṅ'gamā vātā, adhogamā vātā, kucchisayā vātā, koṭṭh'āsayā vātā, aṅgam'aṅg'ānusārino vātā, assāso passāso … ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā vāyodhātu.
sbs_example_3:
yattha āpo ca pathavī, tejo vāyo na gādhati.
na tattha sukkā jotanti, ādicco nappakāsati.

meaning_1: could be; may be; might be; should be
example_1:
kāmesu n'ābhigijjheyya,
manas'ānāvilo siyā,
kusalo sabbadhammānaṃ,
sato bhikkhu paribbaje'ti.
example_2:
padumaṃ yathā kokanadaṃ sugandhaṃ,
pāto siyā phullam'avītagandhaṃ,
aṅgīrasaṃ passa virocamānaṃ,
tapantam'ādiccam'iv'antalikkhe'ti.
sbs_example_3:
yath'indakhīlo pathaviṃ sito siyā, catubbhi vātehi asampakampiyo.
tath'ūpamaṃ sappurisaṃ vadāmi, yo ariyasaccāni avecca passati.
sbs_example_4:
attā hi attano nātho,
ko hi nātho paro siyā,
attanā hi sudantena,
nāthaṃ labhati dullabhaṃ.
sbs_example_5:
atta'd'atthaṃ par'atthena, bahunā'pi na hāpaye,
atta'd'attham'abhiññāya, sadatthapasuto siyā.

example_1: pathaviyā'pi ummujjanimujjaṃ kareyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi udake, udake'pi abhijjamāno gaccheyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi pathaviyaṃ, ākāse'pi pallaṅkena kameyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi pakkhī sakuṇo
example_2:
bhagavā hi kāme abhibhuyya iriyati,
ādicco'va pathaviṃ tejī tejasā,

ācikkha dhammaṃ yam'ahaṃ vijaññaṃ,
jātijarāya idha vippahānaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
yath'indakhīlo pathaviṃ sito siyā, catubbhi vātehi asampakampiyo.
tath'ūpamaṃ sappurisaṃ vadāmi, yo ariyasaccāni avecca passati.

example_1:
māse māse kus'aggena,
bālo bhuñjeyya bhojanaṃ,
na so saṅkhātadhammānaṃ,
kalaṃ agghati soḷasiṃ.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gimhānaṃ pacchime māse ṭhite majjh'anhike kāle marīcikā phandati.
sbs_example_3: vanappagumbe yathā phussit'agge, gimhānamāse paṭhamasmiṃ gimhe. tath'ūpamaṃ dhammavaraṃ adesayi, nibbānagāmiṃ paramaṃ hitāya.
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, vassānaṃ pacchime māse saradasamaye kiṭṭhasambādhe gopālako gāvo rakkheyya. so tā gāvo tato tato daṇḍena ākoṭeyya paṭikoṭeyya sannirundheyya sannivāreyya.

example_1: ekatopakkhikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena sako pakkho ñāpetabbo.
example_2: bhedāya parakkameyyāti, kathaṃ ime nānā assu, vinā assu, vaggā assū'ti pakkhaṃ pariyesati, gaṇaṃ bandhati.

theyyaṃ na kāre na musā bhaṇeyya,

example_1: idha, bhikkhave, ekacco aḍḍhakahāpaṇena'pi bandhanaṃ nigacchati, kahāpaṇena'pi bandhanaṃ nigacchati, kahāpaṇasatena'pi bandhanaṃ nigacchati.
example_2:
yadūnakaṃ taṃ saṇati,
yaṃ pūraṃ santam'eva taṃ,
aḍḍhakumbh'ūpamo bālo,
rahado pūro'va paṇḍito.
sbs_example_3: tatth'āyaṃ samayo, diyaḍḍho māso seso gimhānan'ti vassānassa paṭhamo māso – icc'ete aḍḍhateyyamāsā uṇhasamayo
sbs_example_4: aho vat'āhaṃ tad'antaraṃ jīveyyaṃ yad'antaraṃ up'aḍḍhapiṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjāmi, bhagavato sāsanaṃ manasi kareyyaṃ, bahu vata me kataṃ assā'ti.

commentary: (SNa) kena vaṇṇo pasīdatī'ti kena kāraṇena chavivaṇṇo pasīdatī'ti pucchati.
example_1:
tassa te n'atthi bhītattaṃ,
bhiyyo vaṇṇo pasīdati,
kasmā na paridevesi,
evarūpe mahabbhaye.
example_2:
araññe viharantānaṃ,
santānaṃ brahmacārinaṃ,
ekabhattaṃ bhuñjamānānaṃ,
kena vaṇṇo pasīdatī'ti.
sbs_example_3: tassa na tādiso vaṇṇo hoti seyyathā'pi gunnaṃ, na tādiso saro hoti seyyathā'pi gunnaṃ, na tādisaṃ padaṃ hoti seyyathā'pi gunnaṃ.
sbs_example_4: tuvaṭaṃ cittaṃ samādhiyati, mukhavaṇṇo vippasīdati, asammūḷho kālaṃ karoti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: task; labour; lit. causing to do
example_1: seyyathā'pi brāhmaṇa dakkho assadammako bhaddaṃ ass'ājānīyaṃ labhitvā paṭhamen'eva mukh'ādhāne kāraṇaṃ kāreti atha uttariṃ kāraṇaṃ kāreti.
example_2: idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo yam'enaṃ hatthidammasārathi kāraṇaṃ kāreti, yadi vā katapubbaṃ yadi vā akatapubbaṃ, taṃ aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi katvā sabbaṃ cetasā samannāharitvā ohitasoto suṇāti. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo sotā hoti.
sbs_example_3: tassa mukh'ādhāne kāraṇaṃ kāriyamānassa honti y'eva visūkāyitāni visevitāni vipphanditāni kānici kānici, yathā taṃ akāritapubbaṃ kāraṇaṃ kāriyamānassa.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: tena kho pana samayena bhagavā parito parito janapadesu paricārake abbhatīte kālaṅ'kate upapattīsu byākaroti
example_2:
nānājanā janapadehi saṅgatā,
tava vīra vākyaṃ abhikaṅkhamānā,
tesaṃ tuvaṃ sādhu viyākarohi,
tathā hi te vidito esa dhammo.
sbs_example_3: tasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye rañño na phāsu hoti atiyātuṃ vā niyyātuṃ vā paccantime vā janapade anusaññātuṃ.
sbs_example_4: janapadaniruttiṃ n'ābhiniveseyya, samaññaṃ n'ātidhāveyyā'ti, iti kho pan'etaṃ vuttaṃ. kiñ'c'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ? kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, janapadaniruttiyā ca abhiniveso hoti samaññāya ca atisāro?
sbs_example_5: mālākathaṃ gandhakathaṃ ñātikathaṃ yānakathaṃ gāmakathaṃ nigamakathaṃ nagarakathaṃ janapadakathaṃ itthikathaṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: tassa na tādiso vaṇṇo hoti seyyathā'pi gunnaṃ, na tādiso saro hoti seyyathā'pi gunnaṃ, na tādisaṃ padaṃ hoti seyyathā'pi gunnaṃ.
example_2: tatra, bhikkhave, taramānassa bhāsato kāyo'pi kilamati, cittam'pi upahaññati, saro'pi upahaññati, kaṇṭho'pi āturīyati, avisaṭṭham'pi hoti aviññeyyaṃ taramānassa bhāsitaṃ.
sbs_example_3: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, soṇa, kusalo tvaṃ pubbe agāriyabhūto vīṇāya tantissare'ti?

example_1: gopālako sāyanhasamaye sāmikānaṃ gāvo niyyātetvā iti paṭisañcikkhati, ajja kho gāvo amukasmiñ'ca amukasmiñ'ca padese cariṃsu
example_2: ekādasahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato gopālako abhabbo gogaṇaṃ pariharituṃ phātiṃ kātuṃ. katamehi ekādasahi?
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, vassānaṃ pacchime māse saradasamaye kiṭṭhasambādhe gopālako gāvo rakkheyya. so tā gāvo tato tato daṇḍena ākoṭeyya paṭikoṭeyya sannirundheyya sannivāreyya.

example_1:
māno hi te brāhmaṇa khāribhāro,
kodho dhūmo bhasmani mosavajjaṃ,
jivhā sujā hadayaṃ jotiṭhānaṃ,
attā sudanto purisassa joti.
example_2:
na hi pāpaṃ kataṃ kammaṃ,
sajju khīraṃ'va muccati,
ḍahantaṃ bālam'anveti,
bhasmacchanno'va pāvako.
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso kāḷakaṃ vatthaṃ paridhāya kese pakiritvā bhasmapuṭaṃ khandhe āropetvā mahājanakāyaṃ upasaṅkamitvā

commentary:
(SNa) aggi'pi dūrato'va dhūmena paññāyati.
(SDM) dhūmo'ti dhunāti kampatī'ti dhūmo.
example_1:
māno hi te brāhmaṇa khāribhāro,
kodho dhūmo bhasmani mosavajjaṃ,
jivhā sujā hadayaṃ jotiṭhānaṃ,
attā sudanto purisassa joti.
example_2:
dhajo rathassa paññāṇaṃ,

rājā raṭṭhassa paññāṇaṃ,
bhattā paññāṇam'itthiyā'ti.
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, aṅgārakāsu sādhikaporisā puṇṇā aṅgārānaṃ vīt'accikānaṃ vītadhūmānaṃ.

example_1:

eko care mātaṅg'araññ'eva nāgo.

example_2: yasmiṃ c'assā padese ṭhitāya evam'assa, yaṃnūn'āhaṃ agatapubbañ'c'eva disaṃ gaccheyyaṃ, akhāditapubbāni ca tiṇāni khādeyyaṃ, apītapubbāni ca pānīyāni piveyyan'ti tañ'ca padesaṃ na sotthinā paccāgaccheyya.

example_2: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gahapati, sace so puriso taṃ ādittaṃ tiṇ'ukkaṃ na khippam'eva paṭinissajjeyya tassa sā ādittā tiṇ'ukkā hatthaṃ vā daheyya bāhuṃ vā daheyya aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā aṅgapaccaṅgaṃ daheyya

meaning_1: reviews; regards; reflects; considers; lit. looks back down
construction: pati > paty > pacc + ava + ikkha + ti
example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, añño'va aññaṃ paccavekkheyya, ṭhito vā nisinnaṃ paccavekkheyya, nisinno vā nipannaṃ paccavekkheyya.
example_2: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu atthapaṭisambhidāpatto hoti, dhammapaṭisambhidāpatto hoti, niruttipaṭisambhidāpatto hoti, paṭibhānapaṭisambhidāpatto hoti, yathāvimuttaṃ cittaṃ paccavekkhati.

sbs_example_4: puna caparaṃ bhikkhu imam'eva kāyaṃ uddhaṃ pādatalā, adho kesamatthakā, tacapariyantaṃ pūraṃ nānappakārassa asucino paccavekkhati

meaning_1: this very; this exact same; this here
example_1: bhikkhu imam'eva kāyaṃ vivekajena pītisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripūreti parippharati n'āssa kiñci sabbāvato kāyassa vivekajena pītisukhena apphuṭaṃ hoti
example_2: so evaṃ pajānāti, uppannā kho my'āyaṃ sukhā vedanā. sā ca kho paṭicca, no appaṭicca. kiṃ paṭicca? imam'eva kāyaṃ paṭicca.
sbs_example_3: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu imam'eva kāyaṃ yathāṭhitaṃ yathāpaṇihitaṃ dhātuso paccavekkhati atthi imasmiṃ kāye pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū'ti
sbs_example_4: puna caparaṃ bhikkhu imam'eva kāyaṃ uddhaṃ pādatalā, adho kesamatthakā, tacapariyantaṃ pūraṃ nānappakārassa asucino paccavekkhati

meaning_1: and further; and what is more
example_1: puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, bhikkhu vitakkavicārānaṃ vūpasamā ajjhattaṃ sampasādanaṃ cetaso ekodibhāvaṃ avitakkaṃ avicāraṃ samādhijaṃ pītisukhaṃ dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
example_2: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko, pehī'ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā purime ca pāde saṃharitvā pacchime ca pāde saṃharitvā tatth'eva cattāro pāde abhinisīdati.

example_1:
kumbha-upamaṃ kāyam'imaṃ viditvā,
nagar'ūpamaṃ cittam'idaṃ ṭhapetvā.
yodhetha māraṃ paññ'āvudhena,
jitañ'ca rakkhe anivesano siyā.
example_2:
yadūnakaṃ taṃ saṇati,
yaṃ pūraṃ santam'eva taṃ,
aḍḍha-kumbha-upamo bālo,
rahado pūro'va paṇḍito.
sbs_example_3:
paribbaja mahābrahme,
pacant'aññe'pi pāṇino,
mā tvaṃ adhammo ācarito,
asmā kumbham'iv'ābhidā'ti.
sbs_example_4:
m'āvamaññetha pāpassa, na man'taṃ āgamissati,
udabindunipātena, udakumbho'pi pūrati,
bālo pūrati pāpassa, thokaṃ thokam'pi ācinaṃ.
sbs_example_5: seyyathā'pi puriso sappikumbhaṃ vā telakumbhaṃ vā gambhīraṃ udakarahadaṃ ogāhitvā bhindeyya. tatra yā assa sakkharā vā kaṭhalā vā sā adhogāmī assa

meaning_1: misconduct; moral behaviour; unjust means; cheating
example_1:
na attahetu na parassa hetu,
na puttam'icche na dhanaṃ na raṭṭhaṃ,
na iccheyya adhammena samiddhim'attano,
sa sīlavā paññavā dhammiko siyā.
example_2:
evaṃ bho purisa jānāhi,
pāpadhammā asaññatā,
mā taṃ lobho adhammo ca,
ciraṃ dukkhāya randhayuṃ.
sbs_example_3:
paribbaja mahābrahme,
pacant'aññe'pi pāṇino,
mā tvaṃ adhammo ācarito,
asmā kumbham'iv'ābhidā'ti.

meaning_1: of self; of oneself; one’s own; my own
example_1:
puttā m'atthi dhanam'm'atthi,
iti bālo vihaññati,
attā hi attano n'atthi,
kuto puttā kuto dhanaṃ.
example_2:
sudassaṃ vajjam'aññesaṃ,
attano pana duddasaṃ,
paresaṃ hi so vajjāni,
opunāti yathā bhusaṃ,
attano pana chādeti,
kaliṃ'va kitavā saṭho.
sbs_example_3:
pamādo rajo pamādo, pamād'ānupatito rajo,
appamādena vijjāya, abbahe sallam'attano'ti.
sbs_example_4:
attā hi attano nātho,
ko hi nātho paro siyā,
attanā hi sudantena,
nāthaṃ labhati dullabhaṃ.
sbs_example_5:
anupubbena medhāvī, thokaṃ thokaṃ khaṇe khaṇe.
kammāro rajatass'eva, niddhame malam'attano.

example_1:
pariciṇṇo mayā satthā,
kataṃ buddhassa sāsanaṃ,
ohito garuko bhāro,
bhavanetti samūhatā.
example_2: bhārañ'ca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi bhārahārañ'ca bhār'ādānañ'ca bhāranikkhepanañ'ca. taṃ suṇātha. katamo ca, bhikkhave, bhāro?
sbs_example_3: pakkhī sakuṇo yena yen'eva ḍeti, sapattabhāro'va ḍeti. evam'eva kho bhikkhu santuṭṭho hoti kāyaparihārikena cīvarena kucchiparihārikena piṇḍapātena.
sbs_example_4: bhārā have pañcakkhandhā, bhārahāro ca puggalo. bhār'ādānaṃ dukhaṃ loke, bhāranikkhepanaṃ sukhaṃ.
sbs_example_5:
māno hi te brāhmaṇa khāribhāro, kodho dhūmo bhasmani mosavajjaṃ.
jivhā sujā hadayaṃ jotiṭhānaṃ, attā sudanto purisassa joti.

meaning_1: dark one; black one; evil one; epithet of Māra
commentary: (THa) kaṇhā'ti māraṃ ālapati, so hi kaṇhakammattā kaṇh'ābhijātitāya ca kaṇho'ti vuccati.
example_1:
yo vejayantapāsādaṃ,
pād'aṅguṭṭhena kampayi,
tādisaṃ bhikkhum'āsajja,
kaṇha dukkhaṃ nigacchasi.
example_2:
theyyaṃ na kāre na musā bhaṇeyya,
mettāya phasse tasathāvarāni,
yadāvilattaṃ manaso vijaññā,
kaṇhassa pakkho'ti vinodayeyya.
sbs_example_3:
obhāsajātaṃ phalagaṃ, cittaṃ yassa abhiṇhaso.
tādisaṃ bhikkhum'āsajja, kaṇha dukkhaṃ nigacchasī'ti.

meaning_1: one and a half; lit. two half
example_1: tatth'āyaṃ samayo diyaḍḍho māso seso gimhānan'ti vassānassa paṭhamo māso icc'ete aḍḍhateyyamāsā uṇhasamayo, pariḷāhasamayo, gilānasamayo, kammasamayo, addhānagamanasamayo, vātavuṭṭhisamayo
example_2: sādhikam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, diyaḍḍhasikkhāpadasataṃ anvaddhamāsaṃ uddesaṃ āgacchati yattha attakāmā kulaputtā sikkhanti.
sbs_example_3: nisīdanaṃ pana bhikkhunā kārayamānena pamāṇikaṃ kāretabbaṃ. tatr'idaṃ pamāṇaṃ, dīghaso dve vidatthiyo sugatavidatthiyā, tiriyaṃ diyaḍḍhaṃ, dasā vidatthi.

grammar: adv, masc abl sg, atta group
example_1: varaṃ bhikkhave assutavā puthujjano imaṃ cātumahābhūtikaṃ kāyaṃ attato upagaccheyya na tv'eva cittaṃ
example_2: idha, gahapati, assutavā puthujjano ariyānaṃ adassāvī ariyadhammassa akovido ariyadhamme avinīto sappurisānaṃ adassāvī sappurisadhammassa akovido sappurisadhamme avinīto rūpaṃ attato samanupassati
sbs_example_3: na rūpaṃ attato samanupassati, na rūpavantaṃ vā attānaṃ, na attani vā rūpaṃ, na rūpasmiṃ vā attānaṃ. ahaṃ rūpaṃ, mama rūpan'ti na pariyuṭṭhaṭṭhāyī hoti.

meaning_1: well tamed (by); well trained (by); well controlled (by)
commentary:
(SNa) sudantā'ti cakkhuto'pi dantā sotato'pi ghānato'pi jivhāto'pi kāyato'pi manato'pi dantā.
(ANa) sudanto'ti suṭṭhu damathaṃ upagato.
example_1:
yass'indriyāni samathaṅ'gatāni,
assā yathā sārathinā sudantā,
pahīnamānassa anāsavassa,
devā'pi tassa pihayanti tādino.
example_2:
chetvā khīlaṃ chetvā palighaṃ,
indakhīlaṃ ūhacca manejā,
te caranti suddhā vimalā,
cakkhumatā sudantā susunāgā'ti.
sbs_example_3: mār'ātirekam'abhiyujjhitasabbarattiṃ, ghoram'pan'āḷavakam'akkhamathaddhayakkhaṃ, khantīsudantavidhinā jitavā mun'indo.

attā hi attano nātho,
ko hi nātho paro siyā,
attanā hi sudantena,
nāthaṃ labhati dullabhaṃ.
sbs_example_5: seyyathā'pi usabho chinnavisāṇo sūrato sudanto suvinīto rathiyāya rathiyaṃ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ anvāhiṇḍanto na kiñci hiṃsati pādena vā visāṇena vā

commentary:
(MNa) tattha kujjhanalakkhaṇo kodho, caṇḍikkalakkhaṇo vā, āghātakaraṇaraso, dussanapaccupaṭṭhāno.
(ANa) paresu kujjhanalakkhaṇo kodho.
example_1:
kodhaṃ jhatvā sukhaṃ seti,
kodhaṃ jhatvā na socati,
kodhassa visamūlassa,
madhur'aggassa devate,
vadhaṃ ariyā pasaṃsanti,
tañ'hi jhatvā na socatī'ti.
example_2: yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno abhijjhālussa abhijjhā appahīnā hoti, byāpannacittassa byāpādo appahīno hoti, kodhanassa kodho appahīno hoti
sbs_example_3:
māno hi te brāhmaṇa khāribhāro, kodho dhūmo bhasmani mosavajjaṃ.
jivhā sujā hadayaṃ jotiṭhānaṃ, attā sudanto purisassa joti.
sbs_example_4: byāpannacittassa byāpādo pahīyetha, kodhanassa kodho pahīyetha, upanāhissa upanāho pahīyetha, makkhissa makkho pahīyetha, paḷāsissa paḷāso pahīyetha
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: hates; dislikes; is repelled (by); is hostile (to)
construction: vi > vy > by + ā + pajja + ti
example_1: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā piyarūpe rūpe adhimuccati, appiyarūpe rūpe byāpajjati, anupaṭṭhitakāyassati ca viharati parittacetaso.
example_2: idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo kodhano hoti upāyāsabahulo, appam'pi vutto samāno abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātukaroti.
sbs_example_3: kārako kārakatāya vādaṃ upeti, atha vā vuccamāno upavadiyamāno kuppati byāpajjati patiṭṭhiyati kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātukaroti.

example_1: bhikkhuṃ pan'eva uddissa rājā vā rājabhoggo vā brāhmaṇo vā gahapatiko vā dūtena cīvaracetāpannaṃ pahiṇeyya, iminā cīvaracetāpannena cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā itthan'nāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ cīvarena acchādehī'ti.
example_2: khat'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā. upahat'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā. sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā pitaraṃ dhammikaṃ dhammarājānaṃ jīvitā na voropessatha, imasmiññ'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ uppajjissathā'ti.
sbs_example_3:
kāmā hi citrā madhurā manoramā, virūparūpena mathenti cittaṃ.
ādīnavaṃ kāmaguṇesu disvā, tasmā ahaṃ pabbajito'mhi rāja.
sbs_example_4: kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, mahācoro balavanissito hoti? idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro rājānaṃ vā rājamahāmattānaṃ vā nissito hoti.
sbs_example_5: rājakathaṃ corakathaṃ mahāmattakathaṃ senākathaṃ bhayakathaṃ yuddhakathaṃ annakathaṃ

commentary: (ANa) dubbalīkaraṇe'ti yasmā ime pañca nīvaraṇā uppajjamānā anuppannāya lokiyalokuttarāya paññāya uppajjituṃ na denti, uppannā'pi aṭṭha samāpattiyo pañca vā abhiññā ucchinditvā pātenti. tasmā paññāya dubbalīkaraṇā'ti vuccanti.
example_1: so ime pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe kāye ... vedanāsu ... citte ... dhammesu dhamm'ānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.
example_2: samaṇo, āvuso, gotamo sāvakānaṃ evaṃ dhammaṃ deseti, etha tumhe, bhikkhave, pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe satta bojjh'aṅge yathābhūtaṃ bhāvethā'ti.
sbs_example_3: kāmacchando, bhikkhave, āvaraṇo nīvaraṇo cetaso ajjhāruho paññāya dubbalīkaraṇo. byāpādo, bhikkhave, āvaraṇo nīvaraṇo cetaso ajjhāruho paññāya dubbalīkaraṇo.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: obstruction; obstacle; blockage; impediment; lit. obstructing
example_1: yam'pi no saddhā gahapatikā divā vikāle paṇītaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā denti, tatra'p'ime mukha-avaraṇaṃ maññe karontī'ti.
example_2: uddhaccakukkuccaṃ, bhikkhave, āvaraṇaṃ nīvaraṇaṃ cetaso ajjhāruhaṃ paññāya dubbalīkaraṇaṃ.
sbs_example_3: kāmacchando, bhikkhave, āvaraṇo nīvaraṇo cetaso ajjhāruho paññāya dubbalīkaraṇo. byāpādo, bhikkhave, āvaraṇo nīvaraṇo cetaso ajjhāruho paññāya dubbalīkaraṇo.

meaning_1: dependent (on); clung (to); attached (to); supported (by); living (on); based (on); relying (on); by means (of)
example_1: nissitassa calitaṃ, anissitassa calitaṃ n'atthi. calite asati passaddhi, passaddhiyā sati nati na hoti. natiyā asati āgatigati na hoti. āgatigatiyā asati cut'ūpapāto na hoti. cut'ūpapāte asati n'ev'idha na huraṃ na ubhayam'antarena. es'ev'anto dukkhassā'ti.
example_2:
sabbesu kāmesu yo vītarāgo,
ākiñcaññaṃ nissito hitvā m'aññaṃ,
saññāvimokkhe parame'dhimutto,
tiṭṭheyya so tattha anānuyāyī.
sbs_example_3: kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, mahācoro balavanissito hoti? idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro rājānaṃ vā rājamahāmattānaṃ vā nissito hoti.
sbs_example_4: yaṃ yad'eva hi sā, bhikkhave, gāvī niccammā nissāya tiṭṭheyya, ye tan'nissitā pāṇā te naṃ khādeyyuṃ.

commentary: (VINa) mahāmattā'ti ṭhān'antarappattā mahāamaccā, te'pi tattha tattha gāme vā nigame vā nisīditvā rājakiccaṃ karonti
example_1: evaṃ, devā'ti kho so mahāmatto rañño māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa paṭissutvā āyasmato pilindavacchassa pañca ārāmikasatāni pādāsi, pāṭiyekko gāmo nivisi
example_2: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe. atha kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami
sbs_example_3: kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, mahācoro balavanissito hoti? idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro rājānaṃ vā rājamahāmattānaṃ vā nissito hoti.
sbs_example_4: rājakathaṃ corakathaṃ mahāmattakathaṃ senākathaṃ bhayakathaṃ yuddhakathaṃ annakathaṃ pānakathaṃ vatthakathaṃ
sbs_example_5: idha bhikkhuno pavivittassa viharato bhavanti upasaṅkamitāro bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo upāsakā upāsikāyo rājāno rājamahāmattā titthiyā titthiyasāvakā.

example_1: tasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye rañño na phāsu hoti atiyātuṃ vā niyyātuṃ vā paccantime vā janapade anusaññātuṃ.
example_2:
jiṇṇo'ham'asmi abalo vītavaṇṇo,
nettā na suddhā savanaṃ na phāsu,
m'āhaṃ nassaṃ momuho antarāva,
ācikkha dhammaṃ yam'ahaṃ vijaññaṃ,
jātijarāya idha vippahānaṃ.
sbs_example_3: iti purāṇañ'ca vedanaṃ paṭihaṅkhāmi navañ'ca vedanaṃ na uppādessāmi yātrā ca me bhavissati anavajjatā ca phāsuvihāro cā'ti

example_1: anamataggo'yaṃ, bhikkhave, saṃsāro. pubbā koṭi nappaññāyati sattippahārānaṃ asippahārānaṃ usuppahārānaṃ pharasuppahārānaṃ
example_2:
vītataṇho purā bhedā,
pubbam'antam'anissito,
vemajjhe n'upasaṅkheyyo,
tassa n'atthi purakkhataṃ.
sbs_example_3: idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo yam'enaṃ hatthidammasārathi kāraṇaṃ kāreti, yadi vā katapubbaṃ yadi vā akatapubbaṃ, taṃ aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi katvā sabbaṃ cetasā samannāharitvā ohitasoto suṇāti.
sbs_example_4: tam'enaṃ pubb'aṇhasamayaṃ sattisatena haneyyuṃ. atha rājā majjh'anhikasamayaṃ evaṃ vadeyya, ambho, kathaṃ so puriso'ti?
sbs_example_5: anamataggo'yaṃ, bhikkhave, saṃsāro. pubbā koṭi na paññāyati avijjānīvaraṇānaṃ sattānaṃ taṇhāsaṃyojanānaṃ sandhāvataṃ saṃsarataṃ.

meaning_1: makes one do; causes to make
example_1: seyyathā'pi brāhmaṇa dakkho assadammako bhaddaṃ ass'ājānīyaṃ labhitvā paṭhamen'eva mukh'ādhāne kāraṇaṃ kāreti atha uttariṃ kāraṇaṃ kāreti

meaning_1: able to be tamed; fit to be trained; tameable; trainable; lit. to be tamed
example_1: assakhaḷuṅko hi, sandha, doṇiyā baddho, yavasaṃ yavasan'ti jhāyati. taṃ kissa hetu? na hi, sandha, assakhaḷuṅkassa doṇiyā baddhassa evaṃ hoti, kiṃ nu kho maṃ ajja assadammasārathi kāraṇaṃ kāressati, kim'ass'āhaṃ paṭikaromī'ti.
example_2: so buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti, iti'pi so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavā'ti.
sbs_example_3: idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo yam'enaṃ hatthidammasārathi kāraṇaṃ kāreti, yadi vā katapubbaṃ yadi vā akatapubbaṃ, taṃ aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi katvā sabbaṃ cetasā samannāharitvā ohitasoto suṇāti.
sbs_example_4: hatthidamakena, bhikkhave, hatthidammo sārito ekaṃ'y'eva disaṃ dhāvati, puratthimaṃ vā pacchimaṃ vā uttaraṃ vā dakkhiṇaṃ vā.

meaning_1: elephant to be tamed; elephant in training
example_1: hatthidamakena, bhikkhave, hatthidammo sārito ekaṃ'y'eva disaṃ dhāvati, puratthimaṃ vā pacchimaṃ vā uttaraṃ vā dakkhiṇaṃ vā.
example_2: ahañ'hi, bhante, pahomi hatthidammaṃ sāretuṃ, yāvatakena antarena campaṃ gat'āgataṃ karissati sabbāni tāni sāṭheyyāni kūṭeyyāni vaṅkeyyāni jimheyyāni pātukarissati.

example_1:

example_2: seyyathā'pi, rāhula, rañño nāgo īsādanto urūḷhavā abhijāto saṅgām'āvacaro saṅgāmagato purimehi'pi pādehi kammaṃ karoti, pacchimehi'pi pādehi kammaṃ karoti
sbs_example_3: idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo yam'enaṃ hatthidammasārathi kāraṇaṃ kāreti, yadi vā katapubbaṃ yadi vā akatapubbaṃ, taṃ aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi katvā sabbaṃ cetasā samannāharitvā ohitasoto suṇāti.

example_1:
ovadeyy'ānusāseyya,
asabbhā ca nivāraye,
satañ'hi so piyo hoti,
asataṃ hoti appiyo.

example_1:

example_2: kathāsampayogena, bhikkhave, puggalo veditabbo yadi vā saupaniso yadi vā anupaniso'ti. anohitasoto, bhikkhave, anupaniso hoti, ohitasoto saupaniso hoti.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, bālo abyatto akusalo sūdo rājānaṃ vā rājamahāmattaṃ vā nānaccayehi sūpehi paccupaṭṭhito assa.
example_2: kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, mahācoro balavanissito hoti? idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro rājānaṃ vā rājamahāmattānaṃ vā nissito hoti.
sbs_example_3: idha bhikkhuno pavivittassa viharato bhavanti upasaṅkamitāro bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo upāsakā upāsikāyo rājāno rājamahāmattā titthiyā titthiyasāvakā.

example_1:
manopubbaṅ'gamā dhammā,
manoseṭṭhā manomayā,
manasā ce paduṭṭhena,
bhāsati vā karoti vā,
tato naṃ dukkham'anveti,
cakkaṃ'va vahato padaṃ.
example_2: heṭṭhā kho pana tassa bhoto gotamassa pādatalesu cakkāni jātāni sahass'ārāni sanemikāni sanābhikāni sabb'ākāraparipūrāni, idam'pi tassa bhoto gotamassa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṃ bhavati.

meaning_1: that; such and such (person or place)

example_2: labheyya nu kho so coro coraghātesu, āgamentu tāva bhavanto coraghātā, amukasmiṃ me gāme vā nigame vā mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā, yāvāhaṃ tesaṃ uddisitvā āgacchāmī'ti

example_1: tam'enaṃ jano disvā evaṃ vadeyya, bhogī vata, bho, puriso, evaṃ kira bhogino bhogāni bhuñjantī'ti. tam'enaṃ sāmikā yattha yatth'eva passeyyuṃ tattha tatth'eva sāni hareyyuṃ. taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gahapati, alaṃ nu kho tassa purisassa aññathattāyā'ti?
example_2: assāmikan'ti na añño koci sāmiko hoti, itthī vā puriso vā gahaṭṭho vā pabbajito vā.
sbs_example_3: gopālako sāyanhasamaye sāmikānaṃ gāvo niyyātetvā iti paṭisañcikkhati, ajja kho gāvo amukasmiñ'ca amukasmiñ'ca padese cariṃsu

meaning_1: hot season; summer; lit. hot months
example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gimhānaṃ pacchime māse ūhataṃ rajojallaṃ, tam'enaṃ mahāakālamegho ṭhānaso antaradhāpeti vūpasameti.
example_2: māso seso gimhānan'ti, bhikkhunā vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ pariyesitabbaṃ, addhamāso seso gimhānan'ti katvā nivāsetabbaṃ.

example_2: cattār'imāni, bhikkhave, saṅgahavatthūni. katamāni cattāri? dānaṃ, peyyavajjaṃ, atthacariyā, samānattatā, imāni kho, bhikkhave, cattāri saṅgahavatthūnī'ti.

example_1: katamo c'āvuso, pariyāyo yaṃ pariyāyaṃ āgamma ime dhammā ek'atthā byañjanam'eva nānaṃ? rāgo kho, āvuso, pamāṇakaraṇo, doso pamāṇakaraṇo, moho pamāṇakaraṇo.
example_2: ye dhammā samaṇakaraṇā ca brāhmaṇakaraṇā ca te dhamme samādāya vattissāma evaṃ no ayaṃ amhākaṃ samaññā ca saccā bhavissati paṭiññā ca bhūtā
sbs_example_3: cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, dhammā sāraṇīyā piyakaraṇā garukaraṇā saṅgahāya avivādāya sāmaggiyā ekībhāvāya saṃvattanti.

meaning_1: well learned; knowledgeable; lit. much heard
commentary:
(SNa) bahussutassā'ti pariyattibahussutassa paṭivedhabahussutassa ca.
(ANa) bahussuto hotī'ti bahuṃ assa sutaṃ hoti, nav'aṅgaṃ satthusāsanaṃ pāḷianusandhipubb'āparavasena uggahitaṃ hotī'ti attho.
example_1:
tasmā hi
dhīrañ'ca paññañ'ca bahussutañ'ca,
dhorayhasīlaṃ vatavantam'ariyaṃ,
taṃ tādisaṃ sappurisaṃ sumedhaṃ,
bhajetha nakkhattapathaṃ'va candimā.
example_2: yato ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu saddho ca hoti, sīlavā ca, bahussuto ca, dhammakathiko ca, paris'āvacaro ca, visārado ca parisāya dhammaṃ deseti … evaṃ so ten'aṅgena paripūro hoti.
sbs_example_3: asukasmiṃ nāma āvāse sambahulā therā bhikkhū viharanti bahussutā āgat'āgamā dhammadharā vinayadharā mātikādharā. tesaṃ me therānaṃ sammukhā sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ
sbs_example_4: tathārūp'āssa dhammā bahussutā honti dhātā vacasā paricitā manas'ānupekkhitā diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, sutadhanaṃ
sbs_example_5: bahussuto nu kho'mhi sutadharo sutasannicayo, ye te dhammā ādikalyāṇā majjhekalyāṇā pariyosānakalyāṇā sātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ abhivadanti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: bhavam'atthu bhavantaṃ jotipālaṃ, rājā disampati bhavantaṃ jotipālaṃ māṇavaṃ āmantayati, rājā disampati bhoto jotipālassa māṇavassa dassanakāmo'ti
example_2: brahmamārā ca indā ca lokapālā ca devatā, yamo, mittā manussā ca majjhattā verikā'pi ca, sabbe sattā sukhī hontu.
sbs_example_3: app'ekad'āhaṃ, bho raṭṭhapāla, idha pādaṃ karissāmī'ti aññen'eva pādaṃ karomī'ti.

meaning_1: in whoever; in whichever; at whichever
example_1: yasmiṃ c'assā padese ṭhitāya evam'assa, yaṃnūn'āhaṃ agatapubbañ'c'eva disaṃ gaccheyyaṃ, akhāditapubbāni ca tiṇāni khādeyyaṃ, apītapubbāni ca pānīyāni piveyyan'ti tañ'ca padesaṃ na sotthinā paccāgaccheyya.

meaning_1: and what is more; and so too
example_1: puna caparaṃ, ānanda, bhikkhuno sotena saddaṃ sutvā
example_2: puna caparaṃ, sīha, dāyako dānapati yaṃ yadeva parisaṃ upasaṅkamati, yadi khattiyaparisaṃ yadi brāhmaṇaparisaṃ yadi gahapatiparisaṃ yadi samaṇaparisaṃ, visārado'va upasaṅkamati amaṅkubhūto.

commentary: (VIN 1.1.3) iti cittamano'ti yaṃ cittaṃ taṃ mano, yaṃ mano taṃ cittaṃ.
example_1:
santaṃ tassa manaṃ hoti,
santā vācā ca kamma ca,
samma'd'aññā vimuttassa,
upasantassa tādino.
example_2: yañ'ca kho etaṃ bhikkhave vuccati cittaṃ iti'pi mano iti'pi viññāṇaṃ iti'pi tatr'āssutavā puthujjano n'ālaṃ nibbindituṃ n'ālaṃ virajjituṃ n'ālaṃ vimuccituṃ

mettāya phasse tasathāvarāni,
yad'āvilattaṃ manaso vijaññā,
kaṇhassa pakkho'ti vinodayeyya.
sbs_example_5: bhikkhu manañ'ca pajānāti, dhamme ca pajānāti

example_1:
ete vivādā samaṇesu jātā,
etesu ugghāti nighāti hoti,
etam'pi disvā virame kath'ojjaṃ,
na h'añña'd'atth'atthi pasaṃsalābhā.

meaning_1: wants to hear; wishes to listen; lit. wants to listen

commentary: (MNa) pātukarissatī'ti pakāsessati dassessati. na hi sakkā tena tāni ettakena antarena dassetuṃ.

example_2: sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno aññen'aññaṃ paṭicarati, bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmeti, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātukaroti, evaṃ sant'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo akaccho hoti.

meaning_1: free from the effluents; taint-less; undefiled
example_1: so sace ākaṅkhati, āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭh'eva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihareyyan'ti, tatra tatr'eva sakkhibhabbataṃ pāpuṇāti sati sati āyatane'ti.
example_2:
n'āhaṃ sabbe samaṇabrāhmaṇāse,

sīlabbataṃ v'āpi pahāya sabbaṃ,
anekarūpam'pi pahāya sabbaṃ,
taṇhaṃ pariññāya anāsavāse,
te ve narā oghatiṇṇā'ti brūmi.

meaning_1: being preached (by); being taught (by); being explained (by)
example_1: kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, olīyanti eke? bhav'ārāmā, bhikkhave, devamanussā bhavaratā bhavasammuditā tesaṃ bhavanirodhāya dhamme desiyamāne cittaṃ na pakkhandati na pasīdati na santiṭṭhati n'ādhimuccati. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, olīyanti eke.

example_1: evaṃ adhiccam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, yaṃ manussattaṃ labhati. evaṃ adhiccam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, yaṃ tathāgato loke uppajjati arahaṃ sammāsambuddho. evaṃ adhiccam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, yaṃ tathāgatappavedito dhammavinayo loke dibbati.

meaning_1: talk on ethical conduct; discussion about correct behaviour
example_1: atha kho bhagavā brahmāyussa brāhmaṇassa anupubbiṃ kathaṃ kathesi, seyyath'idaṃ, dānakathaṃ, sīlakathaṃ, saggakathaṃ, kāmānaṃ ādīnavaṃ okāraṃ saṃkilesaṃ nekkhamme ānisaṃsaṃ pakāsesi.
example_2: appicchakathā, santuṭṭhikathā, pavivekakathā, asaṃsaggakathā, vīriy'ārambhakathā, sīlakathā, samādhikathā, paññākathā, vimuttikathā, vimuttiñāṇadassanakathā'ti, imāni kho, bhikkhave, dasa kathāvatthūni.
sbs_example_3: dussīlo, bhikkhave, sīlakathāya kacchamānāya abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātukaroti.

meaning_1: supra-mundane; transcendental; lit. beyond the world
example_1: sammādiṭṭhiṃ'p'ahaṃ, bhikkhave, dvayaṃ vadāmi. atthi, bhikkhave, sammādiṭṭhi s'āsavā puññabhāgiyā upadhivepakkā, atthi, bhikkhave, sammādiṭṭhi ariyā anāsavā lok'uttarā magg'aṅgā.
example_2: ye te suttantā tathāgatabhāsitā gambhīrā gambhīr'atthā lok'uttarā suññatappaṭisaṃyuttā, tesu bhaññamānesu na sussūsissanti na sotaṃ odahissanti

example_1: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, cattāro vaṇṇā, khattiyā, brāhmaṇā, vessā, suddā te tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajitvā jahanti purimāni nāmagottāni, samaṇā sakyaputtiyā tv'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchanti
example_2:
vinicchayā yāni pakappitāni,
te ve munī brūsi anuggahāya,
ajjhattasantī'ti yam'etam'atthaṃ,
kathaṃ nu dhīrehi paveditaṃ taṃ.
sbs_example_3: dhammo ca desito niyyāniko upasamiko parinibbāniko sambodhagāmī sugatappavedito
sbs_example_4: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye desiyamāne na labhati atthavedaṃ, na labhati dhammavedaṃ, na labhati dhamm'ūpasaṃhitaṃ pāmojjaṃ.
sbs_example_5:
pañca kāmaguṇā loke, manochaṭṭhā paveditā,

example_1:
yo have iṇam'ādāya,
cujjamāno palāyati,
na hi te iṇamatthī'ti,

example_2: seyyathā'pi, mahārāja, puriso iṇaṃ ādāya kamm'ante payojeyya. tassa te kamm'antā samijjheyyuṃ.

example_1: dasahi ca lokadhātūhi devatā yebhuyyena sannipatitā honti bhagavantaṃ dassanāya bhikkhusaṅghañ'ca

meaning_1: disintegration; decay; disappearance; dissolution; vanishing; lit. going away
example_1:

mosadhammaṃ palokinaṃ,
phussa phussa vayaṃ passaṃ,
evaṃ tattha vijānati,
vedanānaṃ khayā bhikkhu,

example_2: tīṇ'imāni, bhikkhave, saṅkhatassa saṅkhatalakkhaṇāni. katamāni tīṇi? uppādo paññāyati, vayo paññāyati, ṭhitassa aññathattaṃ paññāyati. imāni kho, bhikkhave, tīṇi saṅkhatassa saṅkhatalakkhaṇānī'ti.

example_2: idam'avoca bhagavā. attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinandun'ti. imasmiñ'ca pana veyyākaraṇasmiṃ bhaññamāne sahassī lokadhātu akampitthā'ti.

meaning_1: related to an offence requiring suspension; lit. related to an offence requiring involvement of the community from start to finish

sbs_example_4: āyudo balado dhīro, vaṇṇado paṭibhāṇado. sukhassa dātā medhāvī, sukhaṃ so adhigacchati. āyuṃ datvā balaṃ vaṇṇaṃ, sukhañ'ca paṭibhānakaṃ, dīgh'āyu yasavā hoti, yattha yatth'ūpapajjatī'ti.
sbs_example_5:
abhivādanasīlissa, niccaṃ vuḍḍh'āpacāyino,

example_2: codakena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā paraṃ codetu'kāmena pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ paccavekkhitvā pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ upaṭṭhāpetvā paro codetabbo

tasmā piyaṃ na kayirātha,
piya-apāyo hi pāpako,
ganthā tesaṃ na vijjanti,
yesaṃ n'atthi piy'āppiyaṃ

meaning_1: name of the people of Bengal; Bengalis

example_1: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā aṅgesu viharati āpaṇaṃ nāma aṅgānaṃ nigamo.
example_2: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā aṅgesu viharati assapuraṃ nāma aṅgānaṃ nigamo.

meaning_1: eats; uses; enjoys; lit. brings here
example_1: bhojane mattaññuno bhavissāma paṭisaṅkhā yoniso āhāraṃ āharissāma n'eva davāya na madāya na maṇḍanāya na vibhūsanāya yāva'd'eva imassa kāyassa ṭhitiyā yāpanāya
example_2: ehi tvaṃ bhikkhu bhojane mattaññū hohi. paṭisaṅkhā yoniso āhāraṃ āhāreyyāsi
sbs_example_3: yo pana bhikkhu adinnaṃ mukhadvāraṃ āhāraṃ āhareyya, aññatra udakadantaponā, pācittiyaṃ.

example_1: sutaṃ m'etaṃ, bhante, samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ uddissa pāṇaṃ ārabhanti, taṃ samaṇo gotamo jānaṃ uddissakataṃ maṃsaṃ paribhuñjati paṭiccakamman'ti.
example_2: yam'pi so evam'āha, gacchatha imaṃ pāṇaṃ ārabhathā'ti, iminā tatiyena ṭhānena bahuṃ apuññaṃ pasavati.
sbs_example_3: yo kho, jīvaka, tathāgataṃ vā tathāgatasāvakaṃ vā uddissa pāṇaṃ ārabhati so pañcahi ṭhānehi bahuṃ apuññaṃ pasavati.

example_1:
uttamaṃ dhammataṃ patto,
sabbaloke anatthiko,
ādittā'va gharā mutto,
maraṇasmiṃ na socati.
example_2:
socati puttehi puttimā,
gomā gohi tath'eva socati,
upadhīhi narassa socanā,
na hi so socati yo nirūpadhī'ti.
sbs_example_3:
yāya devā manussā ca, sitā tiṭṭhanti atthikā,
tarath'etaṃ visattikaṃ, khaṇo vo mā upaccagā,
khaṇ'ātītā hi socanti, nirayamhi samappitā.
sbs_example_4: tassa sā sukhā vedanā nirujjhati. sukhāya vedanāya nirodhā uppajjati dukkhā vedanā. so dukkhāya vedanāya phuṭṭho samāno socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati sammohaṃ āpajjati.

commentary: (SNa) tareyyā'ti ettha tebhūmakavaṭṭaṃ samatikkamanto nibbānaṃ paṭivijjhanto taratī'ti paṭivedhataraṇaṃ nāma vuttaṃ.
example_1:
ākiñcaññaṃ pekkhamāno satimā,
n'atthī'ti nissāya tarassu oghaṃ,
kāme pahāya virato kathāhi,
taṇhakkhayaṃ nattam'ah'ābhipassa.
example_2:
eko ahaṃ sakka mahantam'oghaṃ,
anissito no visahāmi tārituṃ,
ārammaṇaṃ brūhi samantacakkhu,
yaṃ nissito ogham'imaṃ tareyyaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
yāya devā manussā ca, sitā tiṭṭhanti atthikā,
tarath'etaṃ visattikaṃ, khaṇo vo mā upaccagā,
khaṇ'ātītā hi socanti, nirayamhi samappitā.

example_1: pañcakāmaguṇike rāge pariññāte n'atthi taṃ saṃyojanaṃ yena saṃyojanena saṃyutto ariyasāvako puna imaṃ lokaṃ āgaccheyya
example_2: sā ce tato cutā itthattaṃ āgacchati, sā yattha yattha paccājāyati dubbaṇṇā ca hoti durūpā supāpikā dassanāya, daliddā ca hoti appassakā appabhogā appesakkhā ca.
sbs_example_3: yāv'āhaṃ tesaṃ uddisitvā āgacchāmī'ti, udāhu vippalapan'tass'eva coraghātā sīsaṃ chindeyyun'ti?

example_1: jānāhi yadi vā taṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ tathā santaṃ'y'eva saddo abbhuggato, yadi vā no tathā, yadi vā so bhavaṃ gotamo tādiso, yadi vā na tādiso. tathā mayaṃ taṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ vedissāmā'ti.
example_2: puccheyyāma mayaṃ āyasmantaṃ channaṃ kañci'd'eva desaṃ, sace āyasmā channo okāsaṃ karoti pañhassa veyyākaraṇāyā'ti. pucch'āvuso sāriputta, sutvā vedissāmā'ti.
sbs_example_3: yassa siyā āpatti so āvikareyya, asantiyā āpattiyā tuṇhī bhavitabbaṃ. tuṇhībhāvena kho pan'āyasmante parisuddhā'ti vedissāmi.

example_1: paṭiggahetvā tiyojanaparamaṃ sahatthā haritabbāni asante hārake. tato ce uttari hareyya, asante'pi hārake, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
example_2: amhe jano harati vā ḍahati vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karotī'ti
sbs_example_3: yassa bhavissati so harissatī'ti. ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.
sbs_example_4: tam'enaṃ jano disvā evaṃ vadeyya, bhogī vata, bho, puriso, evaṃ kira bhogino bhogāni bhuñjantī'ti. tam'enaṃ sāmikā yattha yatth'eva passeyyuṃ tattha tatth'eva sāni hareyyuṃ.

example_1:
jaheyya sabbasaṃyogaṃ,
kareyya saraṇ'attano,
careyy'ādittasīso'va,
patthayaṃ accutaṃ padan'ti.
example_2:
visenikatvā pana ye caranti,
diṭṭhīhi diṭṭhiṃ avirujjhamānā,
tesu tvaṃ kiṃ labhetho pasūra,
yes'īdha n'atthī param'uggahītaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
yaṃ pubbe taṃ visosehi, pacchā te m'āhu kiñcanaṃ,
majjhe ce no gahessasi, upasanto carissasi.
sbs_example_4:
yathā'ssa passato rūpaṃ, sevato c'āpi vedanaṃ.
khīyati nopacīyati, evaṃ so caratī sato.
evaṃ apacinato dukkhaṃ, santike nibbānam'uccati.

meaning_1: enjoys; finds pleasure (in); takes delight (in); likes
example_1:
dhammapīti sukhaṃ seti,
vippasannena cetasā,
ariyappavedite dhamme,
sadā ramati paṇḍito.
example_2:
ramaṇīyāni araññāni,
yattha na ramatī jano,
vītarāgā ramissanti,
na te kāmagavesino.
sbs_example_3:
uyyuñjanti satīmanto, na nikete ramanti te,
haṃsā'va pallalaṃ hitvā, okam'okaṃ jahanti te.
sbs_example_4:
madhurañ'ca pavanti sabbaso,
kusumarajena samuṭṭhitā dumā,
paṭhamavasanto sukho utu,
ehi ramāma supupphite vane.
sbs_example_5:
abhittharetha kalyāṇe, pāpā cittaṃ nivāraye,
dandhañ'hi karoto puññaṃ, pāpasmiṃ ramatī mano.

meaning_1: falls down; falls forward; falls off; falls (into)
example_1: te jātisaṃvattanike'pi saṅkhāre abhisaṅkharitvā jarāsaṃvattanike'pi saṅkhāre abhisaṅkharitvā ... jātipapātam'pi papatanti, jarāpapātam'pi papatanti
example_2: evañ'hi, bhikkhave, tassa purisassa hoti, imaṃ c'āhaṃ aṅgārakāsuṃ papatissāmi, tatonidānaṃ maraṇaṃ vā nigacchāmi maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkhan'ti
sbs_example_3: upakkhalitvā vā papateyyaṃ, bhattaṃ vā me bhuttaṃ byāpajjeyya, pittaṃ vā me kuppeyya, semhaṃ vā me kuppeyya, satthakā vā me vātā kuppeyyuṃ

example_1: seyyathā'pi nāma kuñjaro saṭṭhihāyano gambhīraṃ pokkharaṇiṃ ogāhetvā sāṇadhovikaṃ nāma kīḷitajātaṃ kīḷati, evam'ev'āhaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ sāṇadhovikaṃ maññe kīḷitajātaṃ kīḷissāmi.
example_2: sa kho so, bhikkhave, kumāro vuddhim'anvāya indriyānaṃ paripākam'anvāya yāni tāni kumārakānaṃ kīḷāpanakāni tehi kīḷati, seyyath'idaṃ, vaṅkakaṃ ghaṭikaṃ mokkhacikaṃ ciṅgulakaṃ patt'āḷhakaṃ rathakaṃ dhanukaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
te kilesā pavaḍḍhantā, āvisanti bahuṃ janaṃ.
kīḷanti maññe bālehi, ummattehi'va rakkhasā.

example_1:
hīnaṃ dhammaṃ na seveyya,
pamādena na saṃvase,
micchādiṭṭhiṃ na seveyya,
na siyā lokavaḍḍhano.
example_2:
āthabbaṇaṃ supinaṃ lakkhaṇaṃ,
no vidahe atho'pi nakkhattaṃ,
virutañ'ca gabbhakaraṇaṃ,
tikicchaṃ māmako na seveyya.
sbs_example_3: tayo satipaṭṭhānā yad'ariyo sevati yad'ariyo sevamāno satthā gaṇam'anusāsitum'arahati, so vuccati yogg'ācariyānaṃ anuttaro purisadammasārathī'ti

meaning_1: believes (in); has faith (in); has confidence (in); has conviction (in)
example_1: idh'āvuso bhikkhu saddho hoti saddahati tathāgatassa bodhiṃ
example_2: yo, bhikkhave, ime dhamme evaṃ saddahati adhimuccati, ayaṃ vuccati saddh'ānusārī, okkanto sammattaniyāmaṃ, sappurisabhūmiṃ okkanto, vītivatto puthujjanabhūmiṃ.
sbs_example_3: tassa so gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā mittato'pi naṃ saddaheyya, suhajjato'pi naṃ saddaheyya, tasmiñ'ca vissāsaṃ āpajjeyya.

example_1: tassa ce, bhikkhave, kulaputtassa evaṃ uṭṭhahato ghaṭato vāyamato te bhogā n'ābhinipphajjanti. so socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati, sammohaṃ āpajjati, moghaṃ vata me uṭṭhānaṃ, aphalo vata me vāyāmo'ti
example_2: so socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati sammohaṃ āpajjati. evaṃ kho, bhikkhu, bahiddhā asati paritassanā hotī'ti.
sbs_example_3: tassa sā sukhā vedanā nirujjhati. sukhāya vedanāya nirodhā uppajjati dukkhā vedanā. so dukkhāya vedanāya phuṭṭho samāno socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati sammohaṃ āpajjati.

meaning_1: feels; experiences; senses; lit. causes to know
example_1: ko nu kho, bhante, vedayatī'ti? no kallo pañho'ti bhagavā avoca, vedayatī'ti ahaṃ na vadāmi.
example_2: kiñ'ca, bhikkhave, vedanaṃ vadetha? vedayatī'ti kho, bhikkhave, tasmā vedanā'ti vuccati. kiñ'ca vedayati? sukham'pi vedayati, dukkham'pi vedayati, adukkham'asukham'pi vedayati
sbs_example_3: tassa kismiñci'd'eva pasādanīye nimitte cittaṃ paṇidahato pāmojjaṃ jāyati. pamuditassa pīti jāyati. pītimanassa kāyo passambhati. passaddhakāyo sukhaṃ vedayati. sukhino cittaṃ samādhiyati.

example_1:
ovadeyya-anusāseyya,
asabbhā ca nivāraye,
satañ'hi so piyo hoti,
asataṃ hoti appiyo.
example_2: ovadatu maṃ, bhante, bhagavā, anusāsatu maṃ, bhante, bhagavā, yaṃ mam'assa dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāyā'ti.
sbs_example_3:
tad'ahu pabbajito santo, jātiyā sattavassiko.
so pi maṃ anusāseyya, sampaṭicchāmi muddhanā

commentary: (ANa) namassantī'ti kāyena namassanti, vācāya namassanti, manasā namassanti, dhamm'ānudhammapaṭipattiyā namassanti, sakkaronti garuṃ karonti.
example_1:
tasmā hi ne namasseyya,
sakkareyya ca paṇḍito,
annena atha pānena,
vatthena sayanena ca.
example_2: no ce haritāni tiṇāni āmaseyyāsi, aggiṃ paricareyyāsi. no ce aggiṃ paricareyyāsi, pañjaliko ādiccaṃ namasseyyāsi
sbs_example_3: svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo, dhammaṃ namassāmi
sbs_example_4: arahante sītībhūte, katakicce anāsave nihacca mānaṃ athaddho, te namasse anuttare'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: brings (for); brings back (for); fetches (for); procures (for); lit. brings here
example_1: kathañ'ca, visākhe, mātugāmo sambhataṃ anurakkhati? idha, visākhe, mātugāmo yaṃ bhattā āharati dhanaṃ vā dhaññaṃ vā rajataṃ vā jātarūpaṃ vā taṃ ārakkhena guttiyā sampādeti, tattha ca hoti adhuttī athenī asoṇḍī avināsikā.
example_2: atha puriso āgaccheyya, ahaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ daḷhadhammānaṃ dhanuggahānaṃ susikkhitānaṃ katahatthānaṃ kat'ūpāsanānaṃ catuddisā kaṇḍe khitte appatiṭṭhite pathaviyaṃ gahetvā āharissāmī'ti.
sbs_example_3: so evaṃ vadeyya, alaṃ me, bho, tāya vīṇāya, tam'eva me saddaṃ āharathā'ti.

example_1:
sa ve indriyasampanno,
santo santipade rato,
dhāreti antimaṃ dehaṃ,
jetvā māraṃ savāhinin'ti.
example_2: tasmā te cakkhūni nassantu vā bhijjantu vā, buddhasāsanam'eva dhārehi, mā cakkhūnī'ti
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya

meaning_1: (of meditation attainments or Nibbāna) experiences; reaches; attains; achieves; lit. touches
example_1:
bhāvehi jhānāni ca indriyāni ca,
balāni bojjh'aṅgasamādhibhāvanā,
tisso ca vijjā phusa buddhasāsane,
itissu maṃ citta pure niyuñjasi.
example_2: so abhijānanto ekaṃ dhammaṃ, parijānanto ekaṃ dhammaṃ, pajahanto ekaṃ dhammaṃ, sacchikaronto ekaṃ dhammaṃ sammāvimuttiṃ phusati.
sbs_example_3:
saritvā pubbake yogī, tesaṃ vattam'anussaraṃ.
kiñ'c'āpi pacchimo kālo, phuseyya amataṃ padaṃ.
sbs_example_4:
te jhāyino sātatikā, niccaṃ daḷhaparakkamā,
phusanti dhīrā nibbānaṃ, yogakkhemaṃ anuttaraṃ.

meaning_1: considers as; takes as; regards as; lit. puts
example_1:
gāme araññe sukhadukkhaphuṭṭho,
n'ev'attato no parato dahetha,
phusanti phassā upadhiṃ paṭicca,
nirūpadhiṃ kena phuseyyu phassā'ti.
example_2:
te vādakāmā parisaṃ vigayha,
bālaṃ dahantī mithu aññam'aññaṃ,
vadanti te aññasitā kath'ojjaṃ,
pasaṃsakāmā kusalā vadānā.
sbs_example_3: sakyā kho pana, ambaṭṭha, rājānaṃ okkākaṃ pitāmahaṃ dahanti.

commentary:
(MNa) paribhāsantī'ti tayā idañ'c'idañ'ca kataṃ, evañ'ca evañ'ca taṃ karissāmā'ti vācāya paribhāsanti.
(SNa) paribhāsissantī'ti kiṃ samaṇo nāma tvaṃ, idañ'c'idañ'ca te karissāmā'ti tajjessanti.
example_1:
yo buddhaṃ paribhāsati,
atha vā tassa sāvakaṃ,
paribbājaṃ gahaṭṭhaṃ vā,
taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.
example_2: evarūpo, bhikkhave, puggalo ajjhupekkhitabbo na sevitabbo na bhajitabbo na payirupāsitabbo. taṃ kissa hetu? akkoseyya'pi maṃ paribhāseyya'pi maṃ anattham'pi maṃ kareyyā'ti.
sbs_example_3: sace taṃ, puṇṇa, sunāparantakā manussā akkosissanti paribhāsissanti, tatra te, puṇṇa, kin'ti bhavissatī'ti?

example_1: kupito anattamano yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ asabbhāhi pharusāhi vācāhi akkosati paribhāsati.
example_2: evarūpo, bhikkhave, puggalo ajjhupekkhitabbo na sevitabbo na bhajitabbo na payirupāsitabbo. taṃ kissa hetu? akkoseyya'pi maṃ paribhāseyya'pi maṃ anattham'pi maṃ kareyyā'ti.
sbs_example_3: sace taṃ, puṇṇa, sunāparantakā manussā akkosissanti paribhāsissanti, tatra te, puṇṇa, kin'ti bhavissatī'ti?

example_1:
anikkasāvo kāsāvaṃ,
yo vatthaṃ paridahissati,
apeto damasaccena,
na so kāsāvam'arahati.
example_2:
yo ca jānaṃ saṃyat'atto,
jānaṃ na bahu bhāsati,
sa munī monam'arahati,
sa munī monam'ajjhagā'ti.
sbs_example_3: sabhayo c'eso maggo sappaṭibhayo ca sakaṇṭako ca sagahano ca ummaggo ca kummaggo ca duhitiko ca. asappurisasevito c'eso maggo, na c'eso maggo sappurisehi sevito. na tvaṃ etaṃ arahasī'ti.
sbs_example_4:
yo ca vantakasāvassa, sīlesu susamāhito.
upeto damasaccena, sa ve kāsāvam'arahati.

example_1: añña'd'atthu, ayaṃ varāko idāni marissati, yaṃ yadeva hi ayaṃ padaṃ nikkhipati, tena tena santike maraṇassa hotī'ti taṃ jano karuṇāyati.
example_2: deva, idāni ṭhapetvā saccakiriyaṃ añño mama sakkhi n'atthi, sac'āyaṃ dārako tumhe paṭicca jāto, ākāse tiṭṭhatu, no ce, bhūmiyaṃ patitvā maratū'ti bodhisattassa pāde gahetvā ākāse khipi.
sbs_example_3: sabbe sattā maranti ca mariṃsu ca marissare, tath'ev'āhaṃ marissāmi, n'atthi me ettha saṃsayo
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: evaṃ vutte yasmiṃ samaye upeti, saññī tasmiṃ samaye hoti. yasmiṃ samaye apeti, asaññī tasmiṃ samaye hotī'ti. itth'eke abhisaññānirodhaṃ paññapenti.
example_2:
middhī yadā hoti mahagghaso ca,
niddāyitā samparivattasāyī,
mahāvarāho'va nivāpapuṭṭho,
punappunaṃ gabbham'upeti mando.
sbs_example_3:
rājā ca aññe ca bahū manussā, avītataṇhā maraṇaṃ upenti.
ūnā'va hutvāna jahanti dehaṃ, kāmehi lokamhi na h'atthi titti.
sbs_example_4:
jīranti ve rājarathā sucittā, atho sarīram'pi jaraṃ upeti,
satañ'ca dhammo na jaraṃ upeti, santo have sabbhi pavedayanti.

example_1: amutra mayā dvattipattapūrā paṭiggahitā, mā kho tattha paṭiggaṇhī'ti. sace passitvā na ācikkhati, āpatti dukkaṭassa. sace ācikkhite paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
example_2: atthi, bhikkhave, loke lokadhammo, taṃ tathāgato abhisambujjhati abhisameti, abhisambujjhitvā abhisametvā taṃ ācikkhati deseti paññapeti paṭṭhapeti vivarati vibhajati uttānīkaroti.
sbs_example_3: pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca viharati, sato ca sampajāno, sukhañ'ca kāyena paṭisaṃvedeti, yaṃ taṃ ariyā ācikkhanti, upekkhako satimā sukhavihārī'ti tatiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.

example_1:
kathaṃ satassa carato,
viññāṇaṃ uparujjhati,
bhagavantaṃ puṭṭhum'āgamma,

example_2: ekacce licchavī evam'āhaṃsu, kiṃ so bhavamāno saccako nigaṇṭhaputto yo bhagavato vādaṃ āropessati, atha kho bhagavā saccakassa nigaṇṭhaputtassa vādaṃ āropessatī'ti?

example_1: cattār'imāni, gahapati, sukhāni adhigamanīyāni gihinā kāmabhoginā kālena kālaṃ samayena samayaṃ upādāya. katamāni cattāri? atthisukhaṃ, bhogasukhaṃ, ānaṇyasukhaṃ, anavajjasukhaṃ.

sbs_example_3: yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ tiṇ'avatthārakena vūpasameyya, ṭhapetvā thullavajjaṃ, ṭhapetvā gihippaṭisaṃyuttan'ti.
sbs_example_4:
mam'eva kata'maññantu, gihīpabbajitā ubho,
mam'ev'ātivasā assu, kicc'ākiccesu kismici.
iti bālassa saṅkappo, icchā māno ca vaḍḍhati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: tasmā't'iha, moggallāna, yathāsaññissa te viharato taṃ middhaṃ okkamati taṃ saññaṃ mā manas'ākāsi taṃ saññaṃ mā bahulam'akāsi
example_2:
na saññasaññī na visaññasaññī,
no'pi asaññī na vibhūtasaññī,
evaṃ sametassa vibhoti rūpaṃ,
saññānidānā hi papañcasaṅkhā.
sbs_example_3: thinamiddhaṃ pahāya vigatathinamiddho viharati ālokasaññī sato sampajāno, thinamiddhā cittaṃ parisodheti
sbs_example_4: vohāravepakkaṃ saññaṃ vadāmi. yathā yathā naṃ sañjānāti tathā tathā voharati, evaṃ saññī ahosin'ti. ayaṃ vuccati saññānaṃ vipāko.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
yathā daṇḍena gopālo,
gāvo pājeti gocaraṃ,
evaṃ jarā ca maccu ca,
āyuṃ pājenti pāṇinaṃ.
example_2:
tasmā kareyya kalyāṇaṃ,
nicayaṃ samparāyikaṃ,
puññāni paralokasmiṃ,
patiṭṭhā honti pāṇinan'ti.
sbs_example_3: tasmā dade appaṭivānacitto, yattha dinnaṃ mahapphalaṃ. puññāni paralokasmiṃ, patiṭṭhā honti pāṇinan'ti.
sbs_example_4:
ahañ'ce taṃ jiguccheyyaṃ, evaṃ dhammesu pāṇisu.
na m'etaṃ patirūp'assa, mama evaṃ vihārino.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: does not take delight (in); is not pleased (with); does not find pleasure (in)
example_1:
n'ābhinandāmi maraṇaṃ,
n'ābhinandāmi jīvitaṃ,
nikkhipissaṃ imaṃ kāyaṃ,
sampajāno patissato.
example_2:
purāṇaṃ n'ābhinandeyya,
nave khantiṃ na kubbaye,
hiyyamāne na soceyya,
ākāsaṃ na sito siyā.
sbs_example_3: so iti paṭisaṅkhāya atītasmiṃ rūpasmiṃ anapekkho hoti, anāgataṃ rūpaṃ n'ābhinandati, paccuppannassa rūpassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipanno hoti.
sbs_example_4: tañ'ce bhikkhu n'ābhinandati n'ābhivadati n'ājjhosāya tiṭṭhati, tassa taṃ anabhinandato anabhivadato anajjhosāya tiṭṭhato nirujjhati nandī. nandinirodhā dukkhanirodho, puṇṇā'ti vadāmi
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
kathaṃdassī kathaṃsīlo,
upasanto'ti vuccati,
taṃ me gotama pabrūhi,
pucchito uttamaṃ naraṃ.
example_2:
kiṃ me ekena tiṇṇena,
purisena thāmadassinā,
sabbaññutaṃ pāpuṇitvā,
santāressaṃ sadevakaṃ.
sbs_example_3: satt'ete sabbadassinā muninā sammadakkhātā bhāvitā bahulīkatā saṃvattanti abhiññāya nibbānāya ca bodhiyā.
sbs_example_4:
pāpaṃ sahāyaṃ parivajjayetha, anatthadassiṃ visame niviṭṭhaṃ.
sayaṃ na seve pasutaṃ pamattaṃ, eko care khaggavisāṇakappo.

example_1:
kassako paṭijānāsi,
na ca passāma te kasiṃ,
kasiṃ no pucchito brūhi,
yathā jānemu te kasiṃ.
example_2: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, kāyagatā sati no bhāvitā bhavissati bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā'ti.
sbs_example_3: samādāya sikkhatha sikkhāpadesū'ti. evañ'hi no sikkhitabbaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: tīṇ'imāni, bhikkhave, indriyāni. katamāni tīṇi? anaññātañ'ñassāmī't'indriyaṃ, aññ'indriyaṃ, aññātāv'indriyaṃ, imāni kho, bhikkhave, tīṇi indriyānī'ti. etam'atthaṃ bhagavā avoca. tatth'etaṃ iti vuccati.
example_2:
passaṃ naro dakkhati nāmarūpaṃ,
disvāna vā ñassati tāni'm'eva,
kāmaṃ bahuṃ passatu appakaṃ vā,
na hi tena suddhiṃ kusalā vadanti.
sbs_example_3: saddh'indriyaṃ, viriy'indriyaṃ, sat'indriyaṃ, samādh'indriyaṃ, paññ'indriyaṃ, anaññātaññassāmī't'indriyaṃ, aññ'indriyaṃ, aññātāv'indriyaṃ.
sbs_example_4: so vata, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ime pañca āvaraṇe nīvaraṇe cetaso ajjhāruhe paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe appahāya, abalāya paññāya dubbalāya att'atthaṃ vā ñassati
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: mā maṃ āyasmanto kiñci avacuttha kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā, aham'p'āyasmante na kiñci vakkhāmi kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā, viramath'āyasmanto mama vacanāyā'ti.
example_2: ehi tvaṃ, tāta sudassana, bhagavato santike imaṃ gāthaṃ pariyāpuṇitvā mama bhatt'ābhihāre bhāsa. ahañ'ca te devasikaṃ kahāpaṇasataṃ bhikkhaṃ pavattayissāmī'ti.
sbs_example_3: puññaṃ mayā yaṃ mama sabb'upaddavā mā hontu ve tassa pabhāvasiddhiyā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: does not know; does not clearly understand; does not distinguish
example_1: idha, bhikkhave, assutavā puthujjano manasikaraṇīye dhamme nappajānāti, amanasikaraṇīye dhamme nappajānāti
example_2: duppañño duppañño'ti, āvuso, vuccati. kittāvatā nu kho, āvuso, duppañño'ti vuccatī'ti? nappajānāti nappajānātī'ti kho, āvuso, tasmā duppañño'ti vuccati.
sbs_example_3: ñātaṃ ye pattidānam'me anumodantu te sayaṃ, ye c'imaṃ nappajānanti devā tesaṃ nivedayuṃ
sbs_example_4: ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā'ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānanti, te jātisaṃvattanikesu saṅkhāresu abhiramanti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: anuvicca pariyogāhetvā avaṇṇa-arahassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, anuvicca pariyogāhetvā vaṇṇ'ārahassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati
example_2: tasmā't'iha, phagguna, tava ce'pi sammukhā avaṇṇaṃ bhāseyya, tatr'āpi tvaṃ, phagguna, ye gehasitā chandā ye gehasitā vitakkā te pajaheyyāsi.
sbs_example_3: idha, potaliya, ekacco puggalo avaṇṇ'ārahassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena, no ca kho vaṇṇ'ārahassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena.

meaning_1: who takes pleasure in; who enjoys
example_1: iti bhinnānaṃ vā sandhātā sahitānaṃ vā anuppadātā samagg'ārāmo samaggarato samagganandī samaggakaraṇiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti
example_2:
ākiñcaññasambhavaṃ ñatvā,
nandī saṃyojanaṃ iti,
evam'etaṃ abhiññāya,
tato tattha vipassati,
etaṃ ñāṇaṃ tathaṃ tassa,
brāhmaṇassa vusīmato'ti.
sbs_example_3: idha gihīhi saṃsaṭṭho viharati, sahanandī sahasokī, sukhitesu sukhito, dukkhitesu dukkhito, uppannesu kiccakaraṇīyesu attanā tesu yogaṃ āpajjati. ayaṃ vuccati manussaggāho.

commentary:
(SNa) jhāyī'ti dvīhi jhānehi jhāyī.
(SNt) dvīhi jhānehī'ti ārammaṇa-lakkhaṇ'ūpanijjhāna-lakkhaṇehi dvīhi jhānehi.
example_1:
yo ca vassasataṃ jīve,
dussīlo asamāhito,
ek'āhaṃ jīvitaṃ seyyo,
sīlavantassa jhāyino.
example_2:
jhāyī na pādalolassa,
virame kukkuccā nappamajjeyya,
ath'āsanesu sayanesu,
appasaddesu bhikkhu vihareyya.
sbs_example_3: idh'āvuso, dhammayogā bhikkhū jhāyī bhikkhū apasādenti, ime pana jhāyino'mhā, jhāyino'mhā'ti jhāyanti pajjhāyanti nijjhāyanti avajjhāyanti
sbs_example_4:
te jhāyino sātatikā, niccaṃ daḷhaparakkamā,
phusanti dhīrā nibbānaṃ, yogakkhemaṃ anuttaraṃ.
sbs_example_5:
samaṇassa ahu cintā, pupphitamhi mahāvane.
ek'aggassa nisinnassa, pavivittassa jhāyino.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: sace kho tvaṃ, bhikkhu, brahmuno vacanaṃ upātivattissasi, seyyathā'pi nāma puriso siriṃ āgacchantiṃ daṇḍena paṭippaṇāmeyya ... evaṃ sampadam'idaṃ, bhikkhu, tuyhaṃ bhavissati.
example_2:
disā catasso vidisā catasso,
uddhaṃ adho dasa disā imāyo,
na tuyhaṃ adiṭṭhaṃ asutaṃ amutaṃ,
atho aviññātaṃ kiñcanam'atthi loke,
ācikkha dhammaṃ yam'ahaṃ vijaññaṃ,
jātijarāya idha vippahānaṃ.
sbs_example_3: ambho purisa, kiṃ tuyh'iminā pāpakena dujjīvitena? matan'te jīvitā seyyo'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: saññā nu kho, bhante, purisassa attā, udāhu aññā saññā añño attā'ti? kaṃ pana tvaṃ, poṭṭhapāda, attānaṃ paccesī'ti? oḷārikaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, attānaṃ paccemi rūpiṃ cātumahābhūtikaṃ kabaḷīkār'āhārabhakkhan'ti.
example_2: ayaṃ kho me kāyo rūpī cātumahābhūtiko mātā-pettika-sambhavo odana-kummāsa-upacayo anicc'ucchādana-parimaddana-bhedana-viddhaṃsana-dhammo, idañ'ca pana me viññāṇaṃ ettha sitaṃ ettha paṭibaddhan'ti
sbs_example_3: rūpī bhavissan'ti maññitam'etaṃ, arūpī bhavissan'ti maññitam'etaṃ, saññī bhavissan'ti maññitam'etaṃ, asaññī bhavissan'ti maññitam'etaṃ, n'evasaññīn'āsaññī bhavissan'ti maññitam'etaṃ.

example_1:
na vākkaraṇamattena,
vaṇṇapokkharatāya vā,

example_2:
rosako kadariyo ca,
pāpiccho maccharī saṭho,

meaning_1: elephant; lit. having a hand; i.e. trunk
example_1: katame ca, bhikkhave, āsavā parivajjanā pahātabbā? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paṭisaṅkhā yoniso caṇḍaṃ hatthiṃ parivajjeti, caṇḍaṃ assaṃ parivajjeti, caṇḍaṃ goṇaṃ parivajjeti, caṇḍaṃ kukkuraṃ parivajjeti
example_2: sārambhaṃ nāma kipillikānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, upacikānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, undurānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, ahīnaṃ vā āsayo hoti, vicchikānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, satapadīnaṃ vā āsayo hoti, hatthīnaṃ vā āsayo hoti

sbs_example_4: atha kho pesso ca hatth'ārohaputto kandarako ca paribbājako yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā pesso hatth'ārohaputto bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.

example_1: evaṃ vutte tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, bhagavantaṃ'y'eva ārabbha sati udapādi, aho nūna bhagavā, aho nūna sugato, yo imesaṃ dhammānaṃ sukusalo'ti. bhagavā, bhante, kusalo, bhagavā pakataññū abhisaññānirodhassa.

example_2: tassa taṃ ṭhānaṃ abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhato yo yobbane yobbanamado so sabbaso vā pahīyati tanu vā pana hoti. idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, atthavasaṃ paṭicca jarādhammo'mhi, jaraṃ anatīto'ti

meaning_1: name of a monk; Kāḷudāyi; lit. rising
example_1: evaṃ vutte āyasmā udāyī bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, hatthim'eva nu kho, bhante, mahantaṃ brahantaṃ kāy'upapannaṃ jano disvā evam'āha, nāgo vata, bho, nāgo'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: idha, bhikkhave, asappuriso yo hoti parassa avaṇṇo taṃ apuṭṭho'pi pātu karoti, ko pana vādo puṭṭhassa! puṭṭho kho pana pañh'ābhinīto ahāpetvā alambitvā paripūraṃ vitthārena parassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti.
example_2: evaṃ saṃsaṭṭho āyasmā moḷiyaphagguno bhikkhunīhi saddhiṃ viharati, sace koci bhikkhu āyasmato moḷiyaphaggunassa sammukhā tāsaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, ten'āyasmā moḷiyaphagguno kupito anattamano adhikaraṇam'pi karoti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: kathañ'hi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, hatthena upakkamitvā asuciṃ mocessasi!
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu imam'eva kāyaṃ uddhaṃ pādatalā adho kesamatthakā tacapariyantaṃ pūraṃ nānappakārassa asucino paccavekkhati
example_2: yathā pana aññe sattā mātukucchito nikkhamantā paṭikūlena asucinā makkhitā nikkhamanti, na evaṃ bodhisatto.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: puṇṇo nāma, āvuso, āyasmā mantāṇiputto amhākaṃ navakānaṃ sataṃ bah'ūpakāro hoti. so amhe iminā ovādena ovadati, upādāya, āvuso ānanda, asmī'ti hoti, no anupādāya.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: unordained person; who is not a higher-ordained; novice monastic or layperson; lit. not attained
commentary: (VIN 2.5.1.4) anupasampanno nāma bhikkhuñ'ca bhikkhuniñ'ca ṭhapetvā avaseso anupasampanno nāma.
example_1: yo pana bhikkhu anupasampannaṃ padaso dhammaṃ vāceyya, pācittiyaṃ.
example_2: yo pana bhikkhu anupasampannena uttaridirattatirattaṃ sahaseyyaṃ kappeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: with eyes; who can see; who has vision; gifted with sight; lit. having eyes quality
example_1:
maggān'aṭṭh'aṅgiko seṭṭho,
saccānaṃ caturo padā,
virāgo seṭṭho dhammānaṃ,
dvipadānañ'ca cakkhumā.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, cakkhumā puriso āpāthagatānaṃ rūpānaṃ adassanakāmo assa, so nimīleyya vā aññena vā apalokeyya.
sbs_example_3: yo cakkhumā mohamal'āpakaṭṭho, sāmaṃ va buddho sugato vimutto, mārassa pāsā vinimocayanto, pāpesi khemaṃ janataṃ vineyyaṃ
sbs_example_4: tattha cakkhumā puriso sakaṃ mukhanimittaṃ paccavekkhamāno yathābhūtaṃ na jāneyya na passeyya.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
āyu usmā ca viññāṇaṃ,
yadā kāyaṃ jahant'imaṃ,
apaviddho tadā seti,
parabhattaṃ acetanaṃ.
example_2:
dassanaṃ me atikkante,
sasaṅghe lokanāyake,
sayanā vuṭṭhahitvāna,
pallaṅkaṃ ābhujiṃ tadā.
sbs_example_3: upaṭṭhaheyyaṃ taṃ, bhante'ti, tadā'pi so vadhako'va. vadhakañ'ca pana santaṃ na aññāsi, vadhako me'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: in the evening; at night; late at night
example_1: tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu, rañño sato khattiyassa muddh'āvasittassa caturāsītithālipākasahassāni ahesuṃ, sāyaṃ pātaṃ bhatt'ābhihāro abhihariyittha.
example_2: atisītan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atiuṇhan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atisāyan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atipāto'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atichāto'smī'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atidhāto'smī'ti kammaṃ na karoti.
sbs_example_3: tena kho pana samayena āyasmā nigrodhakappo pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto vihāraṃ pavisati, sāyaṃ vā nikkhamati aparajju vā kāle
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: who has gone beyond; who has crossed over
example_1:
yaṃ manussā namassanti,
sabbadhammāna pāraguṃ,
devā'pi taṃ namassanti,
iti me arahato sutaṃ.
example_2:
muñca pure muñca pacchato,
majjhe muñca bhavassa pāragū,
sabbattha vimuttamānaso,
na punaṃ jātijaraṃ upehisi.
sbs_example_3:
tasmā jantu sadā sato, kāmāni parivajjaye,
te pahāya tare oghaṃ, nāvaṃ sitvā'va pāragū'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yo'pi hetu yo'pi paccayo cakkhuviññāṇassa uppādāya, so'pi hetu so'pi paccayo anicco vipariṇāmī aññathābhāvī. aniccaṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, paccayaṃ paṭicca uppannaṃ cakkhuviññāṇaṃ kuto niccaṃ bhavissati!
example_2: aṭṭh'ime, bhikkhave, hetū aṭṭha paccayā ādibrahmacariyikāya paññāya appaṭiladdhāya paṭilābhāya, paṭiladdhāya bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya bhāvanāya pāripūriyā saṃvattanti. katame aṭṭha?
sbs_example_3: taṃ kissa hetu? tathārūpānaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ dhammaṃ sutvā dvayena vūpakāsena vūpakaṭṭho viharati, kāyavūpakāsena ca cittavūpakāsena ca.
sbs_example_4: asādhāraṇena ca ñāṇena samannāgato bhavissāmi, hetu ca me sudiṭṭho bhavissati, hetusamuppannā ca dhammā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: idāni, bhante, deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā dve kassakā bhātaro hatā cattāro ca balibaddā
example_2: añña'd'atthu, ayaṃ varāko idāni marissati, yaṃ yadeva hi ayaṃ padaṃ nikkhipati, tena tena santike maraṇassa hotī'ti taṃ jano karuṇāyati.
sbs_example_3: puññassa-idāni katassa yān'aññāni katāni me, tesañ'ca bhāgino hontu satt'ānant'āppamāṇakā
sbs_example_4: tattha purimesu catūsu kiccesu idāni suriy'ālokassa atthitāya n'atthi, aparāni tīṇi bhikkhūnaṃ vattaṃ jānantehi bhikkhūhi katāni pariniṭṭhitāni honti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: evil; wicked; malevolent; lit. having evil quality
example_1: luddo'ti kho, bhikkhave, mārassetaṃ pāpimato adhivacanaṃ. papatā'ti kho, bhikkhave, lābhasakkārasilokassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ. suttakan'ti kho, bhikkhave, nandirāgassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
example_2: na tāv'āhaṃ, pāpima, parinibbāyissāmi, yāva me bhikkhuniyo na sāvikā bhavissanti viyattā vinītā visāradā bahussutā dhammadharā dhamm'ānudhammappaṭipannā
sbs_example_3: maññamāno kho, bhikkhave, baddho mārassa, amaññamāno mutto pāpimato.
sbs_example_4: ayaṃ vuccati ariyasāvako akaraṇīyo mārassa akaraṇīyo pāpimato'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: who has perfect knowledge; who has complete understanding
commentary:
(MNa) catumaggañāṇasaṅkhātehi vedehi akusaladhammānaṃ gatattā vedagū hoti, viditattā'ti attho.
(THa) vedagū'ti vedena gato maggañāṇena nibbānaṃ gato adhigato, cattāri vā saccāni pariññā-pahāna-sacchikiriyā-bhāvan'ābhisamayavasena abhisamecca ṭhito.
(SNa) jātu vedagū'ti ahaṃ ek'aṃsen'eva vedagū, vedasaṅkhātena ñāṇena neyyesu gato, vedaṃ vā gato adhigato, paṇḍito'ham'asmī'ti attho.
example_1:
sukhino vata ye akiñcanā,
vedaguno hi janā akiñcanā,
sakiñcanaṃ passa vihaññamānaṃ,
jano janasmiṃ paṭibandhacitto.
example_2:
pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ,
maññāmi taṃ vedaguṃ bhāvit'attaṃ,
kuto nu dukkhā samudāgatā ime,
ye keci lokasmim'anekarūpā.
sbs_example_3: kathañ'ca bhikkhu vedagū hoti? vidit'āssa honti pāpakā akusalā dhammā, saṃkilesikā, ponobbhavikā, sadarā, dukkhavipākā, āyatiṃ, jātijarāmaraṇiyā
sbs_example_4:
na vedagū diṭṭhiyā na mutiyā,
sa mānam'eti na hi tammayo so,
na kammunā no'pi sutena neyyo,
anūpanīto sa nivesanesu.
sbs_example_5:
sa ve samm'addaso bhikkhu, parijānāti vedanā.
so vedanā pariññāya, diṭṭhe dhamme anāsavo.
kāyassa bhedā dhammaṭṭho, saṅkhyaṃ n'opeti vedagū'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
kadā nu'haṃ pabbatakandarāsu,
ekākiyo addutiyo vihassaṃ,
aniccato sabbabhavaṃ vipassaṃ,
taṃ me idaṃ taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.
example_2: samanuggāhīyamāno'ti yaṃ vatthu paṭiññātaṃ hoti tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ samanuggāhīyamāno, kin'te adhigataṃ, kin'ti te adhigataṃ, kadā te adhigataṃ, kattha te adhigataṃ, katame te kilesā pahīnā, katamesaṃ tvaṃ dhammānaṃ lābhī'ti.
sbs_example_3:
kadā nu rūpe amite ca sadde,
gandhe rase phusitabbe ca dhamme,
ādittato'haṃ samathehi yutto,
paññāya dacchaṃ tad'idaṃ kadā me.
sbs_example_4: kadā nu'haṃ dubbacanena vutto, tatonimittaṃ vimano na hessaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: learned; well-studied; educated; initiated; lit. having heard quality
example_1: tatra, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati, ahaṃ kho eta'r'ahi rūpena khajjāmi. atītam'p'āhaṃ addhānaṃ evam'eva rūpena khajjiṃ, seyyathā'pi eta'r'ahi paccuppannena rūpena khajjāmi
example_2: idha, gahapati, sutavā ariyasāvako ariyānaṃ dassāvī ariyadhammassa kovido ariyadhamme suvinīto sappurisānaṃ dassāvī sappurisadhammassa kovido sappurisadhamme suvinīto na rūpaṃ attato samanupassati
sbs_example_3: evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako rūpasmim'pi nibbindati, vedanāya'pi nibbindati, saññāya'pi nibbindati, saṅkhāresu'pi nibbindati, viññāṇasmim'pi nibbindati.
sbs_chant_eng_3: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_4: tiṭṭhanti kho pana, bhikkhave, tatth'eva pañc'indriyāni. ath'ettha sutavato ariyasāvakassa avijjā pahīyati, vijjā uppajjati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: having stamina; strong; powerful; firm; lit. having strength quality
example_1: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu āraddhavīriyo viharati akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ upasampadāya thāmavā daḷhaparakkamo anikkhittadhuro kusalesu dhammesu.
example_2: āraddhavīriyo viharati akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya, kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ upasampadāya, thāmavā daḷhaparakkamo anikkhittadhuro kusalesu dhammesu.
sbs_example_3: thāmavā hoti yāva jīvitamaraṇapariyādānā thāmaṃ upadaṃsetā.

meaning_1: Himalayas; Himalayan mountains; lit. having snow quality
example_1:
dūre santo pakāsenti,
himavanto'va pabbato,
asant'ettha na dissanti,
rattiṃ khittā yathā sarā.
example_2:
sa ve accaruci nāgo,
himavā'v'aññe sil'uccaye,
sabbesaṃ nāganāmānaṃ,
saccanāmo anuttaro.

meaning_1: fulfilled; completed; finished; perfected; epithet of an arahant; lit. having lived quality
notes: see PED vusita for discussion on etymology
example_1: yo so, bhante, bhikkhu arahaṃ khīṇ'āsavo vusitavā katakaraṇīyo ohitabhāro anuppattasadattho parikkhīṇabhavasaṃyojano samma'd'aññāvimutto, so cha ṭhānāni adhimutto hoti
example_2: sattaṭṭhānakusalo, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tividh'ūpaparikkhī imasmiṃ dhammavinaye kevalī vusitavā uttamapuriso'ti vuccati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: iti'pi so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (SNa) vattā'ti odhunanavattā. bhikkhūnaṃ ajjhācāraṃ disvā, ajja kathessāmi, sve kathessāmī'ti kathāvavatthānaṃ na karoti, tasmiṃ tasmiṃ yeva ṭhāne ovadati anusāsatī'ti attho.
example_1: so h'āvuso, bhagavā jānaṃ jānāti, passaṃ passati, cakkhubhūto ñāṇabhūto dhammabhūto brahmabhūto, vattā pavattā, atthassa ninnetā, amatassa dātā, dhammassāmī tathāgato
example_2: āraddhavīriyo, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. vattā, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. vacanakkhamo, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. codako, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. pāpagarahī, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto.

meaning_1: beautiful; good-looking; lit. having appearance quality
example_1:
yathā'pi ruciraṃ pupphaṃ,
vaṇṇavantaṃ agandhakaṃ,
evaṃ subhāsitā vācā,
aphalā hoti akubbato.
example_2: na, bhikkhave, nevāpiko nivāpaṃ nivapati migajātānaṃ, imaṃ me nivāpaṃ nivuttaṃ migajātā paribhuñjantā dīgh'āyukā vaṇṇavanto ciraṃ dīgham'addhānaṃ yāpentū'ti.

meaning_1: who has heard about; lit. having heard quality
example_1: evaṃ abhisaddahati, ime kho te dhammā ye me pubbe sutavā ahesuṃ, ten'āhaṃ eta'r'ahi kāyena ca phusitvā viharāmi, paññāya ca ativijjha passāmī'ti.

meaning_1: having heartwood; lit. having essence quality
example_1: seyyathā'pi, āvuso, puriso sār'atthiko sāragavesī sārapariyesanaṃ caramāno mahato rukkhassa tiṭṭhato sāravato atikkamm'eva mūlaṃ, atikkamma khandhaṃ, sākhāpalāse sāraṃ pariyesitabbaṃ maññeyya
