meaning_1: inclusion (in); encompassing; grouping (of); lit. holding together
example_1: seyyathā'pi, āvuso, yāni kānici jaṅgalānaṃ pāṇānaṃ padajātāni sabbāni tāni hatthipade samodhānaṃ gacchanti, hatthipadaṃ tesaṃ aggam'akkhāyati yadidaṃ mahantattena, evam'eva kho, āvuso, ye keci kusalā dhammā sabb'ete catūsu ariyasaccesu saṅgahaṃ gacchanti.
example_2: so evaṃ pajānāti, evañ'hi kira imesaṃ pañcannaṃ upādānakkhandhānaṃ saṅgaho sannipāto samavāyo hoti.

example_1:

mūlaṃ papañcasaṅkhāya,

meaning_1: master; lord; boss; employer; lit. supporter
example_1: sa kho so, bhikkhave, paṇḍito byatto kusalo sūdo sakassa bhattu nimittaṃ uggaṇhāti, idaṃ vā me ajja bhattu sūpeyyaṃ ruccati, imassa vā abhiharati, imassa vā bahuṃ gaṇhāti, imassa vā vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati.

example_1:

tapantam'ādiccam'iv'antalikkhe'ti.

meaning_1: (of fire) worships; attends (to) looks after; lit. walks around
example_1:
yo ca vassasataṃ jantu,

yañ'ce vassasataṃ hutaṃ.
example_2: no ce allāni gomayāni āmaseyyāsi, haritāni tiṇāni āmaseyyāsi, no ce haritāni tiṇāni āmaseyyāsi, aggiṃ paricareyyāsi
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: attends (to); looks after; tends (to); lit. walks around
example_1: etañ'hi, āvuso, sāvakassa patirūpaṃ yaṃ satthāraṃ paricareyya manāpen'eva, no amanāpena. anupavajjaṃ channo bhikkhu satthaṃ āharissatī'ti, evam'etaṃ, āvuso sāriputta, dhārehī'ti.
example_2: etadaggaṃ, bhagini, pāricariyānaṃ yā mādisaṃ, sīlavantaṃ kalyāṇadhammaṃ brahmacāriṃ, etena dhammena paricareyyā'ti, methun'ūpasaṃhitena, saṅghādiseso.

example_1: brāhmaṇā, bhante, pacchābhūmakā kamaṇḍalukā sevālamālikā aggiparicārikā udak'orohakā soceyyāni paññapenti, tes'āhaṃ soceyyāni rocemī'ti
example_2: brāhmaṇā, bhante, pacchā bhūmakā kāmaṇḍalukā sevālamālikā udak'orohakā aggiparicārakā. te mataṃ kālaṅ'kataṃ uyyāpenti nāma saññāpenti nāma saggaṃ nāma okkāmenti.

yathā pacchā tathā pure,

example_1: atthi imasmiṃ kāye kesā lomā nakhā dantā taco, maṃsaṃ nhāru aṭṭhi aṭṭhimiñjaṃ vakkaṃ, hadayaṃ yakanaṃ kilomakaṃ pihakaṃ papphāsaṃ

example_1: ime kho, bhikkhave, dve sukkā dhammā lokaṃ na pāleyyuṃ, na'y'idha paññāyetha mātā'ti vā mātucchā'ti vā mātulānī'ti vā ācariyabhariyā'ti vā garūnaṃ dārā'ti vā.
example_2: etha tumhe, kālāmā, mā anussavena, mā paramparāya, mā itikirāya, mā piṭakasampadānena, mā takkahetu, mā nayahetu, mā ākāraparivitakkena, mā diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā, mā bhabbarūpatāya, mā samaṇo no garū'ti.

meaning_1: (of a talk) speaker; lit. doer; maker
example_1: tatra bhikkhu vivekaninnena cittena vivekapoṇena vivekapabbhārena vivek'aṭṭhena nekkhamm'ābhiratena añña'd'atthu uyyojanikapaṭisaṃyuttaṃ'y'eva kathaṃ kattā hoti
example_2: ko nu kho, bhikkhave, jātibhūmiyaṃ jātibhūmakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ sabrahmacārīnaṃ evaṃ sambhāvito, attanā ca app'iccho app'icchakathañ'ca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā, attanā ca santuṭṭho santuṭṭhikathañ'ca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā

example_1: abhibhuṃ abhibhūto sañjānāti, abhibhuṃ abhibhūto saññatvā abhibhuṃ maññati, abhibhusmiṃ maññati, abhibhūto maññati, abhibhuṃ me'ti maññati, abhibhuṃ abhinandati. taṃ kissa hetu? apariññātaṃ tassā'ti vadāmi.
example_2: eso hi, bhikkhu, brahmā mahābrahmā abhibhū anabhibhūto añña'd'atthudaso vasavattī issaro kattā nimmātā seṭṭho sajitā vasī pitā bhūtabhabyānaṃ.

commentary:
(VIN 2.5.2.5) seyyaṃ nāma bhisi, cimilikā uttar'attharaṇaṃ, bhūm'attharaṇaṃ, taṭṭikā, cammakhaṇḍo, nisīdanaṃ, paccattharaṇaṃ, tiṇasanthāro, paṇṇasanthāro.
(ANa) seyyā'ti mañcapallaṅkādisayanaṃ.
example_1: so ca hoti dubbaṇṇo duddasiko okoṭimako bavhābādho kāṇo vā kuṇī vā khañjo vā pakkhahato vā, na lābhī annassa pānassa vatthassa yānassa mālāgandhavilepanassa seyyā-āvasatha-padīpeyyassa.
example_2: bhavissanti, bhikkhave, anāgatam'addhānaṃ licchavī sukhumālā mudutalunahatthapādā te mudukāsu seyyāsu tūlabimbohanāsu yāvasūriy'uggamanā seyyaṃ kappissanti.
sbs_example_3: yo pana bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre seyyaṃ santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā taṃ pakkamanto n'eva uddhareyya na uddharāpeyya anāpucchā vā gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: complete comprehension (of); full understanding (of); comprehensive knowledge (of)
example_1: evaṃvādiṃ kho maṃ, bhikkhave, evam'akkhāyiṃ eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā asatā tucchā musā abhūtena abbhācikkhanti, samaṇo gotamo na kāmānaṃ pariññaṃ paññāpeti, na rūpānaṃ pariññaṃ paññāpeti, na vedanānaṃ pariññaṃ paññāpetī'ti.
example_2: katamā ca, bhikkhave, pariññā? rāgakkhayo, dosakkhayo, mohakkhayo, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, pariññā
sbs_example_3: yesaṃ pariññāya dharamāno so bhagavā evaṃ bahulaṃ sāvake vineti
sbs_example_4: sabb'upādānapariññāya dhammo cakkhuñ'ca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhuviññāṇaṃ. tiṇṇaṃ saṅgati phasso.

commentary: (SNa) sikkhā karaṇīyā'ti tividhā'pi sikkhā kātabbā. yog'ādīsu yogo'ti payogo. chando'ti kattukamyatākusalacchando. ussoḷhī'ti sabbasahaṃ adhimattavīriyaṃ.
example_1:
sv'āhaṃ idha pañca sikkhā karitvā,
paṭipajjitvā tathāgatassa dhamme,
dvepatham'agamāsiṃ coramajjhe,
te maṃ tattha vadhiṃsu bhogahetu.
example_2: parimaṇḍalaṃ nivāsessāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
sbs_example_3: tisso imā, bhikkhave, sikkhā yatth'etaṃ sabbaṃ samodhānaṃ gacchati. katamā tisso? adhisīlasikkhā, adhicittasikkhā, adhipaññāsikkhā.

example_1:
abalā naṃ balīyanti,
maddant'enaṃ parissayā,
tato naṃ dukkham'anveti,
nāvaṃ bhinnam'iv'odakaṃ.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, sāmuddikāya nāvāya vettabandhanabaddhāya vassamāsāni udake pariyādāya hem'antikena thalaṃ ukkhittāya vāt'ātapaparetāni vettabandhanāni.
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso addhānamaggappaṭipanno. so passeyya mahantaṃ udak'aṇṇavaṃ … na c'assa nāvā santāraṇī uttarasetu vā apārā pāraṃ gamanāya.
sbs_example_4: atha kho vesālikā vajjiputtakā bhikkhū taṃ sāmaṇakaṃ parikkhāraṃ ādāya nāvāya sahajātiṃ ujjaviṃsu.

example_1:
pheṇapiṇḍ'ūpamaṃ rūpaṃ,
vedanā bubbuḷ'ūpamā,
marīcik'ūpamā saññā,
saṅkhārā kadal'ūpamā,
māyā-upamañ'ca viññāṇaṃ,
desit'ādiccabandhunā.
example_2:
māyaṃ viya aggato kataṃ,
supinante'va suvaṇṇapādapaṃ,
upagacchasi andha rittakaṃ,
janamajjhe'r'iva rupparūpakaṃ.
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, māyākāro vā māyākār'antevāsī vā catumahāpathe māyaṃ vidaṃseyya.

meaning_1: name of a river; one of the five great rivers of ancient India
example_1: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, yā kāci mahānadiyo, seyyath'idaṃ gaṅgā yamunā aciravatī sarabhū mahī, tā mahāsamuddaṃ patvā jahanti purimāni nāmagottāni, mahāsamuddo'tv'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchanti
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso loṇaphalakaṃ gaṅgāya nadiyā pakkhipeyya. taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu sā gaṅgā nadī amunā loṇaphalena loṇaṃ assa apeyyā'ti?
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, ayaṃ gaṅgā nadī mahantaṃ pheṇapiṇḍaṃ āvaheyya, tam'enaṃ cakkhumā puriso passeyya nijjhāyeyya yoniso upaparikkheyya.
sbs_example_4: tena hi tvaṃ mahante mahante sāṇipasibbake kārāpetvā hiraññasuvaṇṇassa pūrāpetvā sakaṭehi nibbāhāpetvā majjhe gaṅgāya sote osādehi.

example_1:
vedanaṃ pharusaṃ jāniṃ,
sarīrassa ca bhedanaṃ,
garukaṃ v'āpi ābādhaṃ,
cittakkhepañ'ca pāpuṇe.
example_2: so tattha dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā vedanā vedeti, na ca tāva kālaṅ'karoti yāva na taṃ pāpakammaṃ byantīhoti.
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi, āvuso, balavā puriso daḷhena varattakkhaṇḍena sīse sīsaveṭhaṃ dadeyya, evam'eva kho, āvuso, adhimattā sīse sīsavedanā.

example_1: so tasmiṃ purise kāruññaṃ'y'eva upaṭṭhāpeyya, anuddayaṃ'y'eva upaṭṭhāpeyya, anukampaṃ'y'eva upaṭṭhāpeyya, aho vat'āyaṃ puriso labheyya sappāyāni bhojanāni, labheyya sappāyāni bhesajjāni, labheyya patirūpaṃ upaṭṭhākaṃ, labheyya gām'antanāyakaṃ!
example_2: yaṃ kho, bhikkhu, satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ hit'esinā anukampakena anukampaṃ upādāya, kataṃ vo taṃ mayā.
sbs_example_3: sādhu no bhante bhagavā suciraparinibbuto'pi pacchimājanata-anukampamānasā

meaning_1: gnosis; spiritual insight; enlightenment; final knowledge
example_1: katame satta phalā satt'ānisaṃsā? diṭṭh'eva dhamme paṭikacca aññaṃ ārādheti. no ce diṭṭh'eva dhamme paṭikacca aññaṃ ārādheti, atha maraṇakāle aññaṃ ārādheti.
example_2:
jhāyiṃ virajam'āsīnaṃ,
katakiccaṃ anāsavaṃ,
pāraguṃ sabbadhammānaṃ,
atthi pañhena āgamaṃ,
aññāvimokkhaṃ pabrūhi,
avijjāya pabhedanaṃ.
sbs_example_3: saddh'indriyaṃ, viriy'indriyaṃ, sat'indriyaṃ, samādh'indriyaṃ, paññ'indriyaṃ, anaññātañ'ñassāmī't'indriyaṃ, aññ'indriyaṃ, aññātāv'indriyaṃ.
sbs_example_4: tīṇ'imāni, bhikkhave, indriyāni. katamāni tīṇi? anaññātañ'ñassāmī't'indriyaṃ, aññ'indriyaṃ, aññātāv'indriyaṃ
sbs_example_5: iti kho, bhikkhave, yāvatā saññāsamāpatti tāvatā aññāpaṭivedho

example_1: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭ'āgārasālāyaṃ
example_2: āvasathapiṇḍo nāma pañcannaṃ bhojanānaṃ aññataraṃ bhojanaṃ sālāya vā maṇḍape vā rukkhamūle vā ajjhokāse vā anodissa yāva'd'attho paññatto hoti.

commentary: (VIN 1.1.2) haneyyuṃ vā'ti hatthena vā pādena vā kasāya vā vettena vā aḍḍhadaṇḍakena vā chejjāya vā haneyyuṃ.
example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, yavakalāpī cātumahāpathe nikkhittā assa. atha cha purisā āgaccheyyuṃ byābhaṅgihatthā. te yavakalāpiṃ chahi byābhaṅgīhi haneyyuṃ. evañ'hi sā, bhikkhave, yavakalāpī suhatā assa chahi byābhaṅgīhi haññamānā.
example_2: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko, pehī'ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā pacchā laṅghati, kubbaraṃ hanati, tidaṇḍaṃ bhañjati. evarūpo'pi, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko hoti. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo assadoso.
sbs_example_3:
sabbe tasanti daṇḍassa, sabbesaṃ jīvitaṃ piyaṃ.
attānaṃ upamaṃ katvā, na haneyya na ghātaye.

example_1: tena h'āvuso, upamaṃ te karissāmi. upamāya'p'idh'ekacce viññū purisā bhāsitassa atthaṃ ājānanti.
example_2: n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ lahuparivattaṃ yatha'y'idaṃ cittaṃ. yāvañ'c'idaṃ, bhikkhave, upamā'pi na sukarā yāva lahuparivattaṃ cittan'ti.

attānaṃ upamaṃ katvā, na haneyya na ghātaye.

meaning_1: name; label; concept; idea; notion; impression; representation; symbol
example_1:
tass'īdha diṭṭhe va sute mute vā,

taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ diṭṭhim'anādiyānaṃ,
ken'īdha lokasmiṃ vikappayeyya.
example_2:
diṭṭhiñ'ca nissāya anupucchamāno,
samuggahītesu pamoham'āgā,
ito ca n'āddakkhi aṇum'pi saññaṃ,
tasmā tuvaṃ momuhato dahāsi.

sbs_example_4:

example_1: siyā kho pana bhikkhave ekabhikkhussāpi kaṅkhā vā vimati vā buddhe vā dhamme vā saṅghe vā magge vā paṭipadāya vā pucchatha bhikkhave mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha
example_2: pañc'ime, bhikkhave, ānisaṃsā dhammassavane. katame pañca? assutaṃ suṇāti, sutaṃ pariyodāpeti, kaṅkhaṃ vitarati, diṭṭhiṃ ujuṃ karoti, cittam'assa pasīdati.
sbs_example_3:
na naggacariyā na jaṭā na paṅkā, n'ānāsakā thaṇḍilasāyikā vā,
rajojallaṃ ukkuṭikappadhānaṃ, sodhenti maccaṃ avitiṇṇakaṅkhaṃ.

example_1: so mah'iccho samāno vighātavā asantuṭṭho itarītara-cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajjaparikkhārena pāpikaṃ icchaṃ paṇidahati anavaññappaṭilābhāya lābhasakkārasilokappaṭilābhāya
example_2: saṭhassa sāṭheyyaṃ appahīnaṃ hoti, māyāvissa māyā appahīnā hoti, pāpicchassa pāpikā icchā appahīnā hoti, micchādiṭṭhikassa micchādiṭṭhi appahīnā hoti
sbs_example_3:
mam'eva kata'maññantu, gihīpabbajitā ubho,

commentary:
(MNa) katapāpapaṭicchādanalakkhaṇā māyā, tassa nigūhanarasā, tad'āvaraṇapaccupaṭṭhānā.
(NIDD1) māyā vuccati vañcanikā cariyā.
example_1:
dhonassa hi n'atthi kuhiñci loke,
pakappitā diṭṭhi bhav'ābhavesu,
māyañ'ca mānañ'ca pahāya dhono,
sa kena gaccheyya anūpayo so.
example_2:
yamhī na māyā vasatī na māno,
yo vītalobho amamo nirāso,
panuṇṇakodho abhinibbutatto,
so brāhmaṇo so samaṇo sa bhikkhū'ti.

example_1:
khattiyo dvipadaṃ seṭṭho,
balībaddo catuppadaṃ,
komārī seṭṭhā bhariyānaṃ,
yo ca puttāna pubbajo'ti.
example_2:
mātaraṃ kuṭikaṃ brūsi,
bhariyaṃ brūsi kulāvakaṃ,
putte santānake brūsi,
taṇhaṃ me brūsi bandhanan'ti.
sbs_example_3: ime kho hirī ca ottappañ'ca lokaṃ na pāleyyuṃ, na'y'idha paññāyetha mātā'ti vā mātucchā'ti vā mātulānī'ti vā ācariyabhariyā'ti vā garūnaṃ dārā'ti
sbs_example_4: jīvako … janaṃ ussāretvā tirokaraṇiyaṃ parikkhipitvā thambhe upanibandhitvā bhariyaṃ purato ṭhapetvā udaracchaviṃ uppāṭetvā antagaṇṭhiṃ nīharitvā bhariyāya dassesi

example_1:
katī parissayā loke,
gacchato agataṃ disaṃ,
ye bhikkhu abhisambhave,
pantamhi sayan'āsane.
example_2: tassā evam'assa, yaṃnūn'āhaṃ agatapubbañ'c'eva disaṃ gaccheyyaṃ, akhāditapubbāni ca tiṇāni khādeyyaṃ, apītapubbāni ca pānīyāni piveyyan'ti.
sbs_example_3: idha, bhikkhave, rañño bhaddo ass'ājānīyo ubhato sujāto hoti, mātito ca pitito ca. yassaṃ disāyaṃ aññe'pi bhaddā ass'ājānīyā jāyanti, tassaṃ disāyaṃ jāto hoti.

example_1: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā mallesu cārikaṃ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ yena thūṇaṃ nāma mallānaṃ brāhmaṇagāmo tadavasari.
example_2: kosambiyaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto sāmaṃ sen'āsanaṃ saṃsāmetvā pattacīvaram'ādāya anāmantetvā upaṭṭhāke anapaloketvā bhikkhusaṅghaṃ eko adutiyo cārikaṃ pakkāmi
sbs_example_3:

example_1: yaṃ, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ atītaṃ niruddhaṃ vipariṇataṃ ahosī'ti tassa saṅkhā, ahosī'ti tassa samaññā, ahosī'ti tassa paññatti, na tassa saṅkhā atthī'ti, na tassa saṅkhā bhavissatī'ti.
example_2: ajito'ti tassa brāhmaṇassa nāmaṃ saṅkhā samaññā paññatti vohāro nāmaṃ nāmakammaṃ nāmadheyyaṃ nirutti byañjanaṃ abhilāpo'ti, icc'āyasmā ajito.
sbs_example_3:
gaṅgā yamunā aciravatī sarabhū mahī,

commentary:
(DNa) sahabyatan'ti sahabhāvaṃ
(ANa) sahabyataṃ upapajjatī'ti sahabhāvaṃ gacchati, tattha nibbattatī'ti attho.
example_1: yo so yodh'ājīvo saṅgāme ussahati vāyamati, tam'enaṃ ussahantaṃ vāyamantaṃ pare hananti pariyāpādenti, so kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā parajitānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjatī'ti.
example_2: so kāyena sucaritaṃ caritvā vācāya sucaritaṃ caritvā manasā sucaritaṃ caritvā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjeyya devānaṃ tāvatiṃsānaṃ sahabyataṃ.
sbs_example_3: evam'eva kho evaṃ bhāvitāya mettāya cetovimuttiyā yaṃ pamāṇakataṃ kammaṃ na taṃ tatr'āvasissati, na taṃ tatr'āvatiṭṭhati. ayam'pi kho brahmānaṃ sahabyatāya maggo.

meaning_1: sleep; rest; sleeping posture; lit. bed
example_1: petaseyyā kāmabhogiseyyā sīhaseyyā tathāgataseyyā
example_2: bhavissanti, bhikkhave, anāgatam'addhānaṃ licchavī sukhumālā mudutalunahatthapādā te mudukāsu seyyāsu tūlabimbohanāsu yāvasūriy'uggamanā seyyaṃ kappissanti.

meaning_1: name of the Buddha's chief female disciple, foremost female donor to the Saṅgha; lit. April-May
commentary: (AN 1.259) etad'aggaṃ, bhikkhave, mama sāvikānaṃ upāsikānaṃ dāyikānaṃ yadidaṃ visākhā migāramātā.
example_1: idha, visākhe, mātugāmo susaṃvihitakamm'anto hoti, saṅgahitaparijano, bhattu manāpaṃ carati, sambhataṃ anurakkhati.
example_2: atha satthā navahi māsehi cārikaṃ caritvā puna sāvatthiṃ agamāsi. visākhāya-api pāsāde kammaṃ navahi māsehi niṭṭhitaṃ
sbs_example_3: catūhi kho, visākhe, dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo idhalokavijayāya paṭipanno hoti, ayaṃsa loko āraddho hoti. katamehi catūhi?

example_2: tassa evaṃ yoniso manasikaroto tīṇi saṃyojanāni pahīyanti, sakkāyadiṭṭhi, vicikicchā, sīlabbataparāmāso. ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, āsavā dassanā pahātabbā
sbs_example_3: vicikicchaṃ pahāya tiṇṇavicikiccho viharati akathaṃkathī kusalesu dhammesu, vicikicchāya cittaṃ parisodheti
sbs_example_4: ayoniso, bhikkhave, manasi karoto anuppannā c'eva vicikicchā uppajjati uppannā ca vicikicchā bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati

meaning_1: end; finish; conclusion; perfection; lit. stand down
example_1:
niṭṭhaṅ'gato asantāsī,
vītataṇho anaṅgaṇo,
acchindi bhavasallāni,
antimo'yaṃ samussayo.
example_2: accantaniṭṭho accantayogakkhemī accantabrahmacārī accantapariyosāno seṭṭho devamanussānan'ti

meaning_1: (romantic) devotion; love; lit. supporting the heart
example_1:

meaning_1: would think; could imagine; would presume

example_1: atha kho ambapālī gaṇikā bhagavato adhivāsanaṃ viditvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
example_2: atha kho nakulapitā gahapati bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā yen'āyasmā sāriputto ten'upasaṅkami

meaning_1: (in debate) procedure; mode of conduct; rules of engagement
commentary: (ANa) paṭipadāya saṇṭhātī'ti gehe nisīdāpetvā yāgukhajjak'ādīni datvā yāva bhattaṃ niṭṭhāti, tasmiṃ antare nisinno pañhaṃ pucchati. sappi'ādīni bhesajjāni aṭṭhavidhāni pānakāni vatthacchādanamālāgandh'ādīni vā ādāya vihāraṃ gantvā tāni datvā divāṭṭhānaṃ pavisitvā okāsaṃ kāretvā pañhaṃ pucchati. evañ'hi vattaṃ ñatvā pucchanto paṭipadāya saṇṭhāti nāma.
example_1: sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno ṭhān'āṭhāne na saṇṭhāti parikappe na saṇṭhāti aññātavāde na saṇṭhāti paṭipadāya na saṇṭhāti, evaṃ sant'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo akaccho hoti.

example_1:
itthī malaṃ brahmacariyassa,
etth'āyaṃ sajjate pajā,
tapo ca brahmacariyañ'ca,

example_2:
ākāse'va padaṃ n'atthi, samaṇo n'atthi bāhire,

example_1: yo pana bhikkhu sabhojane kule anupakhajja nisajjaṃ kappeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
example_2: yo pana bhikkhu mātugāmena saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho paṭicchanne āsane, alaṃkammaniye, nisajjaṃ kappeyya
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: aim; goal; conclusion; lit. stand down
example_1:
piyā su lokasmiṃ kutonidānā,
ye c'āpi lobhā vicaranti loke,
āsā ca niṭṭhā ca kutonidānā,
ye samparāyāya narassa honti.
example_2: kiṃ pan'āvuso, ekā niṭṭhā, udāhu puthu niṭṭhā'ti? sammā byākaramānā, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā evaṃ byākareyyuṃ, ek'āvuso, niṭṭhā, na puthu niṭṭhā'ti.

example_1:
pāṇimhi ce vaṇo n'āssa,
hareyya pāṇinā visaṃ,
n'ābbaṇaṃ visam'anveti,
n'atthi pāpaṃ akubbato.
example_2: pacchimāyaṃ, bhante, bhittiyan'ti. pacchimā ce, bhikkhave, bhitti n'āssa kv'āssa patiṭṭhitā'ti? pathaviyaṃ, bhante'ti. pathavī ce, bhikkhave, n'āssa kv'āssa patiṭṭhitā'ti? āpasmiṃ, bhante'ti. āpo ce, bhikkhave, n'āssa kv'āssa patiṭṭhitā'ti? appatiṭṭhitā, bhante'ti.

commentary: (SNa) sīsaveṭhaṃ dadeyyā'ti sīse veṭhanaṃ sīsaveṭhaṃ, tañ'ca dadeyya.
example_1: seyyathā'pi, āvuso, balavā puriso daḷhena varattakkhaṇḍena sīse sīsaveṭhaṃ dadeyya, evam'eva kho, āvuso, adhimattā sīse sīsavedanā.

meaning_1: suttas comprised of verse; one of the nine kinds of suttas; lit. song
commentary: (MNa) dhammapadaṃ, theragāthā, therigāthā, suttanipāte nosuttanāmikā suddhikagāthā ca gāthā'ti veditabbā.
example_1: idha, bhikkhave, ekacce moghapurisā dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇanti, suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ.

example_1:
yutto kathāyaṃ parisāya majjhe,

apāhatasmiṃ pana maṅku hoti,
nindāya so kuppati randhamesī.
example_2:
okaṃ pahāya aniketasārī, gāme akubbaṃ muni santhavāni,

commentary:

(MNa) parasampattikhīyanalakkhaṇā issā, tassā akkhamanalakkhaṇā vā, tattha anabhiratirasā, tato vimukhabhāvapaccupaṭṭhānā.

atītayobbano poso,
āneti timbarutthaniṃ,

meaning_1: psychic power; supernormal ability; lit. complete knowledge
example_1: yassa kassaci ca abhiññāsacchikaraṇīyassa dhammassa cittaṃ abhininnāmeti abhiññāsacchikiriyāya tatra tatr'eva sakkhibhabbataṃ pāpuṇāti sati sati āyatane.
example_2: yassa yassa ca abhiññā sacchikaraṇīyassa dhammassa cittaṃ abhininnāmeti abhiññā sacchikiriyāya tatra tatr'eva sakkhibhabbataṃ pāpuṇāti sati satiāyatane.

meaning_1: to gnosis; to spiritual insight; to enlightenment; to final knowledge
commentary: (MNa) na aññā'ti jānan'atthāya cittaṃ na upaṭṭhapenti.
example_1: tassa sāvakā na sussūsanti, na sotaṃ odahanti, na aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhapenti, vokkamma ca satthusāsanā vattanti.

example_1: vuddhi h'esā, bhagini, ariyassa vinaye yo accayaṃ accayato disvā yathādhammaṃ paṭikaroti āyatiṃ saṃvaraṃ āpajjatī'ti.
example_2: appamattikā esā, bhikkhave, vuddhi yadidaṃ bhogavuddhi. etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, vuddhīnaṃ yadidaṃ paññāvuddhi. tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, paññāvuddhiyā vaddhissāmā'ti.
sbs_example_3: yāvakīvañ'ca bhikkhave bhikkhū āraññakesu sen'āsanesu sāpekkhā bhavissanti, vuddhi'y'eva pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni
sbs_example_4: so ca kho n'ev'attabyābādhāya saṃvattati, na parabyābādhāya saṃvattati, na ubhayabyābādhāya saṃvattati, paññāvuddhiko avighātapakkhiko nibbānasaṃvattaniko'.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: appamattikā esā, bhikkhave, parihāni yadidaṃ bhogaparihāni. etaṃ patikiṭṭhaṃ, bhikkhave, parihānīnaṃ yadidaṃ paññāparihānī'ti.
example_2: tato tuyhaṃ, bhikkhu, yā ratti vā divaso vā āgamissati vuddhi'y'eva pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu, no parihānī'ti.
sbs_example_3: yāvakīvañ'ca bhikkhave bhikkhū abhiṇhaṃ sannipātā bhavissanti sannipātabahulā, vuddhi'y'eva pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni
sbs_example_4: mā yam'pi'ssa taṃ saddhāmattakaṃ pemamattakaṃ tamhā'pi parihāyī'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: atha kho bāhiyo dārucīriyo taramānarūpo jetavanā nikkhamitvā sāvatthiṃ pavisitvā addasa bhagavantaṃ sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya carantaṃ
example_2: atha kho ambaṭṭho māṇavo yena so vihāro saṃvutadvāro, tena appasaddo upasaṅkamitvā ataramāno āḷindaṃ pavisitvā ukkāsitvā aggaḷaṃ ākoṭesi. vivari bhagavā dvāraṃ.
sbs_example_3: yathā, mahārāja, rañño bhaṇḍ'āgāriko bhaṇḍ'āgāraṃ pavisitvā nīlapītalohit'odātamañjiṭṭhāni rājabhogāni rūpāni passitvā sañjānāti. evaṃ kho, mahārāja, sañjānanalakkhaṇā saññā'ti
sbs_example_4: mataṃ me jīvitā seyyaṃ, tasmā araññaṃ pavisitvā ubbandhitvā marissāmī'ti araññaṃ gato maraṇabhayatajjito paṭinivatti.

meaning_1: (gram) here; in this regard; in this case
example_1: sare'ty'adhikāro. pana ime pana ime-ti-iha sarā lopaṃ itv'eva.
example_2: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, vīriyaṃ ārabhatha appattassa pattiyā, anadhigatassa adhigamāya, asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.
sbs_example_3: veditabbam'etaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā, abhāvitā me asubhasaññā, n'atthi me pubben'āparaṃ viseso, appattaṃ me bhāvanābalan'ti. iti-iha tattha sampajāno hoti.

example_1:
bhante nāgasena, bhāsitam'p'etaṃ tathāgatena, abyāvaṭā tumhe, ānanda, hotha tathāgatassa sarīrapūjāyā'ti. puna ca bhaṇitaṃ,
pūjetha naṃ pūjaniyassa dhātuṃ,
evaṃ karā saggamito gamissathā'ti.
example_2: rājā sumanaṃ upasaṅkamitvā pucchi kuto dāni bhante dhātuyo lacchāmāti
sbs_example_3: vandāmi cetiyaṃ sabbaṃ ‒ sabbaṭhānesu patiṭṭhitaṃ, sārīrikadhātumahābodhiṃ ‒ buddharūpaṃ sakalaṃ sadā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: having known; having perceived; having understood
commentary: (NIDD2 2.8) yaṃ viditvā sato caran'ti yaṃ viditaṃ katvā tulayitvā tīrayitvā vibhāvayitvā vibhūtaṃ katvā.
example_1: ayaṃ samaṇo gotamo āgacchati. appasaddakāmo kho so āyasmā appasaddassa vaṇṇavādī. app'eva nāma appasaddaṃ parisaṃ viditvā upasaṅkamitabbaṃ maññeyyā'ti. evaṃ vutte te paribbājakā tuṇhī ahesuṃ.
example_2:
kittayissāmi te dhammaṃ,
diṭṭhe dhamme anītihaṃ,
yaṃ viditvā sato caraṃ,
tare loke visattikaṃ.
sbs_example_3: uposathakammassa pattakallattaṃ viditvā idāni kariyamāno uposatho saṅghena anumānetabbo.
sbs_example_4:
kumbh'ūpamaṃ kāyam'imaṃ viditvā, nagar'ūpamaṃ cittam'idaṃ ṭhapetvā.
yodhetha māraṃ paññ'āvudhena, jitañ'ca rakkhe anivesano siyā.
sbs_example_5: saṃvissattho kho my'āyaṃ gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā'ti, atha naṃ rahogataṃ viditvā tiṇhena satthena jīvitā voropeyya.

meaning_1: having bowed down (to); having paid high respect (to)
example_1: atha kho ambapālī gaṇikā bhagavato adhivāsanaṃ viditvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
example_2: atha kho therā bhikkhū yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu. upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
sbs_example_3: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhāsi. ekam'antaṃ ṭhitā kho sā devatā bhagavantaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: ayaṃ kho, bhikkhave, viseso ayaṃ adhippayāso idaṃ nānākaraṇaṃ sutavato ariyasāvakassa assutavatā puthujjanena, yadidaṃ gatiyā upapattiyā sati.
example_2: yāvatā, bho, akatakalyāṇānaṃ akatakusalānaṃ akatabhīruttāṇānaṃ katapāpānaṃ kataluddānaṃ katakibbisānaṃ gati taṃ gatiṃ pecca gacchāmī'ti.
sbs_example_3: ṭhānam'etaṃ vijjati, yaṃ dvinnaṃ gatīnaṃ aññataraṃ gatiṃ gaccheyya, nirayaṃ vā, tiracchānayoniṃ vā.

meaning_1: memory; remembering; recollection; keeping in mind
example_1: atthi, bhikkhave, dhammā kāyena sacchikaraṇīyā, atthi, bhikkhave, dhammā satiyā sacchikaraṇīyā, atthi, bhikkhave, dhammā cakkhunā sacchikaraṇīyā, atthi, bhikkhave, dhammā paññāya sacchikaraṇīyā.
example_2: katame ca, bhikkhave, dhammā satiyā sacchikaraṇīyā? pubbenivāso, bhikkhave, satiyā sacchikaraṇīyo.
sbs_example_3:
tiṭṭhañ'caraṃ, nisinno vā, sayāno vā, yāvat'assa vigatamiddho,

example_1:
puriso aṅkusam'ādāya,
dehi pādan'ti yācati,
nāgo pasārayī pādaṃ,
puriso nāgam'āruhi.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, aggivessana, allaṃ kaṭṭhaṃ sasnehaṃ udake nikkhittaṃ. atha puriso āgaccheyya uttar'āraṇiṃ ādāya, aggiṃ abhinibbattessāmi, tejo pātukarissāmī'ti.
sbs_example_3: tena kho pana samayena satta ca jaṭilā satta ca nigaṇṭhā satta ca acelakā satta ca ekasāṭakā satta ca paribbājakā parūḷhakacchanakhalomā khārivividham'ādāya bhagavato avidūre atikkamanti.

meaning_1: having gone out (from); having exited; having left; lit. having gone out
example_1: atha kho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ nagaramhā nikkhamitvā addasa bāhiyaṃ dārucīriyaṃ kālaṅ'kataṃ.
example_2: atha kho, āvuso, rājā pasenadi kosalo sāvatthiyā nikkhamitvā antepuradvārā paṭhamaṃ rathavinītaṃ abhiruheyya, paṭhamena rathavinītena dutiyaṃ rathavinītaṃ pāpuṇeyya, paṭhamaṃ rathavinītaṃ vissajjeyya dutiyaṃ rathavinītaṃ abhiruheyya.

example_2: andhabālapitaraṃ nissāya evarūpaṃ buddhaṃ upasaṅkamitvā kāyaveyyāvaṭikaṃ vā kātuṃ dānaṃ vā dātuṃ dhammaṃ vā sotuṃ n'ālatthaṃ, idāni me hatthā'pi anadhipateyyā, aññaṃ kattabbaṃ n'atthī'ti manam'eva pasādesi.

example_1:

asādhu hutvā puna sādhu honti.

sbs_example_3: so sace ākaṅkhati, anekavihitaṃ iddhividhaṃ paccanubhaveyyaṃ, eko'pi hutvā bahudhā assaṃ, bahudhā'pi hutvā eko assaṃ, āvibhāvaṃ tirobhāvaṃ

meaning_1: from there; from that; from then
example_1:
manopubbaṅ'gamā dhammā,
manoseṭṭhā manomayā,
manasā ce paduṭṭhena,
bhāsati vā karoti vā,
tato naṃ dukkham'anveti,
cakkaṃva vahato padaṃ.
example_2: atha kho āyasmā rāhulo, ko n'ajja bhagavatā sammukhā ovādena ovadito gāmaṃ piṇḍāya pavisissatī'ti tato paṭinivattitvā aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle nisīdi
sbs_example_3: so tatonidānaṃ labhetha pāmojjaṃ, adhigaccheyya somanassaṃ
sbs_example_4: no ce te evaṃ viharato taṃ middhaṃ pahīyetha tato tvaṃ, moggallāna, ubho kaṇṇasotāni āviñjeyyāsi pāṇinā gattāni anumajjeyyāsi

example_1:
asinā hanti attānaṃ,
visaṃ khādanti mucchitā,
rajjuyā bajjha mīyanti,
pabbatām'api kandare.
example_2: daḷhāya rajjuyā bandhitvā daḷhe khīle vā thambhe vā upanibandheyya. atha kho te, bhikkhave, chappāṇakā nānāvisayā nānāgocarā sakaṃ sakaṃ gocaravisayaṃ āviñcheyyuṃ.
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso chappāṇake gahetvā nānāvisaye nānāgocare daḷhāya rajjuyā bandheyya.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
haṃs'ādiccapathe yanti,
ākāse yanti iddhiyā,
nīyanti dhīrā lokamhā,
jetvā māraṃ savāhiniṃ.
example_2:
mama saṅkappam'aññāya,
satthā loke anuttaro,
manomayena kāyena,
iddhiyā upasaṅkami.
sbs_example_3: seyyath'īdaṃ, cattāro satipaṭṭhānā cattāro sammappadhānā cattāro iddhipādā pañc'indriyāni pañca balāni satta bojjh'aṅgā ariyo aṭṭh'aṅgiko maggo.
sbs_example_4: so sace ākaṅkhati, anekavihitaṃ iddhividhaṃ paccanubhaveyyaṃ, eko'pi hutvā bahudhā assaṃ, bahudhā'pi hutvā eko assaṃ, āvibhāvaṃ tirobhāvaṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: having arrived; having come to; having returned
example_1: puratthimāya disāya āgantvā sīghaṃ dūtayugaṃ taṃ dovārikaṃ evaṃ vadeyya, kahaṃ, bho purisa, imassa nagarassa nagarassāmī'ti? so evaṃ vadeyya, eso, bhante, majjhe siṅghāṭake nisinno'ti.
example_2: bhikkhussa ṭhit'okāsaṃ vā nisinn'okāsaṃ vā nipann'okāsaṃ vā āgantvā mantentaṃ ukkāsitabbaṃ, vijānāpetabbaṃ, no ce ukkāseyya vā vijānāpeyya vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
sbs_example_3: santi, bhikkhave, bhikkhū imasmiṃ bhikkhusaṅghe tiṇṇaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā rāgadosamohānaṃ tanuttā sakadāgāmino saki'd'eva imaṃ lokaṃ āgantvā dukkhassantaṃ karissanti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
yathā divā tathā rattiṃ,
yathā rattiṃ tathā divā,
abhibhuyya disā sabbā,
appamāṇasamādhinā.
example_2:
bhagavā hi kāme abhibhuyya iriyati,
ādicco'va pathaviṃ tejī tejasā,
parittapaññassa me bhūripañña,
ācikkha dhammaṃ yam'ahaṃ vijaññaṃ,
jātijarāya idha vippahānaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
sace labhetha nipakaṃ sahāyaṃ, saddhiṃcaraṃ sādhuvihāridhīraṃ,
abhibhuyya sabbāni parissayāni, careyya ten'attamano satīmā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: sabbaṃ dhammaṃ pariññāya yaṃkiñci vedanaṃ vediyati sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkham'asukhaṃ vā so tāsu vedanāsu anicc'ānupassī viharati
example_2:
nāhaṃ sabbe samaṇabrāhmaṇāse,
jātijarāya nivutā'ti brūmi,
ye s'īdha diṭṭhaṃ'va sutaṃ mutaṃ vā,
sīlabbataṃ v'āpi pahāya sabbaṃ,
anekarūpam'pi pahāya sabbaṃ,
taṇhaṃ pariññāya anāsavāse,
te ve narā oghatiṇṇā'ti brūmi.
sbs_example_3:
sa ve samm'addaso bhikkhu, parijānāti vedanā.
so vedanā pariññāya, diṭṭhe dhamme anāsavo.
kāyassa bhedā dhammaṭṭho, saṅkhyaṃ n'opeti vedagū'ti.
sbs_example_4:
ubhosu antesu vineyya chandaṃ, phassaṃ pariññāya anānugiddho,
yad'attagarahī tad'akubbamāno, na lippatī diṭṭhasutesu dhīro.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
yo ve parakulaṃ gantvā,
bhutvāna sucibhojanaṃ,
āgataṃ nappaṭipūjeti,
taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.
example_2:
vīriyaṃ me dhuradhorayhaṃ,
yogakkhem'ādhivāhanaṃ,
gacchati anivattantaṃ,
yattha gantvā na socati.
sbs_example_3: s'āhaṃ nūna ito gantvā, yoniṃ laddhāna mānusiṃ, vadaññū sīlasampannā, kāhāmi kusalaṃ bahuṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: sense of shame; modesty; conscience; sense of right and wrong; scruples
commentary: (DHPa) api cettha ajjhattasamuṭṭhānā hirī, bahiddhāsamuṭṭhānaṃ ottappaṃ.
example_1: dve'me, bhikkhave, dhammā sukkā lokaṃ pālenti. katame dve? hirī ca ottappañ'ca.
example_2:
saddhā bījaṃ tapo vuṭṭhi,
paññā me yuganaṅgalaṃ,
hirī īsā mano yottaṃ,
sati me phālapācanaṃ.
sbs_example_3: paṭisaṅkhā yoniso cīvaraṃ paṭisevāmi yāva'd'eva sītassa paṭighātāya uṇhassa paṭighātāya ḍaṃsamakasavāt'ātapasiriṃsapasamphassānaṃ paṭighātāya yāva'd'eva hirikopīnapaṭicchādan'atthaṃ
sbs_example_4:
hirīnisedho puriso, koci lokasmi vijjati,
yo nindaṃ apabodheti, asso bhadro kasām'iva.
sbs_example_5: ime kho hirī ca ottappañ'ca lokaṃ na pāleyyuṃ, na'y'idha paññāyetha mātā'ti vā mātucchā'ti vā mātulānī'ti vā ācariyabhariyā'ti vā garūnaṃ dārā'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
yoniso manasikāro,
dhammo sekhassa bhikkhuno,
n'atth'añño evaṃ bahukāro,
uttam'atthassa pattiyā,
yoniso padahaṃ bhikkhu,
khayaṃ dukkhassa pāpuṇe'ti.
example_2:
evaṃ vihārī ātāpī,
ahorattam'atandito,
bhāvayaṃ kusalaṃ dhammaṃ,
yogakkhemassa pattiyā.
sbs_example_3: na, bhikkhave, hīnena aggassa patti hoti. aggena ca kho, bhikkhave, aggassa patti hoti.
sbs_example_4:
ye suppayuttā manasā daḷhena, nikkāmino gotamasāsanamhi.
te pattipattā amataṃ vigayha, laddhā mudhā nibbutiṃ bhuñjamānā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: dīgharattaṃ kho maṃ tvaṃ, devi, iṭṭhehi kantehi piyehi manāpehi samudācarittha, atha ca pana maṃ tvaṃ pacchime kāle aniṭṭhehi akantehi appiyehi amanāpehi samudācarasī'ti
example_2: tena kho pana samayena rājā pasenadi kosalo mallikāya deviyā saddhiṃ uparipāsādavaragato hoti. atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo mallikaṃ deviṃ etadavoca, atthi nu kho te, mallike, koc'añño attanā piyataro'ti?
sbs_example_3: na me dessā ubho puttā, maddī devī na dessiyā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: pāṇ'ātipātā veramaṇī kusalaṃ
example_2: evam'eva kho, cunda, vihiṃsakassa purisapuggalassa avihiṃsā hoti parikkamanāya, pāṇ'ātipātissa purisapuggalassa pāṇ'ātipātā veramaṇī hoti parikkamanāya, adinn'ādāyissa purisapuggalassa adinn'ādānā veramaṇī hoti parikkamanāya
sbs_example_3: musāvādā veramaṇī, pisuṇāya vācāya veramaṇī, pharusāya vācāya veramaṇī, samphappalāpā veramaṇī, ayaṃ vuccati bhikkhave sammāvācā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (SNa) rāgo'tiādīni lobhass'eva nāmāni. so hi rañjanavasena rāgo, nandanavasena nandī, taṇhāyanavasena taṇhā'ti vuccati.
example_1: cakkhusmiṃ, āvuso, rūpe cakkhuviññāṇe cakkhuviññāṇaviññātabbesu dhammesu yo chando yo rāgo yā nandī yā taṇhā ye ca upāy'ūpādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhān'ābhinives'ānusayā tesaṃ khayā virāgā nirodhā cāgā paṭinissaggā vimuttaṃ me cittan'ti pajānāmi.
example_2:
kacci tvaṃ anagho bhikkhu,
kacci nandī na vijjati,
kacci taṃ ekam'āsīnaṃ,
aratī n'ābhikīratī'ti.
sbs_example_3: kathañ'ca, gahapati, anokasārī hoti? rūpadhātuyā kho, gahapati, yo chando yo rāgo yā nandī yā taṇhā ye upay'upādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhān'ābhinives'ānusayā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: idha, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako hirīmā hoti, hirīyati kāyaduccaritena vacīduccaritena manoduccaritena, hirīyati pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ samāpattiyā. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, hirīdhanaṃ
example_2: jegucchī hoti kāyaduccaritena vacīduccaritena manoduccaritena, jegucchī hoti anekavihitānaṃ pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ samāpattiyā.
sbs_example_3: idha, brāhmaṇa, ekacco samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā sammā brahmacārī paṭijānamāno na h'eva kho mātugāmena saddhiṃ dvayaṃdvayasamāpattiṃ samāpajjati
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: so sabbaso rāg'ānusayaṃ pahāya paṭigh'ānusayaṃ paṭivinodetvā asmī'ti diṭṭhimān'ānusayaṃ samūhanitvā avijjaṃ pahāya vijjaṃ uppādetvā diṭṭh'eva dhamme dukkhass'antakaro hoti
example_2:
yo nīvaraṇe pahāya pañca,
anigho tiṇṇakathaṃkatho visallo,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.
sbs_example_3: idha bhikkhave ariyasāvako micchāājīvaṃ pahāya sammāājīvena jīvitaṃ kappeti, ayaṃ vuccati bhikkhave sammāājīvo.
sbs_example_4: byāpādapadosaṃ pahāya abyāpannacitto viharati sabbapāṇabhūtahit'ānukampī, byāpādapadosā cittaṃ parisodheti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: app'eva nāma mayam'pi āyasmantānaṃ kiñcimattaṃ anupadajjeyyāmā'ti. evañ'ca so bhikkhu vatvā kiñcimattaṃ anupadajjeyya antamaso piṇḍapātamattam'pi, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
example_2: citto'pi kho gahapati sesakaṃ vissajjethā'ti vatvā there bhikkhū piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandhi.
sbs_example_3:
idaṃ vatvā sālavane, samaṇo bhāvit'indriyo.
brāhmaṇo parinibbāyī, isi khīṇapunabbhavo'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: mātā'pi puttena vivadati, putto'pi mātarā vivadati, pitā'pi puttena vivadati, putto'pi pitarā vivadati, bhātā'pi bhātarā vivadati, bhātā'pi bhaginiyā vivadati, bhaginī'pi bhātarā vivadati, sahāyo'pi sahāyena vivadati.
example_2: bhūtapubbāhaṃ, pāpima, dūsī nāma māro ahosiṃ, tassa me kāḷī nāma bhaginī. tassā tvaṃ putto. so me tvaṃ bhāgineyyo ahosi. tena kho pana, pāpima, samayena kakusandho bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho loke uppanno hoti.
sbs_example_3: etad'aggaṃ, bhagini, pāricariyānaṃ yā mādisaṃ, sīlavantaṃ kalyāṇadhammaṃ brahmacāriṃ, etena dhammena paricareyyā'ti, methun'ūpasaṃhitena, saṅghādiseso.
sbs_example_4: ye vā pan'assa te honti atthakāmā hitakāmā phāsukakāmā yogakkhemakāmā mātā vā pitā vā bhātā vā bhaginī vā mittā vā amaccā vā ñātisālohitā vā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: having approved (of); having applauded; having been pleased (with)
example_1: atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmato mahākaccānassa bhāsitaṃ abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu
example_2: atha kho nakulapitā gahapati bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā yen'āyasmā sāriputto ten'upasaṅkami
sbs_example_3: ekasmiṃ samaye nātho moggallānañ'ca kassapaṃ gilāne dukkhite disvā, bojjh'aṅge satta desayi. te ca taṃ abhinanditvā rogā mucciṃsu taṅ'khaṇe.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: state of misery; bad destination; hell; lit. going badly
example_1: taṃ kissa hetu? aparisuddhattā, bhikkhave, vatthassa. evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, citte saṃkiliṭṭhe, duggati pāṭikaṅkhā.
example_2:
ayasā'va malaṃ samuṭṭhitaṃ,
tat'uṭṭhāya tam'eva khādati,
evaṃ atidhonacārinaṃ,
sakakammāni nayanti duggatiṃ.
sbs_example_3:
dhammo have rakkhati dhammacāriṃ,
dhammo suciṇṇo sukham'āvahati.
es'ānisaṃso dhamme suciṇṇe,
na duggatiṃ gacchati dhammacārī.
sbs_example_4:
alajjitāye lajjanti,
lajjitāye na lajjare,
micchādiṭṭhisamādānā,
sattā gacchanti duggatiṃ.
sbs_example_5: micchādiṭṭhikammasamādānā, te kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapannā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, ārabbhadhātuyā sati ārabbhavanto sattā paññāyanti, ayaṃ sattānaṃ attakāro ayaṃ parakāro.
example_2: nāhaṃ aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yena anuppannaṃ vā thinamiddhaṃ n'uppajjati uppannaṃ vā thinamiddhaṃ pahīyati yatha'y'idaṃ ārambhadhātu nikkamadhātu parakkamadhātu.
sbs_example_3: cakkhu'ndriyassa sot'indriyassa ghān'indriyassa jivh'indriyassa kāy'indriyassa. atthi, bhikkhave, mano, atthi dhammā, atthi avijjādhātu.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: having given; having offered; having donated
example_1: atha kho pāyāsi rājañño uttaraṃ māṇavaṃ āmantāpetvā etadavoca, saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, tāta uttara, dānaṃ datvā evaṃ anuddisasi, imin'āhaṃ dānena pāyāsiṃ rājaññam'eva imasmiṃ loke samāgacchiṃ, mā parasmin'ti
example_2: sace yāgu hoti, bhājanaṃ dhovitvā yāgu upanāmetabbā. yāguṃ pītassa udakaṃ datvā bhājanaṃ paṭiggahetvā nīcaṃ katvā sādhukaṃ appaṭighaṃsantena dhovitvā paṭisāmetabbaṃ.
sbs_example_3: āyudo balado dhīro, vaṇṇado paṭibhāṇado. sukhassa dātā medhāvī, sukhaṃ so adhigacchati. āyuṃ datvā balaṃ vaṇṇaṃ, sukhañ'ca paṭibhānakaṃ, dīgh'āyu yasavā hoti, yattha yatth'ūpapajjatī'ti.
sbs_example_4: yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhussa sāmaṃ cīvaraṃ datvā, kupito anattamano, acchindeyya vā acchindāpeyya vā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
yo dhammaladdhassa dadāti dānaṃ,
uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatassa jantu,
atikkamma so vetaraṇiṃ yamassa,
dibbāni ṭhānāni upeti macco'ti.
example_2: ubhatobhāgavimutto idha ekacco puggalo ye te santā vimokkhā atikkamma rūpe āruppā te kāyena phusitvā viharati paññāya cassa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇā honti.
sbs_example_3: ayañ'ca dasasahassī lokadhātu saṅkam'pi sampakam'pi sampavedhi, appamāṇo ca uḷāro obhāso loke pāturahosi atikkamma-eva devānaṃ devānubhāvan'ti.
sbs_chant_eng_3: The Discourse on  Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma

meaning_1: directly knowing; understanding experientially; lit. completely knowing
example_1: so sabbaṃ dhammaṃ abhijānāti, sabbaṃ dhammaṃ abhiññāya sabbaṃ dhammaṃ parijānāti
example_2:
ākiñcaññasambhavaṃ ñatvā,
nandī saṃyojanaṃ iti,
evam'etaṃ abhiññāya,
tato tattha vipassati,
etaṃ ñāṇaṃ tathaṃ tassa,
brāhmaṇassa vusīmato'ti.
sbs_example_3:
atta'd'atthaṃ par'atthena, bahunā'pi na hāpaye,
atta'd'attham'abhiññāya, sadatthapasuto siyā.

example_1:
api dibbesu kāmesu,
ratiṃ so n'ādhigacchati,
taṇhakkhayarato hoti,
sammāsambuddhasāvako.
example_2:
ratiyā jāyatī soko,
ratiyā jāyatī bhayaṃ,
ratiyā vippamuttassa,
n'atthi soko kuto bhayaṃ.
sbs_example_3: amatamhi vijjamāne, kiṃ tava pañcakaṭukena pītena, sabbā hi kāmaratiyo, kaṭukatarā pañcakaṭukena.

example_1:
na taṃ kammaṃ kataṃ sādhu,
yaṃ katvā anutappati,
yassa assumukho rodaṃ,
vipākaṃ paṭisevati.
example_2: katvā'pi te, rāhula, kāyena kammaṃ tadeva te kāyakammaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ, yaṃ nu kho ahaṃ idaṃ kāyena kammaṃ akāsiṃ idaṃ me kāyakammaṃ attabyābādhāya'pi saṃvattati
sbs_example_3:
akataṃ dukkaṭaṃ seyyo, pacchā tappati dukkaṭaṃ,

meaning_1: giving up; disavowing; renouncing; rejecting; lit. speaking against
example_1: so kupito anattamano sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvattati. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ūmibhayassa bhīto sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvatto.
example_2: so rāg'ānuddhaṃsena cittena maraṇaṃ vā nigacchati maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkhaṃ. maraṇañ'h'etaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyassa vinaye yo sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvattati.
sbs_example_3: aham'etaṃ sabbaṃ paccakkhāya aññaṃ sabbaṃ paññāpessāmī'ti, tassa vācāvatthukam'ev'assa
sbs_example_4: maraṇañ'h'etaṃ, sunakkhatta, ariyassa vinaye yo sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvattati, maraṇamattañ'h'etaṃ, sunakkhatta, dukkhaṃ yaṃ aññataraṃ saṃkiliṭṭhaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.

example_1: yato ca kho so, bhikkhave, bahusampatto hoti, atha taṃ dvāraṃ pidhīyati.
example_2: yato kho, kassapa, bhikkhu averaṃ abyāpajjaṃ mettacittaṃ bhāveti, āsavānañ'ca khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭh'eva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
sbs_example_3: yato ca kho me, bhikkhave, imesu catūsu ariyasaccesu evaṃ tiparivaṭṭaṃ dvādas'ākāraṃ yathābhūtaṃ ñāṇadassanaṃ suvisuddhaṃ ahosi

meaning_1: having asked (for); having requested; having begged (for); lit. having caused to know
example_1: yo pana bhikkhu sāmaṃ suttaṃ viññāpetvā tantavāyehi cīvaraṃ vāyāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
example_2: yāni kho pana tāni paṇītabhojanāni, seyyath'idaṃ, sappi, navanītaṃ, telaṃ, madhu, phāṇitaṃ, maccho, maṃsaṃ, khīraṃ, dadhi. yo pana bhikkhu evarūpāni paṇītabhojanāni agilāno attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

example_1: idam'avoca bhagavā. idaṃ vatvāna sugato ath'āparaṃ etadavoca satthā.

kunnadīnaṃ'va odakaṃ.
example_2:

appaṃ h'idaṃ jīvitam'āhu dhīrā, asassataṃ vippariṇāmadhammaṃ.

meaning_1: tie; rope; bond; fetter; lit. binding
example_1: sace, mārisā, dev'āsurasaṅgāme samupabyūḷhe asurā jineyyuṃ devā parājineyyuṃ, yena naṃ sakkaṃ devānam'indaṃ kaṇṭhapañcamehi bandhanehi bandhitvā mama santike āneyyātha asurapuran'ti.

example_1:

example_2: yadā kho, āvuso, imaṃ kāyaṃ tayo dhammā jahanti, āyu usmā ca viññāṇaṃ, ath'āyaṃ kāyo ujjhito avakkhitto seti, yathā kaṭṭhaṃ acetanan'ti.
sbs_example_3: katvāna kaṭṭham'udaraṃ iva gabbhinīyā, ciñcāya duṭṭhavacanaṃ janakāyamajjhe, santena somavidhinā jitavā mun'indo
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi allaṃ kaṭṭhaṃ sasnehaṃ udake nikkhittaṃ. atha puriso āgaccheyya uttar'āraṇiṃ ādāya, aggiṃ abhinibbattessāmi, tejo pātukarissāmī'ti.

meaning_1: which is felt; felt experience; feeling; lit. felt
example_1: yam'p'idaṃ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkham'asukhaṃ vā tam'pi suññaṃ attena vā attaniyena vā.
example_2: pittasamuṭṭhānāni'pi ... semhasamuṭṭhānāni'pi ... vātasamuṭṭhānāni'pi … sannipātikāni'pi … utupariṇāmajāni'pi … visamaparihārajāni'pi … opakkamikāni'pi … kammavipākajāni'pi kho, sīvaka, idh'ekaccāni vedayitāni uppajjanti.

sbs_example_4: te ca h'āvuso, āyusaṅkhārā abhaviṃsu te vedaniyā dhammā, na'y'idaṃ saññāvedayitanirodhaṃ samāpannassa bhikkhuno vuṭṭhānaṃ paññāyetha.

meaning_1: cause; reason; foundation; basis; lit. sign
example_1: sammāsambuddhassa te paṭijānato ime dhammā anabhisambuddhā'ti. tatra vata maṃ samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā devo vā māro vā brahmā vā koci vā lokasmiṃ sahadhammena paṭicodessatī'ti nimittam'etaṃ, sāriputta, na samanupassāmi.
example_2: adhicittam'anuyuttena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tīṇi nimittāni kālena kālaṃ manasi kātabbāni, kālena kālaṃ samādhinimittaṃ manasi kātabbaṃ, kālena kālaṃ paggahanimittaṃ manasi kātabbaṃ, kālena kālaṃ upekkhānimittaṃ manasi kātabbaṃ.

meaning_1: why?; lit. from what?; from where?

sbs_example_3: hirīmā'yaṃ, bhikkhave, ottāpī appamatto hoti. so appamatto samāno bhabbo anādariyaṃ pahātuṃ dovacassataṃ pahātuṃ pāpamittataṃ pahātuṃ.

meaning_1: restlessness and fidgetiness; agitation and edginess
example_1: idh'āvuso, paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa bhikkhuno kāmacchando pahīno hoti, byāpādo pahīno hoti, thīnamiddhaṃ pahīnaṃ hoti, uddhaccakukkuccaṃ pahīnaṃ hoti, vicikicchā pahīnā hoti

meaning_1: sense base; internal sense organ; lit. stretching out

example_1: kathañ'ca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammesu dhamm'ānupassī viharati chasu ajjhattikabāhiresu āyatanesu?
example_2: evaṃ vutte aññataro bhikkhu there bhikkhū etadavoca, cha kho, āvuso, ajjhattikāni āyatanāni eko anto, cha bāhirāni āyatanāni dutiyo anto, viññāṇaṃ majjhe, taṇhā sibbinī.
sbs_example_3: avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārā, saṅkhārapaccayā viññāṇaṃ, viññāṇapaccayā nāmarūpaṃ, nāmarūpapaccayā saḷ'āyatanaṃ, saḷ'āyatanapaccayā phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā

meaning_1: realm; sphere; dimension; range; lit. stretching out
example_1: atthi, bhikkhave, tadāyatanaṃ, yattha n'eva pathavī, na āpo, na tejo, na vāyo, na ākās'ānañca-āyatanaṃ, na viññāṇ'añca-'āyatanaṃ, na ākiñcañña-āyatanaṃ, na n'evasaññān'āsañña-āyatanaṃ, n'āyaṃ loko, na paraloko, na ubho candimasūriyā.
example_2: kudāssu nām'āhaṃ tad'āyatanaṃ upasampajja viharissāmi yadariyā eta'r'ahi āyatanaṃ upasampajja viharantī'ti
sbs_example_3: atthi, bhikkhave, upekkhā ākās'ānañc'āyatananissitā, atthi viññāṇ'añca-āyatananissitā, atthi ākiñcañña-āyatananissitā, atthi n'evasaññān'āsañña-āyatananissitā

meaning_1: change of mind; change of mental state; change of opinion; lit. otherwise state

meaning_1: (in debate) one’s position; premise; lit. standing
commentary: (ANa) ahaṃ tayā satakkhattuṃ niggayhamāno'pi ucchedavādīyevā'ti vadati. iminā nayena sassatapuggalasuññatavād'ādīsu'pi nayo netabbo. evaṃ ṭhān'āṭhāne saṇṭhāti nāma.

example_2: paṭipadāya na saṇṭhātī'ti paṭipattiyaṃ na tiṭṭhati, vattaṃ ajānitvā apucchitabbaṭṭhāne pucchatī'ti attho. ayaṃ pañho nāma cetiy'aṅgaṇe pucchitena na kathetabbo, tathā bhikkhācāramagge gāmaṃ piṇḍāya caraṇakāle.

example_1: kathañ'ca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammesu dhamm'ānupassī viharati chasu ajjhattikabāhiresu āyatanesu?

example_2: yv'āyaṃ, āvuso, mato kālaṅ'kato tassa kāyasaṅkhārā niruddhā paṭippassaddhā, vacīsaṅkhārā niruddhā paṭippassaddhā, cittasaṅkhārā niruddhā paṭippassaddhā, āyu parikkhīṇo, usmā vūpasantā, indriyāni paribhinnāni.

meaning_1: sick; ill; unwell; lit. being sick

meaning_1: engaged in; doing; practising; indulging in; lit. yoked near

example_1: dasa'y'imāni, bhikkhave, saṃyojanāni. katamāni dasa? pañc'oram'bhāgiyāni saṃyojanāni, pañc'uddham'bhāgiyāni saṃyojanāni.
example_2: uddh'aggalomo kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo, uddh'aggāni lomāni jātāni nīlāni añjanavaṇṇāni kuṇḍal'āvaṭṭāni dakkhiṇ'āvaṭṭakajātāni, idam'pi tassa bhoto gotamassa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṃ bhavati.

meaning_1: desirable; arousing; enticing; tantalizing; lit. to be desired

meaning_1: created; constructed; conditioned; fabricated; lit. put together
commentary:

example_2:

meaning_1: ugly; unattractive; discoloured; bad looking; lit. bad colour
example_1: idha, bhikkhave, sapatto sapattassa evaṃ icchati, aho vat'āyaṃ dubbaṇṇo assā'ti! taṃ kissa hetu? na, bhikkhave, sapatto sapattassa vaṇṇavatāya nandati.
example_2: so ca hoti dubbaṇṇo duddasiko okoṭimako bavhābādho kāṇo vā kuṇī vā khañjo vā pakkhahato vā, na lābhī annassa pānassa vatthassa yānassa mālāgandhavilepanassa seyyāvasathapadīpeyyassa.

example_1: kathañ'ca, thera, ekavihāro vitthārena paripuṇṇo hoti. idha, thera, yaṃ atītaṃ taṃ pahīnaṃ, yaṃ anāgataṃ taṃ paṭinissaṭṭhaṃ, paccuppannesu ca attabhāvapaṭilābhesu chandarāgo suppaṭivinīto.
example_2:
atisāradiṭṭhiyā'va so samatto,

sbs_example_3: na'y'idaṃ sukaraṃ agāraṃ ajjhāvasatā ek'antaparipuṇṇaṃ ek'antaparisuddhaṃ saṅkhalikhitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carituṃ.
sbs_example_4: ayaṃ hem'anto'tu, asmiñ'ca utumhi aṭṭha uposathā, iminā pakkhena, eko uposatho sampatto, satta uposathā atikkantā, aṭṭha uposathā paripuṇṇā.

meaning_1: enamoured (with); charmed (by); infatuated (with); possessed (by); obsessed (with); lit. attached together

meaning_1: not eternal; not endless; not perpetual
example_1: kiṃ pana, bhante, asassato loko, idam'eva saccaṃ mogham'aññan'ti? etam'pi kho, poṭṭhapāda, mayā abyākataṃ, asassato loko, idam'eva saccaṃ mogham'aññan'ti.
example_2: yatra hi nāma aniccaṃ'y'eva samānaṃ niccan'ti vakkhati, addhuvaṃ'y'eva samānaṃ dhuvan'ti vakkhati, asassataṃ'y'eva samānaṃ sassatan'ti vakkhati, akevalaṃ'y'eva samānaṃ kevalan'ti vakkhati, cavanadhammaṃ'y'eva samānaṃ acavanadhamman'ti vakkhati

na dīgham'āyuṃ labhate dhanena, na c'āpi vittena jaraṃ vihanti.
appaṃ h'idaṃ jīvitam'āhu dhīrā, asassataṃ vippariṇāmadhammaṃ.
sbs_example_4: so aparena samayena appaṃ vā bhogakkhandhaṃ pahāya mahantaṃ vā bhogakkhandhaṃ pahāya appaṃ vā ñātiparivaṭṭaṃ pahāya mahantaṃ vā ñātiparivaṭṭaṃ pahāya

sbs_example_4: aho vat'āhaṃ tada-antaraṃ jīveyyaṃ yad'antaraṃ assasitvā vā passasāmi, passasitvā vā assasāmi, bhagavato sāsanaṃ manasi kareyyaṃ, bahu vata me kataṃ assā'ti

example_1: so imaṃ lokaṃ sadevakaṃ samārakaṃ sabrahmakaṃ sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiṃ pajaṃ sadevamanussaṃ sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti.
example_2: na khv'āhaṃ taṃ, brāhmaṇa, passāmi sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya, yassa so pāyaso bhutto sammā pariṇāmaṃ gaccheyya, aññatra tathāgatassa vā tathāgatasāvakassa vā.
sbs_example_3: n'eva tāv'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambuddho'ti paccaññāsiṃ

example_1: yaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevakassa lokassa samārakassa sabrahmakassa sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya idaṃ sukhan'ti upanijjhāyitaṃ, ta'dam'ariyānaṃ etaṃ dukkhan'ti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya sudiṭṭhaṃ, ayam'ek'ānupassanā.
example_2:

sabbaṃ tamaṃ vinodetvā,

sbs_example_3: n'eva tāv'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambuddho'ti paccaññāsiṃ

sbs_example_4: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gāmaṇi, idh'assa puriso pāṇ'ātipātī adinn'ādāyī kāmesumicchācārī musāvādī pisuṇavāco pharusavāco samphappalāpī abhijjhālu byāpannacitto micchādiṭṭhiko.
sbs_example_5: ime, bhante, licchavikumārakā caṇḍā pharusā apajahā ... kul'itthīnam'pi kulakumārīnam'pi pacchāliyaṃ khipanti.

example_1: ty'āhaṃ evaṃ vadāmi, api pana tumhe āyasmanto yā tā devatā ek'antasukhaṃ lokaṃ upapannā, tāsaṃ bhāsamānānaṃ saddaṃ suṇātha, suppaṭipannāttha, mārisā, ujuppaṭipannāttha, mārisā, ek'antasukhassa lokassa sacchikiriyāya
example_2:
avihaṃ upapannāse,
vimuttā satta bhikkhavo,
rāgadosaparikkhīṇā,
tiṇṇā loke visattikan'ti.
sbs_example_3: micchādiṭṭhikammasamādānā, te kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapannā.

example_1: seyyathā'pi nāma maṇi veḷuriyo subho jātimā aṭṭh'aṃso suparikammakato paṇḍukambale nikkhitto bhāsate ca tapate ca virocati ca
example_2: anattani, bhikkhave, attā'ti saññāvipallāso cittavipallāso diṭṭhivipallāso. asubhe, bhikkhave, subhan'ti saññāvipallāso cittavipallāso diṭṭhivipallāso.
sbs_example_3: mayā dinnānapuññānaṃ anumodanahetunā, sabbe sattā sadā hontu averā sukhajīvino, khemappadañ'ca pappontu tesāsā sijjhataṃ subhā
sbs_example_4: n'āhaṃ aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppanno vā kāmacchando uppajjati uppanno vā kāmacchando bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati yatha'y'idaṃ subhanimittaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: idha, bhikkhave, ekacco yena dukkhena abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto socati kilamati paridevati, urattāḷiṃ kandati, sammohaṃ āpajjati
example_2: kodhano'yaṃ, bhikkhave, purisapuggalo kodha-abhibhūto kodhapareto, kiñ'c'āpi so hoti sunhāto suvilitto kappitakesamassu odātavatthavasano, atha kho so dubbaṇṇo'va hoti kodha-abhibhūto.
sbs_example_3: luddho pan'āyaṃ purisapuggalo lobhena abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto pāṇam'pi hanati, adinnam'pi ādiyati, paradāram'pi gacchati, musā'pi bhaṇati, param'pi tathattāya samādapeti
sbs_example_4: veditabbam'etaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā, abhibhūtam'etaṃ āyatanaṃ'. abhibh'āyatanañ'h'etaṃ vuttaṃ bhagavatā'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
satthugaru dhammagaru,
saṅghe ca tibbagāravo,
hiriottappasampanno,
sappatisso sagāravo.
example_2:
kalyāṇamitto yo bhikkhu,
sappatisso sagāravo,
karaṃ mittānaṃ vacanaṃ,
sampajāno patissato,
pāpuṇe anupubbena,
sabbasaṃyojanakkhayan'ti.
sbs_example_3: kesu na mānaṃ kayirātha, kesu c'assa sagāravo. ky'assa apacitā assu, ky'assu sādhu supūjitā'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gāvī pabbateyyā paṇḍitā byattā khettaññū kusalā visame pabbate carituṃ.
example_2:
vicittavatth'ābharaṇā,
āmuttamaṇikuṇḍalā,
kusalā naccagītassa,
sakkassa paricārikā.
sbs_example_3:
karaṇīyam'atthakusalena, yaṃ taṃ santaṃ padaṃ abhisamecca,
sakko ujū ca suhujū ca, suvaco c'assa mudu, anatimānī.
sbs_example_4:
ko imaṃ pathaviṃ vicessati, yamalokañ'ca imaṃ sadevakaṃ,
ko dhammapadaṃ sudesitaṃ, kusalo puppham'iva pacessati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: such; of such character; of such quality; like; kind of
commentary: (ITIa) tādinā'ti chaḷaṅg'upekkhāvasena sabbattha iṭṭh'ādīsu ekasabhāvatāsaṅkhātena tādilakkhaṇena tādinā.
example_1:
yass'indriyāni samathaṅ'gatāni,
assā yathā sārathinā sudantā,
pahīnamānassa anāsavassa,
devā'pi tassa pihayanti tādino.
example_2:
na kappayanti na purekkharonti,
dhammā'pi tesaṃ na paṭicchitāse,
na brāhmaṇo sīlavatena neyyo,
pāraṅ'gato na pacceti tādī'ti.
sbs_example_3:
iṭṭhā dhammā aniṭṭhā ca, nappavedhenti tādino.
ṭhitaṃ cittaṃ visaññuttaṃ, vayañ'c'ass'ānupassatī'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso araññe pavane caramāno passeyya purāṇaṃ maggaṃ purāṇ'añjasaṃ pubbakehi manussehi anuyātaṃ.
example_2:
purāṇaṃ n'ābhinandeyya,
nave khantiṃ na kubbaye,
hiyyamāne na soceyya,
ākāsaṃ na sito siyā.
sbs_example_3: iti purāṇañ'ca vedanaṃ paṭihaṅkhāmi navañ'ca vedanaṃ na uppādessāmi yātrā ca me bhavissati anavajjatā ca phāsuvihāro cā'ti
sbs_example_4:
khīṇaṃ purāṇaṃ navaṃ n'atthi sambhavaṃ, virattacitt'āyatike bhavasmiṃ.
te khīṇabījā avirūḷhichandā, nibbanti dhīrā yath'āyaṃ padīpo.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: more sublime (than); more refined (than); more delicious (than)
example_1: etadānuttariyaṃ, ānanda, ñāṇānaṃ yadidaṃ tattha tattha yathābhūtañāṇaṃ. etasmā c'āhaṃ, ānanda, ñāṇā aññaṃ ñāṇaṃ uttaritaraṃ vā paṇītataraṃ vā n'atthī'ti vadāmi
example_2: iti kho, bhikkhave, tathāgato diṭṭhasutamutaviññātabbesu dhammesu tādī'y'eva tādī. tamhā ca pana tādimhā añño tādī uttaritaro vā paṇītataro vā n'atthī'ti vadāmī'ti.
sbs_example_3: imesaṃ kho, potaliya, catunnaṃ puggalānaṃ katamo te puggalo khamati abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro cā'ti?
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: faring badly; poor; miserable; suffering; unfortunate
commentary: (MNa) duggatā'ti duṭṭhugatā duppaṭipannā kāyadaḷhibahulā vissaṭṭhakammaṭṭhānā. evarūpā'pi ekacce atthi.
example_1: tathā hi pana ayam'āyasmā saṅghe vā viharanto eko vā viharanto, ye ca tattha sugatā ye ca tattha duggatā, ye ca tattha gaṇam'anusāsanti, ye ca idh'ekacce āmisesu saṃdissanti, ye ca idh'ekacce āmisena anupalittā, n'āyam'āyasmā taṃ tena avajānāti.
example_2: so, duggataṃ durūpetan'ti pāḷiyā na sameti, tasmā vuttanayen'ev'ettha bhāvanam'ārabhitvā sīmāsambhedaṃ katvā appanā vaḍḍhetabbā.
sbs_example_3: ime sakkāre duggatapaṇṇākārabhūte paṭiggaṇhātu amhākaṃ dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāya
sbs_example_4: so dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passati cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe, sugate duggate, yathākamm'ūpage satte pajānāti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā saṃkhittena dhammaṃ desetu yam'ahaṃ bhagavato dhammaṃ sutvā eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahit'atto vihareyyan'ti. upādiyamāno kho, bhikkhu, baddho mārassa, anupādiyamāno mutto pāpimato'ti.
example_2:
yo ca pubbe pamajjitvā,
pacchā so nappamajjati,
so'maṃ lokaṃ pabhāseti,
abbhā mutto'va candimā.
sbs_example_3: idha, gahapati, ariyasāvako vigatamalamaccherena cetasā agāraṃ ajjhāvasati muttacāgo payatapāṇi vossaggarato yācayogo dānasaṃvibhāgarato. ayaṃ vuccati, gahapati, cāgasampadā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā aṅgesu viharati assapuraṃ nāma aṅgānaṃ nigamo.
example_2:
diṭṭhā'pi sutā'pi te janā,
yesaṃ nāmam'idaṃ pavuccati,
nāmaṃ yev'āvasissati,
akkheyyaṃ petassa jantuno.
sbs_example_3: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya, sammukhā m'etaṃ, āvuso, bhagavato sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ, ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanan'ti.
sbs_example_4: evaṃ me sutaṃ ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā gayāyaṃ viharati gayāsīse saddhiṃ bhikkhusahassena. tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi
sbs_example_5: yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ cetasā anuvitakkeyyāsi anuvicāreyyāsi, manasā anupekkheyyāsi
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: addasā kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno taṃ puggalaṃ dussīlaṃ pāpadhammaṃ asuciṃ saṅkassarasamācāraṃ paṭicchannakamm'antaṃ asamaṇaṃ samaṇapaṭiññaṃ
example_2: tassa imissā ca asappāyakiriyāya, asuci visadoso apanīto saupādiseso tadubhayena vaṇo puthuttaṃ gaccheyya.
sbs_example_3: idha ekacco dussīlo hoti pāpadhammo asucisaṅkassarasamācāro paṭicchannakamm'anto assamaṇo samaṇapaṭiñño abrahmacārī brahmacāripaṭiñño antopūti avassuto kasambujāto – antopūtibhāvo'ti.

example_1:
dānañ'ca yuddhañ'ca samānam'āhu,
app'āpi santā bahuke jinanti,
appam'pi ce saddahāno dadāti,
ten'eva so hoti sukhī paratthā'ti.
example_2: acchindāpeyyā'ti aññaṃ āṇāpeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa. sakiṃ āṇatto bahukam'pi acchindati, nissaggiyaṃ hoti.
sbs_example_3: idha bhikkhu divase nikkhante rattiyā patihitāya iti paṭisañcikkhati, bahukā kho me paccayā maraṇassa:
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa vācā vūpasantā hoti
example_2: ayaṃ vuccati, mahānāma, ariyasāvako visamagatāya pajāya samappatto viharati, sabyāpajjāya pajāya abyāpajjo viharati, dhammasotaṃ samāpanno sīl'ānussatiṃ bhāveti.
sbs_example_3: idh'āvuso, paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa bhikkhuno vitakko ca vattati, vicāro ca pīti ca sukhañ'ca citt'ekaggatā ca.
sbs_example_4: te ca h'āvuso, āyusaṅkhārā abhaviṃsu te vedaniyā dhammā, na'y'idaṃ saññāvedayitanirodhaṃ samāpannassa bhikkhuno vuṭṭhānaṃ paññāyetha.

example_1: yattakā bhikkhū tassa uposathakammassa pattayuttā anurūpā, sabb'antimena paricchedena cattāro bhikkhū pakatattā, saṅghena anukkhitā, te ca kho hatthapāsaṃ avijahitvā ekasīmayaṃ ṭhitā.
example_2:
na yuttaṃ socituṃ putta,
hāsakāle upaṭṭhite,
tayā me saraṇaṃ putta,
nibbānaṃ tam'upāgataṃ.
sbs_example_3: evan'taṃ uposathakammaṃ imehi catūhi lakkhaṇehi saṅgahitaṃ pattakallaṃ nāma hoti, kātuṃ yuttarūpaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: seyyathā'pi brāhmaṇa dakkho assadammako bhaddaṃ ass'ājānīyaṃ labhitvā paṭhamen'eva mukh'ādhāne kāraṇaṃ kāreti atha uttariṃ kāraṇaṃ kāreti
example_2: aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato rañño bhaddo ass'ājānīyo rāj'āraho hoti rājabhoggo, rañño aṅgan't'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchati. katamehi aṭṭhahi?
sbs_example_3: evaṃ vihārim'ātāpiṃ, ahorattam'atanditaṃ. taṃ ve bhadd'ekaratto'ti, santo ācikkhate muni.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: aham'asmi, bhante, jiṇṇo vuḍḍho mahallako addhagato vayoanuppatto āturakāyo abhikkhaṇ'ātaṅko.
example_2: yato ca kho ayaṃ bhavaṃ puriso jiṇṇo hoti vuddho mahallako addhagato vayoanuppatto, āsītiko vā nāvutiko vā vassasatiko vā jātiyā, atha tamhā paññāveyyattiyā, parihāyatī'ti.
sbs_example_3: ettha dāni, māluṅkyaputta, kiṃ dahare bhikkhū vakkhāma yatra hi nāma tvaṃ, bhikkhu, jiṇṇo vuddho mahallako addhagato vayoanuppatto saṃkhittena ovādaṃ yācasī'ti.

meaning_1: able (to); capable (of); possible (to); likely (to); fit (to); lit. to be
example_1:
catūh'apāyehi ca vippamutto,
cha c'ābhiṭhānāni bhabba kātuṃ,
idam'pi saṅghe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.
example_2: pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu bhabbo sammāsamādhiṃ upasampajja viharituṃ. katamehi pañcahi?
sbs_example_3: etha tumhe mā anussavena, mā param'parāya, mā itikirāya, mā piṭakasampadānena, mā takkahetu, mā nayahetu, mā ākāraparivitakkena, mā diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā, mā bhabbarūpatāya, mā samaṇo no garū'ti.
sbs_example_4: hirīmā'yaṃ, bhikkhave, ottāpī appamatto hoti. so appamatto samāno bhabbo anādariyaṃ pahātuṃ dovacassataṃ pahātuṃ pāpamittataṃ pahātuṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: so ca hetu so ca paccayo sabbena sabbaṃ sabbathā sabbaṃ aparisesaṃ nirujjheyya
example_2: tañ'ca cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti, yatth'assa te uppannā pāpakā akusalā dhammā aparisesā nirujjhanti.
sbs_example_3: es'ev'anto daṇḍ'ādānasatth'ādānakalahaviggahavivādatuvaṃtuvaṃpesuññamusāvādānaṃ. etth'ete pāpakā akusalā dhammā aparisesā nirujjhantī'ti.

example_1:
ahiṃsakā ye munayo,
niccaṃ kāyena saṃvutā,
te yanti accutaṃ ṭhānaṃ,
yattha gantvā na socare.
example_2:
sati kāyagatā upaṭṭhitā,
chasu phass'āyatanesu saṃvuto,
satataṃ bhikkhu samāhito,
jaññā nibbānam'attano'ti.
sbs_example_3: ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, sīlavā hohi, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharāhi ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhassu sikkhāpadesū'ti

example_1:
yo have daharo bhikkhu,
yuñjati buddhasāsane,
so'maṃ lokaṃ pabhāseti,
abbhā muttova candimā.
example_2: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu daharo hoti yuvā susu kāḷakeso bhadrena yobbanena samannāgato paṭhamena vayasā. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo samayo padhānāya.
sbs_example_3:
dumapphalānī'va patanti māṇavā, daharā ca vuḍḍhā ca sarīrabhedā.
etam'pi disvā pabbajito'mhi rāja, apaṇṇakaṃ sāmaññam'eva seyyo.
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanakajātiko sīsaṃ nhāto ahikuṇapena vā kukkurakuṇapena vā manussakuṇapena vā kaṇṭhe āsattena aṭṭīyeyya harāyeyya jiguccheyya.

example_1:
subh'ānupassiṃ viharantaṃ,
indriyesu asaṃvutaṃ,
bhojanamhi c'āmattaññuṃ,
kusītaṃ hīnavīriyaṃ,
taṃ ve pasahati māro,
vāto rukkhaṃ'va dubbalaṃ.
example_2: āraddhavīriyassāyaṃ dhammo n'āyaṃ dhammo kusītassa
sbs_example_3: dukkhaṃ, bhikkhave, kusīto viharati vokiṇṇo pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi, mahantañ'ca sadatthaṃ parihāpeti.

meaning_1: sensed; perceived; known; (comm) smelled; tasted or touched
commentary: (VIN 2.5.1.1) mutaṃ nāma ghānena ghāyitaṃ, jivhāya sāyitaṃ, kāyena phuṭṭhaṃ.
example_1:
yadattanī passati ānisaṃsaṃ,
diṭṭhe sute sīlavate mute vā,
tadeva so tattha samuggahāya,
nihīnato passati sabbamaññaṃ.
example_2:
ucc'āvacā hi paṭipadā,
samaṇena pakāsitā,
na pāraṃ diguṇaṃ yanti,
na'y'idaṃ ekaguṇaṃ mutaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
diṭṭhe diṭṭhamattaṃ bhavissati, sute sutamattaṃ bhavissati,
mute mutamattaṃ bhavissati, viññāte viññātamattaṃ bhavissatī'ti.
sbs_example_4:
sa sabbadhammesu visenibhūto,
yaṃ kiñci diṭṭhaṃ va sutaṃ mutaṃ vā,
sa pannabhāro muni vippamutto,
na kappiyo n'ūparato na patthiyo'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
samānabhāgaṃ kubbetha,
gāme akkuṭṭhavanditaṃ,
manopadosaṃ rakkheyya,
santo anuṇṇato care.
example_2: tulyasevī'ti, attanā samānasevī
sbs_example_3:
dānañ'ca yuddhañ'ca samānam'āhu,
app'āpi santā bahuke jinanti.
appam'pi ce saddahāno dadāti,
ten'eva so hoti sukhī paratthā'ti.

construction:
adhi > adhy > ajjh + atta + ika
ajjhatta + ika
commentary:
(ITIa) ajjhattikan'ti niyak'ajjhattasaṅkhāte ajjhatte bhavaṃ ajjhattikaṃ.
(ANa) ajjhattikassa upādāyā'ti ajjhattikaṃ khandhapañcakaṃ upādāya. idañ'hi upayog'atthe sāmivacanaṃ.
example_1: yaṃ kiñci, rāhula, ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ kakkhaḷaṃ kharigataṃ upādinnaṃ … yaṃ vā pan'aññam'pia kiñci ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ kakkhaḷaṃ kharigataṃ upādinnaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā pathavīdhātu
example_2: evaṃ vutte aññataro bhikkhu there bhikkhū etadavoca, cha kho, āvuso, ajjhattikāni āyatanāni eko anto, cha bāhirāni āyatanāni dutiyo anto, viññāṇaṃ majjhe, taṇhā sibbinī.
sbs_example_3: cakkh'āyatanaṃ sot'āyatanaṃ ghān'āyatanaṃ jivh'āyatanaṃ kāy'āyatanaṃ man'āyatanaṃ, cha ajjhattikāni āyatanāni veditabbānī'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
yo appaduṭṭhassa narassa dussati,
suddhassa posassa anaṅgaṇassa,
tam'eva bālaṃ pacceti pāpaṃ,
sukhumo rajo paṭivātaṃ'va khitto.
example_2:
passāmi suddhaṃ paramaṃ arogaṃ,
diṭṭhena saṃsuddhi narassa hoti,
ev'ābhijānaṃ paraman'ti ñatvā,
suddh'ānupassī'ti pacceti ñāṇaṃ.
sbs_example_3: buddho susuddho karuṇāmah'aṇṇavo, yo'ccantasuddhabbarañāṇalocano, lokassa pāp'ūpakilesaghātako
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi nāma suddhaṃ vatthaṃ apagatakāḷakaṃ samma'd'eva rajanaṃ paṭiggaṇheyya
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: gathered together; assembled; lit. fallen together
example_1: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, sannipatito, bhante, bhikkhusaṅgho. yassa dāni, bhante, bhagavā kālaṃ maññatī'ti.
example_2: tena kho pana samayena rāj'antepure rājaparisāya sannisinnānaṃ sannipatitānaṃ ayam'antarākathā udapādi
sbs_example_3: bhikkhugaṇanā nāma imasmiṃ uposath'agge uposath'atthāya sannipatitā bhikkhū ettakā'ti, bhikkhūnaṃ gaṇanā.
sbs_example_4: bhikkhugaṇanā ca, imasmiṃ uposath'agge sannipatitānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ gaṇanā kittakā bhikkhū honti?
sbs_example_5: dasahi ca lokadhātūhi devatā yebhuyyena sannipatitā honti bhagavantaṃ dassanāya bhikkhusaṅghañ'ca.

meaning_1: mere; simple; the fact of; by virtue of
example_1:
na vākkaraṇamattena,
vaṇṇapokkharatāya vā,
sādhurūpo naro hoti,
issukī maccharī saṭho.
example_2: n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, jaṭilakassa jaṭādhāraṇamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi.

patirūpe vase dese, ariyamittakaro siyā.
sammāpaṇidhisampanno, pubbe puññakato naro.
dhaññaṃ dhanaṃ yaso kitti, sukhaṃcetaṃadhivattatī.

meaning_1: disrepute; disgrace; discredit; lit. not fame
example_1: ujjhāpanakaṃ nāma upasampannaṃ saṅghena sammataṃ sen'āsanapaññāpakaṃ ... avaṇṇaṃ kattu'kāmo, ayasaṃ kattu'kāmo, maṅkukattu'kāmo, upasampannaṃ ujjhāpeti vā khiyyati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
example_2: evaṃ vadeyyā'ti upasampannaṃ saṅghena sammataṃ bhikkhun'ovādakaṃ avaṇṇaṃ kattu'kāmo ayasaṃ kattu'kāmo maṅkukattu'kāmo evaṃ vadeti
sbs_example_3: ayasena phandamānaṃ, pasaṃsāya phandamānaṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
na tena thero so hoti,
yen'assa palitaṃ siro,
paripakko vayo tassa,
moghajiṇṇo'ti vuccati.
example_2:
rāgo uppatho akkhāto,
vayo rattin'divakkhayo,
itthī malaṃ brahmacariyassa,
etth'āyaṃ sajjate pajā,
tapo ca brahmacariyañ'ca,
taṃ sinānam'anodakan'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary:
(DNa) na yattha sā'ti yattha sunakho, piṇḍaṃ labhissāmī'ti upaṭṭhito hoti, tattha tassa adatvā āhaṭaṃ na gaṇhati. kasmā? etassa piṇḍ'antarāyo hotī'ti.
(SNa) sā gaddulabaddho'ti gaddulena baddhasunakho.
example_1: seyyathā'pi nāma sā gaddulabaddho daḷhe thambhe vā khile vā upanibaddho tam'eva thambhaṃ vā khilaṃ vā anuparidhāvati anuparivattati
example_2: na saṅkittīsu na yattha sā upaṭṭhito hoti na yattha makkhikā saṇḍasaṇḍacārinī, na macchaṃ na maṃsaṃ na suraṃ na merayaṃ na thus'odakaṃ pivanti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
n'atthi puttasamaṃ pemaṃ,
n'atthi gosamitaṃ dhanaṃ,
n'atthi sūriyasamā ābhā,
samuddaparamā sarā'ti.
example_2:
majjhe sarasmiṃ tiṭṭhataṃ,
oghe jāte mahabbhaye,
jarāmaccuparetānaṃ,
dīpaṃ pabrūhi mārisa,
tvañ'ca me dīpamakkhāhi,
yathā'y'idaṃ n'āparaṃ siyā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: tena kho pana samayena āyasmā soṇo rājagahe viharati sītavanasmiṃ. atha kho āyasmato soṇassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi
example_2:
n'atthi loke raho nāma, pāpakammaṃ pakubbato,
attā te purisa jānāti, saccaṃ vā yadi vā musā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: namo tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa
example_2: handa mayaṃ buddhassa bhagavato pubbabhāganamakāraṃ karomase

meaning_1: self-mortification; ascetic practice; austerity; lit. burning
commentary:
(SNa) lūkhaṃ tapan'ti pañc'ātapatāpanaṃ kaṇṭakaseyy'ādikaṃ tapaṃ.
(SNt) lūkhaṃ tapan'ti attakilamath'ānuyogaṃ.
example_1:
taṇh'ādhipannā vatasīlabaddhā,
lūkhaṃ tapaṃ vassasataṃ carantā,
cittañ'ca nesaṃ na sammā vimuttaṃ,
hīn'attharūpā na pāraṅ'gamā te.
example_2: imāya ca, kassapa, mattāya iminā tapopakkamena sāmaññaṃ vā abhavissa brahmaññaṃ vā dukkaraṃ sudukkaraṃ, n'etaṃ abhavissa kallaṃ vacanāya, dukkaraṃ sāmaññaṃ dukkaraṃ brahmaññan'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: ahañ'c'eva kho pana sabbaso ajaddhukaṃ paṭijāneyyaṃ, imā ca me devatā dibbaṃ ojaṃ lomakūpehi ajjhohāreyyuṃ, tāya c'āhaṃ yāpeyyaṃ, taṃ mam'assa musā'ti.

example_1:
ayasā'va malaṃ samuṭṭhitaṃ,
tat'uṭṭhāya tam'eva khādati,
evaṃ atidhonacārinaṃ,
sāni kammāni nayanti duggatiṃ.
example_2: ayo, lohaṃ, tipu, sīsaṃ, sajjhaṃ, ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca jātarūpassa upakkilesā, yehi upakkilesehi upakkiliṭṭhaṃ jātarūpaṃ na c'eva mudu hoti na ca kammaniyaṃ na ca pabhassaraṃ pabhaṅgu ca na ca sammā upeti kammāya
